name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Flying Attack!
description: Shredder's Foot Clan Ninjas are scaling the high-rise on an evil mission. Send the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles flying into action to stop them! Launch the Turtles from the construction-site catapult to knock enemies off their perilous perch. But beware! Whoever plays Shredder has cunning cards that can thwart the Turtles' high-flying heroics!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Tootsie Roll Dice Game
description: The object of The Tootsie Roll Dice Game is to be the first to make specific combinations of dice by rolling your dice as fast as you can.

name: Ichigeki Heroes
description: In Ichigeki Heroes, you and your opponents are heroes attempting to defeat a variety of monsters, each time using just one massive attack! To play, the active hero flips tiles hoping to find as many attack modifiers as possible before either swinging with a massive punch... or missing wildly! Defeating each monster grants that hero an instant, future, or permanent bonus on future attacks! The hero with the most victory points when all 10 monsters have been defeated is declared the ultimate ICHIGEKI HERO!!

name: Blackout: Journey into Darkness
description:
Blackout is a post-apocalyptic dungeon crawler for 1-4 players. Players take control of one or more characters and venture out into the Northern Wastes in search of glory and renown. Blackout is a mission-based leveling system that offers savage combat and rewarding exploration.

Blackout is designed for solo and co-op play. In addition, Blackout missions can be presented by a gamemaster if the players wish to experience a more narrative adventure. Blackout offers 15-20 hours of play.

name: Big Basket and Small Basket and...
description:
User summary
大きなつづらと小さなつづらと (Ookina Tudura to Tiisana Tudura to) is 'Big Box And Small Box And More' according to the publisher.

There are three closed baskets on the table - one is full of gold, one has a little gold, and one is empty. You must choose one to place in front of you, but beware! If you're greedy and take the big basket, and another player chooses your basket as well, you'll get nothing!

Big Basket and Small Basket and... is a bluffing game played in a number of rounds equal to the number of players. Each round, the first few players secretly choose a single basket card from the cards remaining and place it in front of them. The remaining players then choose a basket to peek into - the big basket gold gets stolen easily, the little basket has a little for everyone, and the empty basket rewards the holder. The winner is the player who collects the most gold.

name: Dinosauriespelet
description:
The cruel seamonster has taken a baby dino captive on the small island, guarding the waters around the island voraciously. The dinosaurs walk around the board, collecting the watersteps needed to get out to the island and rescue baby dino. On the way you can meet both the sea monster that steals watersteps and the pterodactyl that can fly you to a location of your choice. If you meet another dinosaur you can challenge it for watersteps. The winner is the player that reaches the island first and and saves babydino.

You start with placing the tiles on the board backside up, then take turns moving along the lines collecting waterstep tiles needed to save the baby dino, stone tiles are useless, landsteps are needed to cross certain sections.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bitwy Okretow
description:
Bitwy Okrętow (War of Ships or Battles of Warships) is a quick, easy wargame about battles fought between XVII-XVIII century ships. Players may choose and customize their fleets, creating big number of small ships or small number of the bigger ones. Rules contains maneuvers, wind dependency, boarding and burning enemy ships.

Game was published in the 40 issue of "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine in both Polish and English editions.
categories: Age of Reason, Nautical, Pirates, Wargame

name: What is this?
description:
The game consists of two packs of 30 cards. Each card has a picture on one side and a description on the other.
One pack of cards is spread out picture side up so that all pictures can be seen. The other pack is stacked picture side up. The game starts by turning over the top card of the stack so that the descritipion can be read. Somewhere amongst the pictures showing is the item matching this description but finding the match may not be as easy as it seems as the pictures have been chosen so as to appear to be something else and a little imagination may be needed to make the match. Whoever makes the match first takes both cards and then the next stack card is turned over and a new match has to be found. When all cards in the stack have been used, whoever has the most cards in the winner. The game rules state that it is for two players or teams but clearly any number can play.

name: Accentuate Quotes Expansion: Films
description:
It's simple: read a quote from a Quotation Card in the accent printed on the Accent Card selected; if your team mates guess correctly you win a point.

The trick is to convey the essence of the accent to your team mates, without giving any verbal or visual clues. Your team mates' jobs are to giggle hysterically, ridicule you and - regardless of how terrible your accent is - guess correctly.

This expansion adds a new deck of quotes based on films, and a new method of scoring based on correctly guessing the name of the film!

name: Rock Stage: A Path to Fame
description:
The world's first board game about heavy music, which brought together the experience of the leading concert and promotional agencies.

The player forms a band from the deck of over 100 musician cards. With the band the player attempts to gain as much fame as possible with the money they earn from the band. The player with the most fame at the end of the game wins.

name: Tsundoku
description:
User summary
In Japanese, つんどく (Tsundoku) refers to the act of piling up stacks of unread books.

As the game title suggests, each player, in their turn, places a Book card from their hand either in their own area or another player's area, on top of the cards there, with the Star icons on the lower cards showing.

However, you cannot score by merely piling up the Books. If you manage to pile up 3 Books with the same color and the same number of Star icons on them in a row, you can "read" those Books and score points matching the number of Star icons on them.

In your turn, you can choose to 'place a Book card', 'sort the order of some Books in your pile', or 'play a special card (to apply its effect)'.

At the end of the game, the player with the highest number of Star icons on the Books they've read, wins.

The game includes artwork from public domain.

Publisher's summary
「つんどく」とは、まだ読んでいない本を山のように積み上げていることをいいます。

ゲームタイトル表す通り、手番になったら手札から本のカード１枚を自分の場、もしくは他のプレイヤーの場に積み上げます。
しかし、ただ本を積み上げるだけでは得点になりません。
本を「同じ色かつ同じ星マークの数」で３つ以上つなげて置くことができたら、そのセットの本を「読む」ことで、星マークの数分の得点になります。

得点につなげるために、手番では「本のカード置く」代わりに、「自分のツンドクの山を並べ変える」か「スペシャルカード（いろんな効果のあるカード）使う」をすることができます。

ゲーム終了時に、一番「読んだ本の星マークの数」が多いプレイヤーがゲームに勝利します。

name: A.D.A.P.T.: Blue Fantasy Creature Expansion Pack
description: A blue-themed, magical expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 5 new bodies, 8 new parts, and 3 status trackers. Also introduces blast, changeling, immune: poison, oversize: (location), and shapeshifting.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: This One Time, I...: The Game of Ludicrous Life Choices – Party Edition
description:
Have you ever hooked up with someone within an hour of meeting them, or blacked out before 9 p.m. because you were too drunk?
Unlike most of the party games you have played, THIS ONE TIME, I... provides an explicit, hilarious opportunity for friends to relive their funny, dirty and downright crazy life experiences. We have probed deep into the dirty pasts of people to compile hundreds of ludicrous life choices that we can all relate to.
The game is played with Confession Cards, which are examples of ludicrous life choices, and Rule Cards which tell you how to play each round - that make it easy and fun to learn who’s the craziest, dirtiest, wildest friend of the group!

Every round, a player selects a Red Rule Card from the top of the pile, reads the instructions aloud and must then do as the Rule Card says.
If you are guilty of an act detailed by a Blue Confession Card given to you, you must add it to your losing pile (face up) in front of you until the end of the game, so that everyone can enjoy reliving your bad decisions. If you are not guilty of a Confession Card, you must scrap it.
The first player to have 10 Confession Cards in their losing pile loses the game. There are no winners in this game, only losers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Shopkins Big Roll Bingo
description:
Product Description
Shopkins Big Roll Bingo is a great way to play the one of the world's most popular games, with oversized dice that are much more fun than spinners and loads of your favorite Shopkins characters. Roll the oversized dice to find out which letter and character to look for on your card. Do you have Kooky Cookie in your “B” column? If you do, place a token there. If you roll a Shopping Cart instead of a letter you can cover the picture no matter where it is. The first player to cover five squares in a row wins. This easy-to-play game comes with 6 bingo cards, 2 oversized dice, 60 tokens and complete instructions. For 2-6 players ages 4 and up.

From the Manufacturer
Shopkins Big Roll Bingo is a great way to play the one of the world's most popular games, with oversized dice that are much more fun than spinners and loads of your favorite Shopkins characters. Roll the oversized dice to find out which letter and character to look for on your card. Do you have Kooky Cookie in your “B” column? If you do, place a token there. If you roll a Shopping Cart instead of a letter you can cover the picture no matter where it is. The first player to cover five squares in a row wins. This easy-to-play game comes with 6 bingo cards, 2 oversized dice, 60 tokens and complete instructions. For 2-6 players ages 4 and up.

name: Crazy Cafe
description:
Each player will spin the spinner and stack the dishes on the table accordingly. When you land on “pull” you must pull the tablecloth without the dishes flying everywhere!

You must successfully remove the tablecloth from the table, but the trick is that you can’t move the dishes first. The first person to remove the tablecloth without knocking down the whole dinner is the winner of the game. You can either start with a full table or build up to one. Do a round with just one dish and then add them as you go along.
publishers: International Playthings, Inc., Martinex, Peliko Oy

name: DKT: Das kriminelle Talent
description: DKT: Das kriminelle Talent plays similar to regular DKT, a.k.a. Das kaufmännische Talent, with players owning spaces on the board and trying to get money out of others, but instead of streets or cities being for sale, now you'll find different business areas, from the nightclub to the jeweler to Glamor Mimi's nail salon. You want to strongarm protection money from other players, get security that protects you from extortion, demand ransoms, and pursue other dubious machinations.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Jeunesse Farm
description:
[Jeunesse Farm]

In my Jeunesse farm there are a cabbage, an onion, a carrot, a cow, a rabbit and a pig.

A cabbage, is the one of those cabbages that froze in fields once in a chill autumn night.

A carrot, is one of those carrots that our house puppy Rocky dug from the field and chewed on.

A rabbit, is one of those rabbits that my mother raised with care when I was 16.

A pig, is one of those pigs that we had together until the last day, when we closed our farm.

This is my story about Jeunesse Farm.
And what is your story of Jeunesse Farm?


===================================================This is a mind battle game for farm managers!
In this game you will need good memory and earnest management skills to build the richest farm, through all four seasons.

[Game play and winning]
On your turn you will choose and flip an action tile face up, apply its action, and then flip the tile face down again. Each tile has a specific farm management function: buy, sell, etc, tiles will be shuffled from time to time.

You should remember and pay attention to the position of the tiles, so that you can use the right action on your turn. The goal is to get the best resources among produce and livestock, and to trade them for your profits as high as you can.

The game ends in winter, the farmer who collected most cash wins the game.

name: Lord of the Manor (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
It adds castles to cities and farms.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: The Grim Reaple (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
When the grave yard tile is laid, the Grim Reaple comes into play. The Grim Reaple reaps one meeple. This is done in a certain order. First, the Reaple takes the closest robber on a road that touches the grave yard. If there is no robber, then the Reaple takes a knight or mayor from a city that is contingent to the graveyard or is connected to the graveyard by road. If there is no knight or mayor in a city connected to the graveyard, then the Reaple takes a monk from a cloister or abbey that is contingent to or in the same field as the grave yard. Lastly, as a professional courtesy to a meeple that uses the same tool of the trade, and a monk is not present in a contingent cloister/abbey, the Reaple takes a farmer from a field that touches the graveyard.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: The Believer Box of Bad Advice
description:
A card game of horrible advice from your favorite comedians. Featuring David Cross, Amy Sedaris, Zach Galifianakis, Louis C.K., Judd Apatow, Dave Eggers, Mindy Kaling, Michael Cera, Ed Helms, Janeane Garofalo, Fred Armisen, and more.

Players are dealt five answer cards, and the dealer reads aloud one question card to the group. Players submit their funniest answer card to the dealer. The most mixed-up, messed-up advice (judged by the dealer) wins the round. Dealer duty passes from player to player until one player wins a fourth round. The first player to win four rounds wins the game.

Topics range from political to existential to mature, and more.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political

name: Cards & Punishment: Vol. 2 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
From publisher:
"*And yet another unofficial, unauthorized, 3rd party expansion pack for Cards Against Humanity

You must own Cards Against Humanity to use this expansion. It is not for use without original game.
Professionally printed on casino-quality cards with a linen-finish.
Includes 33 question cards and 77 white cards (one blank).
Now in the correct size, for her pleasure! (Pleasure not guaranteed)

You didn't ask for it, so here it is! Volume 2 of Cards & Punishment is here like news that you're pregnant with twins: unwanted, more than you asked for, and just an additional expense. Please note, there have been a couple of required changes from the first printing of volume 1. Size issues have been fixed; you're welcome ladies. Card backs are still black and white with a minor formatting change. Card front colors are now Dark Blue Balls and Someone Else Peed the Bed Light Yellow."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Qube: Afrikas stjerne
description:
Play your cards right, and the Star of Africa will be yours.

This is a simple card version of Afrikan tähti, where you race to be the first to find the Star of Africa and reach the city of Tangers. In this small family friendly game you collect sets of matching colored cards to be the first to fulfill the goal and win the game. Each round you start with a fixed number of cards and play them to either hinder your opponents or get closer to the finish.
—user summary

Put the Qube on the table. Pull out the drawer and start the game immediately! The pursuit of the Star of Africa continues - a classic, now as an exciting card game.

Monkeys and robbers means trouble. Using the map, pickaxe and sets of diamonds in different colors will help you find the Star, the city of Tanger and get a visa. First one to get all three items wins!

—description from the publisher

name: The Polar Express: Train-Opoly
description:
This is a Monopoly-style game with a "The Polar Express" theme. This collector's edition game was sold by the Masterpieces Inc. company.
—user summary

Relive the magic of The Polar Express adventure with this gameboard featuring the characters and places of the movie. Enjoy trivia, movie moments, and character quotes on the back of each property card. Each game contains a custom gameboard filled with gorgeous imagery and striking detail, 6 custom collectible pewter tokens, 28 property cards featuring interesting brand-themed trivia, 32 action cards, 1 pack of illustrated money, 44 custom designed plastic property markers, 2 dice, and illustrated rules. All Aboard!
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: 弱者の剣 (Jakusha no Tsurugi)
description:
弱者の剣 (Jakusha no Tsurugi, "Sword of the Weak") is the first game from Polygonotes. It resembles the classic card game Daifugo but adds many twists.

At the start of a round each player is dealt six normal cards and one Sword of the Weak card. Normal cards have two numbers on them, one blue and one red, that always add up to nine, as well as a colored symbol in the middle. The Sword of the Weak has a different pattern on the back and its red and blue numbers are both one.

Your goal is to play all your cards. Each turn you have to either pass (and draw a card) or play cards to the middle. In order to play cards to the middle you have to have a higher total than the previous hand, and whether you use the red or blue numbers depends on the Scales card by the deck - it starts on blue, but every time a Sword of the Weak is played it's flipped. Being lucky will help you play larger hands, but in order to win you'll have to correctly time when you play your Sword card for the greatest advantage.

—user summary

name: UNO: Coca-Cola
description:
"Special Edition UNO" with a Coca-Cola theme.

WHAT MAKES THEM DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO:
This version adds a unique "Thirst card" with the following ability: "When this card is played, the player who plays it may select any player to have their thirst quenched. The player selected must draw cards from the deck until he or she draws either a red suited card or any wold card. Upon drawing a red suited card or any wild card the player is to place it in the discard pile. Prior to resuming play the player who plays the card also determines the color to be played in the next round by announcing his/her choice of red, yellow, green or blue."

name: Moonshiners of the Apocalypse: Event Cards
description:
Event cards are an optional component of the game.
Playing with them changes the experience by adding events at every move you make on the board. Thus certain decision and strategies will be altered.

Pack was available as an add on during the kickstarter campaign.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: L.O.L. Surprise!: Ruckus Card Game
description:
This is a simplified reskin of Ruckus. Players collect cards with pictures of L.O.L. dolls by stealing from other players to form sets. There are 72 cards (6 cards for each of 12 characters).

The endgame rules differ slightly from traditional Ruckus. The rules specify scoring 77 points as the victory condition, regardless of the number of players. Instead of shouting "OUT!" as in traditional Ruckus, players shout "RUCKUS!"

The game comes with an L.O.L. toy accessory (purse, sunglasses, bracelet, etc.) that is not used in the game.

name: Superzings: Rivals of Kaboom
description: Roll the battle dice and determine your battle power. The highest battle power score wins the clash! Compete and defeat five times to win the game! Contents: Double-sided game board, 4 character playing pieces and stands, 4 character battle power cards, 1 unique enigma figure, 1 battle dice and instructions.

name: GayBar
description:
GayBar is a LGTBI-THEMED game where your objective is to try to seduce as many guys as you can in one night, but... watch out! Because the bitches of your friends will try to prevent you to get them.

You will be part of a group of gay men (twinks, bears, str8...), and, depending on your role, you will flirt with other men. Everything is played using cards.

When you play your turn, other players can use their cards to go against you.

name: Love is Blind
description:
Score big on your next game night with Love is Blind. Inspired by the hit dating show on Netflix, you’ll secretly answer a series of questions and discover who could be your best match.

Players become couples as the proposals begin -- we provide the rings, you bring the courage! Say “Yes” in the Pods and retire to The Apartments, where newly formed power couples can strengthen their bond or run from the relationship. Earn Hearts by answering real-life questions and matching your partner’s answers. Are you a mismatch? Propose to another player whose relationship is on the ropes, and you’ll get a second chance at finding your true soulmate! The first couple to earn 9 Hearts wins and lives happily ever after... or at least until your next game night.

—description from the publisher

name: SubDown
description:
You are crew members of a submarine that has suffered great damage in an accident. All systems are down. The life support system is compromised and soon the CO2 level will rise to a lethal level.

It's important that you work together quickly as a team to get the engines working again and get to the rescuing surface.

SubDown is cooperative game for up to 4 people by Diego Albuja Ortiz, where you play in different roles of a submarine crew using your different skills to repair the technical equipment using spare parts before you run out of air.

Place three of the four engine cards in the center of the table and choose a crew card for each. Three markers each go into your action supply, and three more go into your energy supply.

At the beginning of a round, turn over a Spare Parts card.

Take turns placing a marker from an Action Supply onto one or more Spare Parts.

If you lack the appropriate skill in your role, you may still place a marker on the card, but you must also place a marker in your energy supply. The task has you particularly strained.

Every now and then, you'll need to rest instead so that you can replenish your action supply.

If a spare part has all the markers you need on it, you may use it to start repairing a machine by placing one of the markers on it. Each color may only appear once.

When you have completely repaired a machine with the help of the spare parts, it is ready for use again and you may turn over a training card. You can use this card at any time and use its effect, but only once in the whole game.

One allows you to take a break all together and regenerate forces. The other allows you to move up to three markers from one spare part to another at will.

If you manage to repair all three machines before you have used up the spare parts deck twice, you will survive!

If not, the CO2 level will rise too far and you will be trapped at the bottom of the ocean ...

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Hangry
description: Hangry is the fast-paced, food-flipping game featuring delicious cuisine. Flip your food card, look for a match, and slap! Chop chop! There are other hangry players trying to poach your favorite food. Collect the most cards and reward yourself with mouth-watering menu items. The first player to fill their table setting wins the game. Hangry is a quick and easy recipe for fun!

name: ラッキーメーカー (Lucky Maker)
description: Lucky Maker is a trick-taking game in which cards each have two suits. The winning suit is unknown until all players have played into the trick. At that point, the suit with the majority that matches the "Master Card" become the winning suit. The player with the highest number of that suit wins the trick and scores points.

name: Star Wars: Galactic Battle Game
description:
This game is a pack in with every Hasbro 3.75 inch Star Wars action figure. Each figure comes with a stat card with bonus powers, a base to hold the figure and the card and a die.
The die is custom and has 6 Star Wars symbols on it.
Make up your army of figures from as few or as many as you want. Pick an opponents figure to battle and roll the dice. The symbol on the dice can grant you bonuses if the symbol matches one on your card.
The last man standing wins.

Each battle card comes with a number of stats like Battle Skills, Force Ability and Luck and a number that represents how talented your warrior is in that field.

The figures that include the game are drawn from both the film series and the Clone Wars animated series.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: JELL-O Jiggler Slap Game
description:
"LEFT HAND... LIME!" Listen for the JELL-O flavor that's read out loud, then be the quickest to slap your hand-- the CORRECT hand-- on the corresponding JELL-O Jiggler card.
If a "Jiggle!" card is called out, you must jiggle and wiggle for the flavor you savor. You'll love this quick-thinking, hand-slapping game from everyone's favorite jiggly treat. There's always room for this JELL-O gelatin game!

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Squiggly Worms
description: Squiggly Worms features a large plastic "apple" that contains 20 plastic worms inside of 20 holes. The apple is mechanically operated by pulling a lever (no batteries required). A player pulls the lever which causes the worms to move up and down, popping out of the holes. The player must grab the worms one at a time and check to see if the color on the tail matches one of the color cards in his hand. If it matches he keeps the worm. If it doesn't match he puts it back in the hole. Other players can watch to see what colors are put back in case they need them. When the worms stop moving the player's turn ends. The player with the most color matches wins.

name: Arena
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

The cost of life is increasing every day, and you do not know what to do with the coins in your pockets? Then Arena is the game for you! All the matches in this particular Arena are fought using nothing but coins and some dexterity: the White player and the Black one, on their turn, grab one of the twenty coins available and drop it in the Arena, trying to cover their opponent's dots while protecting their owns. Each move can mess up the board, because you are not only challenging your friend, but also the force of gravity itself!

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

name: The Lie Detector Game
description:
From the publisher:

idQuest: A new game of lies and laughter. Imagine showing up at a party with some sophisticated polygraph equipment. Then imagine what it would be like to strap it on some unsuspecting soul.
Now let's imagine putting that person through a series of all sorts of embarrassing questions. Can't you just see all the other guests laughing every time the machine registers a lie? Imagine the fun, imagine the spectacle...Imagine no more!

Call it the perfect ice breaker, a novelty, a gizmo from hell, call it idQuest the lie detector game.

idQuest is a socially interactive adult party game that consists of a hand held lie detector and 216 socially provocative questions. The lie detector was developed and patented by a police polygraph examiner and an electronics engineer. The questions are designed to contrast the id and the ego. The questions are about things that most people have done or thought about, but don't want to admit.

Players are divided up into two teams. After determining who will be questioned first, the question cards are then randomly selected and read to all players.

The other team must then discuss which question will generate the highest emotional response from the player being questioned. Once this has been decided, with the lie detector engaged, the two questions are asked. The hand held lie detector will then display the size of the emotional response to each question using an illuminated bar graph. If the opposing team guessed correctly the device sounds an incriminating alarm and they are awarded a point.

You'll laugh at each other! You'll laugh at yourself! You'll find out how much you don't know about friends, and how much we all have in common.

Nominated by the National Research Council as one of the most innovative projects of 1996.

name: Buy It or Don't
description:
HILARIOUS CREATIVE FUN: BUY IT OR DON'T IS A TOTAL PITCHFEST
From the makers of Pulsar Event: Battle Card Game comes a new game is NOTHING like it.
It's time to get serious about investing in your game night portfolio! Buy It Or Don't is the energetic party game that allows players to craft products ideas out of a mix bag of random Descriptors and Noun cards. Throw in a Slogan card and pitch your latest and greatest terrible idea! The Investor player chooses to "buy" their favorite pitched product. First player to sell 5 products wins and is crowned "The Biggest Pitch".
Buy It or Don't comes fully loaded with over 250 unique cards for a ridiculous amount of creative combinations. With continued success expansions will pour out like "Glow-in-the-Dark" + "Prison Wine" to keep the game as fresh as "Zeus's" + "Meat of the Month Club"

—description from the publisher

name: Hop Pop
description:
"A lively game of funny animals ready to stalk and capture."

Players must attempt to catch small plastic animals that are mounted on spring-loaded platforms which are set in predetermined positions in the colorful 14" square game board. Cards held determine which animals are available to a player on a particular turn.

The first player to capture five animals is the winner.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Harry Potter Famfrpal Metlobal
description: Harry Potter - Quiddtich is easy memory game. Your task is to find 4 parts of a Quiddtich stadium and then to find the tile with the ball to score. Just be careful, if you find all parts of the stadium but do not find the ball your opponent can place a tile with the minus scoring and give you some minus points this way.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Rope
description: Rope is a game of patterns and quick reaction, inspired by the classic game Ricochet Robot. Player must recreate the pattern or not flipped up from the deck of cards using their own pieces of rope and rings.

name: Donald Duck Money Bag
description: Players move around the board with the help of spinner to grab money bags. Player with the most money bags wins in the end of the game.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Birds and Squirrels: black bird edition
description:
Description from the publisher:

A Kickstarted creation. The second by Scolopendra Games Creator Joseph Pendergast.

Rules of play:
Each person gets a player strip and the cards are placed face down on the table. If you do not have enough strips for all the players just remember to stop at 6 cards. Take turns flipping cards onto your player strips in turn.
Squirrel cards clear your line and you get no points.
Hawk cards clear all lines and no points are collected.
White raven cards are wild and the suggested use is to double the score of a line but, it is up to you.
Once you have successfully filled a line with cards you may choose to keep your score by counting the number of birds up and adding them to what you already have acquired or if any blank cards are present you may try to gain more points by waiting to cover them a turn at a time until you desire to stay with what you have. After a line is successfully cleared draw a new card and play resumes. If a hawk or squirrel clears your line you do not pick up a new card.
Place all used birds in a face-up discard pile. You may not draw from this discard pile. When you run out of cards shuffle the discard and continue play.
Once the agreed upon score is reached by any player either that player wins after all other players finish their turns or all other players have a chance to overcome the winner before the deck runs out.
This rule card may be used as an optional 4 bird card.
For a quick single player game, try to make it to 30 points in one round through the deck.
The number of points you choose to go to decides how long gameplay will be I generally play to 30 but some people will play to 1000.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Marvel ReCharge CCG
description:
Two players face off with their deck of Marvel Superheroes. For every battle, you compare the power numbers on their respective Hero cards with the highest number winning. Other cards, such as Power cards and Teamwork cards, can be used to bump up the power total or bring other Hero cards into play respectively.

Counters are used to bet on the outcome of a turn, with the first player to 30 points worth of counters being the winner.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting

name: Pimps and Ho's
description:
A roll-and-move "adult" themed board game. From the publisher's web site:

"The craziest board game ever made! Adult game content. It's crude, it's hilarious, it's extremely vindictive, but be warned...it is not a game for the timid, this is a seriously fun game that has you bustin a gut laughin, or gritten your teeth on every play. Looking for a fun adult board game, you just found it! You've never played adult party games like this. It's a board game that weaves sex and strategy into every play. Buy yours today and introduce Pimps and Ho's at your next adult party. We promise...you'll be the hit of the party!"

Several expansion sets are available: Sick and Twisted, Drinking, Swingers, and StripTease.

name: Invasores
description: Each player has nine spaceships and one atomic-cannon. The objective of the game is to land all your spaceships in the enemy's planet, on the other side of the board. You move the spaceships by rolling the dice and if an enemy approaches your planet you can try to shoot him with the atomic-cannon.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Grow Jogos e Brinquedos

name: Scruble Cube
description:
Scruble Cube (Swedish and Finnish: Alfapet Twist) consists of a 4x4x4 Rubik's Cube, except a letter (along with the letter's point value) appears on each exposed side of each sub-cube. These letters are attached on circular pegs that freely rotate. This enables you to rotate each letter so that you can spell words in any direction.

Players have 90 seconds manipulate the cube to form a word in a straight line that may wrap around the cube. Other sub-cube faces have Scrabble-type point modifiers such as double letter score or tripe word score. You get to use these point modifiers if they appear at the beginning or end of your word. A variant allows you to use these modifiers to represent any letter. Players also score bonuses if their word covers more than one face and if it intersects a previously created word (and that word still appears on the cube).

From the web site of the game, http://www.scrublecube.com/:

If you can spell you can play ... SCRUBLE Cube!

What if you took some of the known playing patterns of some of the most popular word games and puzzles in history and combined them in a brand new, unique format to create the World’s Greatest 3-D Word Game? Well, you’d have the SCRUBLE Cube, a patent pending game with over 7.4 x 10^45 (that’s 7,401 septillion) possible configurations that anyone who can spell can play. And all in a portable format that can be played anywhere -- anytime. The SCRUBLE Cube is a word game and a puzzle -- on steroids!

name: Fail!
description: From the publisher's website: A player starts by reading one of the four category cards: (Mis)Leading Questions, (Im)Personal Trivia, Trivial Abandonment, or Bad-Libs. Other players discreetly submit their most awful answers, and the reader chooses the answer that FAILS! the most to win.

name: Battle Of The Bikes
description:
Fixie or Brompton Pinarello racer or Mongoose BMX which is the fastest? The most expensive? How about their ride-by kudos, or their crash survival rate? These playing cards allow bike lovers of all ages to play iconic makes and models off against each other to discover whos got the best set of wheels.

Gameplay

On your turn you name one of the traits and its value of a bikecard from your hand. The other players chose one of there bikecards and call the value. The player with the highest call win the cards.

The goal is to win the most bike cards.

name: The Reel to Reel Picture Show
description:
This is two games in one. Reel to Reel is a movie trivia game to interest all type of players from the novice to the movie buff. "The Picture Show" is a picture drawing game in which players draw words or phrases for their team.

Play as individuals or in teams. Race around the board as fast as you can collecting the different category pieces to win.

Three years later, a short-lived game show based on the board game of the same name ran on PAX (later called I, now Ion Television) ran from August 31 until October 2, 1998 hosted by veteran game show host Peter Marshall. Produced by the now-defunct Til' Productions.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game
publishers: Daisy Reel Productions Inc., The Reel to Reel Picture Show Ltd.

name: Deer Hunter 2050
description: In this future scenario, you play a hunter trying to bring his/her quota of mutant deer back to the Fish & Game Bureau first. Players alternate moving their hunter pawn and a random deer pawn. Cards are drawn depending on certain movement rolls that aid or hinder players. When moving deer, players can move them toward their hunter, away from other hunters, or to another hunter and roll to attack the hunter and send him/her to the hospital. Rolls also determine the success of hunters' attacks on deer.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Edge of the World
description:
Get ready for an adventure at sea! Are you ready to sail to the end of the world?

Each player controls a ship with a hold that has room for up to four Trade Discs.
New action cards are drafted each round and then used for either travelling or fighting. Each card can be used only for one of the two options, so some kind of sacrifice is done each time a card is used.

The players sail their ships between the Northern half of Europe and the Southern half picking up Trade Discs from active cities and delivering them to the other side of the known world. The Trade Discs are kept secret from the other players and can contain either trade goods or manpower to be used for attacking. The attacking can be aimed at an active city, but also against another player's ship. When stopping in a city dock the player has to make a choice: Raid or Trade.

By both raiding and trading the players can accumulate gold, and the first player to 150 wins a spot for the final battle. The other players then race to be the first to reach the dock where the battle will happen. The single player who wins the final battle is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Drawing, Finale Ending, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Trading, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Knights' Kingdom Challenge Card Game
description: Knights' Kingdom Challenge Card Game is a card game based on the Knights' Kingdom LEGO series. In the card game, two players face off against each other in a joust with each card bearing one of four joust symbols (sword, helmet, shield, and Heart of the Magical Shield) and numerical values in each of four skills (speed, agility, strength and wisdom). Gameplay is similar to Top Trumps. Each player draws a card from their deck. Players compare their joust symbols (without revealing their skill values) in rock-paper-scissors style to determine the challenger and defender. Then the challenger chooses a skill, and players reveal their cards. Players compare the value of the cards in the chosen skill, and the player whose skill is highest wins the joust.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Give a Dog a Bone
description:
From the Publisher:

Each player claims a dog house. Create the game path with the 10 extra-sturdy game squares. Move the plastic puppy along the path - when you land on a space that features the dog in your dog house, you collect dog bones. As the puppy moves, so does the game path, so it never ends - and it's different every time you play! When all the dog bones are collected, the player with the most is the winner.
publishers: International Playthings, Inc., Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: The Great Goanna Hunt
description:
(From the publisher's website)

The Great Goanna Hunt™ is a true-blue Aussie game! If you like treasure hunts, you’re going to love searching our vast, breathtaking landscape. Your goal is to collect Goanna treasures (footprints & eggs) by guessing the location of Australian towns and cities. Experienced explorers can play a second, even more challenging game. Using a set of clue cards, you can launch a fast paced battle requiring quick thinking and even quicker answers!

* Enjoy some fun family times together for Ages 8 and up
* 2 games in one for 2-4 players
* Builds both knowledge and memory skills
* Perfect for both classroom and home use
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gut gefragt ist halb gewonnen!
description:
Back of box, translated:

Depending on the number of players, a deck of 12-16 cards is prepared. One player draws the top card, rolls the coloured die and then reads the corresponding ANSWER on the card. Every player, including the reader, then writes down a QUESTION that could match the answer. Afterwards everybody reads their answer and points are awarded for matches.

name: Delta: värikäs seurapiiripeli
description:
At the beginning of the game every player takes one "color code" card with the pattern he needs to win.
Every player during his turn picks his top most colored triangle from his stack and places it in the central square area of the board, trying to reproduce his winning pattern.
If the whole board contains visible triangles of just one color, then every player picks a new color code card.
Winner is the person who has first completes the figure on his color code card.

name: C'est la Vie
description:
In this game players must gain friends in an apartment building in order to win the chance to rent the penthouse.

First each player receives a number of cards which are played in the second phase of the game: these cards tell him of the relationships between the current inhabitants of the building allowing him to select the best road to victory.

After this the players receive a number of character traits and outfits. In order to befriend an inhabitant, one must meet this person while wearing the correct outfit and using the correct character trait. (play the correct cards). These cards can be traded at the local shrink or boutique.
After a few rounds of moving around and making friends, the second phase starts.
In this phase the relationships are put into play by playing the cards mentioned above: having befriended some people, but not others may gain you more friends. Each player only knows of the relationships on his cards, which means that other players may have some surprises for you.

name: Evil Genius
description:
Free web-published card game that can be found at http://www.xenomind.com/ludo/index.html (currently this page is down). Made to be printed on business cards.

Players are evil geniuses attempting to satisfy the requirements for performing "Greater Experiments", such as building a robot army or mastering weather control. Among the requirements are various ingredients, such as body parts or duct tape, as well as completing "Lesser Experiments", such as building a mind control laser or harnessing a brain in a jar. These lesser experiments also require ingredients, and once completed they can give players special powers (such as increasing their hand size). Players may trade with other players for ingredients and whatnot on their way to world domination.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: FRANCHI$IT
description: Using your wits, strategy, and hopefully a little luck to buy and control as many franchises as you can, build up your cash and try to become the wealthiest player by the end of the game!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Screen Challenge
description:
Screen Challenge is a game that tests the players' knowledge of movies and their industry. Taking turns, each player rolls the special die and draws a deck from the indicated deck to start testing his or her knowledge (and to move his or her token).

The four different categories have different styles of tests and rewards. The Big Picture provides a snippet of a plot and asks for the movie title and two of its major stars; a correct answer allows the player to move their token ahead a space. Fast Forward/Rewind provides three clues on an actor or film, advancing the player's token two spaces for a correct answer but backwards two spaces for an incorrect one. Correctly answering Outtakes' questions about trivia allows a player to move an opponent's token back three spaces. Action's task is basically a scramble against time for everyone to write down 6 films related to a category, advancing those who answered correctly.

The first player to move his or her token to the last space on the board wins the game.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cash oder Crash
description: One player plays a card with a color on it. The next has to play one with a number on it. The color says who can move on the gameboard.

name: Battle of the Sexes: Blind Date Game
description:
From the publisher:

The Battle of the Sexes: Blind Date Edition. Based upon the hit television program, "Blind Date." The battle just heated up! This version of the hit party game "Battle of the Sexes" is a little spicier. Can she tell you who founded Playboy? Can he tell you another term for "g-string"? Does not include Roger Lodge. Combat was never so fun! The aim of the game is to test your knowledge of the opposite sex through a series of gender-based trivia questions. Does she know what an odometer is? Could he tell you how to stop a hole in your pantyhose from getting any bigger? To spice things up, the battle gets a little tougher with wild cards. These cards could either propel you to an easy victory-- for buying diamonds for her birthday-- or send you catapulting backwards-- for borrowing his razor to shave your legs!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Permission
description: 'The New Property Development Board Game': in contrast to Monopoly presumably. Play comprises two stages. In stage one players travel around a a perimeter track, 'the inner ring road' on the roll of two dice, collect income on one corner and pay taxes on another. Each space represents a parking space. These give either an option to purchase either property or pick up a card and follow the instructions on it. The object is to collect a complete site made up of ten back-land plots together with a drainage easement. When a player has achieved this, movement moves to the outer (ring road?) track that is meant to represent the process of obtaining Planning Approval for the development. This is achieved by firstly collecting cards giving recommendations for approval from three separate local authority departments and then being the first to land on the town hall space: yes, on the roll of the dice and, yes, doubles mean another go!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fußball-Spiel
description:
Fußball-Spiel (Or "Jalkapallopeli" (Fin.) or "Fotbollspelet" (Swe.)) is a football (soccer) simulation for 2-players from the East German games publisher SPIKA, and so it is from the glory days of old DDR.

The titles mean "football game" in German, Finnish and Swedish. The Finnish/Swedish was probably mostly sold in Finland, who is an officially bi-lingual (Finnish and Swedish) country, but likely also available in Sweden.

name: Fargo
description:
This is a game about the old west. You can bring cattle from Bulls Ranch to Ok Corral, selling guns to Indians, or bringing hides along Powder river. Between the "working" you can spend some time in Fargo City. Enter the casino, the general store or hunt famous bandits like Jesse James in Carters Saloon.

You choose one route and follow it by rolling the dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: DrinkMaster Says...
description:
From the back of the box:

DrinkMaster Says is the ultimate party in a pack. The game is an exciting mix of rules and challenges, loaded with non-stop action. Once you start playing you may never want to stop!

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards. Along the way, you might have to drink with o hands, balance stuff on your head, or be part of a burping competition ,just to name a few.

So gather your friends, pop open your favorite beverage and deal out the cards - Find out who among you can truly be called DrinkMaster!

There are 2 types cards:

Blue Cards - These cards are known as the Challenge Cards. Attempt to put your skills to the test. If the player is victorious, he/she does not drink and may distribute that amount of drinks to the other player(s).
Green Cards - These are known as the Rule Cards. Follow the rules or drink. Rule Cards are in effect until replaced by the next rule card that is placed on top.

Red Boxes - The boxes on the bottom half of the Rules Cards are known as the Action Boxes. These are specific tasks that must be completed by the person that plays the card.

Numbers on Cards - Located in the upper left corner of all cards. This is the number of drinks to be had if anyone breaks a rule or loses a challenge.

Each player is dealt four cards. Play begins to the left of the dealer. The first player can choose to play either color card to begin the game. The next player must play a card of the opposite color (or take a drink and skip their turn.) Discard the used card face up in the appropriate pile (during play you should have two piles - a Rules pile and a Challenge pile). Play continues to the left until directed differently by the Action Boxes.

name: Den Store Bagedyst
description:
A family board game based on the Danish TV show "Den Store Bagedyst", a spin-off of the The Great British Bake Off TV show, where contestants compete in creating the best cakes.

Players roll a dice and move around on a circular board where they land on spaces which result in various challenges. They get to do such things as answer a question from a card draw, solve a picture puzzle, carry a construction round the table, or do other things that are all cake related. If they succeed in any of the challenges they get a chefs hat, and the first player to gather twenty of those wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Trivia

name: Crazy Food
description:
In Crazy Food you have to be the quickest to grab the food needed to solve the puzzle on each card.
Work out the next in the sequence and gab the fruit before anyone else
The first to get five points wins.
Each card has a sequence, the first who take the correct color or shape of the fruit to continue the sequence win one point.

—description from the publisher

name: Soccer Challenge
description: Players use cards to advance their soccer player down the field to score a goal while also using cards to block their opponent from doing the same.

name: Herzklopfen
description:
While playing Herzklopfen you can get to know the other players better, you could even lose your heart ...
Each player gives themselves scores for their positive characteristics.
From then on you roll and move - and answer questions.
With every question asked and answer given, you try to find a fitting mate amongst the other players, who resembles you most concerning their answers.

name: Logik for Viderekomne
description: A logical thinking game where you answer yes, no or gibberish to the questions asked. An example of a question is “can a hungry beaver, that freezes, be wet if it is full?” or “can a sticky marshmallow, which is soft, be round if it is sweet?”. If the question is contradictory and you can answer yes or no then gibberish is the right answer.

name: The "I Love Lucy" Game
description: A board game based on the I Love Lucy television series. Players travel around the board gaining cash and act out famous scenes from the series.

name: Karaoke the Game
description:
The players divide into teams that race around the board, trying to get the team members to guess artists by singing, or if they are not able to sing, by describing the artist. The questions come from the 4 categories Rock & Roll, Pop, Country and Oldies. Some cards contain the words "Sing it!" that mean that you have to sing any of the other artists on the song.

The race part of the game uses dices, and works much like any other party games. There are a number of action spaces on the board, and the actions are written on the same cards as the question cards with artists on them, which is rather inconvenient.

name: Seattle in a box
description:
Another in Late for the Sky Production Company's Monopoly inspired games. In place of Atlantic City street names, this game's properties are familiar places in and around Seattle, from Skid Road (Seattle was in fact the home of the original Skid Road) and Fremont Troll (a bizarre and popular local sculpture) to Mt. Rainier and Elliott Bay.

In place of Electric Company and Water Works, Seattle in a box has Seattle's Best Coffee and Ferry Boats.

Instead railroads, we have four Seattle neighborhoods.

While hell in early 20th century Atlantic City may have been jail, in modern Seattle it is a traffic jam.

The metal tokens are the Space Needle, a salmon, an apple, an umbrella, a crab, and a slug.

The Monopoly board begins with GO. Seattle in a box begins with RAIN.

And in a nod to a popular Monopoly house rule, instead of Free Parking, this game has Puget Sound where all the game's fines are collected and given to the player landing there.

Seattle in a box is amusing for Seattleites and visitors to the Emerald City, and it is very familiar to anyone who has played the original Monopoly.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Hästspelet
description: Horse game were the players try to make it through a course with obstacles while receiving the best marks that they can.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Alfons kurragömma-jakt
description:
Alfons Åberg is the main character in a series of very popular children’s books from Sweden.

The players play catch and seek and when there is only one player left on the board, that player wins the game. Each player has four wooden pieces that are moved round and round on the board. If you end up on the same space as another player you catch that players piece. Some spaces are marked as hiding places, if you end up on the same hiding place as another player you have to pick up a card from the draw pile and if the card has a picture of the same character you are trying to catch, that players piece is caught.

Ages 4 and up
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crossword Challenge
description:
From the box:
Crossword Challenge gives you all the fun of a regular crossword as well as the chance to compete with your friends or family. Each player or team has a pad of blank crosswords. The "Cluemaster reads a clue and the first person to grab the Gizmo has the opportunity to answer.
The result is a hilarious grab for the Gizmo to make sure you answer first and get the points.
There are 40 puzzles in the book with varying degrees of difficulty.

Contents include: game board, gizmo (small soft plastic toy), 1 clue book, 5 crossword playing pads, 5 pawns, 5 pencils.

name: Patron-ow
description: Players take turns playing 'Russian Roulette'. Beginning of the players turn one out of 7 bullets is 'loaded'. Player rolls a die and can take any number of bullets (one after the other...) until he stops or draws the loaded one. He receives points equal to the number of bullets times the die roll - of course these are negative when he drew the loaded one.

name: Pingu på skattjakt
description: Easy bluffing game for children. You choose small ice blocks and then one opponent tries to deceive you whether there is gold underneath the block or not. The first player to collect five gold is the winner.

name: EleMental
description:
EleMental is a 3D strategy board game for ages 10+. Players take charge of the five EleMental forces of Earth, Water, Fire, Air and Time and battle it out across the EleMental planes to reach the center of the board - Creation.

Once a player has reached Creation they must build up a collection of EleMents to the extent that they are immovable, or better still, get all five types of EleMent onto the creation spot, thereby making an 'Ultimate' or 'Perfect Force'. An IMMOVABLE, PERFECT or ULTIMATE FORCE instantly wins the game.

How a player wins the game determines how many points they are awarded at the end; this points tally can be affected by throwing the EleMental dice. If a player is confident they will win they can throw the dice to multiply the points - multipliers range from 2x to 20x the winning points total.

name: Sylabex
description:
Sylabex is a word-making game, easy to play in which both skill and luck are involved.

The cards all bear a three-letter syllable and a number (which is the points value used in scoring). Any cards when placed beside certain of the other cards forms a complete six letter word, or in some cases will form a nine letter word.

The object of the game is to make words with all the cards in your hand. Other players score the points value of the cards in hand when the round ends, and the winner is the player with the lowest score after the agreed numbers of rounds.

name: Monopoly: Atlanta Braves
description:
From Publisher:

The Monopoly Brand proudly presents the Atlanta Braves™ Collector’s Edition of America’s favorite board game. Braves fans now have the opportunity to buy, sell and trade Braves players, coaches, announcers and team icons. Features legendary Braves players like Hank Aaron, John Smoltz and Andruw Jones. Includes six collectible pewter tokens: Braves hat, batter, pitcher, ball in glove, Georgia dog and the Atlanta Braves tomahawk. With some of the all-time greatest Major League Baseball players and a bright future ahead, the Braves continue to make for exciting play in this timeless game of risk taking and deal making. Bankrupt your opponents in a quest to own the Braves.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Acronymity
description: Guess the meaning of an acronym or abbreviation to advance around a board. First person/team to reach the ending space on the board and then answer a question correctly wins. Each game comes with 952 question cards in about 20 categories. Answering a question correctly without needing any hints allows you to roll a 4-5-6 die to determine your movement; if you needed a hint, you instead roll a 1-2-3 die.

name: Hot Slots
description: A casino dice game that uses 3 dice to simulate 3 rollers of a slot machine. Points are awarded for various combos, and the first player to reach 1000 points wins the game.

name: Pocket Ungame: Teens
description:
This is the Teen version of Ungame. This set has new cards that are specifically designed for teens, their parents, and youth groups to get to know each other better and explore each other's feelings.

There are 140 cards divided into two decks of 70 cards each. The first deck contains lighter questions such as, "If you were stranded on an island, whom would you like for a companion."

The second deck is composed of more specific questions and deeper questions, for example, "Share your feelings about child abuse." That's heavy.

Players take turns drawing cards and answering the questions on them in a few sentences. Most of the rules are considered as guidelines, such as the "hint" to keep your answers fairly short, but the Rule of Silence during another player's answer must be observed.

As with other games in the Ungame series, there is no winner or loser. The object of the game is to spend quality time with your family and learn more about the thought and feelings of those closest to you.

name: Heist
description: Heist is a card game depicting the efforts of a modern band of thieves to pull off a major caper. Recruit members to your gang and accumulate the right set of skills to pull it off. Mess with your opponents Jobs or trade with them to get the skills you need.

name: Sedmiměstí
description:
Game is played in the country "Sedmiměstí" ("Seven-cities"). There are six ordinary cities on the board and one magic - The seventh. Goal of the game is reach the magic city which is located on an island in the middle of the board. To get into the magic city you need to know names of three magic items.

It's a game of fun and parody, combining strategic games and RPG. Very quick game setup.

Box contents:
- 1 colorful board 60 x 60 cm in two variants
- 21 hero cards
- 25 fortune cards (magic items and beings)
- 33 encounter cards
- 3 six-sided dice
- 33 plastic card stands
- 1 list of magic items
- rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Duck Duck 1-2-3
description:
Welcome to Duck Duck 1-2-3, where you move Mama duck around the park, pick up all the baby ducklings and take them to a party in the pond!

This game is one in the latest wave of games by Cranium for preschoolers. These games intend to bring parents and their little ones together by participating in a fun and interactive setting.
The three games in the trilogy (Puppy Pals Bingo, Duck Duck 1-2-3 and Polar Bear A-B-C) are a fun way for your preschooler to learn about matching shapes and patterns, simple counting and spelling.

In Duck Duck 1-2-3, players must spin a spinner to move their Mama ducks around the various parts of the pond to pick up their 3 ducklings. You must count your way along the lily pads to the island in the center where all the ducks are having a party!

name: Follow-mir. English game
description:
Objective:
Be the first to reach the final stop on Oxford Street.

ways to play:
The first player turns the wheel and say aloud the color that corresponds to them, spelled in English. Then, he moves with his statement indicated the number of boxes in the color.

There are the following boxes:
Substantive-Box
Adjectives-Box
Verb-Box
-Box numbers
- Box Bus Stop: Lose a turn
Bus-Box Jump: Back to throw

Content:
1 board
4 chips
40 letters of verbs
80 letters of substantive
40 letters of adjectives
1 Roulette
1 Dictionary
1 tape cassette
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

name: Miljöspelet
description:
Roll and move trivia game with an environmental theme. The rules stress that discussing the answers given to questions is the most important part of playing.

Note that there is a different game with the same name.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Junior DKT: Das kaufmännische Talent
description:
Children's version of the Austrian classic DKT. The game works monopoly-like: players roll dice and walk around the board, following instructions from cards, buying, selling or paying others. Besides money, there is another form of currency: entrance tickets. These can be used to pay other players, but also have to be collected to exchange them for money.
The game is theme park-themed, so players buy and run rides.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Socceristic
description:
Socceristic is a very realistic representation of an actual game of football (soccer). Players choose either a club or national team they wish to be and play out a challenge match following the rules laid down for the world's number one sport.The board game creates excitement, brilliant moves, joy and disappointment, great banter and re-invents imagination.

Socceristic is the only football (soccer) board game that features every rule in football, including scoring goals, tackles, fouls, injuries, substitutions, sending-offs, penalties etc. The objecticve is to score more goals than your opponent in the pre-agreed time.

The board is a scaled down pitch divided into squares. Movement of the ball is determined by throwing the dice, the icon in the square the ball lands in, the square in which the ball finishes determines the next action, either via a direction arrow or one of 27 Outcome cards or 27 Referee's Decision cards.
There are injuries to deal with and there are yellow and red cards to contend with.

For 2 players or teams, aged 8+

name: Strawberry Shortcake Labyrinth
description:
Explore the labyrinth and try to collect the greatest berry treasure of all. Spin the spinner and move to the next flower of that type on your path; if there is a berry token, you may pick it up. Beware of the berry thief, though! You can head for the finish line whenever you want to, but everyone's berry treasures stay hidden - you won't know how many berries your opponents have until it's time to reveal them at the end.

The modular labyrinth consists of large puzzle pieces, so every game is different. The game is easy to learn and full of exciting twists and turns.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Platinum Series Baseball
description:
Platinum Series Baseball, or PSB, is a fast-paced, tabletop dice-and-card baseball strategy game that puts YOU in control of a fantasy style Big League franchise. PSB is an official licensee of the Major League Baseball Players Association.

As the manager of a big league franchise, you are in charge of building a team of all-stars.

Two managers compete in a realistic head-to-head baseball simulation, where the dice determine the outcome of each play. Managers need to use real baseball strategy to gain the advantage and earn the win. Each game box will provide enough player cards to field 2 full teams. You can build the ultimate team by acquiring more player card packs.

Real player stats drive the outcome of each play, combined with the luck of a dice roll and clever strategies employed by each manager. Strike out or hit a home run to clear the bases! As you become a better manager, unlock more gameplay features online to become the ultimate manager. Access stadiums, weather, and more complex calls that only an expert manager can make!

The stadium is filled and the fans are cheering for you to take the field as the manager of your own big league franchise. Play ball!

1) Build your team
2) Roll to play offense and defense
3) Use real baseball strategy to win
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Trading

name: F*That!
description: In F*That!, the active player each round is presented with an uncomfortable or unusual situation (e.g., You've just gone to the bathroom only to discover afterward that no toilet paper is available. What's an acceptable substitute?) along with five possible solutions for this situation (e.g., fashion magazine, pile of leaves, etc.). The active player tells everyone how many of the solutions they find acceptable, then everyone else simultaneously guesses which solutions that player might pick.

name: Blowfish Blowup
description: Will a player's hand make the fish expand? This fun game combines fun and easy play with a silly and exciting payoff! Try not to startle this silly blowfish who has collected all kinds of special treasures. Reach inside the bowl to fish out the treasures… but watch out! If a player grabs one too many treasures, the blowfish might expand suddenly, sending them out of the game! The only player not to make the blowfish inflate wins. In the Advanced Play option, players count up the number of points for each of their treasures, and the player with the most points wins.

name: Yogi Bear Game
description:
From the box:

Yogi and Boo Boo were at home in their cave. It was a nice day and the door was open. The aroma of fresh baked cakes and doughnuts drifted thru the open door. Yogi knew it came from Ranger Smith's Headquarters and he was determined to get a taste of the goodies. Boo Boo told Yogi he could get in real trouble if he tried to get them. Yogi said he would go alone but Boo Boo knew he would help his friend if he could. In this game, each player moves both Yogi and Boo Boo thru many adventures to be the first to get to the Ranger Station and all the sweets there.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blip
description: An early attempt at producing a hand-held "electronic" tennis game like Pong, BLIP featured a light-emitting diode which tracked across a dark plastic screen. Players had to decide which of three bars the LED would hit, and press the corresponding button before the "blip" got there. Otherwise, your opponent scored a point. The game was basically a really slow version of Gnip Gnop, and it made an obnoxious racket.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Treasure, Treasure!
description:
This treasure hunt is played on a spiral board; there is a treasure in the middle that players are trying to reach. Each player is secretly assigned the color of one of the pawns, and each player gets three cards.
The active player rolls two dice and multiplies the result with the number of one of the cards in his/her hands to move the pawn of the same color (as the card) the corresponding number of fields. If the pawn lands on a spiral, it changes positions with another pawn; if it lands on a feather, it can move the double distance.
When the first pawn reaches the center field, the secret colors are revealed, and the player who has the same color as the winning pawn wins the game.

name: Minister i klister
description: You are the Prime Minister (oddly there is four parties (purple, yellow, red and green) all with their respective Prime Minister!) and try to control your ministers so you can stay in power. But some of the ministers leak stories to the press, but who is doing it? Ministers that become too involved in sleazy affairs will be sacked and given new roles as county governors (of which there was 25 in Sweden at this time, correctly reflected in the map of the game). The player (Prime Mister / party) with the fewest county governors when all 25 has been appointed, wins the game.

name: Mare Bella
description:
Mare Bella is a children's game that takes place at the sea side. Players have to collect 5 hidden types of sea animals and avoid picking up rubbish such as tires and old boots that have been washed up by the tide. But if they do, they will have the opportunity to rid the beach of such litter, which brings its own reward.

For the younger player, the game has a simple environmental message; for the older player it has a gameplay in which a certain amount of skill and memory is involved.

Basic Rules:

Each player has a 'lotto' board, with space for 5 sea animals: a fish, starfish, crab, sea urchin (type thing) and an octopus. The aim is to be the first to collect all 5 of these, from amongst the square tiles that are laid out over the playing area. Players receive the 'beach bag' from which they draw a round token (same idea as dipping into the Scrabble bag that holds the letters). This token has on it a particular fish type or a particular colour on it. The player then chooses a square tile from the playing area whose upside corresponds in colour or fish type to the round token. He/she flips over the square tile to reveal its underside (which is likely to be different). If the underside is a fish that he/she hasn't collected yet, then the player adds it to his 'lotto' board. If the underside shows a pollution, he/she must collect the pollution. Once a player has three, then he/she may remove them from the game and get a 'free dip'.

Memorising the underside of certain tiles definitely helps, but is not essential, meaning that anyone can play from the age of 3 and up, although the game is certainly illustrated with kids in mind.

The game is soon to be available in the UK, costing around £18. See www.isimat.fr or email muellbauer@lycos.com for details
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Memory

name: Munchkin Water
description:
Part of the Munchkin series

Healthful!
Refreshing!
In-Game Benefits!

Despite the dangers of dihydrogen oxide, munchkins everywhere enjoy it, and now we have special, Munchkin-ized water. Unseal this 16.9-ounce bottle at your gaming table for bonuses to combat, and enjoy up to three in-game-benefit-producing swallows of Munchkin Water! Then sell the bottle for 100 gold pieces!

But wait, there's more! You can:

Use it to quench your thirst!
Rinse your mouth out after a handful of nachos!
Clean produce before eating!
Wash the dog!
And a million other applications!
Warning! Apparently not valid as a promotional item in certain casinos in Nevada

Additional Rules:
You may use this bottle in any game of Munchkin or it's sequels. It may be used during any combat.

Show everybody the bottle so they can read the rules and see whether it's sealed. Only if the bottle is sealed at the beginning of the game can you be sure it contains genuine Munchkin Water. Refilled bottles cannot be used for a combat bonus, even with a cheat card.
A sealed bottle contains three swallows - that is, doses - of Munchkin Water. Each swallow gives +1 in combat. You must unseal the bottle and actually drink one swallow for each +1 you want. You may drink all for one combat, to get +3, or spread it out between combats. You may give swallows of your Munchkin Water to other players, but be careful not to share Munchkin germs.
After each swallow, you must mark off one of the three boxes on the label. When all three boxes are marked off, the bottle is empty for game purposes, though you should still finish all the water, because it's good for you.
For alternate expanded rules see www.sjgames.com/munchkin/water
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Flip Flop Pikku Myy
description:
Flip Flop Pikku Myy (Little My / Moomin character) is a childrens game where the aim of the game is to collect cards by throwing the Little My game pieces.

On a turn player places all the Little My pieces (two sided head, torso, hands, legs and feet pieces) in a dice cup, shakes them up and tips the pieces on the table. Once pieces have been thrown player arranges the pieces to form a picture of Little My.

Player then compares the picture formed by the pieces and three open Little My cards on the table and if there's a match (colors and facial expression) player collects the card. If there's no match, player can select pieces and rethrow them twice. After the third toss it's next players turn.

Game ends when a player has collected 7 cards.

name: Mix & Fix cardgame
description:
An educational mathematics card game from Finland. Each player is dealt seven cards face-down from a deck of 50 (numbered 1-15, and three jokers). One card is dealt on the table face-up and the dealer calls "MIX". Players now simultaneously pick up their cards and try to create an equation using exactly three of them with addition, subtraction, or multiplication that will result in the number on the face-up card. For example, if the face-up card shows 11, then (2 x 3) + 5 would do. Fastest player to create a valid equation calls "FIX" and wins a point; play until 21 points to find out who's the winner of the whole game.

Box back claims three play variants, but the rules actually have four: Solo game (practising math), Team game (team gets a point if any team member is the fastest), Joker game (jokers are included in the deck, can be any number) or Memory game (cards are simply used to play the traditional flip-a-card-at-a-time memory game).
mechanics: Open Drafting, Race, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Summoner's Grimoire
description:
Summoner's Grimoire is an occult-themed board game with two distinct modes.

In Basic Mode, players roll dice to move their pieces across a map representing planes of existence, landing on each other to block progress. In the Advanced Mode, players choose Patrons and move their pieces one space each, confronting each other using the statistics of their chosen Patron and a hand of Incantation cards.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Keys To The TARDIS
description:
Time streams have been crossed and now several versions of the doctor are running about the TARDIS at the same time! Choose from six modern regenerations of the doctor and try to make it across the TARDIS. But be careful, there are Daleks, Cybermen, and worse lurking about.

Gameplay
Tiles are randomly set up in a 7x7 grid, with each time representing a closed TARDIS room. On a players turn, the draw a card increasing their hand to four cards. They must play a card, and then move their chosen Doctor to an opened room beside the current room they are in, if they choose to.

Available cards can unlock or lock a room color that matches the card color, block a room with a time barrier card, move an opponent one room with a Cyberman assault, jam cookie card allows to move through a tile that has a Dalek in it when it is opened, a time tunnel card allows you to move diagonally between rooms, and sonic screwdrivers which can open any colored door, close it, or remove a time barrier card.
