Winning the game occurs when one doctor has made their way from one side of the TARDIS to the other side by opening doors and moving your Doctor into the rooms.

name: Harry Potter: Race to the Triwizard Cup
description:
Calling all Harry Potter super-fans! Are you ready for the next Wizarding World adventure with the ultimate Race to the Triwizard Cup? From Dodging the Dragons, landing on Magical Encounters, playing your next Spell Card or passing the Golden Egg, this is the phenomena that will put your inner Wizardry to the test!

The game is basically a luck based die rolling game that has a few cards for the twist.

On a player's turn, the player first plays a card (if have any or want), roll a die and moves according to the die. If a player lands to a spell slot the player draws a spell card and if he/she lands in a magical encounter slot the player draws and reads encounter card and does what it says.

There are also moving dragon tokens that effect the player progression on the board and the spells can push other players backwards or counter other players' spells etc.

When the player goes around the circle he/she gets to the inner circle etc. In the center of the board is the Triwizard Cup and when the player reaches it, the player wins and the game ends.
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: SpongeBob SquarePants: Eels and Escalators – The Board Game
description: Play as the nautical goof, SpongeBob, and win a pair of shoes for Gary and the rest of the Bikini Bottom crew in SpongeBob SquarePants Eels and Escalators! Simply roll the dice and move across the board, riding the escalators to victory! But be careful not to slide down too many eels, or you’ll lose your cool and have to use a Sailor Mouth card to shout a swear word!

name: The Magic Tooth Fairy Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

When a kid loses a play-tooth they place it under the Magic Bed's pillow, plunge the Tooth Fairy Wand and hey presto their tooth has turned into a gold coin.

Great game play recreates all the tension and excitement of losing a tooth - including that Wobbly Tooth Dilemma: do you have the courage to pull your tooth out - or don't you?
publishers: Drumond Park Ltd., Goliath Games, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Playing Gods: Expansion Pack
description:
For Playing Gods players who wish to delve deep into the well of blasphemy (or just want to see deluxe cards with full-color images of the gods), here's an Expansion Pack with 30 deluxe cards specific to the five major religions. They provide special attacks and defenses based on each religion's characteristics, and are easily incorporated into the existing rules and card decks. You can even create your own attacks!

Includes:
- 30 new cards
- 5 blank cards

Expands:

Playing Gods: The Board Game of Divine Domination
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Religious, Wargame

name: HEINZ Ketchup Dice Game
description:
Roll the dice and collect as much ketchup as possible to try and score 57 points! But beware, if you get too greedy for the taste of HEINZ ketchup you could lose everything! Mustard and Sweet Relish bring an added level of flavor to the game, but can serve as penalties in your quest to roll the best. It's HEINZ ketchup or BUST in this press your luck game of risk versus reward! America's Favorite Ketchup game is definitely worth the wait.

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.

name: Treasure Island
description:
Welcome to Treasure Island!
it’s on this lonely desert island that Captain Flint one of the boldest buccaneers ever to sail the seven seas, once hid all his treasure. He intended to return to Treasure Island one day to claim his booty, but (like so many pirates) he drank too much rum and didn’t live to
see either the island or his treasure again! Today there are six other adventurers on Treasure Island and each one of them is now searching for Flints fortune.
They are:-
SQUIRE TRELAWNEY, the owner of the good ship Hispaniola which is moored off the coast of Treasure Island and which has been taken over by its mutinous crew, a band of rascally pirates.
DOCTOR LIVESEY, the ship’s doctor and an old friend of Squire Tretawfley.
CAPTAIN SMOLLETT, the worthy captain of the good ship Hispaniola who has been betrayed by most of his crew.
JIM HAWKINS, who is the cabin boy and one of the bravest lads ever to go to sea.
LONG JOHN SILVER, who is the ship’s cook and the fiercest of all the pirates. To get his hands on the treasure, he will double-cross anyone —even his fellow pirates.
BEN GUNN, who is the wild man of the island and, unlike the others, didn’t arrive on the good ship Hispaniola. Once upon a time Ben Gunn was a member of Captain Flint’s band of
pirates and it was that cruel captain who left him stranded and alone on Treasure Island.

All six are racing to find Flint’s hidden treasure. It’s an exciting race, as you'll discover when you play the Treasure Island game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Birmingham
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Birmingham, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Les Recettes Pompettes: Le Jeu
description:
Inspired by the show of the same name, Les Recettes Pompettes - Le Jeu will get the party started every time! The goal is simple:
Take a card and complete the challenge, otherwise...
SHOOTER!

Before the game, players have to decide what consequence will happen to the player who loses the game. There are 52 challenge cards in the game. A player loses the game once he or she has lost a total of 4 of the challenges that are on the cards. Everyone else wins the game!

name: iKnow junior
description:
Answer questions and perform different tasks, like simple drawing, reading and a lot, lot more! Contains 300 tasks and 100 picture questions along with clues.

—description from the publisher

name: Truth or Dare?
description:
From the publisher:

It’s fun, funny and very revealing! The object of this game is to get rid of all your cards by fessing up and getting silly. Are you ready to sing a song in a foreign language? Do you have the guts to tell everyone in the group which celebrity they most resemble? Do you know the middle name of the player on the right? A terrific icebreaker for young and old alike, it’s a fresh take on an old favorite. Snazzy, sturdy metallic packaging adds to the appeal. Includes 34 Truth or Dare Cards, 16 Do You Know Cards and 3 Rebound Cards. For 2 or more players.

name: Wobbly Worm
description: Children's dexterity game. Either place or throw a ring around the battery-operated snake's head. Difficulty can be adjusted by adding or removing pieces to the snake.

name: Coins
description:
Coins is a trick taking card game for three players. A Spanish deck of 48 cards is used. Coins is distinctive in that the suits are ordered in a cyclic fashion – similar to Rock-Paper-Scissors. The goal is to be the first player to win a given number of coin-cards.

Mark Steere designed Coins in October, 2022.

name: Hazard
description: Themed on Chaucer's Canterbury Tales and an old dice game called Hasard, players gamble stakes on dice rolls, allowing to progress along the track. In doing so, they lay cards depicting the various pilgrims progressing to Canterbury.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: (Public Domain), Historical Collections Group plc, Oxford Games, Ltd.

name: The Outer Limits
description:
The game consists of a deck of 42 cards: 8 'Radar Image', 32 'Monster Parts', and 2 Wild cards. A game board is also included which has spaces for up to four 'radar' screens'.

The entire deck is shuffled and five to ten cards are dealt to each player (depending on how many are playing).

On each turn a player draws one card and then may play one card to each active Radar screen on the board. If he holds a 'Radar Image' and an empty screen exists it must be played (this is the only compulsory play). Monster Parts may only be played on areas that have an Image.

The first person to get rid of his hand of cards wins.

A good card matching game for Ages 7 - 12... not much more.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shaun the Sheep: A Pizza the Action!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Shaun the Sheep - A Pizza the Action is a wonderful game for the whole family. It's a beautiful summer's day down on Mossy Bottom Farm. The farmer is feeling hungry and decides to have pizza in the meadow. As the pizza arrives, the delivery boy trips and pieces of pizza fly all over the farm.

Will Shaun be able to collect all the pizza pieces from around the farm and bring them back to the barn to share with the flock? Play this game with the whole family and see if you can beat Blitzer and the farmer to get "a pizza the action"!

Additional information (not from the publisher):

Each player draws a card at the beginning of a turn and takes the action on the card: move forward, move backward, or stay in the place. The first player to reach the end of board wins.

name: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar – Instantiation Generator Promo Card
description:
Card was available during the Secret Cabal 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Instantiation Generator Legendary Souvenir: At the end of the game, this counts as one of each color treasure
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Bump
description: In Bump: the Sneaky Numbers Game, players are given a hand of cards, and play those to a common pile, hoping to bring the count to one of several target numbers. Going over (or under with a negative card) the target number costs money, but hitting it dead on wins $2,000. Money can also be claimed by bumping other players. First to win $10,000 wins the game.

name: Time Vectors
description:
Time Vectors™ is a Tic-tac-toe style game, but it is a four-dimensional game of four-in-a-row. The board is a 4×4×4×4 matrix on four vertical levels.

The game board is constructed of a nice hardwood base and supports, and the playing surfaces are printed clear acrylic boards.

Some have described Time Vectors as "Tic-tac-toe on steroids." So far in fifteen years of private play, no algorithm has evolved for producing a sure win or tie game for the first player, as happens with most Tic-tac-toe style games.

name: Fantasy Conflict
description: Game very similar to Mayfair's Encounters (and their later game, Fantasy Adventures). Players form a party of different characters and then use the monsters, spells, weapons, items, etc. that they draw from the "action" deck to build up their party's strength and attack the parties of their opponents.

name: Baywatch: The Game
description:
Question - Who did Neely Capshaw file false sexual harassment charges against? Situation - A cafe on the beach names a delicious health shake after you. It becomes a best seller. Move forward two spaces.
Take on the role of one of the famous lifeguards in this marketing exercise and get some actual exercise. Roll & move round the beach, collecting discs, doing Physical Challenges (press-ups, star jumps), answering quiz questions or gamble on the situation, and then move on. Get three discs matching your character and win. With almost no publicity shots of the crew to embellish it, this game is so wholesome, it will make your teeth squeak.
Question - How many bottles of sunscreen do the Baywatch stars use in a week? Situation - A gang of rowdy youths tell you that their beers are non-alcoholic, they are fibbing of course. Move back one space for believing them.

name: Road Block
description:
Similar to a memory match game (turn over pairs of cards looking for a match) with a bit more theme and some special cards.

Players take turns attempting to match cards which are forming a roadway from a central point. Cards unmatched at the end of each players turn are placed face-down once again, relying on the player's memory to complete matches. Special cards, when turned over, may allow the player to perform special actions, or loose them points in the final scoring.

When all matches are made the game ends, and the person with the most points in their "parking lot" wins.

name: Sweet Pickles
description:
From the box:

Here are the famous funny Sweet Pickles and here is the town they live in. Welcome!

Although the game is basically a simple collection game for the young child, it is made even more entertaining by the dialogue (suitable for early readers) from each of the animal characters. Reading is not required, only optional. The game is based on the characters created by Ruth Lerner Perle and Jacquelyn Reinach and illustrated by Richard Hefter.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Affluence
description:
A game of Real Estate speculation... actually three games in one... each one slightly more advanced.

In Agent, players roll the die and move around the board listing properties. This is a simple race game to see who can list the most properties before they run out.

In Real Estate PLUS, players not only list, buy, and sell properties, but they also manage stocks. The winner in this version is the player who bankrupts the other players.

In Affluence more complexity is added. Loans, Savings Accounts, stock dividends, and insurance are added to the 'Real Estate PLUS' game. The winner is the person with the most net worth at the end of the game (one year of simulated time) or the player who bankrupts his competitors.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Uncle Happy's Train Game
description:
A crayon-rail game for kids that is reminiscent of Milton Bradley's classic "Game of the States". Has two levels of play:

At the first level, players are dealt five state cards and have to connect them all together with rail along with an east-coast state and a west-coast state. The first to do this wins.

At the second level, a random load chip is drawn and added to each of the five state cards. The winner is the first player to connect up all five states plus the states that produce the loads (the coastal states requirement is dropped).

A spinner is spun each turn to determine how many (adjacent) states a player can hook up to their line.

name: Der Kleine Kommissar
description: This is a very simple deduction game with dice rolling. One of the players is a thief, and the other ones are after him. The thief makes a choice about where on the 76 squares of the gameboard he is. If any other player comes closer he has to say warm, then warmer, then hot. The player who catches the thief becomes the next thief and scores points.

name: One More Time
description: Each player has a peg board having a row of holes on the bottom step and on the top. The holes are numbered from 1 to 11 with two special "12" holes. The idea is for a player to move his pegs from the bottom to the top and back again in numerical sequence (1,2,3, etc.). The roll of the three numbered dice determines which peg (or pegs) may be moved. Players take turns rolling the dice and moving pegs, if possible. Any player rolling a "double" or "triple" may roll again, "ONE MORE TIME".

name: Let's Eat Out
description:
Let's Eat Out is (actually) a children's game based on the same mechanics as Candy Land.

Players draw cards depicting various pictures of fast foods. Once a card is drawn, he/she moves his/her playing piece to the next icon on the board with that picture. A special card may be drawn that forces a player to move to one of 6 special squares, which can even be disadvantageous. There are also two shortcuts on the board that bypass certain sections.

The winner is the first player to make it "Home" (the last space).

name: Patty Duke Game
description:
Patty and Cathy Duke, the cute look-alike cousins, like to do things together. In this game, the players have fun matching cards of Patty and Cathy doing the same things.
As players move around the path on the board, they try to stop on certain squares so that they can pick a green card showing Patty or Cathy doing the same thing as a red Cathy or Patty card in their own hand. When a player has matched a green card from the board with a red card from his hand, both cards are discarded and out of the game. The first player to discard all of his cards is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Waltons Game
description:
The Waltons Game is a card game that uses images from a 1970s television series. Its main mechanic involves completing a scene from the show printed on Place cards with the quadrants of that scene printed on Scene cards.

Taking turns, players draw cards into their hand and play them under the rule that Place cards are always played if in hand. John Boy cards can be used to complete a set if the set already has 3 matching Scene cards.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the round, scoring 1 point for each card in the other players' hands. The next round then begins anew. The game ends when a player attains 25 total points, making that player the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Harlem Globetrotters Game
description:
The Harlem Globetrotters Game uses basketball cards for scoring baskets on the gameboard. The card spaces have pictures of each player on the famous TV basketball team. This game is like the Globetrotters, fast, skillful and fun. However, unlike the Globetrotters, you don't have to understand basketball to play.
Players place cards on spaces with pictures of the Harlem Globetrotters. Each card has a design of a different colored basketball. Baskets are scored by having 3 of the same colored cards, side by side. It takes skill and a lot of luck.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Penguin Freeze-Tag
description:
Penguin freeze tag is a game of strategy and adventure. Players race their penguins around Antarctica in a mad dash to catch some fish and return to the Penguin club. But watch out...another player can freeze you and stop you in your tracks. That's where the excitement begins.

The hungry penguins roll the die and waddle around the board to reach the Fishing hoels. When they land exactly on one of the squares with fish printed on them, they catch a fish of that color and move it to their Fish Freeze. Each time that they catch a fish, penguins msut return to the Penguin Club through one of the four blue entrances marked “Start.” Penguins must catch the fish of their own color last.
Penguins who land on or next to another penguin can freeze that penguin by covering it with a Freeze-Tag Ice Cube.
Frozen penguins stay frozen, and may not move, although they roll the die on each turn. On the turn that they roll either a one or a six, frozen penguins thaw out, and roll again and move. Penguins get an extra turn whenever they freeze another penguin.
Penguins may move in any direction that they choose, although they may not move diagonally or move through a square that they already moved though on that turn. Penguins who start their turn on a Swimming Hole may move to any other Swimming Hole, then roll and move.
To reach a Swimming Hole, the Penguin Club, or one of the squares with a fish printed on them , penguins must roll the exact number of squares needed. Swimming Hole spaces and the Penguin Club count as one square. The first penguin to catch one fish of each color and return to the Penguin Club is the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Arithmetic Bingo
description: Players cover places on their cards based on what space is called out by a caller as is classic Bingo. But in this game the number is Number One plus/subtract Number Two. Good for children Ages 4 - 6 to learn addition & subtraction.

name: Rettet die Dinos
description: An interesting little children's game that has players stacking papier-mache eggs (of varying sizes) into a nest (a wooden ring) positioned in the center of the board. Movement is handled via die roll with the resulting spaces dictating the action (place an egg, take an egg, reverse direction, etc.) Some variant rules are included to increase or decrease the game's difficulty.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Prehistoric

name: America's Challenge
description:
"August 22, 1851

The Royal Yacht 'Victoria and Albert' lay at anchor near the Royal Yacht Squadron Castle at Cowes. Queen Victoria watched the winning yacht sail past in the twilight. "Who is first?" the Queen is reported to have asked. " 'America', your Majesty" came the reply. "And who is second?".... "Madam, there is no second." "

A spinner controls movement and 'Hazards' in this simple educational game.

0ne 11" x 17" paper map of the 18 segment course around the Isle of Wight with six 1 1/2" paper cut-out sailing ships.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: NASA: The Space Place Collectible Card Game
description:
The object of the game is to complete more of the five missions than your opponent. Points are scored for completed missions and lost for holding multiples of various cards. Component cards are used to complete missions, effects cards affect mission completion, galaxy cards allow drawing of advantage cards which allow you to take extra turns, move cards around, look at your opponent's hand, etc. You draw and play from a common deck with six cards in hand.

The game is not collectible as all the necessary cards come in the pack. However, mine says New Millennium Deck, so there may have been other decks planned / produced.

[Update 2011] I have a "Cosmic Journeys" deck aimed at astrophysics, so there are at least two decks for this game.

[Update 2012] Additional deck "Missions to Planet Earth" also exists.

name: Nationwide
description: Based on the BBC TV news magazine programme. Set on a board showing a map of the UK, players must collect sets of TV Monitor Bank cards and Story Counters from around the country.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Dating Game
description:
Four players, two males and two females play the game. Players traverse the gameboard according to the dictates of two dice and follow the directions upon the space landed. To win the game a player must collect $100, match five questions and/or answers with a player of the opposite sex, check off all seven items of a list and have landed on the “Meet Date Here” space with a player of the opposite sex who has done the same.

The game is very loosely based on the television series of the same name.

---

Information in American Games lists that there was perhaps a "Party Pack" version of this game that was packed with a 45-RPM record, produced by ABC Promotions.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: I've got a Secret
description:
An elaborate adaptation of a simple game show created by comedian Allan Sherman, the first player to hold one card from each of four chance card piles declares "I've got a secret!" The others have to guess what statement the cards comprise. (Example from the rules: "I am a bow-legged baby sitter who stands on his head while taking a shower.") A running score is kept of guesses, and the first to 100 points wins.

One episode of IGAS around the time of the game's release had special guest Don Ameche use it to construct his secret (which only differed from the example in the first two cards, using "bald-headed" and "garbageman"). The segment was basically no more than a plug for the game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rave
description:
From the box:

‘ALL YOU NEED TO RAVE IS A LITLE SKILL AND A SCREW LOOSE.

Your adventure begins in Trip City.
You've got fifty quid in your pocket and you're buzzin' with energy.
Flyers and rumors come at you from every club you visit, but when you've got three flyers in your hand it's time to decide which RAVE looks pukka and fork out for your ticket.
This is when things start to go crazy. As you leave Trip City and travel from one meeting point to another following the rumors on your flyer, Vibe cards tell you what's going on and where plod is patrolling. Maybe you're on the guest list, maybe you're busted, but once you hit the right number and find your RAVE, get there and get dancing 'cos you're running out of energy and everyone else is rushing like crazy. WOW status is just a beat away.’

The game was withdrawn from sale by stockists shortly after it's release due to 'adult content' i.e. the frequent references encouraging recreational drug use. The game also had a very provocative theme for the time which didn't help its chances with major retailers.
A small number of game boxes were packed with a magnetic tape 'Rave soundtrack' and sparkly dice which allegedly entitled the lucky owner to special gifts from the manufacturer.
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Singing

name: The Merry Game of Fibber McGee and the Wistful Vista Mystery
description:
"A hilarious party game for any number of players. A riot of fun for everyone - take it from me! - Fibber McGee

...by Arrangement with the National Broadcasting Co. Inc."

A large deck of yellow cards are placed face down on a table in a loose spread out pile. Each card has a few words that make up a partial sentence on them.

One player reads a story out of a booklet and when the reader encounters a blank line ("_______") in the story, they pause and another player quickly draws a card and reads what is on it, then the reader continues.

For example, "My first encounter came after a series of lessons from _A_perforated_fire_hose_ who had slain nine thousand bulls."

Some cards have points on them, so the player who drew that cards would get some points. When all cards have been drawn, the points are tallied and a winner determined.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Baa Baa Black Sheep
description: A children's game in which players use a spinner to move a black sheep around a farm. Each space has a picture of a farm resident. If the space you land on matches a card in your hand, you turn it over to reveal a bag of wool. And yes sir, yes sir, when you get three bags full you win.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Centre Court
description: A tennis board game. Normal rules of tennis apply, but movement around the court is governed by use of cards. The game includes a printed cardboard net and cardboard players on stands. Play singles or doubles.

name: Winkle's Wedding or Why Did He Do It?
description:
From the Publisher:
The cards are equally divided up among the players, with the exception of one who has no cards but takes the book and reads out from it until a blank is reached, when the first player turns up a card and calls out the name upon it, followed similarly by all the other players in rotation.
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Games Gazette, H. P. Gibson & Sons, Johnson Brothers

name: Rubik's Checkers Challenge
description:
This is a game of checkers with a twist.

Each player starts with 8 two-sided, dual-colored checker pieces. Each piece begins with the full power of a King, moving diagonally forwards and backwards and jumping captures as in regular checkers. Upon a first capture a piece is flipped over to the pawn-side with its movement then reduced to a backwards direction only. A second capture of the same piece removes it from the game. Winning is determined by getting your opponent into a position where s/he cannot make a legal move or the capture of all opponents pieces.

name: The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game: Golf
description:
From the publisher:

Play golf the Worst-Case way and get ready for the most frustrating—and funny— game you’ve ever played. First, choose your putter. Will it be a ruler? Your foot? Next, you’ll be given a dreadful golf predicament and three possible ways to get out of it. Do you know how to proceed when your ball lands in a bird’s nest? Pick the right answer and you’re free to make your putt. Pick the wrong one and you’ll get a hilarious penalty. You may find yourself trading scores with the losing player, playing on your knees or worse! Comes with 3 real Worst-Case Scenario golf balls, a cardboard putting green, water hazard and bunker, a scorecard and an erasable crayon. For 2 or more players.
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, University Games

name: Jack Pot!
description: A dice game that any number of people can play. Chips are equally divided amongst the players. Each players must contribute 10 chips to the pot before starting the game. Roll all three dice into the playing area. Match your roll to the payoff chart. If you have matched any of the odds shown - you are a winner! Collect your winnings and pass the dice to the next player. For even more fun, create your own variations of this famous game!

name: Koops Hoops
description: This is a dexterity finger flicking game that simulates a game of basketball. Each person (or team of two people) take turns flicking "ball" toward opponents "basket." Each team is giving 2 flicks per turn. Rules for regular scoring: 3-point shots, foul shots, and even slam dunks!

name: Fiskedamm
description: The fish are made of plastic and have a small magnet in their mouths. The fishing rod is also made of plastic and has a magnet at the end of the line. When it is a players turn he takes the fishing rod and drops the line on the box (the pond) and tries to capture a fish and drag it over to one of the holes in the box without losing it.

name: Moro Mix
description: In Moro Mix (Fun Mix) you play cards to make up various figures/characters, and at the end of the game the player who has the most complete characters win. Each character is made up of five cards: headgear, head, chest, left leg and right leg.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Bingo Romano
description:
A Pelikan bookcase game from their "Buchkassette" series.

This is the basic bingo game played at many locations. Includes the "Gioco Romano" variant where only motives are called not the numbers.

name: Who Dares?
description:
WHO DARES? is a game of courage, bluff and perspicacity. It all revolves around a set of 'dares' and the individual decisions of players. Dare they dare, or dare they not!

Once each dare is read out, each player has to decide "Yes" or "No" whilst taking account of the following two factors:

- whether or not they can carry out the dare.
- how they think the other players will answer.

From the voting pattern, and their own vote, players can work out (by reference to the appropriate chart) whether or not they have to carry out the proposed dare and their scores (positive or negative).

And don't forget ... it is possible to win and never to have to do anything if you can successfully guess your opponents' responses.

The winner is the first player (or team) to score 20 points (though different target scores can be agreed on depending on the time available).

name: Four-Up
description:
FOUR-UP is an abstract boardgame with two players taking it in turns to place a marble on the board with the aim of making a row of four marble next to each other horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The first to do so is the winner.

The box carries standard rules, but also rules for Advanced play and Solitaire play.

name: Commuter
description:
Trafikant (Swe.) or Commuter (UK) is a simple roll and move board game for 2-5 players about travel and road signs. Both versions has been adapted to national trafic rules and road signs etc. of the respectice countries, Sweden and the United Kingdom.

Players start at home and have to make five circuits of the board, representing journeys to work on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.

Players take it in turns to move their (car) markers the number of space determined by the roll of dice. The space that is landed on, many of which are marked with appropriate road signs, may affect the playing piece either in that round (go back to...) or in the next (throw 7 or more to proceed..).

Certain squares require a question on road safety or the rules of the road to answered. These are graded into three levels to allow people of mixed ages to play.

Each circuit of the board earns a player a counter in his or her color. The first player to receive five counters by completing his final journey with an exact roll of the dice is the winner.

The first version (the Swedish one) was made in partnership with Sweden's National Society for Road Safety.

name: Skeletons in the Closet
description: Rather than using rote memorization, put an exciting new spin on learning the names, location, and relationships of the major bones in the human body (skull, pelvis, tibia, rib cage and more). First player to assemble their skeleton in the closet wins. Bones are labeled with letters to help identify each bone and assemble the skeleton faster. Six challenging games with varying levels of difficulty. Includes 50 True/False Fun Bone Facts, 10 milk cartons, 30 closet cards, closet box, four plastic skeleton models, four skeleton boards, game guide, and spinner.

name: Repulsion
description:
"Repulsion" is a dexterity game in which, like Jenga, the object is to take turns building a tower and to try not to be the person who causes the tower to topple.

In this game, though, the tower-building elements are six plastic spheres, with each sphere flattened at each of two ends. Inside the spheres at each end are magnets, so the magnetic fields generated by the sphere you're trying to place may repulse that of the sphere atop the tower (hence the game title, "Repulsion"), and so success in the game is dictated by your ability to delicately determine the polarities of your piece and that atop the tower without toppling the tower, and place your piece safely on top.

name: Viking Adventure
description:
The Viking Adventure Game is an award winning historical game that is both fun and educational for the entire family. Learn the history and mythology of the Vikings as you sail your ship to far-off lands, conquering countries and winning treasures. Follow the treasure map to Åsgård, the fabled home of the Norse Gods. Ride the rainbow bridge to seek your destiny as the Gods influence the outcome of your fate.

Up to 6 players, of all ages, can play this game at the same time. The game features playing pieces in the form of 6 different miniature replicas of real historical ships: the Fram, the Griffin, the Kon Tiki, the Oseberg, the Skuldelev and the Viking. The game comes with a ship’s log detailing the fantastic historical voyages these great ships made. It will be cherished by your family for years and years to come

The game also features 6 decorative treasure chests to store your loot during game play, and neatly store the ship playing pieces when you are finished playing. Also included are Norse coin replicas, colorful playing cards, a treasure map game board and more. Viking Adventures compiles research from dozens of renowned sources to create a fun and memorable learning tool for the entire family.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Adhesives Family Game
description:
This is a game that was developed to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the Henkel group (which manufactures adhesives).

It is a combination of different mechanics.

The aim of the game is to collect a complete set of picture cards. A complete set consists of 8 cards, each with a different colored border. There are also 3 "joker" cards in the game, which can be used instead of a colored picture card.

The picture cards are placed face up on the board around the movement fields, 4 picture cards are placed face down on special "guessing" fields.

Each player also has a hand of 3 movement cards, which can be used to move the pawn around the track. When you have played a movement card, the pawn is moved according to the instructions on it (it can be a fixed number or you may have to throw a die).

You can land on different kind of fields, some allow you to take the picture card that is placed next to it. Others allow you to take a guess at the color of one of the face-down picture cards. You can take it if the guess is correct. You can also be allowed to swap picture cards with opponents, you can be forced to give one of your picture cards to another players, you can steal a card from another player or you must play a game of poker to win extra picture cards.

Players with complete sets score 8 points plus 1 extra point per joker. The others score points equal to the longest sequence of cards.

You play 3 games to determine the overall winner.

name: Diner Chess
description:
A game of late-night deduction and coffee for two or more players.

Object: To figure out the secret rules that govern how the other players move pieces on their turn.

You Need:

* An area with diverse items that you can group in general categories. A table with four place settings at your local late-night diner should do nicely.
* Paper and pencil for each player.

Each player makes up a rule and writes it down. The player's rules dictates how he moves pieces when it's his turn. On each player's turn, the player moves a piece in accordance with his secret rule and then asks a yes/no question to another player. Players can also guess other players' rules for points.

The game ends when all rules but one have been guessed. If your rule remains unguessed, then you lose 1 point. The player with the most points wins.

name: Tongue Tangle
description:
The Game of TONGUE TANGLE:

From the box:

Are you ready to play the game of selfish shellfish and Peggy Babcock?

Do you have the stamina to take the titanium tonsil challenge?

The game of Tongue Tangle contains tons of tortuous tongue twisters to tickle your tonsils.

Trick other players by secretly setting the special mechanical timer.....but watch out-it might come back to you, and then who would be stuck for words?

Try to catch out your opponents in the 'Hot Lips' round by saying your tongue twister and passing the 'wibbly wobbly wubber' lips to another player.

The first person to reach the tip of the twisty turny tongue track and survive the final 'Hot Lips' round triumphs!

Contents of the Norwegian Krøll på tunga? edition:

Game board
112 tongue tangle cards
Timer
Rubber lips
6 pawns
One die

name: Old Mummy
description:
(From the website)
WATCH OUT FOR OLD MUMMY!
Learn about ancient Egypt as you play fun card games in the style of "Old Maid" and "Concentration." Collect ancient treasures but don't get caught with the "Old Mummy" card! The game comes in a keepsake tin box and includes a full-color guide describing the gods, goddesses, symbols and beliefs of the ancient Egyptians.

Discover:

Who swallowed the sun each evening and gave birth to it each morning?
Why did the ancient Egyptians believe gold was the "flesh of the gods"?
What symbol was painted on coffins so the dead could see out onto the land of the living?

47 playing cards and a guide come in a fun tin box in the shape of a sarcophagus.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Game of Golf
description:
Clear all nine holes with the fewest number of strokes. Starting at the tee, roll the die to determine how well your shot did. A good shot will advance you to the next spot on the fairway, while a bad shot puts you in a hazard. Once on the green, roll the die to determine how many putts to add to your score.

The game includes pegs for up to four players, a die numbered 1-1-2-2-3-3, and a pencil to keep score. This game, along with others in Channel Craft's Vintage Game Series, comes in a small tin. Progress is marked with pegs, which rest in a hole after each move, making it a very portable game.

name: The Wiggles Wiggly Safari Board Game
description: There's a lot to do, see and hear on this Wiggly Safari! The game that's packed full of pictures, sounds and questions for endless family fun! Like the video of the same name, this board game is ready to help you have lots of fun with exotic animals like snakes, elephants and more. Can you guess the animal on the card? Do you know which animal makes that sound? You’ll even get to hear what they sound like! Travel around the game board meeting your new safari friends, and then get back to the Big Red Car.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kansasopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Bicycle, Jayhawk, Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe

Board Spaces:
Jayhawk Boulevard, Student Ghetto, Chi Omega Fountain, Joe's Donuts, Memorial Stadium, The Campanile, Chancellor's Residence

Cards:
Recite the Rock Chalk Chant or Lose One Turn.

Parking in the Blue Zone! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

Someone dumped soap in the Chi Omega Fountain, The Dean thinks it was you! Lose 2 turns.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: LSUopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Thomas Boyd Hall, Middleton Library, Alex Box, Indiana Mounds, The Pastime, The Chimes, Dalrymple Drive.

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

LSU vs. Ole Miss. Advance to Tiger Stadium. GEAUX TIGERS!

Louie's is packed! Advance to Louie's and lose one turn to stand in line.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Bee Lines
description:
A children's game, involving adding and subtracting 2 numbers, rolled on two spinners, from 1-10.

Players take turn to flick the two spinners, producing two numbers. The player can the place a bee on the sum of the numbers (adding), or the difference of the numbers (subtracting the low number from the high). In the case of a double, the player gets an extra turn.

The board is filled with numbers from 0 to 20, and the first player to make a complete line from one side to the other has won the game.

Since some numbers are harder to come by than others, there is some skill in choosing the right path. There is also some skill in using numbers that can potentially give you more than one way to continue, as well as blocking your opponents path.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dr. Kildare
description:
Medical game for kids Ages 7 - 12. Based on the TV show of the same name. Players make rounds in the hospital diagnosing patients.

Contents include: game board, four pawns, spinner, "analyzer", 12 red doctor cards, 40 blue/green doctor cards, 40 diagnosis cards, and instructions.

name: Walt Disney Productions' Robin Hood Game
description:
One day Prince John decides to raise the taxes on all the people of Nottingham. So he sends the Sheriff of Nottingham and his men out to collect the taxes. After the Sheriff has collected the taxes he returns to Prince John's castle and places all the gold in Prince John's treasure room. The people of Nottingham are already poor and many of them are left with no money at all after paying their taxes. The poor people send a message telling of the new tax to Robin Hood and his band of merry men who live deep in the heart of Sherwood Forest......

Based on the Disney production of Robin Hood. Each player selects a character (Robin Hood, Little John, Friar Tuck or Maid Marion). The first person to get the bag of gold from Prince John and return to Robin's Forest Hideout is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

description:
This is part of the Big Deal series of card games by Patch Products.

Players divide the deck evenly and take turns laying out three cards at a time. If all three cards match by number or symbol, they take the cards, plus any under them, and place them in there score pile. Sevens are wild and match anything. If you do not match, your cards stay out there, and the next player plays his three cards on top of them. The winner is the player with the most point cards when all of the cards are used.

name: Break Twist
description: This is somewhat similar to classic Twister. There are footprints of different colors on the play mat and players are going round the mat always stepping on the right colored footprint.

name: Eve's Quest
description: Trivia game celebrating women with over 1,000 questions from Mother Teresa to Mother Goose. Something for everyone: charades, drawing, singing, intuition challenges and of course trivia, proving that girls got game, indeed!

name: Vegas Nite Slots
description:
Object of the game: To win all the cards, bankrupting all other players.

Vegas Nite Slots plays like a One Arm Bandit slot machine. On your turn, you can play one, two or three cards on any of three piles attempting to get three of the same cards in a row. If you do, you get a payoff. If you don't you have lost the cards you just played.

name: Die diebischen Elstern
description:
In "Die diebischen Elstern" (=the thievish magpies) 2-4 players attempt to be the first player who can collect 6 different objects.

The board size is 5x5 spaces. The space in the middle is neutral and the 24 other spaces show all 6 objects in the 4 colors of the players. Movement can be done to any adjacent space. If a player lands on an space of his color, he can take that object and put it on his scoreboard. If he lands on an space with another color, he can steal that object, if he does not have this object yet and if the affected player has it on his scoreboard.

The game is very easy to learn, but not as easy to play as you would expect. It's difficult to concentrate on your own moves as well as on the possible moves of your opponents. And the fact that each object shows up 4 times on the board, does not help reduce the confusion.

name: The Gong Show Game
description:
Players move around the gameboard with the goal being to land on the Stage space. One there, a player draws a card and performs the task on it. The other players give score cards to the performer based on how the other players judge the performance. If one player gives the performer a "Gong" Card, both players have a roll-off to see which of those two players will be penalized. If two Gong Cards are awarded, the performer gets no points. The first player to accumulate 30 points is the winner.

The game is based, rather loosely, on the popular television series which originally ran from 1976-80.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: American Trivia Challenge California Style
description: A player moves ahead on the board with a piece by rolling the die or pair of dice. The landing space has a color. A card of the same color is drawn. If the player can correctly answer the question, the player can throw the dice and move ahead again. Also, the player is given a puzzle piece matching the color/category if the player does not already have that piece. The first player to complete a flag (using the puzzle pieces), return to California and answer a final question, wins.

name: 4 Tractors and a Cow Game
description:
From the publisher:

And there're off! In this fanciful farm game, players use a spinner to move their four tractors out of their barns and across the game board - hoping to land on a space showing a farm item that matches a card they've been dealt. But watch out - Elizabeth the Cow can get in the way and tractors can run out of gas! When all the tractors have moved off the board, the player with the most matched cards wins. It's a fast, funny farm game for kids!
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Brandoodles
description: This is a Hangman/Wheel of Fortune type game where players guess a brand name by choosing letters to fill blanks. Brandoodles "challenges players' knowledge of more than a thousand popular brands in such categories as food and beverage, health and beauty, and household products."

name: Höjdarna
description: Swedish children´s game themed on the TV-series Höjdarna. Roll the colored die and move towards the air balloon in the middle of the board. If you get the right cards you can move there quicker. Suddenly the balloon will take off. Will you be on board?
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Just Say No! Game
description:
The object is to be the first player to unlock the Just Say No! Castle with a golden key. Players earn keys by answering a question on a card. There are no right or wrong answers. For example, "How would you say No if someone tried to give you a pill? Or "What does crack look like?"
Game was endorsed by the National Just Say No! Foundation, a Nancy Reagan thing.

name: Civil Lore!
description:
Civil Lore! is the new game where players battle to win the board by using their knowledge of America's cultural lore. We all know trivia - little facts about this and that. Here today, gone tomorrow. Lore is lasting - the neat stories and meaningful facts we love to hear and pass along!

Players stake flags in six fun cultural territories, by answering questions about American cultural lore. Yet watch those flags - others will try to topple them - likely becoming Cannon Fodder themselves!

name: The Very Quiet Cricket Game
description:
For 2 - 4 players Ages 3 and up.

The Very Quiet Cricket Board Game is a spin and move game based on the Eric Carle book "The Very Quiet Cricket". Players start as newly hatched crickets and move from leaf to leaf in a journey to meet new friends and find their voice. Children learn about persistence, individuality, growth and love in this colorful game. Includes game board, 4 cricket game pieces, 24 insect cards, spinner and instructions. 2 to 4 Players.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Exploration

name: Munch Math Game
description:
For 2 or more players, Ages 7 and up.

This game won the 2004 National Young Game Inventors Contest. Players add, subtract, multiply, and divide to fill up their food cards. At the same time, they must use strategy to slow down their opponents. There are 3 ways to play.

name: ShaNuCo
description:
ShaNuCo, according to the game's rulebook, stands for Shapes, Numbers and Colors.

It is a card game with 76 very large playing cards (Approx. 3" x 4"). Of these, 64 are marked with all combinations of the numbers 1-4, each color of blue, red, purple and green, and either a circle, star, square or triangle.

The rest of the cards are either Wild, Super Wild, Pass or Show cards, in some combination of the three characteristics that the main cards represent.

It's box is approximately 4.5" x 6" x 1". Instructions are in English, French and Spanish, and fit on both sides of a 4" x 6" sheet of paper (per language).

2-4 Players.
The box claims 4-104 as appropriate ages for the game, but the rules are possibly too sophisticated for a child under 6 or 8 years of age.

The object of the game is to gain the most points after 5 rounds of play. Each player starts with 100 points, and each round a player may both gain or lose points, depending on game play.

Copyright 1996.
Published by International Playthings, Inc. (Parsippany, NJ, USA), it appears to be their product number P55001. Also credited on the box are Creative Concepts, Inc. and Excel Development Group, Inc. "Made in Canada"
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection
publishers: Connected Concepts, Inc., Excel Development Group, Inc., International Playthings, Inc.

name: Solitaire plus Colourtaire
description:
The colour layouts give this game an entirely new fascination & provide a source of endless entertainment.

After selecting one of the colour layouts & setting up the board accordingly the player moves & takes pegs as in Solitaire but with the condition that reds, yellows, greens, blues, pinks & blacks are removed in that order, pegs of any colour being completely cleared before proceeding to the next colour.

Thus the aim is to be left with a single black peg in the centre of the board.

name: Hanni & Nanni
description:
A merchandising game from the "Hanni & Nanni" (English: St. Clare's) series from Enyd Blyton.
Players using dice to race around St.Clares trying to collect a collection of clothes cards.

name: Sagan om Ringen: Härskarringen
description: Answer questions about the Middle Earth. A die and a card decides what question to answer.

name: Let's Drive
description: "Tommorows safety thru todays fun". 1959 board game by Decor Note Co. of St. Paul Minnesota, Educational Games Division #200. The box comes with 2 Driver training games in the same box. Let's Drive and Old Scratch (see separate entry for Old Scratch). This colorful 2 sided game board measures 20 1/2" x 15 3/4" The instructions are on each side of the gameboard for that particular game. There are 15 white cards and 11 yellow cards, each side of a card is for one of the games. The game includes tiny plastic model cars. Object of the game is to successfully complete the course.

name: Puttentaken
description:
From the publisher's website:

Be the only player left with chips to win this fun and frantic dice game. Roll the dice to determine if you will "Put" or "Take" chips from the pot.

The yellow die can change everything as it lets you steal chips from your opponents. And, when you do, everything changes!

name: pendur
description: Each of the 2-7 players tries to put the own tiles next or upon tiles already lying on the table. The tile must be of suitable color/form combination, because not every tile fits in the three-dimensional building concept. Only the player who places his tiles smartly has a chance to win.

name: Planetreisen
description:
(Translated from their homepage, from Norwegian)

Here you have a game which is both fun, exiting and educational. The game does not demand any prior knowledge. The players travel around in our solar system and meet surprises and possibilities. The player who is the first to have visited all the planets is the game's winner.

name: World Bank
description:
World Bank: The Game casts players as governments of developing countries. The goal of the game is to acquire resources of various kinds, dealing with debt, foreign aid, multinational cartels and natural events in the process.

While the game involves rolling and moving around a circular board, there are a number of subtleties; players may trade amongst themselves, establish cartels for uncommon resources, and even engage in wars.

name: Monopoly: Option One Mortgage Corporation
description:
This is an official limited edition version of Monopoly which is themed on the Option One Mortgage Company. The tokens, board spaces, cards, etc. are themed on various aspects of the company and the mortgage industry.


According to amazon.com:
"This game was manufactured in 2000 and there were 5000 issues printed. The Manager of Custom Game Developement at USAopoly states, "This was a custom game not offered to the public and all 5000 copies were gifts."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Singapore 1941: Fall of the Fortress
description:
This is a two-player game that simulates the Far East Campaign between the invading force, the Japanese, and the defenders, the Commonwealth forces led by the British, from the period starting 8th December 1941 to the 15th February 1942. The game allows two players to command either the Japanese or Commonwealth forces over ten weekly turns with the outcome determined by victory conditions based on various elements such as the captured of key installations, territory captured and force depletion.

Map scale: 1 hex = 17 km
Unit scale: regiment/brigade
Time scale: 1 turn = approx. 1 week
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Around the World
description:
This game takes you “Around the World” as you give correct answers to interesting questions and problems. A wide variaety of questions is provided. They cover such subjects as History, Geography, Sports, Famous People, etc. With the use of the Ans-O-Rama you verify answers, making the game educational as well as entertaining.



Who can play…?
ONE PERSON can spend many enjoyable hours by answering the questions – then verifying the answers.
THE WHOLE FAMILY can play together! Many of the questions are familiar to children and yet may stump their parents.
GROUPS OF CHILDREN, TEENS OR ADULTS can play in keen competition by choosing appropriate categories.


Listed in American Games, #4490. 1962, Q&A, Board Game.

name: License Plate Game
description:
License Plate Game
Games On The Go Ages 4 and up.

On their cards, players write letters from the license plates of passing cars. As the cards fill up, players score points for every three letter word that they create. The strategy is in deciding where on the card to put your letters to maximize your ability to create words. (letters can not be moved once placed). Everyone works with the same letters that drive by, so this strategy is the only thing that separates the winner from the rest.

Contents: Instructions, playing cards, pencil.
categories: Card Game, Transportation, Travel, Word Game

name: Tomteland
description: It´s Christmas! Santa needs your help! In this game you are a "tomtenisse" and you are trying to collect Christmas gifts and get them to Rudolf. Have fun...

name: Tiddly Winks Barrage Game
description:
From the rules: Players form two teams. Each team has five tiddly winks and one larger wink for shooting. Players place the winks, one at a time on the Battery Emplacement.

Each team now shoots his winks as fast as possible (without waiting for turns), in an endeavor to land the winks in the opponent's seaport, munitions dump, air field, and munitions dump so as to have at least one wink in each of the three, is the winner, or any player who lands one wink in his opponent's capitol wins immediately.

name: Wuzzles
description:
Those delightfully mixed-up creatures, the Wuzzles, and their enchanted island of Wuz are just a wish away when you play this race game with the towering 3-D mountain.

The Wuzzles have been invited to a party, but unfortunately, their gifts have become as mixed up as the Wuzzles. Bits and pieces of their presents have been scattered all over the gameboard.

Can you tunnel in and out of the 3-D mountain, put together a complete gift, avoid Croc and the Creepasaurs, and be the first to arrive at the party?
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Peterborough and Area On Board
description: Peterborough and Area On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Ontario, Canada . Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Peterborough Community Housing Development Corporation.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Saskatoon On Board
description: Saskatoon On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Saskatchewan, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Huskies Football.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Burial Ground
description:
Tales tell of gold in the hills, and also stories of Zombies. For some strange reason the prospectors are turning into flesh hungry ghouls. For you, digging for gold is still high on the agenda, but with the walking dead infesting the area it isn't going to be such an easy task.

The objective is for the players to move around the board, digging for gold, or digging holes for the zombies to fall into (where they are more easily dispatched). Both methods reward the players with points. But there is always the threat of each action drawing the unwelcome attention of the roaming Zombies.

The zombies movement phases are in-game driven, and Cut-throat gameplay often sees other players placed between the target and the marauding ghouls.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Riders of the Range
description: This card game consists of four coloured suits, each or which has a ranch, a danger card and 9 numbered cards. The object of the game is to exhaust your hand and to play the camp fire (number 9) cards.
categories: American West, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: N.C. Stateopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Back the Pack!
Hey all you N.C. State fans! Ever dream of owning Reynolds Coliseum, Memorial Bell Tower, or Hillsborough Street? Here’s your chance! N.C. State is up for sale in this game designed for alumni, students and fans of N.C. State.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Girl
description:
A trick-taking card game with cards depicting the original comic strip characters from the "Girl"-comic magazine from the 1950ies.

It consists of 12 heroine cards, 30 trio cards and two girl cards.

Object of the game is to win cards as much as possible, using the girl-cards as jokers.

Gameplay is the same as in the PLANES GAME and the CARS GAME from the same publisher and somewhat special, using the trio-cards in prominent role.

Short-time fun for the whole family with the exceptionally well printed cards in top quality.

name: Scruples for Kids
description: Be the first to get rid of all your dilemma cards. To get rid of your cards, guess how your opponents will reply to the dilemmas on them.

name: Mein erstes Naturspiel: Wie Tiere groß werden
description:
Content:
35 picture cards, 7 colored wooden plates

You may know all animals and saw some already. Do you know though how those animals are born and how they grow up.
All 35 picture cards are laid face down on the table.
Now everyone tries to find the cards of every animal in the row of 1-5 and to lay it down aside a wooden plate. The player with the last picture card aside the wooden plate gets the plate. The most plates determines the winner.

name: Dr. Sound
description:
Dr. Sound is a unique game that will give the players a chance to prove their ability to take a word and transform it to a sound. So will you be the next Dr.Sound??

Contents:
1 board game
6 marker
6 cards of direction
36 tiles
350 sound cards
6 figures
1 color dice
1 watch
1 glass timer
6 pencils
1 rule sheet

name: Bug Hunt
description: A boarding party of Space Marines has been tasked to assault the USS Argos and eliminate the alien "Bugs" which have overrun the ship. At your disposal are six Marines, a Lieutenant, Tech, Medic, and two Gunners. Your goal is to clear the four central areas of the ship. Your level of victory will be reduced if the Lieutenant or Tech get hit.

name: Monopoly: Prince Caspian
description: C.S. Lewis' book "Prince Caspian: The Return to Narnia" merges with the world-famous board game Monopoly.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Askim
description: This card game has 40 cards. 5 color-coded sets of 8 cards each. 4 cards in each set are question cards, 4 cards are answer cards. The object of the game is to be the first to get rid of all of your cards.

name: Scooby-Doo! Board Game:  The Maze of Mayhem!
description:
From Publisher: "Scooby and the gang are trapped in the creepy maze. The keys to the old wooden door are buried deep so it's up to the gang to do some digging. But watch out where you dig! The last thing you need is a zombie on your trail! Be the first to find the old key and escape the Maze of Mayhem . . . on a full belly of 'Scooby Snacks' of course!"

This is a basic roll-and-move game where players race to collect a key and three snacks before escaping from the maze. The keys and snacks are all hidden throughout the board but among them are three different monsters from various Scooby-Doo episodes. Once a monster is uncovered, it remains on the board and moves on a separate die roll each turn. Monsters catch players and send them back to start, complicating the process of gathering keys and snacks and moving to the exit. Because each player has the chance to move the monsters, there are typically many opportunities to slow down the progress of other players.
categories: Children's Game, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pass the Buck
description:
Pass the Buck is one of at least three in this company's series of nature themed "Cigar Box" games. Pass the Buck is themed around North American wildlife, in particular 15 different animals on the cards from eagle, dove, cardinal, buck, skunk, bear, etc. in beautifully engraved animal art.

Object: 4-10 players vie to be the last player holding 1 or more wooden nickels.

Components:
-Cigar Box decorated with a deer Buck and red scroll with game title all in 18th century style drawn art. Interestingly, game is sealed with a simulated "tax stamp" featuring the serial number and company logo.
-52 playing cards in 4 sets of 10 (each set features 10 different birds), and 12 special play cards (4 bucks, 4 bears, 2 ducks, 1 doe, and 1 skunk) with variable special abilities.
-50 wooden nickels with company logo on one side, and game title and image of Buck on the other.

Game Play description:
Each player starts with 5 wooden nickels. The dealer deals each player 1 card. In turn, each player looks secretly at the card and decides whether to keep or trade with player on the left. A player is stuck with their choice (keep or trade) once completed. Since players want the lowest value card possible, this adds an element of risk assessment, as the player(s) with the highest value must pay a nickel into the pot. Last player standing with nickels, after others are bankrupt wins. Special play cards change order and value of play for more variability to play.
categories: American West, Animals, Card Game, Environmental
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading, Trick-taking

name: Utopia
description:
"Solo card, dice & record keeping game. Based on the old Intellivision Video Game. Build up your Island Paradise."

The only components required for play are the card deck, writing paper, a pencil and six-sided dice. The player starts with 100 Gold Bars and a population of 1000.

A turn consists of thirteen phases: Census Phase, Taxes Phase, Industry Phase, Housing Phase, Food Phase, Flip Phase, Fishing Phase, Farming Phase, Build Phase, Piracy Phase, Rebellion Phase, Hurricane Phase, and Score Phase.

The player keeps a running score based on the amount of gold earned each turn. The game ends after the deck has been gone through two times.

name: Pilkkipeli
description: This game is about fishing in the winter. The players try to catch as much fish as possible. These kind of winter fishing competitions are held annually all around Finland.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Game of Minstrel Show
description:
WARNING: This game is considered offensive by many and is part of the BGG database for completeness

The object of the game is to collect musicians, great songs and perform at the most prestigious theaters.

name: Day Watch
description: Card game under the book of Russian writer Sergey Lukyanenko. This game is a fight of two forces. Choose the side and join eternal struggle of Light and Darkness.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Space Race
description:
Space Race - Wedloop om de maanmineralen - Course pour les minereaux de la luna - Race for the moon minerals

Space Race is a game where players compete to be the first to land on the moon with their rocket ship and return to earth with precious moon minerals. Players can choose and switch between several pre-printed color dotted orbit lines to reach the moon or earth.

The game contains a full color playing board, 30 plastic rockets in 6 colors and 3 dice (red, green, white)

'The game is published and printed in 1970 in the dutch language but was first sold in 2008' (quoting the salesman).

Home Page: http://www.spacerace-voorthuizen.nl/indexEN.html

name: 12 O'Clock High Game
description:
Based on the mid 1960's (1964-1967) television series , this roll and move board game takes you on bombing runs over Europe. First player to have their squadron score 35 points, wins.
Note: Two versions of the cover art exists; one with Robert Lansing (who left the show after 1 season) and one with Paul Burke. The Lansing cover art is the rarer of the two.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, World War II

name: High School Musical 3 CD Board Game
description: It's Senior Year at East High. Join the High School Musical gang as they face their hopes, dreams and their fears on the way to the graduation stage. Along the way players answer trivia questions and sing & dance a bit. The interactive music game CD adds to the fun! All packed in a neat portfolio case. For 2 or more players Ages 7 and up
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Bee-Line
description:
From the box:
The simple strategy game for all the family, with easy-to-learn rules for two to four players, aged five years and upwards.

The Bees are returning to their beehive, after a busy day collecting pollen in the meadow. Players have to get their Bees into the honeycomb without upsetting the other Bees.

It seems easy at first but the Bees have a sting in their tails and it's not as simple as it looks!

Quick Summary:
Each turn, a player must place one of the four bees in their colour onto the 4 by 4 "honeycomb", but each placed bee must be placed in an empty cell and may not "see" another bee of the same colour. If you can not place a bee, then you are out of the game and the last player to place a bee wins.

name: Monopoly: Nice
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Nice, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Versailles
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Versailles, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The House that Jack Built
description:
A simple yet most enjoyable game for children Ages 4 - 8. 2-4 can play, or a child can amuse himself playing alone.

The pieces are placed face up in the centre of the table. Throw the coloured die in turn. If you throw white, you take a white front wall; if you throw any other colour before you possess your front wall you pass. Once you have this you take pieces that match the colour you throw. If you throw a colour you do not require, you pass. The first player to complete his house wins the game.

name: Cirkle Kids
description:
The goal in Cirkle Kids is to collect a set of 4 shapes or 4 colors pieces. the board is formed of 16 squares covered by 16 gray hats -Magician style hat- , the challenge is to be able to remember which symbol is under the hat you just uncovered. The roll of dice and the possibility of rotating the board add a mix of luck/strategy to the game .
The game is the most simple to play (billed as kids) in the Cirkle board games family.

name: Walzermühle
description: Essentially a version of Tic-tac-toe, but after the initial setup, the playing pieces can move to form a line of three. Also, the pieces are numbered and depending on whether the line reads 3-2-1 or 1-3-2 or other combinations, the points scored vary.

name: Spot the difference lotto
description:
This game takes the traditional spot the difference puzzle and turns it into a lotto game.

The game comes with four double-sided player boards, each with space for nine tiles. The game is played as lotto - draw a tile and find the matching board - but instead of spotting a picture and finding the relevant board, you're spotting the difference and finding the relevant board. The differences aim to teach pre-reading and pre-maths skills.

On the easy side each board contains nine almost identical pictures, but with slight differences - such as different numbers of balls juggled by the clown, or a different animal in the window of the house, or a different arrangement of colours on the kite.

On the hard side each board contains nine shapes, each coloured in the four primary colours, but with different arrangements of the four colours.

name: Endango
description: Endango is an environmental board game that teaches kids how to go green. With a unique game strategy it links the child’s behaviors to their indirect environmental consequence - the fate of endangered animals. When playing the game, each player is responsible for three endangered animals in an environment. The points they earn as they navigate the human track affect the fate of the endangered animals in their environment. Positive points for "green behavior and knowledge" move the animals toward saved; negative points for "less environmentally friendly behaviors" move the animals toward extinction.

name: Push of Pike: Edgehill 1642
description: Edgehill 1642 is a simulation of the first important battle of the English Civil War. The Royalist army led by King Charles I and Prince Rupert was marching on London when it was blocked by a Parliament army under the Earl of Essex near the village of Edgehill.
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame

name: The Million Dollar Sales Game
description: Roll the dice and move your car around the track while you compete with other salespeople to be the first to rack up one million dollars in sales. Collect prospects and convert them to active customers. Luck may grant you an Opportunity Knocks card (good thing) or a Stuff Happens card (bad thing). The game reminds you of various aspects of good salesmanship through repetition of sales jargon.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mind Your Manners
description:
The Mind Your Manners game is a delightful way to assist your child in learning and reinforcing basic aspects of good manners. The game plays with or without parental guidance.

Players draw a card and move forward (if they mind their manners) or backward (if they misbehave) and each card has a short lesson on courtesy.

Example: You replied "Yes" when answering a question, instead of "Yeh". Move ahead 4 spaces.

Event cards (like improper behavior) force a player to go back to the nearest matching color.

Designed for children age 4 and older.

Includes 100 cards, a colorful board, 6 tokens, rules, and storage insert.

Smethport Model No. 727

name: Spelen in de Keuken
description:
A trivia game about gastronomical knowledge of the players. An after dinner game with questions like:
How do you check the freshness of an egg? At which temperature is coffee been made? The player with the most correct answer wins the silver Chef's Cap and wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Breda
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The famous Monopoly game. In this version you own, buy and sell streets of the Dutch city Breda.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Skins Game
description:
From back of box:

"Game Preview: Deal 4 cards face down to each player. 'Draw' cards from pile - exchange for lower values, play 9 holes. Avoid 'The 3 Putt Snake' while pursuing the bonus 'Bingo, Bango, Bungo.' Lo score wins big buckos!"

Cards include instruction cards, various bonus/bane cards, cards denoting money and numbered cards denoting various numbers of strokes.

name: Extreme Fight Games
description:
During the Summer of 2009, Extreme Fight Games, Inc. released the World's First Original Mixed Martial Arts Board Game. This one of a kind, patented game simulates all aspects of the sport from Stand-Up to Ground fighting, all in an extremely realistic and captivating way. The input from many top MMA professionals, as well as hard work from some of the best illustrators and graphic designers in the industry, was crucial to developing this entertaining and artistic game.

OBJECT OF THE GAME
To defeat your opponent by performing different moves that will result in a Knock Out, Submission, or accumulate enough winning rounds on your Fight Card to win
by decision.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Snakes
description:
