Boardgame version of the well-known video-game Snake.

Players move on the 8x8 grid game board hunting food or bonus objects and try to avoid to hit the walls and opponents' snakes. For every food they eat they grow 1 snake-piece longer. Eaten food may be use for scoring or for their special abililities.

In his turn player:
1) roll 3xd8 for placing food/object on the board
player chooses 1xd8 as food/object and other 2xd8 for coordinates.on the game board
2) playing card with the food icon and number for snake moving
a) exchanging all these food for points (1 food = 1 point,
2 foods = 1+2=3 points, 3 foods = 1+2+3=6 points etc.)
b) moving his snake in straight direction as many squres as showed on the card.

Game ends if player places his last snake-piece on the table in his turn and then the scoring take places. Players add 1 point for every snake-piece on the scoring track. Player with the most points is the winner.

Contents:

1 gameboard
40 Snake-pieces in 4 colors
4 scoring markers in 4 colors
36 cards
35 Food tiles (Mice, Rats, Rabbits, Snails, Moles, Crabs)
15 Bonus object tiles marked with "?" (Magnets, Scissors, Bombs, Clues, Stones)
3xd8 dice
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Algonquin-Voyageurs
description: Algonquin-Voyageurs, a game of fun and educational value, is based upon actual canoe routes and wildlife found in the park. It may be played by children and adults. The game is designed to build knowledge of the creatures and plants which are common in Algonquin Park, and which are also found throughout much of eastern North America.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Zombie Apocalypse Survival Game
description:
Everybody is dead.

Okay, you’re still alive, but almost everybody else is dead. And the dead aren’t really dead, they’re un-dead, they’re hungry and they’re coming for YOU!

Can you survive a zombie apocalypse? Find out with The Zombie Apocalypse Survival Game!

The game includes six sheets of die-cut markers, equipment and vehicle pieces, an 11x17” cardstock playing board, an 8½ x 11” battle board, a complete rulebook and a survivor’s guide to the apocalypse with encounter charts and scrounging tables for all the locations on the board. Some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

Players can work separately or cooperate as they try to survive to reach the zombie-free sanctuary. (If it really is zombie-free.) Players battle hordes of the undead, plus escaped criminals, redneck cannibals, rampaging marauders, corporate security goons, government troops and (maybe) each other for the food, fuel, equipment, weapons and ammo necessary to survive the zombie apocalypse.

It’s all here from every zombie movie you’ve ever seen: chainsaws, kukri, shotguns, the armored bus, the shopping mall, the farmhouse, secret underground lab, and more! Play against your choice of fast (28 Days Later-style) zombies or “classic” zombies.

The game play is fast and furious with combat almost every turn. May be played solitaire or with up to ten players. If you’re killed you just lose all your equipment and start over as somebody else. A great party game!

Some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

You can buy on-line at www.fantasynations.com/
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Attacke
description:
Attacke belongs to the "Taschen-Spiele"("pocket games") series from Heyne which included 34 games.

The board shows a small castle on one side of the board, which the defender must try to defend against the attacks from the attacker. Both players have just one single playing piece for their regular moves. The rest of the playing pieces (34 chips for the defender, 2 tokens for the attacker) are used to keep track of the movement limitations of the players: while the attacker can use every path outside the castle only once, the defender cannot use the same path within the castle more than two subsequent turns.

If the attacker manages to enter the castle exactly on the point where the defender is staying, he is the winner. If he is forced to enter the castle on an empty point, he has lost the game, because the defender will catch him on his next turn. The attacker has also lost the game, if he has no possible move left (outside of the castle).

The game exists in 2 editions with different rules. According to the designer Tom Werneck, the first edition had the problem, that the attacker won in most cases, but the second edition did not help this game from being broken, because now, the defender won most times!
publishers: Heyne, Interplay (Board Game Related), Palet spil

name: Shapy
description: The players throw the three dice at one time and everyone looks together for the tile with the same shapes as those that come up on the dice. Different versions offer variety so that even older children and adults can have a lot of fun with Shapy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Liiklusmäng
description: Liiklusmäng is a simple roll and move game about teaching traffic rules to children. The players are bycyclists who's aim is to move safetly through a city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Garden-party
description:
From the rulebook:

Each player walks his counters across the board. If he lands on a space marked with one of the seven different plant symbols, he may take the matching plant card. But before all 64 board spaces have been "planted" with altogether four kinds of plant, the amateur gardener may suffer several cruel turns of fortune. Drought may wither his lawn, sunflowers or plums, caterpillars and greenfly attack his pansies and lettuce beds. The lucky player will be protected against such ravages by having earlier drawn an "antidote" card, such as insurance against flooding, bug killer to combat a plague of maybugs. A player landing on the "Garden Party" space is served a small refreshment for relaxation, such as a sweet or a glass of lemonade. Adults will prefer a glass of the harder stuff.
Winner is the first player to plant the 16 spaces of his garden with 4 different types of plant cards.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Power Kitty
description:
A card game published on thegamecrafter.com that bears a fairly strong resemblance to Uno.

You start the game with seven cards. The first player to get rid of their hand wins. On your turn, you can play a card matching the color of the face up card or a special card. If you do neither, you draw a card. The card can be immediately played. Special cards include Skip, which skip the next player's turn, rainbows, which can be played after any color and cause the next player to draw a number of cards, power animals, which can be played on any color and allow the player to play all cards in their hand of that animal, and bug cards, which require the next player to play a bug spray card or draw a card, continuing until a bug spray is played.

From TheGamecrafter.com:

"Be the first to play all the kitties, doggies, mousies, and bunnies from your hand. Power animals will help you out, but watch out for the dreaded Bug or you'll need to find some Bug Spray!

A fast-playing card game for 2-6 players. We play it with kids ages 4 and up. By Colleen and Matt Leacock."

Game contents:
47 cards
Rules document

name: Goal
description:
From the website of the publisher: little magnetic strategy game with theme sports: Football.

Travel pocket game for two players in which each player tries to move his/her two pieces ("footballs") into the target zone ("goal"). Both players start on the same side and try to bypass six defenders. You either move one of your own pieces horizontally or vertically, you jump with one of your piece over a single other playing piece or you move one of the defenders.

name: Maus voraus!
description:
A piece of cheese is put into the mouth of a battery-driven mouse. The mouse is then set loose on the floor and dashes through the room. The players represent cats and have to catch the mouse's tail with a small plastic sling. The first player to succeed in that gets the cheese. After nine rounds, the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Similar to Maniac Mouse
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic
publishers: AS Company, Goliath Games, Hasbro, Kod Kod

name: Thundarr the Barbarian
description:
A rogue planet passes between Earth and the moon causing catastrophic changes. Earth as we know it no longer exists. Travel trough this strange new world with Thundarr The Barbarian, Princess Ariel, and Ookla. Bold challenges and exciting battles await you. Your journey begins in the middle of the board. From there, travel along the gamepath in either direction, and try to land on Battle Squares and win Battle Cards with victory points. You may also win cards by challenging an opponent when you land on the same space. If you win a Sunsword it will help you to capture a Battle card and a card with Thundarr’s White Stallion on it will enable you to move anywhere on the board without rolling the die. Your journey ends and the game is over when all of the Battle Cards have been won.
The player with the highest total number of victory points is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Synonyms: The Word Game That Gets Your Mind Racing!
description:
WINNER: 2011 CREATIVE CHILD MAGAZINE SEAL OF EXCELLENCE
WINNER: 2011 CREATIVE CHILD MAGAZINE PREFERRED CHOICE
WINNER: 2011 DR. TOY TEN BEST GAMES
WINNER: 2011 DR. TOY 100 BEST CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS
WINNER: 2011 PARENTS' CHOICE RECOMMENDED PRODUCT

SYNONYMS is the exciting word challenge that entertains and educates in a fast-paced and fun board game for ages 10 through seniors.

Players race their pawns around the board to be the first to collect all the letters of the word SYNONYMS. A roll of the die and a card is selected. The player has one minute to earn a letter by naming the designated number of synonyms - unless a competitor declares a challenge! Minds race at maximum brainpower as each tries to top the other. Over 400 cards with over 10,000 empowering words provide hours of word-building fun for the whole family.

Never be at a loss for words again - Play Synonyms!

name: Απολύομαι!
description:
Taken from the back of the box:
They say that in the army there is no logic... You go to sleep not knowing what tomorrow brings...
From the sentry to chores... from chores to patrols... and every now and then "camping" on the mountains and the beaches!

In "apolyomai" (greek for leaving the army) players try to finish their national service by avoiding chores and most importantly sergeants and captains.
The game plays more or less like Monopoly, with the players rolling the die and moving equal amount of spaces.
Everyone hopes to land somewhere helpful for them or collect cards that aids them in an easier service, and of course trying to avoid the officers who are ready to hand out penalties!
So that in the end they 'll serve fewer days than others having the least penalties.

Contents:

1 Game board
54 Cards (18 for 3 sets)
1 Block for penalties
6 Playing pieces
2 Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Transformers Warrior Robot Game
description:
A snakes-and-ladders-type game. Players each have two pieces and the aim of the game is be the first to get both pieces to the 'WIN' square. Players must decide which of their pieces to move on each turn.

Play starts on an outer track of the board and pieces transfer to the central track by landing on the relevant space. Players' pieces can be in vehicle mode (roll two dice to move) or robot mode (roll 1 die) and they transform between the two by landing on certain squares. Autobot symbols on the board act as 'ladders' allowing a piece to jump ahead and Decepticon symbols act as the 'snakes' causing a piece to move back to a previous square.

name: Apollo
description:
Simple roll and move game with a space theme. Players race their rocketships, trying to be the first to orbit the moon and safely return to earth.

You roll a single D6 and move that many spaces, certain spaces have bonuses or penalties.

components: game rules, game board, 4 plastic rockets, 1 D6

name: Xtreme Global 1940 Xpansion Mod  (fan expansion for Axis & Allies: Europe 1940)
description:
This is a total Uber Xtreme Xpansion mod for Axis & Allies Europe 1940.

Players play the game like regular Axis & Allies. The game's turns go like this. Instead of playing individual countries for individual players, my rules NOW have all the countries going together at the same time, the incomes are still separate and Japan still controls Japan's income, etc, but NOW ALL players will conduct their turns all at one time, with separate incomes for separate countries and they will all purchase their units at the same time, their turns at the same time, placed on the same "Place Units" board on the game and all playing pieces are color-coded like the regular game. Germany spends income on Germany's pieces and places them in German-held territories with industrial complexes, and Britain does the same, etc on down the line.

United States is NOT at war with anyone and therefore cannot declare war, unless and Axis player declares war on it first or after its 3rd turn for example, like in the real Global game.
The question of ownership of the Dutch territories in the game has been solved. Players will no longer need to land grab the Dutch territories in the wake of Hollland's collapse. Instead, ownership will go to the United Kingdom because they control and are patrons of the Dutch Govt in Exile in London and the Dutch Govt. In Exile is under British control, therefore they belong to the United Kingdom. They will receive the usual bonus for having posession of them. See my PDF document for additonal changes.

The goals of the game are similar to a regular Axis & Allies game. The Axis will capture London, Paris, Kiev, Moscow, and Washington. The Allies will capture the Axis capitals of Tokyo, Berlin, and Rome.

The players are France, Soviet Union, Italy, United Kingdom,(Pacific and Europe) and USA. The goals for the Axis and the Allies are the same as Europe 1940 and Global 1940. Nothing's changed there.

The Allies capture the Axis capitals of Berlin and Rome.

The rules are the same as regular Axis & Allies.

I wanted to expand upon the whole Axis & Allies game by adding more to it. This pack also adds new territories, such as Crimea. Crimea is now important for control of Sea zone 125 as it was in real life. The Black Sea Fleet is also represented with one Battleship and 1 destroyers, and 1 Transports. The Romanian fleet and Russian fleet will inhabit the same waters, but Romania will not be at war until Germany is at war with the Soviet Union because Romania and Hungary are controlled by Germany.

There also new rules regarding the setup.

Germany will receive 1 Major Industrial Complex in Romania to represent the Ploesti oil refinery, which was a large portion of Germany's oil production and gasoline in World War II and 1 Major Industrial Complex for Slovakia-Hungary, which was a large portion of Germany's armaments production that supplied the Germans with the tanks they used to invade France in 1940.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Wargame, World War II

name: Yoohoo, Can You Moo?
description: Yoohoo, Can You Moo? is a children's card matching game. Kids collect cards to create of a barnyard of animals by challenging each other to successfully imitate animal sounds.

name: Joulupukki Santa Claus: Game
description:
"Santa Claus is already a very old man and he also has a habit of forgetting things. Sometimes Santa Claus gets lost and then Mother Christmas becomes worried. Once again Santa Claus has gotten lost. Your task is to find Santa Claus and take him back to Korvatunturi to Mother Chistmas' gentle care."

Simple roll and move game for 2-6 players. Players roll dice or use action cards to move around gameboard and flip over any tokens they encounter. First player to find Santa and bring him back home wins.

name: Critical Hit! - Volume 7, No. 3
description:
Volume 7, No. 3 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine, containing articles, scenarios and a historical map (Pointe du Hoc) for Advanced Squad Leader.

The following articles are included:
- Scenario Analysis: Akrotiri Gone Awry (a scenario from this issue)
- Küstenjäger: German Coastal Commandos in ASL
- Incidents with the 7th: A first-hand account of British combat on the battlefields of Normandy in 1944
- Tigers to the Front: A review of the scenario pack
- Busting the Bocage: A review of the ASL module

The following scenarios are included (BtB scenarios are played on the enclosed historical map):
BtB#1: NO NEED FOR ORDERS; 6 June 1944; Pointe du Hoc, France
BtB#2: SHRAPNEL MOTIVATION; 6 June 1944; Pointe du Hoc, France
BtB#3: A FUTILE HOUR; 6 June 1944; Pointe du Hoc, France
BtB#4: ROUT THE KRAUT; 6 June 1944; Pointe du Hoc, France
BtB#5; WALKING WOUNDED; 6 June 1944; Pointe du Hoc, France
BtB#6: FROM OMAHA WITH LOVE; 8 June 1944; Pointe du Hoc, France
CH#170: BRIDEGROOMS OF DEATH; 14 August 1936, Badajoz, Spain
CH#171: INTERNACIONALE FOLLIES; 14 December 1936, Boadilla, Spain
CH#172: WINTER BLUES; 19 March 1942; North of Novgorod, Russia
CH#173: 'BITCHES' ON THE BEACH; 11 August 1945; Sakhalin Island
CH#174: SETTLING AN OLD SCORE; 17 August 1945; Sakhalin Island
CH#175: ESCAPE HATCH; 24 June 1941; Grodno, Russia
CH#176: TOUCHDOWN!; 28 May 1940; Abbeville, France
CH#177: AKROTIRI GONE AWRY; 20 May 1941; Akrotiri Peninsula, Crete
CH#178: CROCODILE HUNT; 8 February 1945; Frasselt, Germany
CH#179: ACROSS THE BEREZINA; 9 July 1941; near Osipovitchi, Russia
CH#180: THE RUINS OF SILLEGNY; 19 September 1944; Sillegny, France
CH#181: THUNDER AT SEELOW; 16 April 1945; Seelow, Germany
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: i See it!
description: i See it! - Is a fast-action Electronic word trivia game, where questions light up in a LED display Globe. There are 12 categories and 6 different versions of the game. The game includes more than 7200 challenges. Players try to see what the answer is and hit their buzzer to stop the word as it comes up, then they have to say what it is by seeing it first!
categories: Educational, Electronic, Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: Take the Test
description:
"Will You Make a Good Driver?"
"An Educational and Interesting Game For the Whole Family."

Players take a vehicle of their choice.
The Traffic Signal is placed in the centre of the board.
Players move around the board by throwing the dice. They should try to land on the coloured squares and answer questions correctly to gain points. Question subjects include Traffic Problem Pictures, general questions and traffic signs.
The objective is to score 20 Points first and thus win the game.
You must also pay close attention to the signs on the board - If you make a mistake, you lose points.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
3 Packs of Question Cards.
6 Driving Licences.
4 Vehicles.
1 Set of Traffic Lights.
2 Dice.
1 Rules/Questions/Answers Booklet.

name: Deutschland  Reise für Kinder
description:
Objective: be the first entering the choosen theme park -
learn more about Germany (read documentation on rear side of the cards)

- acting/moving by turn -
1. draw a card out of theme park pile (destination for all players)
2. draw a card out of city card pile (starting point for all players)
3. each player draws 5 city cards (unique route)
4. plan your route
5. throw the die and move - follow your route and discard your five city cards travelling through

name: Quindiche
description:
User Summary

Each turn, a player can combine a tile in his hand with some more in the table, being the sum 15. If he can do that, he take all the tiles for himself. If he can't make 15, he discards one tile.
After all the players have used his tiles, the scoring phase begins, adding point for haver certain tiles (yellow 7 by example), having three cards of the same color, most red tiles, or other combinations. The first player that reaches 60 points, wins.

name: I Doubt It
description:
Card game for youngsters.

Each player is dealt some cards. In their turn, a player first spins the spinner. This will indicate, when it stops spinning, one of the five sets of cards included with the game. The sets are titled:
Policeman
Fireman
Ballplayer
Mary Milker
Clown
After spinning, a player must play one card from their hand, face down, that matches the set indicated. If he does not have such a card, he must still play one and hope the others don't challenge him.
If a player suspects another player is not playing a legal card, that player calls "I doubt it". If the card was correct, the challenger picks up all the discard pile. If the card was a bluff, the challenged player picks up all the cards from the discard pile.
The game ends when one player has all the cards.

name: Easy Foot
description:
Football game with dice.
There are 7 dice in this game and player rolls these on his turn.
Different dice have different faces like: passing, defencing, corner kick, fault, shot a goal, penalty and players do the actions according to dice.

A game consists of two half-time of three minutes. Players with the most goals at the end of the game is the winner

name: Hooray for Horses
description:
Horse lovers will enjoy the view of their favorite animal while playing the Hooray for Horses Card Game. A great game for horse lovers, the Hooray for Horses Card Game includes thick and large cards that are perfect for growing card players. The Hooray for Horses Card Game includes 48 colorful game cards with instructions to play 5 games:

1) Hooray for Horses - In this game, whoever is the first person to get rid of all his/her cards shouts "no more horses" and is the winner.

2) No More Horses! - The object of this game is to match the horses shown on the cards and to win the most pairs. When one of the players uses up all his/her cards, or when there are no cards left in the deck, the game ends and points are calculated.

3) Color Rummy - You have to be the first player to colelct 5 cards of the same color.

4) Classic Rummy - The object is to be the first player to match all the cards in his/her hand by collecting 3 cards picturing one horse and 4 cards picturing another.

5) Horse Memory - You have to collect the most pairs. As the game is played, players claim matches until all the cards are claimed. Whoever has the most matching pairs is the winner.

The beautifully detailed illustrations on these playing cards depict breeds of breathtaking horses to help kids identify and name each type of horse. The Hooray for Horses Card Game is the perfect game for horse lovers and card players alike!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Amazonas
description:
Amazonas is a dice-roll based game for 2-4 players. The players score points by "shooting" animals on the way to the finish line. Everyone starts with 10 bullets and uses the 1-2-3 dice to move forward and the regular dice to shoot at the animals. When you arrive on a tile with an animal on it, you can decide if you want to shoot at that animal. This is done by the regular die. If you roll a number (1-6) that has an animal token on it, you "shot" the animal, you remove the token and keep it. Every shot costs one bullet. If you miss, you can try again by using another bullet. Obviously, if less animals remain, your chances to shoot one is smaller. Once you hit an animal, the next player's turn begins. If you arrive on an "Amazonas" tile, you can choose the animal you want to shoot at. Different animals give you different points (e.g. parrot one, lion six).
There are also obstacles on the way that players must cross. If they fail to cross them, they loose animals worth of 6 points. If you don't have enough animals to return, you can give back your bullets (1 bullet - 1 point).

SWAMP: In order to cross the swamp, you need to roll a number (with the regular dice) that corresponds with the value of a neighboring tile (except the one behind you). In this case, you can move to that tile, making your way across the swamp.
Once you make it through an obstacle (or even if you fail), you arrive in a village, where you can sell your animals for bullets according to the animal's value. (For a 6 point lion you get 6 bullets).

CHASM: In order to cross the chasm, you need to get 10 points out of 3 rolls.

COCONUT: Monkeys are throwing coconuts at you, and you must avoid them. You place your marker anywhere on the first row (there are four) and throw with the blue and red dice. The values of the colored dice show you where the monkeys are throwing the coconuts (red value counted from the left and blue from the right). If they miss, you go to the next row, if either of the hits you, you fall.

SUSPENSION BRIDGE: from 8 rolls you must get all the 6 values of the dice (1-6, in any order)

CROCODILES: You need to row through the water by using the green and white 1-2 dice (Right paddle green dice, left paddle white). Equal numbers: you go straight ahead 1 or 2 tiles. Green 1, white 2: you move one ahead and one left. If you hit a croc on the way, you fail.

ROPE: You have 8 rolls and you need to get to the other side by always rolling a bigger number than the previous.

Once you get to the finish line, you count the value of your animals.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Let's Pumpkin
description:
Pumpkins have surprisingly small brain stems – non-existent even, you might say. As such they're not the brightest of creatures and they get in trouble easily. In Let's Pumpkin, you're trying to help this fragrant fruit find their way to safety, mostly so that you can plant them again later.

Starting with an array of face-down, vibrantly orange triangular tiles arranged in a circle, players take turns planting a pumpkin on an unrevealed tile – at which time the landscape beneath the tile is discovered, often to the pumpkin's detriment as each terrain tile hides a trap. The pumpkins can catch fire, freeze, be sucked up by tornado, and so on. To counter the devastating effects of these traps and save the pumpkins, a player can use tokens acquired from burning or frozen terrain; alternatively, a player can use these tokens against opponents, really grinding their gourds by strengthen traps that affect them.

Whoever manages to plant the last pumpkin, whether owned or already on the game map, wins!

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Jabba's Palace Battle Game
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

"Launch,Stack, Destroy!"

Princess Leia Bird, Jabba the Hutt Pig, and Jabba's Rancor Pig.

This is a new edition to the Angry Birds line. The game comes with a three figures, a launcher, 6 plastic blocks, 1 place piece, and instructions. The object of the game is to launch birds and knock down pigs.

The game is based on the Star Wars Angry Bird app. In addition, the game comes with a App code to unlock game content.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Fiore
description:
Game components:


- Wooden board with two concentric rings of 10 round notches
- 10 small red balls

Two games can be played with these components:

a) Fiore: A puzzle game for one player.

Game begins with all 10 balls placed in the internal ring notches. The goal is to move nine of those balls to the outer ring.

A ball is moved four steps to the left or right and, after landing in the destination notch, is moved to the corresponding outer notch. Another ball is then chosen and moved four steps right or left and then outwards. The counting begins always in a occupied inner notch. Empty inner notches must also be counted.

b) Peccato: a game for two players.

At the beginning of the game all balls are placed in the outer ring of notches. The balls are moved from the outdoor fields to the internal ones. The player who moves the last ball is the loser of the first round. The starting player may moved none, one or two any outer balls to their corresponding inner notches. Then, players alternate moving one or two balls. Only adjacent balls or else balls laying in opposite notches can be selected to be moved simultaneously in a player's turn.
A number of rounds are played until one player has lost four rounds. The loser of a round is the start player of the next round and decides if moving the last ball will be the winning or losing condition of the new round.

name: Color Mix-A-Roo
description: Players use the spinner to determine how many color cards to turn over, then attempt to "make" one of the face-up colors using the Mix-A-Roo dial. If the correct color is mixed, the player keeps the card. The winner is the player with the most cards when the last rainbow card is flipped over.

name: Spelet om Valköping
description:
What does local politicians really do? Try to be a part of the municipal council. Learn to prioritize and distribute resources - both according to political affiliation and for the common good.

In the last round an opinion poll will be undertaken - the winner of that also wins the game.

At the start of the game you randomly choose one of six different political characters (from six different, fictional, political parties [Alfa, Beta, Kappa, Delta, Sigma and Gamma]).

Each political character has one issue that he or she must fight for and another three issues that they must prioritize in the game. These issues are: “school”, “leisure”, “local transports”, “culture”, “business”, “social services”, “elderly care”, “waste management”, “welfare”, “housing”, “water & sewer”, “fire & rescue”.

As elected you spend resources (chits) on one or more of these areas that you are assigned. But look out! The next player has another set of issues that they must fight for – and they will grab every opportunity to take resources from your areas and put on their own.

The best way to try to win is to get the other players on your side, to contest and argue. There is no successful “sneak under the radar”-strategy in this game. Loud and vocal and on the attack but smart, is a winning strategy. But that is not enough; sooner or later you (your issues) will be stripped of resources – and you must be smart when trying to get them back to your most important issues.

During the course of the game you will start one turn, the next player starts the next turn et cetera (that means if you are more than four players, one or more will not get to start a turn). Each player gets the same amount of new resources, but not the same opportunity to shift resources from issue to issue, that is decided by the dice.

There is another random factor in the game, a deck of event cards that is used once at the end of each turn.

The ultimate goal of the game is to win the “opinion poll” at the end of the last turn, year four (one election cycle in Sweden). The opinion poll is won by the player that has collected most resources; double points for each resource on one’s issues at heart and one point on the other issues that you fight for!

There are also rules for winning the overall game – not only do you compete against the other players, you all must successfully meet the public opinion and you all must collectively have enough points to pass the game. So it is not all about competition, you must also collaborate with your opponents from time to time. And that’s trickier said than done.
publishers: Fabel Kommunikation, Sveriges Kommuner och Landsting

name: Disney Planes Air Champions
description: Themed around the Disney animated movie Planes, this is a dexterity game where players' planes try to visit three countries before returning to Propwash Junction. The planes are moved by a simple kind of catapult and they are successful in visiting a country if they at least touch the border of a country tile - in this case they get a country token. However, there are 10 Storm tokens randomly distributed on the table as well. When a plane lands on these tokens the player must skip a turn. If a country is reached, the player gets a reward: spin a spinner and see the consequences (it's your turn again, or choose another player who has to put back one of their country chips, or make a country tile smaller by adding fog, or redistribute the thunder tokens, possibly hurting other planes). The game ends when the first player returns to Propwash Junction with the three different country tokens in their bag.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Travel

name: Ruck Zuck
description:
Based on the popular long running 1988-2000 and 2004-2005 Tele 5, RTL II, tm3 and currently RTLplus since 2016 German game show of the same name. (for which in turn was originally adapted from a short-lived 1986 U.S. daytime game show on ABC called Bruce Forsyth's Hot Streak) First, the players determine which set of cards to work with. Then it determines the starting player, for which they continue clockwise. The first player pulls on the clock and draws the top card from the deck. Then He/She submits to his/her right players and starts the clock. the player must then now decide on which of the two generic terms the he/she will use and announce them. He/She then list three terms matching the topic while stopping the clock. The hands of the clock displays the score, which is listed in the circular column under the name of the player. Then the timer switches to the next player. In the following four rounds, five and even six terms must be found in the same subject.

The bonus round is also somewhat different that the actual TV series. for which the active player can draw new cards for so long, until the clock expires. For each card completely played, the player gets a point. Cards can continued to be pulled out until the time expires. at the end of the round, the Player will receive one point for each completed card that has been played. The winner is the player whose total is after the bonus round is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: My Little Pony: Regnbågsspelet
description:
In Regnbågsspelet (The Rainbow-game) the four ponies Twilight Sparkle, Pinkie Pie, Rarity and Lyra Heartstrings compete as to who reaches the castle first. If you follow the rainbow you advance on the board. If you end up in the waterfalls you risk sliding backwards, but if you are lucky one of your pony-friends might help you escape the slide. The pony that reaches the castle first wins.

A My Little Pony-version of the classic snakes and ladders-game with a few modifications.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Journey: Wrath of Demons – Spider Demons Expansion
description:
The Spider Demon Expansion gives the Pilgrims a chance to retrieve the third piece of the sundered Sutras. But before Tripitaka can assemble more of the sacred scroll, his band will have to defeat the Spider Demons. The book describes them as “seductive spider spirits, half beautiful women, half spider”.

In the Silk Cave, high in the Silk Mountains, Zige the Spider Demon Queen spins her webs of the toughest silk. Her minions weave traps of sticky cobwebs and wait for unsuspecting prey to become ensnared. Will they feast on our brave travellers?

Once again, we will introduce new game play elements with the Spider Demons. These Demons fight at longer range, spitting poison and throwing spider web nets. Pilgrims will be more likely to suffer on-going conditions, like Poisoned and a new condition Entangled. Webs act as traps that hold the Pilgrims and attract the Demons when the Pilgrims are entangled. Each Demon moves towards the closest entangled Pilgrim, and may get to attack while the Pilgrim is unable to defend: an entangled target cannot use the Defense Dice.

name: Whac-a-Mole Molehill Mania Game
description: Grab a mallet and smack away on the lever at the base of the play set. With every smack, moles fly out of the molehill and onto the ground. Use the special mole-catching mallet to collect the moles. Be the first player to fill your mallet with moles to have your “mallet” mole reach all the way to the top wins. Includes 2 mallets, moles, and three different levels of play.

name: Immunity
description:
Immunity is a board game in which your immune system will fight against the pathogens agents that attempt to infect your body. Become the healthiest player of the table, and live all your life free of harmful diseases! Take the control of virus, bacteria and parasites, and strike the vital organs of your rivals! The game emulates in a proper way some aspects of the immunity, like the inflammation, adverse effects of medicaments, the disease transmission, the spread of tumors, and many others.

In this card game, each player receives an organism board which shows the health of your five vital systems (nervous, cardiorespiratory, digestive, hepatic, and renal), as well as your age throughout the life. There are also two environment squares that will be occupied with the pathogens before they invade your organism. In addition, the board shows different human cells (red blood cells, immune cells, platelet, etc) that can be bought with oxygen. These cells are responsible for eliminating pathogens.

There are 3 types of deck cards in the game. Pathogen cards can be placed on the environment squares of the rivals, in order to infect and harm their organs. Medic cards can be used to prevent damage, transplant organs, eradicate microorganisms, etc. There is a common deck for all the players, the environmental deck, which represents hazardous effects that can affect the health of a person, like occupational accidents, blood donation and school fights.

name: Twoja Krzyżówka
description:
Yet another Scrabble spin-off. Twoja Krzyżówka in Polish language means Your Crossword.

The board is very Scrabble-like, but the bonuses are not split into word and letter. These are just additional points.

At the beginning of the game each player receives 8 letter tiles. The letters do not have points assigned to them. Every letter which is placed on the board scores 2 points and every letter used in current turn, but placed earlier scores 1 point.

What's more, there are bonuses for creating words longer than 5 letters. Six points for 6-letter word, 7 points for 7-letter word etc.

The winner is the player who scores most points.

name: Icebreaker
description:
Spin the spinner to choose a player and pick a card from the next category. Then its time to answer a question, perform a task or match the active player's answer. The one with most victory point chips at the end of the game wins.

The game contains questions and tasks from every possible topic! The game is easy to learn and get going. Scoring is simple and easy.

name: Eggheads Card Game
description: Based on the hit TV quiz show. Teams compete head to head to see who can provide the most correct answers and win the points on offer. Take your team to the high-scoring final round and battle it out to be crowned the Eggheads in this exciting trivia shoot-out!

name: Filly Butterfly: Sammle deine Funkelsteine
description:
The beautiful Filly Butterflies are excited, because Princess Scarlet is visiting. She ha brought sparkling crystals, which they generously hands out in the magic Papillia garden.

To reach all Fillies, the princess travels from place to place. With a little luck of the dice and courage to some take risks you can get hold of a lot of colorful glitter stones. Here we go!

In Filly Butterfly: Sammle deine Funkelsteine (Filly Butterfly: Collect your Glitter Stones), each player attempts to collect as many crystals as possible.

At the beginning of the game, all players receive the same amount of crystals.

The board shows six locations in Papillia; each location has some spaces for crystals. A Princess Scarlet pawn is placed on one of the location.

Players take turns rolling the die and moving Princess Scarlet a number of spaces clockwise, as indicated on the die. If Princess Scarlet ends her move in a location that still has an empty spot for a crystal, the active player has to place one of his crystals there, and may then roll the die again, if desired. On the other hand, if Princess Scarlet ends her move on a location that has no more empty spots, the active player may take all crystals from that location, and his turn ends.

The game ends when one player has no more crystals left. Then, the player who has collected the most crystals wins.

name: 77 Kivaa Kysymystä ja Vekkulia Vastausta
description:
There are two kind of cards, red and blue, questions and answers.
Two players, other one take a question card deck, and second one take a answers card deck, which will be shuffled. Player with the question deck ask question from a card and player with the question deck read answer from the answer deck, other one ask and other one answers, until both decks are gone through, than you resuffle decks and can change players. For listeners game is also a fun pass time.

Finnish description:
Kortteja on kahdenlaisia, sinisiä ja punaisia, kysymyksiä ja vastauksia. Pelaajia on kaksi, joista toinen ottaa kysymyspakan ja toinen vastauspakan, jotka sekoitetaan. Nurinpäin käännetystä pakasta ottaa kysyjä kortin kerrallaan, lukee kysymyksen ja toinen pelaaja vastaa, kunnes pakka on käyty läpi. Tällöin sekoitetaan pakat uudelleen ja pelaajat voivat vaihtua. Myös kuuntelijoille peli on hauskaa ajan kulua.

name: New China (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Tusken Raider Attack & The Battle of Yavin
description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.

This set has the Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Yavin, also available as a single set. Tusken Raider Attack is exclusive to this 2-Pack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: New York (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Turnee
description:
This game is similliar to Kimble/Turnee

The game is abstract, each player has set of pawns of his color. Each turn player rolls a die and selects one of his pawns to move. Pawns can enter the track from Home base only on a roll of five or six. Each pawn needs to travel around the board and finish on the Finish lane. If pawn of another player is stops in to a same game square , the bumped pawn is returned to home. The goal is to be the first one to get all the pawns to the Finish lane.

The trick is that the game board is a squere with circles in the corners. The home bases are in these circles. There are also X shaped gates at corners wich turn everytime a pawn goes through it. This way every other pawn would go to the square route and every other to the circle route.

name: Busted
description: Busted is a push-your-luck dice game played with eight dice. After each throw, one or more dice must be "locked" and the player can then choose whether to roll again or to bank any accumulated points. However, if a player eventually spells out “B-U-S-T-E-D“ on the dice, they lose any accumulated points for that hand. Players roll the dice for as long as they can to drive up their score toward the goal of 1000 points.

name: Get to the Point Poker
description: This innovative take on poker re-imagines the classic card game as a fast and easy competition between friends. Each five-card hand is cut as a single card, letting players enjoy a quick hand or a speedy smack-down tournament. This compact and travel-friendly package comes with everything players need to swiftly get a game of poker going, wherever they are!

name: La Información
description: It's a trivia game where you can answer the questions alone or picking a teammate for every question.

name: Connect 4 Twist & Turn
description: Just like the classic game play of Connect 4, but instead of a flat game grid, it is a 5 layer tower - and each layer twists. Players take turns dropping a piece in the tower and then MAY twist any layer exactly one space. By doing so, at least 1 piece typically drops to a different layer adding an extra level of skill to the game. First player to get 4-in-a-row wins.
mechanics: Action Queue, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Facets of Fortune
description: In Facets of Fortune, you are plunged into a world of high-powered gem trading, with a relatively small amount of money to get you started. Your goal is to buy low and sell high, using special gem trading cards in strategic and surprising ways to make thrilling plays for cash. Sometimes, it seems like your fortunes have fallen so low that you'll never get ahead, but with one clever play, you could suddenly find yourself on top of the gem world!

name: A Game for Good Christians: The Red Letter Deck – The Words and Actions of Jesus the Christ
description:
This expanded expansion deck is based on the words and actions of our Lord and savior, Jesus the Christ including

"That time Jesus was a racist" (Matthew 15:21-28)

"Fishing for men" (Matthew 4:19)

"Demon-castin’, tongues-speakin’, snake-handlin’, poison-drinkin,’ hand-layin’-healin' in the name of Jesus" (Mark 16:17-18)

and of course

"God so loving the world that he gave his only Son, so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life." (John 3:16)

This BIGGER deck comes with 70 Cards (20 Creed & 52 Canon) in a custom tuck box.

–description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Religious

name: A Game for Good Christians: Things That Make The Baby Jesus Cry
description:
THIS NEW UN-THEMED EXPANSION DECK INCLUDES SUCH FONDLY REMEMBERED BIBLICAL MOMENTS AS:

A present of golden mice and hemorrhoids sent as an offering to the Lord. (1 Samuel 6:1-18)

Sarah wondering if she'll ever be "abundantly wet" again. (Genesis 18:12)

The Lord shaving your pubic hair. (Isaiah 7:20)

THIS EXPANSION COMES WITH 54 CARDS: 12 CREED & 42 CANON.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Religious

name: Wings Around the Globe Rally
description:
Publisher's blub:

A very simple Disney-themed racing game.
Land on the airstrips to get points.

name: Hiragana Sentence
description:
Hiragana Sentence is a mix of boggle and bingo. Each round a new theme will be drawn and hiragana characters drawn bingo style. Players will fill their 5x5 sheet with the characters in any way they want, after all of them have being filled up players try to form a word based on the theme. Players vote for the best word of the round and a new round is played.

Description from the publisher:

It is a communication game to make sentences that fit the theme by connecting hiragana well. She turns over the cards with hiragana written and fills the letters in the favorite squares of the sheet in that order. When everyone can write, last letters are connected by a line and announced.

name: Wash My Underpants
description:
Be the first to collect nine pairs of clean pants. Spin the arrow to see which color to put in the wash. When the spinner tells you the pants are clean, take them out of the washing machine and put them in your basket.

The Wash My Underpants Game is an exciting early learning game which teaches color recognition and matching, provides practice in counting, encourages observation skills and develops hand-eye coordination.

name: Colorow
description:
Family-friendly strategic color-matching card game. Match colors to create rows, working to find combinations that allow you to lay all of your cards down while preventing your opponents from doing the same. Be the first to play all of your cards and you win.

Game is compact, making it easy to transport and simple instructions make it a quick learn.

name: Sverige runt
description:
During setup each player receives travel cards, corresponding to destinations in Sweden, and a pawn. Om his turn, the player moves 1-2 steps (on road or railway) or checks in for a flight. The goal is to travel from southest-northest Sweden (or vice versa), while visiting destinations in the travel cards. Om his way the player can also choose to visit destinations with souvenir cards. After visiting all destinations in his travel cards, the player moves to the final destination, where he is given three questions about Sweden.

After all players have finished, final points are calculated: Every travel card is worth 5 PTS, souvenir cards are 2 PTS each, and correct answers to the questions in the are 1 PTS each. The player with most points win.

name: Go BLEEP yourself
description:
We dare ya to fill in the blank!

How the BLEEP do you play this awesome game?!

1. Read the phrases and fill in the BLEEP... secretly!
2. Other players write down what they think the reader will answer.
3. If you can't guess what the reader said, try to be the funniest...because funny wins points, too!

—description from the publisher

name: Hexus Plus
description:
-Game introduction
Hexus is a game using cubes and puzzles.
Players have to plan and use their own strategy through exchanging, acquiring cubes and holding each other in check.
This is a useful board game, which is easy to learn and enjoyable for everyone, as well as being helpful for brain health.

-Game objective
Each player has to move using a dice and construct a Hexus base while they compete with each other through exchanging, and acquiring cubes, that have various shapes and holding each other in check.
There are 2 ways to finish The Hexus game. At this time, the player who constructs the most stable and ideal Hexus build wins.

name: Neck of the Woods
description:
The giraffes are hungry! - Can you help them reach the leaves in the tree?

It takes a steady hand and a clever mind to stack the blocks, reach the reward, and earn the most points.

On each turn, you must roll the die to determine which block you have to use. Keep on stacking turn after turn to stack your giraffe's neck as high as you can.

The higher the leaves are in the tree, the more points they're worth. - Stack as high as possible to win the biggest reward!

But beware. If your giraffe tumbles, you'll have to start all over, and the other giraffes might start chanting -

"Icarus lost his nee-eck! Icarus lost his nee-eck!"

Once all the leaves have been grabbed, everyone flips them over at the same time to count up their points. The player with the most points wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Liikennepeli
description:
Liikennepeli is a kids’ game similar to Old maid but with a twist. The deck consists of six groups of four cards plus a ”Fines” card. The cards depict traffic signs and the game teaches their meanings. (The back of the box actually suggests to play Old Maid with this deck, using the 'fine' card as Old Maid.)

All cards are dealt to the players and players take turns drawing cards from their leftmost neighbor. If a player gets a full set of four cards, he/she places them face up and another player explains the meaning of the traffic signs one by one. If he/she succeeds the cards are set aside and the game continues, otherwise the set of four cards is dealt back to the players. The player with the Fines card at the end of the game loses.

name: Disney Pixar Cars 3: Risky Raceway Game
description:
Join Lightning McQueen, Cruz Ramirez and Jackson Storm as they train for the big race! Use Training Tokens to avoid hazards. Reach the checkered flag first to win!

Race over bridges and avoid hazards!

PASS over a Training Space to earn a Token.
STOP at a Hazard Space. GO if you have a Training Token!
WIN! Reach the finish first to win!

name: Raumaneuvos kaupunkipeli
description: Raumaneuvos is a local reimplementation of Monopoly for the city of Rauma, Finland. It has some new rules and the stops are all local landmarks and businesses. 1200 copies of the game have been made.

name: 逆臣の炎 (Gyakushin no Honoo)
description:
逆臣の炎 (Gyakushin no Honoo, "Fire of the Rebel") is the second game from Polygonotes. You play as a servant in the house of a mad king, waiting for a chance to depose him to save the kingdom.

The game has three special kinds of cards. There's one each of the Night and the Dawn, which move around the table - the Night is always held by the active player, and the Dawn by the previous player. In the deck there are many "Flames of the Treacherous Retainer" cards, which have different colored backs. A round ends when one player has three Flames and the Night card; you win by having 20 points at the end of a round.

Each turn you can play a card or draw a card. Some cards can't be played and just add points (positive or negative) to your hand. Others have all kinds of effects, like making another player put a Flame on the bottom of the deck, reversing turn order, or even flipping the deck upside down. Even the Night and Dawn cards are worth points, so you might want to trick someone else into ending the hand.

In order to win you'll have to choose when to play your cards right as well as bluff the other players as to how good your hand is. Can you depose the king?

—user summary

name: Wau Wau Muh und was machst du?
description:
A new day starts on the farm, with animals and humans both rising to start the day and ready to eat! Can you help the farmers feed their animals?

In Wau Wau Muh und was machst du?, players get task cards to show what food they need to find, and once they do find it under the hidden tiles, then they feed the corresponding animal by pushing the food into its mouth and making the appropriate sound. If you complete most of the tasks by the time all the tokens have been distributed, you win.

name: QANAT
description:
In the near future, civilization has dissolved. You must try to collect cultural treasures from the ruins of what was, specifically CDs. You'll need to manage three kinds of luck — chit-pull, random tile placement, and dice — to become the greatest treasure hunter.

The game of QANAT has a map of connected spaces, some of which are dig sites that may have CDs. Each turn you move by pulling chits from a bag, choosing when to stop. Most of the chits are normal moves, but some are events that can be good or bad. If you arrive at a dig site, you can try to dig up a CD by rolling over the dig number for the region. Some dig sites will end up being duds with no CDs at all, and if you find a CD the value of them varies.

In order to get an advantage over the other treasure hunters, you need to decide when to use special powers to mitigate the effects of luck. Can you get the most valuable CDs?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Do You Even Lift? The Game
description:
Bro, Do You Even Lift?

The much awaited game is finally here!

Three decks of cards will decide if you are the biggest beast at acquiring GAINS or if you are living the best LIFE.

But who's got it all? You could duke it out or you could just play and find out?

Players take turn and draw cards in a trivia style party game.

—description from the publisher

name: Masters of Mayhem
description:
"Masters of Mayhem is a disaster-based population control game! Your goal is to completely decimate every other player's populations using a variety of natural and unnatural disasters! As you're destroying each other, the map is also growing every round! As you play the game, you discover new and strange ways to eliminate your opponents and expand your territory! Use geomagnetic storms to kill opponents trying to escape! Crack the map in half with a massive earthquake! Or if it comes to it, just nuke everyone!"

"Because of the mix of chaos and strategy, every time you play it is different! Because of the mix of tiles and cards, the possibilities for each game are almost infinite!"

--from the publisher

Each player begins with one city tile and '5000' people (represented by 5 meeples). Everyone takes turns playing destruction cards (representing various natural and unnatural disasters, such as hurricanes or alien invasions) to destroy each other's populations, and playing defense cards to block disasters. At the beginning of each new round, every player gets a new city tile, a new card, and a new meeple (representing 1000 more people) for each city tile you still control. Rounds continue until only one player still has population meeples on the board.
--user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Player Elimination, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Farmer Jones
description: Farmer Jones is similar to the well-known "memory", but requires even more concentration due to the acoustic announcement by the farmer from the included sound box, which animal or which item is currently being sought. Two to four children can support "Farmer Jones" with the search and keep the farm tidy.

name: Studia junior: Maailma tutuksi -peli
description:
Studia junior is a roll-and-move trivia game with questions taken from publisher's encyclopedia series of the same name. The game rules even provide rules on how to allow searching the answer from the books. After players have travelled around the board and given enough right answers, they must finish in the board center and answer successfully to final questions selected by other players.

—user summary

name: Neverheim: Path of Destruction
description:
Set in a Nordic universe, Neverheim was established as an experimental planet by the gods! All the races from the realms were put together on one planet to see what would happen! They didn‘t realise what chaos would be created…

In this tactical minatures game Champions from many realms go head to head in battle or team-up to take on the enemy. In this game, your footing can be the difference between success & failure! An extensive cooperative campaign for 1-4 players set in an apocalyptic dystopia.

The Goddess of Death has raised the Army of the Dead & infiltrated the realms with carnage and corruption. Team-up with gods, giants and champions from across universe and unlock the power to overcome this zombie apocalypse! Throughout the campaign you will be levelling-up constantly to become more and more powerful as you progress while the battles get bigger and bigger!

This game has RPG elements and there is multiple towns where you will find blacksmiths, alchemists, mystics, healers, tradesmen etc. Familiars add another level to the combat and can be a ferocious companion. An in-depth experience with multiple game modes and rich lore to discover!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Backflip!
description:
This solo game has the shortest rules ever written. The goal of the game is written on the title: Backflip!

During his turn, the player throws the eraser in order to do a backflip with it. If the eraser does a full rotation and it lands showing a smile on the face, he wins. If the player fails to complete a full rotation with the eraser or doesn't land showing a smile on the face, he loses.

name: 百合乱慕 (Yuri Ranbou)
description: Play as girls attempting to gain a harem. Draft cards of various levels of strength with unique effects to form your hand and battle other players, winning the affection of various girls to build your harem. Over three rounds, each player plays a card from their hand. After resolving all effects, the player with the highest strength gains the girl targeted that round. At the end of the third round, the player with the most girlfriends wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Humor
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Deduction

name: Şokopop
description:
Ask your friends about 90's Turkish pop culture. One person becomes the judge and reads the card. Who ever answers first gets the point. Most Points wins the game!

—user summary

Kavga, polemik, basitlik, skandal...Hepsi bir kutuda bir araya geldi! Şokopop ekibi, siz ve kankeytolarınızın eğlenerek magazin bilgilerinizi yarıştırmanız için kolay, orta ve zor olmak üzere toplam 200 soru çıkardı. Size de oynamak ve sürpriz joker kartlarla uzmanlığınızı kanıtlamak kaldı. Şansınız bol olsun!

—description from the publisher

name: Sharks Feeding Frenzy
description:
You and your friends (or people you hire off Craigslist) each take the role of a competitive shark, battling it out to eat tourists, locals, or even a dead whale carcass in a race to get 50 points. There's tricks and treats and fights and bites along the way. It's a back and forth tile-laying-take-that-oh-no-you-didn't finfunfest (I think that's German for shark-party.)

With so many different tile types and draws, each game is delightfully different, like the friends you hire off Craigslist. There's luck in the tile pulls and dice rolls. There's strategy in tile usage, plans of attack, and fight or flight choices. Adults and kids and hobos alike will love the quick-natured fun battle of Sharks Feeding Frenzy!

—descriptions from the designer
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Tile Placement

name: odds & even
description:
In odds & even, a trick-taking game, the cards have different suit backs depending upon if the number on the front is odd or even. In each hand, rather than a suit being trump, either odd or even numbers are trump.

Each player is dealt a hand which is half odd cards and half even cards. The players look at the half which is not trump and makes a bid on how many tricks they will win this hand.

Then, each player picks up their trump cards and drafts them, choosing 1 and passing the others, until there are no cards to pass.

Players complete a number of rounds equal to the number of players and earn points for hitting their bid and other ways. The player with the most points wins.

name: Monsterjäger: Happy Meal Edition
description: In this 2-player only version of Monsterjäger you start the monster mixer and try hit the the shown monster first with your sticky hand.

name: Brands of the World
description:
Do you know some of the most important brands in the world?
This compact game names famous brands that have shaped all of our lives. Each card features a picture of a well-known brand, a question about it, and a short fact about its fascinating history. No one will be stuck waiting for their turn, as the players answer all the questions at the same time. Let’s see how much you know about the Brands of the World!

name: GegenteilSpiel
description: GegenteilSpiel is a creative word and reaction game, in which players have to do the opposite action of the task they get presented by the active player. The person that loses all its points first wins.

name: I've Venn Thinking
description:
We have more in common than you might think. In fact, that's kind of the point of this game. This Venn diagram-based party game by Brass Monkey is all about finding (hopefully) hilarious similarities between two random (and we mean random) things. Just draw the included red and blue discs to create unexpected pairings (like the Month of February and Tom Cruise*) and then compete with friends to try to find the funniest thing that they both have in common.


We recommend: Shorter than average.


Includes 100 red & 100 blue 'topics' to pair together.
Not to mention 520 different pre-written 'answers.'
Psst: You also have the option to come up with your own answers (since you obviously think you're more clever than we are).
The outer box measures 5.8" wide by 3.7" tall by 3.5" deep–that's 147mm by 94mm by 89mm if you're fancy.
Suitable for 3-8+ players. Go crazy.

—description from the publisher

name: Spise med Price
description:
A challenging and entertaining game for the whole family.
Come inside to James and Adam Price cottage kitchen and battle with the chefs Price brothers. The goal is to become the first to gather all the ingredients for a 3-course meal - but remember to have plenty of butter! James and Adam Price have great success on a DR1 channel ingested with their food program "Eating with Price," which has been followed faithfully by 1 million viewers. The fourth season of "Eating with Price" is shown on DR1 in autumn 2011.
The first player to collect enough ingredients for a 3-course meal is the winner, provided they have enough butter like shown on the board.

name: Skandale!
description:
From the back of the box:

The game of scandalous news.

This crazy, fun game about the tabloid press twisted world, is about creating the most insane headlines for todays newspaper. Headlines are based upon celebrities, words, objects and animals in different categories: law and order, disasters, art and culture, sports horoscopes and scandals. The best headline wins and everyone get the opportunity to play editor and journalist.

Keep an eye on the deadline and remember to be creative.

The most outrageous headlines, that makes the players laugh will score points in this game.

name: Maneuver
description:
Maneuver is a basic game for two players intended to help those who are new to simulations to understand the fundamental rules and procedures commonly found in wargames. It is an abstract treatment of conflict, and is not designed to cover any particular war or battle in a realistic fashion.

Components:

8x11" map with chart
20 die cut counters


Published in Moves magazine Issue #71, Aug-Sept 1992.

name: Kittenwar
description: Based on the Kittenwar website, this card game sets pairs of kittens against each other to see which is the cutest. Although the basic game is based on War, there are three different variants that take advantage of five different stats per kitten: Agility, Speed, Stealth, Avian Observation Tactics, and Paw to Paw Combat. Each of the 100 cards depicts a full-color photograph of a featured kitten from the website.

name: Tipping Cows
description:
Tipping Cows is a dexterity game of bovine shenanigans. Players take turns flicking discs in order to tip a cow (a.k.a. knock it over). Obstacles are in the way, however, and you lose a turn knocking into a tree. Hit a cowpie, and you lose one of your flickers.

After all cows are tipped, they score one point each or a loss of two for knocking over the bull. Special and optional rules add to the game for the different types of cows.

Highest score wins!

name: What shall I be? The Exciting Game of Career Girls
description:
Object of the game is to the first player to become a Career Girl.

Players move around the board collecting School Cards, Subject Cards and Personality Cards.

Game ends when one of the players has collected 4 School Cards of one Profession and 2 Subject Cards and 2 Personality Cards that are good for that Profession.

Professions and their respective schools are:

College - Teacher
Airline Training School - Airline Hostess
Drama School - Actress
Nursing School - Nurse
Charm School - Model
Ballet School - Ballet Dancer
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Star Trek: The Final Frontier
description:
'Space, the final frontier, this is a game involving the SS Enterprise and it's (sic.) missions to explore new worlds and seek out new civilizations!'

Star Trek - The Final Frontier is a fun, action packed game for all the family' because it is not particularly difficult, but involves a lot of luck in die rolling and event cards. Travel around the board to reach four destinations before reaching Earth, (by throwing an exact number on the die.)

Includes a four piece interlocking game board, six playing pieces with stands, 24 StarTrek cards, 24 destination cards, a die, and a rule sheet.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
description:
From the publisher:

A magical board game based upon the all-time best-selling children's book, Charlie & the Chocolate Factory,by Roald Dahl. Children enter their fantasy world inside Willy Wonka's factory as they try to be the first to collect 6 different candies and reach the great glass elevator.

Compete for incredible sweets but take care! If you are greedy you will be squeezed in the juicing room, stretched in the stretching room, languish in the rubbish room, if you are in deep trouble Mr Wonka will come to your help.

Contains: Game board, deck of candy cards, oompa-loompa disks, Wonka cards, Tokens and dice
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Damm / Egmont, Identity Games International B.V., Knopf, Winning Moves Games (USA)

name: Expedition Robinson
description:
Based upon the Swedish original TV competition "Survivor", where the participants stay on a desert island for several weeks, competing in games and trying to get enough food to survive.
Through bluffing you should make your opponents believe that your Robinson characters are someone else than those that you have!
The games in the game are both trivia and dexterity types.

Each turn is a day on the island, which consists of 4 actions: Choice of Robinson character to move (it doesn't need to be your own, as you may bluff the other here), Investigation of the island, A Robinson competition and The island council (where you elect which character has to leave the game this turn). The characters may also disappear out of the game through "illness" - a special symbol tile, which you might find during the exploration.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Don't Make Me Laugh Jr.
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

Parents, do you want a new game that's fun for you and your kids to play? Do you want a game endorsed by the San Diego superintendent's office as being educational and beneficial to esteem and confidence building? Don't Make Me Laugh JR. does all that while kids just have fun racing from the "Little Chuckle" to the "Big Guffaw". Along the way, either as individuals, pairs or the whole group plater act out the creative prompts on the HaHa HoHo HeeHee laughter cards. Don't get caught in "Lolo Land" or be the one who wears the Clown nose.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game

name: Bull Market
description:
Players buy and sell stock to get rich -- buy low and sell high. The player with the most combined wealth in cash and stock is the winner.

Kids and adults alike have a great time playing while learning about the stock market.

Bull Market features stock trading, corporate takeovers, money management, IPO's (initial public offering), bookkeeping, stock splits and much more!

name: Mickey Mouse Game
description: Who's the leader of the club that's made for you and me... M-I-C-K-E-Y M-O-U-S-E! You have to sing it out loud and clear. Because when the singing stops the action starts. You'll try to be the first player to grab the token for the last letter sung. Each time you grab the correct token, you'll be one step closer to spelling out Mickey Mouse and winning the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Tequila Game
description:
Components:

Folding Board, Playing Pieces, Border Wars Ammo, Question Cards, Dice, Instructions.

Publisher's Description:

"THE SCENE IS SET ON THE MEXICO/TEXAS BORDER IN THE 1800'S. EVERYONE IS ON THE WRONG SIDE OF THE LAW; ROBBING BANKS, FIGHTING, GAMBLING, CHEATING, SMUGGLING, - AND DRINKING!

This colorful game allows you to criss-cross over the border robbing banks for bags of cash (providing you have the ammo), Drinking Beer (in Texas), Margarita and Tequila (in Mexico). You may turn your Best Friend Over To The Law for a reward, perform a Mexican Hat Dance, start a Mexican Wave, answer questions on Tequila and Mexico, play Strip Poker, have a Gun Fight, perform Crazy Mimes, Tongue Twisters, and Kiss Everyone. - All in the first 15 minutes."

Brief Notes:

Obviously, the beverage of choice to drink in this game can be adjusted to fit the crowd playing. For those easily offended, the "Strip Poker" segment does not need to go overboard, so this can make for a decent party game among almost any crowd of reasonable adults.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Storytelling

name: The Sherlock Holmes Game
description:
Agents of the notorious Professor James Moriarty have stole the crown jewels! Your assignment, Sherlock Holmes, is to find them so they may be returned to the Tower of London. Each player has a dual role, first as Moriarty, hiding the Jewels, then as Holmes, searching for them.

This is "another", and earlier, Sherlock Holmes game made by Cadaco. Players hide a magnet under the game board then switch sides. Each player uses cards and die rolls to move around the board and use a small clear round plastic container holding a metal ball to locate the "hidden gems" that the other player placed under the board.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Top Gear Race the Stig game
description:
Turn on your engine, build up the revs and put the pedal to the metal as you race the Stig round the Top Gear test track.
Use your cash strategically to build the best car possible. Answer trivia questions, test your luck on the chance cards and try to set the fastest possible lap time in this electronic, interactive board game.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Trivia

name: Flip-O-Hoy
description:
Extrapolation from 'Play The Game" by Brian Love.

Flip-O-Hoy is an aerial race game. It consists of a sky rack divided into stages representing an actual flight. Players advance around the board by spinning the propeller spinner. Different spaces on the board cause things to happen -- Engine Trouble, Air Pockets, Loop the Loop, Fog, Spinning Nose Dive, Forced Landing, and Glide Home either help or hinder your flight.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Battle of Kingdom
description:
In this game players will try to win cards by playing cards from their hand which match an open card on the table. After that a pandorra card is taken from the pile and if that also matches the pair you just made they stay on the table and can only be collected by playing the last matching card. This will also get you a bonus card from all other players collected cards.

You score by collecting cards in different groups: Throne, Lords, Knights and Citizins. Each group has a different scoring threshold and lot's of extra scoring options for special combinations.

When you score a certain minimum number of points (depends on the number of players) you can decide to end the round (declare peace) and score the points or keep playing (declare war) which will give you the obligation to score extra points each additional turn untill you stop the game. This process enables you to multiply your score by 2, 4, 8, 16 ... depending on how long you keep improving your score. When you declare war all other players are automatically forming a team which will allow them to exchange cards.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Tågspelet
description: A Swedish game for 2-6 players involving trains and movement to various cities such as Stockholm, Hudiksvall, Gävle, Helsingborg, Norrköping and Ånge.

name: Pierscien Swietej Kingi
description:
Action of game take place in medieval Malopolska - region of Kingdom of Poland. Players are playing roles of knights, settlers, merchants and pilgrims. Their job is to help prince Boleslaw and princess Kinga in rebuilding province after invasion of Tartars.Players can establish towns, salt mines, castles, they are fighting with Tartars, robbers, and taking part in process of canonization of local sacrosant
Game is in Polish.
categories: Fighting, Medieval, Political, Territory Building, Travel
mechanics: Acting, Area Majority / Influence, Role Playing

name: Everest
description:
You are intrepid explorers looking to climb up and down Mount Everest. The first one to do so wins.

The game uses three dice, a pen, and a piece of paper. Each player writes down the numbers from one to twelve, and then from twelve to one. The one to twelve represent climbing up Mount Everest, the twelve to one represent climbing down Mount Everest.
