The game is similar to Martinetti, but in Everest the numbers don't have to be crossed off in sequential order.

On each player's turn they roll the dice once, and using the results either separately or combined, they cross off the numbers representing the ascension of Mount Everest. For example, if a 1, 2, and 4 are rolled, they could cross of 1, 2, and 4, or 3 and 4, or 2 and 5, or 1 and 6, or 7. Once they have crossed off all twelve numbers going up, then they start crossing out the numbers going down.

A (less thematical) variant exists where both columns can be used in combination.

name: Match Game
description: In Match Game, players try to solve 12 questions relating to the placement of a set number of colored matches. The first player to place their matches correctly wins.

name: Down To Hell: The Board Game
description:
Down To Hell is a board game that faithfully reproduces popular hack and slash video games. It offers a wide variety of mechanics well known from other board games. The game can be played in cooperative mode, as well as in solo mode. In this game heroes fight against evil who have invaded their land.

There are four hero classes, each of them are distinguished by specific attacks, spells and other abilities. There are multiple ways to carry out the skills of your hero throughout the game. Specific skillsets can be more suitable for fighting against players or monsters, the choice is yours.

Fighting against a boss is about guessing the boss's next move and planning your next move accordingly. A player with the lowest priority token can see the next boss action card, which is a compensation for being attacked first. Each of the bosses has a unique set of skills, there is a big reward for each of them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Awesome Game of Meme
description:
A game about memes that is most commonly branded under the name The Awesome Game of Meme, and more rarely as The Game of Meme.

Game-play overview: Show a picture card. Everyone else answers with his or her funniest Meme Card. The funniest Meme gets the points. Be the first to win 5 cards!

Contains: 225 Picture Cards, 175 Word Cards, 20 Theme Cards, Instructions.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids
description: This a game based on the TV show Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids by Bill Cosby. The object of the game is to get the gang together by collecting each of their cards.

name: That Little Crack?
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"A crack to Hadell has just opened. Now skeletons and demons are pouring out of it! As the only three true heroes around, it is your job to hold the fort until backup arrives." A One Page Wars series game.

A barbarian, cleric, and archer fight a growing pack of skeletons in a narrow church. Each unit and monster is rated for power, movement, attack range, and hit points.

name: Mágové z Hexanu
description:
Each player takes role of one adept at final exam at Dargor Academy of Magic. The task is to find all six magic schools and become familiar with their teachings. Whoever reaches it first, is invited to the Council of Mages.

However, because the magic realm Hexane literally lives and its parts are constantly moving back and forth, it is not so easy to find a single building. Before the game, all hexagonal pieces of the world are randomly placed into a single hexagonal unit. Each player gets three magic cards and three wizards he controls. Magic card can be played only if the player masters the school of the magic card. At the end if some player disagree with the partial result, all wizards are placed in the middle of the board to compete in the final match.

Every move is accompanied by tension because wizards could end up trapped in a swamp, from where he can get out by throwing sixes. The player can choose any piece that moves with a given direction.

Because it is a small world, there are many encounters between individual wizards. Their rivalry triggers a fight at every meeting. Winner gets one card from the loser who must also return to the starting tile.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fingerpori Pisnespeli
description:
Based on the popular finnish comic Fingerpori by Pertti Jarla.

Collect the largest fortune in this "hardcore" business game.
Bribe the mayor or send your money to a nigerian prince. Do whatever it takes to increase your wealth.

Players rolls a die, moves around the board and follows instructions on board/card.

The player who collects most money wins.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Humor, Party Game

name: Hound
description:
Today is a wonderful day — also a good day for hunting! The hunter Rex is very excited to be out with his dogs, and he is ready for hunting. Wish him good luck!

Hound is played in multiple rounds until one player obtains 10 points and wins. Players can use different dogs for their special abilities and to hunt other animals. Who will be the best hunter? Just try!

name: Royal Comette
description:
Subtitle:

"A Courtly Game of Risk an Speculation"

Themed on the discovery of a comet by Halley in 1682, this is an imitation of a courtly game of the period. In Royal Comette, players place tokens on astronomical sections on the board, lay cards in a sequence, and when your card matches a section, you collect the tokens.

Unlike the title, there is little speculation in the game.

Game Play:

At the start, all players (including the dealer) place a token (a small yellow rod) on each of the eight compartments of the game-board. The dealer then places extra tokens on certain compartments and hands every player and equal number of cards. One extra hand of cards is dealt to the center of the game-board. When all cards are equally divided, the remainder cards are added to the center. The dealer turns the last card over to determine the trump of that round. If the trump is a certain card, the dealer instantly wins all tokens on the board, else, the round is played.

A round of play consist of players playing card out and calling their names (e.g. the Ace of Spades). The next player is the player who has the first next card in that sequence. The round comes to an halt when either the card to be played cannot be played (it was already played before or is in the center 'hand') or when all players have been dealer once or when a previously agreed number of rounds has been played.

Players collect tokens from the board if they have won the round. Winning the round depends on the cards a player has in hand. The player that has the most tokens at when the game ends, is the winner.

name: DON: Conquest of Manhattan
description:
DON - Conquest of Manhattan plays on three elements: Strategy, Diplomacy and Business.

In a world of prostitutes, pickpockets, henchmen, assassins, smugglers and politicians, New York is the hometown of 5 of the most famous mob-families in history.

You start of as a low-level gangster and have to work your way up with a big family, lots of weapons, money, and people, and ultimately you will control the whole town. FBI, CIA, and ICR, in addition to other mob-families will make life difficult for you.

DON is Mediamobster's first game ever, and is basically their boardgame version of "Gangland", which was released for the PC in 2004.
categories: Bluffing, Economic, Mafia, Negotiation, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Donkey and the Carrot
description: A game for 2 to 4 players Ages 4 and up. The object of the game is for each player to make a track from one corner square on the board, joining up with one of the paths leading into the stable and to move his donkey along this path. The player whose donkey enters the stable first being the winner.

name: Tyrants of Rome
description:
This game offers 2-6 players the chance to struggle for supreme authority atop the declining Roman Empire, employing attacks by Legions, barbarians, bribes, assassins, and even the whims of the gods to weaken their opponents or strengthen themselves.

Tyrants of Rome contains a total of 128 cards, in two decks. Build your faction of wily or powerful leaders from five regional nationalities of the empire, as depicted in the Leader deck. A large Action Card deck allows for conflicts and excitement with every new play, with options and hard choices at every turn.

(from the publisher and user's description)

name: Bravo Bravo
description:
Bravo! Bravo! is a party game where we all play together with one voice!
Every time a card is flipped over, everyone has to say or do the same thing according to the revealed card. Hilarity and absurdity is guaranteed! Discover 10 roughly-sketched yet totally endearing characters who will accompany you: the Disco Ball, the Little Person, the Slime, the Banana, and many more! Watch out for the Confetti cards; they’ll test your creativity by making you change the rules as the game goes on.

How do you play?

1: Flip a card. 2: Say it together. 3: Fun guaranteed!

Goal: Be the player with the fewest points at the end of the game!

name: Tuttu Juttu tuntemisleikki
description:
Translates roughly to 'That's familiar' or 'A familiar story'

A party game for couples. In order to win the members of a couple have to know each other better than the other couples know each other. There are 400 question cards included. Can also be played by just one couple as a "solitaire".

name: Police
description:
This is a very simple card game designed for kids.

Each player has a handful of Gangsters that they have to place before a Judge (5 cards), or send to Prison (1 card). Which Judge you send your gangster to depends on a die roll, and if there is already a Gangster there, you instead must take that Gangster back into your hand. A roll of a 6 allows you to send a Gangster to prison, and there is always room there. Or you can break a Gangster out of prison and send them to another player's hand. A round is played until one player disposes of their last gangster, and all other gangsters left in hand are worth negative points. Play to an agreed upon time limit or a specified number of rounds.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Humor
publishers: AG Müller (AGMüller), ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, MIKA

name: Police Academy
description: The red police motorbikes are roaring, the trucks with the obstacles go through the narrow streets of Manhattan. The police wants to catch 12 escaped convicts again. Not the best single player wins, but the best police team.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Global Cooling
description:
from the publisher's website:

Global Cooling is an “energetic” family board game invented by Danes and produced in Denmark.

It’s all about placing as many Global Windmills on as many of the World’s 7 Continents as possible. To get the right to place a Global Windmill on one of the World’s 7 Continents you need to have been able to place a Forrest and a Windmill on your Lot.

You receive a salary each time you pass START including a bonus in case you have made wise environmental disposition! You need money to build up a windmill empire! You can increase your income and your chances of winning the game by investing in sustainable energy solutions such as buying an Electric car, Solar Panels for you House – or by winning in the Casino. If you are lucky you may even receive a contribution from the Global Cooling Foundation.

If you are in need for cash you may pawn your assets at any time. But be aware - it can be risky! The other players might get a chance to buy your pawned assets if they subsequently land on the Pawn square where you have placed your pawned assets.

You occasionally get the opportunity to draw so-called “Global Cards” which describe realistic climate and/or environmental scenarios giving you either an advantage or a disadvantage in the game.

Towards the end of the game there will often be a hectic race against the other players. The winner of the game is the player who first passes START having placed the most Global Windmills on the World Map - subject to all 7 Global Windmill having been placed on all the World’s 7 Continents – alternatively the player who first succeeds in having placed a total of 4 Global Windmills.

name: Don't Make Me Laugh
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

Who wants a new way to have fun with friends and family? Collect your Ha Ha, Ho Ho, Hee Hee cards while challenging your friends and family to laugh at your crazy interpretations of improvisational situations, objects, impressions, jokes, and other zany antics. Thats not all, as Heckle cards have you ask playres to do the craziest things, and Jester cards add unexpected strategy. But be careful, Party Poopers end up wearing the clown nose.

name: Adult Drinking Games Compendium
description:
25 all-time great drinking games. You've probably even heard of some of them: Spooks (ghost), Liar Dice, Fizz Buzz, Name Game, Wink Death, Slap - Clap.

The game box contains the rules for 25 simple drinking games along with some of the necessary equipment for playing them: paper, pencils, dice, cards, corks, etc. The players may need to supply other common items such as pennies, handkerchiefs, bottles, glasses, and beverages.

All these games end up with the loser(s) having to take a drink. Which in turn will make the losing player more likely to keep losing. In the tradition of bar games, the point of all these games is to have silly fun with friends.

The instructions included in the box state
"WARNING These games have been assembled in a spirit of fun - We strongly recommend they are not played with alcoholic beverages. If they are played with alcohol we urge players to exercise moderation in their alcohol consumption. MOST PARTICULARLY DON'T EVER DRINK AND DRIVE!"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Law Courts
description:
A game taken from the British legal system.

A game of excitement, challenge and skill where players have to decide which actions to fight in court and which actions to challenge.

"At the start of the game, players are credited with 15,000 Pounds and are deemed to be employed. Throughout the game players have to decide which actions to fight in court. To proceed to the next circuit, players must win at least one action of their own in court, settle all outstanding actions and challenges, still be employed, and increase their holding to 30,000 Pounds."
"There can be but one winner! The first player to win an action in the House of Lords wins the game."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Paper-and-Pencil, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Team-Based Game
publishers: Brand Makers International, Oliron Games Limited

name: The X Game
description:
A trivia game where players collect colored stones for answering questions correctly. The object of the game is to collect all colors of stones and move to the central square of the board (similar to Trivial Pursuit). The four categories of trivia are: Parapsychology, Science, Theology, and Occult.

Four of the stone colors are collected by answering a question correctly of the appropriate color, you can only have one stone of each color. The fifth stone (black), is special, there is only one of them. It is collected by either moving your pawn to the center of the board, or stealing it from another player (by landing on the same board square as their pawn.)

There is a "special rule" variant that allows players who have collected stones to use them after a six is rolled on the movement die. Each color gives the player some kind of advantage (free movement, card skipping, etc). As well, you get to keep the cards that you have answered correctly (though only one at a time), and use them in much the same way as you use the stones.

From the back of the box.

"Why? This question has plagued humanity since... well... forever. It is what drives people and science to explain the unknown. While others embrace the unknown, some fear it... but that's why this is a GAME.

The X-Game combines current knowledge of our world into a fascinating combination of Science, Paranormal, Theology and the Occult trivia. The X-Game contains 1000 questions on 250 cards, 16 Power Stones, 4 Player Pieces, 4 Power Cards, 1 Black Power Stone, instructions and a fantastic playing board. Anywhere from 2 players can compete for the glory of winning (abducting) the Black Power Stone and the rest of the X-Game..."

name: Astro Boy Saves the Universe Game
description: Each player plays as astro boy and has to be the first to collect the robot gear from each world in order to recharge your astro powers.

name: Scooby-Doo: The Movie Game
description: This game is based on the recent Scooby Doo films. Scooby has been kidnapped, and the players, taking on the rolls of Freddie, Daphne, Velma, and Shaggy, must capture the correct Villain to win. A spinner is used to both tell how many spaces on the board you may move, and how many spaces you may move a villain.

name: Countdown
description:
5 Cards are placed in the middle. Cards with letters on them. Now everyone tries to make a word. But none of these letters is allowed in this word.
Per Round one more card is turned over and it gets more challenging.

name: Marketing
description: Business game where the players compete to sell the most of their products.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Nathan, T:mi Olli Forsgren, Tre ringar

name: DVD Sudoku
description:
This version of Sudoku comes with a DVD. The tiles are double-sided: one side has traditional numbers, the other side has symbols for slightly different experience.

Place the board in the middle of the table. The board shows an empty Sudoku puzzle. In the box there are the numbered tiles.

Start the DVD an choose from the menu which variant you want to play.
In the classic mode, the screen shows the startposition. Or you can choose a variant where only the numbers 1 to 9 are placed once.
When it's your turn, push 'enter' on the remote control, place a tile, and push 'menu'. The other players can comment your placement. If the active player placed a tile on the wrong place, he/she gets penalty time. The turn is moved to the next player.

When a puzzle is solved (or cannot be solved any futher) choose çup' from the menu. All the players can see what their time is. The fastest player wins the game.

The other side of the tiles can be used to play with different colors instead of numbers. There are also chips included. When the timer reaches 30 minutes, it starts over from zero. To remind the players that half a hour is passed they can use the chips.
publishers: Beacon Multimedia S.A., Piatnik, Pressman Toy Corp., Tactic

name: Roy Morgan's Ultimate Survey
description:
A game which aims to educate about the value of collecting social and consumer statistics.
The object is to earn the most votes by guessing opponents' responses to questions posed on the survey cards. When a player reaches the finish all players' vote are tallied, the winner having the most votes.
Players gain votes from betting on opponents' survey answers. When a player lands on a poll space he undertakes a survey, picks up a survey question card, reads it aloud and secretly chooses a response card (1,2 or 3) corresponding to the multiple choice answers provided. The other players each then choose a response card which they think the survey player has chosen and wager on their response being correct. There is no limit to the wager. Players who guess correctly double their wagers. Players who incorrectly guess lose their wager. The survey player receives 10 votes for each player who correctly guesses their answer.
Players also gain and lose votes from the action spaces on the board.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Forino
description:
Something is happening in the cheese! The mice are very hungry and are very keen on tasty cheese. Through the holes at the sides and in the top of the cheese the children try to catch themselves the pieces of cheese that are stuck to the magnets.

But beware - those who get caught by a cat lose a turn!

(For Ages 3+)

name: World Quest
description: Simple to understand, use letter tiles and enjoy word building, be paid for words you make and what you know, travel through 32 countries, buy tour rights, charge tour fees and learn along the way. Fun to play - easy to learn. A winner in the 1987 Toy of the Year Awards.
categories: Economic, Negotiation, Party Game, Travel, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: HeroZero
description:
HeroZero is a fast-paced, action packed card game. To win HeroZero you race to beat your opponent by collecting a complete set of cards.
All that is needed is contained in a single deck.

name: Ingemar Stenmark's Slalom Cup
description:
Be the first to cross the finish line and win 5 world cup points. The winner is the first skier to reach a total of 20 points.

Gameplay is very straight forward:
After your first diceroll, you move accordingly and risk free. Then you have the choice to take another dice roll and stand the risk of falling and be disqualified in that race (if you roll a 6) or make an unfortunate stop in the slope (if you roll a 1). If you roll a 2,3,4 or 5 you move as the dice showed. You can keep rolling and push your luck as long as you want.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Breitschopf Verlag, International Game Development Company

name: LogIQ: Ψ Psi
description:
From the publisher:
Challenge yourself and your friend with this fast-paced IQ duel game. Each product includes tasks divided into different task types, covering everything from number sequences to 3D problems and analogies. Put that grey matter to work and win the tasks by being the fastest one to solve the tricky problems!
Game 3 in a series of 4.

name: Gathering a Garden
description: On its adorable and happy game board, take a trip round to each vendor to gather some flowers, vegetables and more for your bounty of garden delights. Get your flower, herb and tree, vegetable and bird. (They're free!) Your garden is completely done? Get home first, and you have won!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sooty Saves Sixpence
description:
Card game using ideas from a regular card game called Casino. The cards all feature Sooty but they also have amounts of money on each one, ranging from 1 penny to 1 shilling (that is 12 pennies). Four cards are laid face-up in the middle of the table and each player is dealt 4 cards. In your turn you can take a card from the display by using a card with the same value from your hand. Alternatively, you could add a card from your hand, and add it to the amount on the card on the table, with a view to taking it next turn with a card equal to the total on the two cards which you were 'building'. However, before your next turn comes round, another player might be able to take your 'build'.
There are special cards that score more than normal.
The game ends when the pack runs out. Cards you captured are added up, their face value in money. Then any Lucky Pennies score as 1 shilling. Any Lucky Sixpence scores 2 shillings. Any Money Boxes score 4 shillings and twopence. The player with the most in his 'savings' wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Duck Dynasty: Redneck Wisdom
description:
A trivia game about the popular TV series, Duck Dynasty. Answer questions and complete famous quotes to see who knows this show better among your family or friends! Fool other players with your believable answers and spot the genuine quotes from among the decoys to score.

Players race to answer the most questions correctly for the first player/team that makes it once around the board wins!

Contents:
1 Answer Pad
1 Die
1 Game Board
4 Movers and 4 Mover Bases
130 Quote Cards
70 Trivia Cards
10 Rules Cards
Game Instructions
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

description:
This game consist of ten different game variants to learn numbers and some basic math. The main components are foam numbers from 0 to 9. There are two pieces of every number and plus, minus and equality signs. Basic idea is to recognize numbers by feeling them in your hand. To prevent you from seeing the numbers, you construct bigger box from the game box and two cardboard walls. Those walls have an hole to put your hand into the box. Hole is covered with cloth.

Basic idea of the games is to find the wanted number(s) from the box. Some examples: 1. You have to pick up numbers in ascending order. 2. You throw 12 sided die and you have to find two numbers that add up to the result. 3. You pick up a tile with a two digit number and find corresponding numbers. And so on. In most advanced games you have to add or subtract numbers or you have to recognize number sequence.

name: Emojinary
description:
''Emojinary where pictures speak louder than words!
Everyone knows emojis - but how quickly can you work out what they are trying to say?

In this exciting board game of pictures (and a few words!), your skills are tested with four fun party activities - guessing, spotting, drawing and acting!

A picture-perfect combination where using your emojination will be sure to put a smiley on your face.

Players/teams win by being the first to reach the top of their scoring ladder; each time a an activity is completed successfully, they are award a point and take one step up the ladder!

name: Hooch Stooges
description:
Welcome to Megacityopolis... the most hooch infested city during the roaring dandies. Become a boss and recruit your goons, then conquer your rival bosses and control Megacityopolis. Hooch Stooges' innovative mechanic asks you to risk your contraband before using it; allowing greater reward for the risk of being busted by the police.
—description from the back of the box

Hooch Stooges is a combination of Area Control and Deck-building. Turf cards are randomly distributed to make the playing area and each player begins play in their HQ. Cards are added to your deck by gaining Hooch and then used to attack and take over turf. Players are eliminated if their HQ turf is taken over by another player. The last player left on the board is the winner.
—user summmary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Wild Assent: Lavon Rising
description:
Wild Assent is a 1-4 player miniatures board game with solo, player-versus-player and cooperative modes. Battle your opponents in the gladiatorial arenas of the Silvestrem in Wild Assent’s skirmish mode. Hunt the dangerous creatures of the Wilds, by yourself or with friends, fighting not just for survival, but to keep your expedition running. Regardless of the mode you choose, Wild Assent offers strategic and varied combat, ensuring no two battles are the same.

Wild Assent: Lavon Rising is a reprint campaign for Wild Assent, the questionably named and overly- ambitious board game from Lazy Squire Games. We’ve learned a lot since we first started making the game, in terms of design as well as manufacturing and fulfillment. We’re taking that hard-earned knowledge and putting it back into Wild Assent, to make a great game even better.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Vektek Security Kit Escape Game
description:
Somewhere in the not too distant future, Chris Ramsay sent a distress beacon from the Hadrian Base Station. This is where YOU come in! Can you help Chris track down and eliminate the A.C.E clones?
This is a stand-alone escape game that comes complete with the following:

Mobile/Desktop Digital Experience
Vektek Security Booklet
Game Cards
1 Deck of USPCC playing cards


This is an escape room game produced by youtuber, magician, and puzzler Chris Ramsay.

name: Penguin Rescuer Game
description:
From the rulebook intro:

"On the South Pole, families of penguins live happily until the temperature increases from effect of global warming, resulting from activities of people in the cities which releases Carbon Dioxide (CO2). Icebergs begin to melt, leaving penguins with no place to stay out of water. A cooperativve game of helping one another to bring the penguins to the safe land. A perfect game to learn about global warming."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: Ap-bingo
description: Ap-Bingo is a bingo game with ape theme. The game plays as most bingo games, but also having some twists. Each player has a bingo card, and the chips is mixed in the box. The chips can have picture of four different kind: ape, banana, gorilla poo, and a shovel. The goal is to get five apes in a row or column. The columns have different colors that must match (red, yellow, blue, green, purple), the rows most have one colour of each kind. The game plays around the table, each player drawing a chip from the box. When a ape is drawn it is placed on the bingo card. If you get a Banana you can take a ape from another players bingo card. Gorilla poo is placed on another players bingo card to block. The only way to get rid of the poo is to draw a shovel.

name: Galaxy of Trian: New Order
description: Galaxy of Trian is a dynamic tile-based game in which players act as commanders of alien races. They vie for control over nebulas and planetary systems, which they level up to gain an advantage over other players. What is at stake is taking possession of the powerful technology left behind by the unequaled race of the Trian. Over the course of the game, players use beautifully illustrated, double-sided tiles to create outer space and fill it with nebulas, planetary systems, and gas clouds. Using their emissaries and ships, they explore and take control of these parts of the galaxy which have hitherto remained undiscovered. With a ﬂeet of vessels at their disposal, they fight for dominance over areas filled with rich mineral deposits. Players can choose from 8 diﬀerent alien superpowers, each characterized by a unique constellation of features and skills. Close your ranks and enter the race for the hegemony over the Galaxy of Trian. What is at stake is taking possession of the powerful technology left behind by the ancient yet unequaled race of the Trian, and conquering the entire Galaxy!
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Miniature Table Football
description:
Seven-a-side miniature version of the bar-football games you see in pubs or clubs.

Each player stands at halfway, on opposite sides of the board. Once the ball is in play, both try to swivel their players (using levered handles on their side), to kick the ball into their opponent's goal. This game tends to get more frantic as the game progresses.

name: Rallye Paris Dakar
description:
Each player directs a buggy along each of the 6 boards representing different parts of the Paris-Dakar races.

Each player rolls the dice and advances his buggy of the same number of steps and then applies the effects of the case on which he lands: generally "pick a trouble card", "pick a fixing mechanic card", "advance 3 steps" or throw the "wheel of fortune". Sometimes 2 different courses are possible, one which is shorter but riskier.

To reach the finish line, players must land exactly on the last case.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zombie High School Card Game
description:
The zombies are coming! Zombies are invading Zombie High (go figure) and it's up to you to save your fellow classmates. Run, fight and outsmart the zombies while trying to save the others. Take too many wounds and you'll become a zombie - then it's feasting time on your fellow students as you try to eat their brains.

A Frantic Game of Survival in a school invaded by zombies!

GAMEPLAY:
The three decks (30 zombie, 30 victim, and 60 action cards) are shuffled and each player is given a random victim. A roll of a d6 determines where the zombies come from.
Then the torture(fun) begins.
A victim draws one card and then takes an action of fighting zombies, fleeing from zombies, or cause another to follow.

But if your victim takes too many wound cards, your player turns into a zombie then must attack other victims or heal.

If everyone becomes a zombie or the zombie and victim decks are dealt out the game ends.

Components: 30 victim and zombie cards, 18 wound cards, 60 action cards, 2 six-sided dice and rules

name: Druthers
description:
Druthers is an LDS game for two or more players. Players share their opinions using phrases such as, "If I had my druthers..."

From the publisher: Everyone likes to be asked their opinion, but how often does a seven-year-old (or even her dad) get to tell what she thinks? In this easy-to-play game, her choice can become the right answer! Simple, everyday questions have four given answers and a fifth "fill in your own" answer. Questions are geared to people in four categories: family, young child, teenage, or general. Players get points for correctly predicting "others' druthers." Some questions bring hilarious responses; others might be insightful or thought-provoking. You'll discover things you have in common with all LDS families and what may be unique to your own household.

name: Knights Kingdom Save the Kingdom Game
description:
From the box back:
In the Kingdom of Mercia, Knights compete in Tournaments and follow a strict Code of Honor. When a Dark Knight takes control of the realm, a band of brave, honorable Knights take on a dangerous mission to defeat him. Their quest leads to the Citadel of Orlan. The Knights must overcome four challenges to attain the Heart of the Shield of Ages. Only then will they have the power to face the Dark Knight in a climactic tournament to save the kingdom.

Contents:

25 Knight's collectible gaming cards
29 Lego pieces
32 Code tokens
Gameboard
Arena Tournament Disc
4 Support stands
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Medieval, Memory

name: Killbots Inc.
description:
Description from the publisher:

What are robots for if not competitive combat? Take the role of a master builder and square off against fellow scientists and engineers in a battle of robo-supremacy in KILLBOTS!

There's a small catch though...

Each robot has a positive and negative action. Every time a robot attacks it could deal damage, heal a fellow robot, or even steal another player's cards. But maybe something will go wrong and your robot will attack you, or switch sides, or simply explode. Robots are unpredictable - they're more of an art than a science, really. This element of chance keeps the action dynamic and unpredictable, as well as leveling the playing field a bit for new players. Players able to better manage their robots in play and anticipate these events will ultimately come out on top!

Killbots is a competitive tabletop card game for 2 to 6 players where each player builds and controls an army of imperfect killer robots. The functions of each robot are determined by a custom 8-sided die - effectively making all moves calculated (or uncalculated) risks and keeping gameplay fresh.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Take That

description:
This game is played on an empty 9x9 square board with 81 stones of just one color.

Turns - At each turn, each player drop a stone at an empty cell.

* For every 3 stones in any line (orthogonal or diagonal) the player gets 1 point;
* For every 6 stones in any line (orthogonal or diagonal) the player gets 2 points;
* For every 9 stones in any line (orthogonal or diagonal) the player gets 3 points;

When the board is full, the game ends. The player with the higher score wins.

name: Presidentti-peli
description: A Finnish game on presidential election. Players roll-and-move on a monopoly-like board, get professions and other sources of income, pay money for different reasons, and can become members of the parliament. The ultimate goal is to be elected the president, which happens through landing in the presidential election square, sponsoring a campaign, and then getting enough votes in a random draw of vote cards.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bastogne: The Desperate Defense, December 1944
description:
(from the back of the box:)

A remake of one of the classic SPI folio quad-games.
Graphics updated to FGA standards.
Step-reduction introduced.
Brand new overrun rules with possible adverse effects to the overrunning player.

All new 1d10 Combat results Table.
But still retains the classic 'Quad-Game' flavor originated by SPI.
This simple game system results in a dynamic, fun-to-play game that captures the essence of WWII warfare, where the right gamble at the right moment can change history.

3 Scenarios with 1/2 day turns
17" x 22" full color paper map
100 back-printed die-cut counters
(plus 20 counters for fixes to Eagle and the Sun)

name: Angry Town: The Fighting Card Game
description:
Angry Town is a 2 player fighting card game loosely based on the mechanics of fighting games. In Angry Town players will choose from 8 different Fighters all with their own unique abilities that gives them an edge over their opponent. Players will be able to chain together amazing combos, build a Meter and BLAST their opponent away all in the hopes to become the new Mayor of Angry Town.

It is Election Season in Angry Town, but instead of the boring stuff like voting, debates and fundraisers, the candidates enter the Mayoral Tournament and FIGHT for the chance to challenge the current Mayor, who has been Mayor for over fifty years. The winner becomes the new Mayor and has absolute power.

Players will choose one of the 8 Fighters: a Ninja Howler Monkey, a Failed Martial Artist Bum, a Quack Doctor, an Angry Nerd, a Demented Girl Scout, the Don of the Baby Mafia, a Luchador Rabbi, and an Irish Catholic Nun who knows over 87 ruler based attacks. Each Fighter's play style is simple to learn but challenging to master, but once mastered you will be one step closer to achieving ultimate power!

There are 2 Modes of Play: "Classic Mode" (2 Player head-to-head), and "Tag Team Mode" (2 Player head-to-head with 2 or 3 Fighters each).

Are you ready to fight? In that case, Welcome to Angry Town, where everyone is happy, happy to kick your ass and stomp you into the ground!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Print & Play

name: Defense of the Citadel
description:
Description from the publisher:

Defense of the Citadel is a cooperative hero defense board game. Set in a high fantasy world, enemy forces are marching towards your Citadel in great numbers and only a handful of heroes remain to prevent them from achieving their goal.

Mission & Campaign mode

Players can choose to play set missions for a quick game with predefined objectives and events, or a more traditional defense game in campaign where the map and events are all randomized, and the status of the game carries over to the next round until you reach the final objective.

Crafting & Preparation

Players must make preparation before the inevitable battle to even out the odds. A large variety of options are available to players from crafting items, traps, infrastructure, scouting, rest or even restructuring the Citadel!

The Invasion

During the invasion, players can perform special combat skills through the usage of class skill cards. Players can mix and match different classes skills to create a unique battle strategy of their own. The course of the invasion is randomized through the invasion card deck, with many different events.

Cooperation

The enemy units are controlled by the rules of the game, there are no game masters. The game is a fully cooperative game with many game elements to promote working together, such as with crafting, battles, event choices or helping other player characters who were taken out of action to continue fighting.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Isäntä vs. Emäntä
description: A men vs. women game similar to Battle of the Sexes. The board has a figure-eight looped track with a side for men and a side for women. A die is rolled, and a pawn moves along the track. Rather than certain types of cards printed on spaces, there are two spinners to show what to do for that round. There is a start space on one end, a "stop" space in the middle where the tracks meet, and a finish spot at the other end of the board.

name: Pig Tails
description:
Pig Tails, collect the most pigs to wine..but watch out for the Big Bad Wolf!

Players roll 3 dice to collect the pig cards.
The color pig you roll determines which color pig card you can take.
If you roll a Big Bad Wolf you cannot claim any pigs! Instead, you must put back pigs you already collected!

The first player to collect 4 pig cards of each color wins!

User summary:

Dice rolling game for the very young. The active player rolls three dice. One shows a pig head in one of three colors. One shows 1-3 pig tails and the third one shows nothing or a wolf.
The player may take as many pig tokens in the color rolled as the number of tails determines, unless he/she also rolls a wolf. In that case, he/she has to return that number of tokens to the "bank". The first player to gather four tokens of each color is the winner.

name: Stick the IRS
description: Sticking the IRS does not require pins or needles or knowledge of the Internal Revenue Code. It requires tax players who are willing to take a chance with a "Tax Shelter" that may give financial security or may backfire. After four tours around the Board, the Tax player who has the most after-tax cash wins the game and has successfully been able to STICK THE IRS. The players move around the colorful board, landing on opportunities to earn income, spend money on non-deductible expenses and to purchase a variety of tax shelters. In addition, the players have a chance to receive "annual reports" that determine whether the tax shelter investment made them rich or, as in most "real life" shelters, turn out to be a bust. Finally, an exposure to the horrors and humor of audit lurks with every roll of the dice. Drilling for oil in Hawaii, establishing a baseball team in Alaska, reviving an old motion picture, and building ski condominiums in Texas are just a few of the fun and exciting tax shelter opportunities that the player is offered in STICK THE IRS. Although humorous and in good taste, the game also offers certain educational benefits in highlighting the good and the bad in the use of shelters to reduce taxes. The player who manages to best use his income, his CPA and his shelters, and therefore who manages to pay the least tax, is the winner, having successfully been able to STICK THE IRS.

name: Stack 21
description: Stack 21 is a clever twist on Blackjack. It is played with a deck which is basically two standard decks of cards with some interesting variations on suits and the four Jokers thrown in. To start, each player is dealt four cards which form the basis for four stacks. The goal is to have each stack sum to 21 points. Any stack which sums to greater than 21 points is immediately tossed out. Any stack that sums to less is still in play. Only stacks that sum to 21 score. When all stacks have either scored or blown, the round is over.

name: Sea-Fleet
description:
Players move their playing pieces on an 11 by 11 grid gameboard. Several of the grid squares are specially marked and under certain circumstances allow a player to take and extra (bonus) move of the piece being moved.

Each player starts the game with 3 Battleships, 5 Destroyers, and 3 Submarines. Each type of pieces move in unique (different) ways.

Game Plays 2 Ways:
1) Low-Skill - Uses luck of rolled die to determines the number of
squares a player may move any one of his/her pieces.
2) High-Skill - No luck (of die), all skill. In this case, the number of
square moves allotted to the playing pieces is fixed, as
determined by the game rules.

The object of game is to be the first player to eliminate any 8 of your opponent's 11 playing pieces. You eliminate your opponent's pieces by moving one of your pieces to or through a square occupied by your opponent's piece.

Latest Game Review:
(Nov. 2006) By Ron McClung of "The Gaming Report". (www.gamingreport.com)
Game Rated: ***** or (10/10)
Reviewers Summary Comments:
* "I liked this game for its originality, complexity in strategy,
and overall intelligence of the game."
* To check the reviewers entire review of this game,
log onto "The Gaming Reports" web site (www.gamingreport.com)
and click on "Game Reviews" in left column of home page.

Note: Game is available via BoardGameGeek Marketplace.

name: The Three Stooges Trivia Game
description: Standard fan trivia game about the Three Stooges. Players roll and move across the board, answering three types of questions: True/False, Multiple Choice, and Specific Answer. Players cannot move until they answer correctly; if three or more questions are missed, the player may declare themselves stuck, roll the die, and move backwards, in hopes of getting a different type of question. Questions range from the biographical ("When Moe Howard skipped school, where did he spend his free time?") to show-specific ("Which short features the phrase, 'Slowly I turn, step by step, inch by inch'?") Nostalgia will get you across the board, but only true fans will sweep the board.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Navigation
description: Navigation is a race game, for 2 players, using tiles to successfully complete a "missile" attack on an enemy base. Using tiles with lines on them, one must create a connected path form start to finish. First player to the finish line wins.
mechanics: Connections, Network and Route Building, Race, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Driveway Deals
description: Driving Deals is a board game about shopping at garage sales. You're on a mission to collect five random items-- but you don't know what they are. Travel around the board finding the best bargains you can, avoiding pitfalls like parking tickets and unpaved roads, and then get back home to find out if you've picked up what you need.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: EuroHit
description:
From the back of the box:

Eurohit is an enjoyable and challenging card game for 3-6 players aged 10 years and upwards. The rules are easy to understand and allow play to be friendly or cunningly crafty, depending on your style of play and the group of players.

The object of the game is to score 500 points (or over) by visiting as many European Cities as possible whilst keeping one step ahead of the Hit Man. However, as the Hit Man, you can score points off the other players.

You will soon master the rules, and some, but not maybe all, of the possible stategies, but if you do, there are optional rules to alter the play to make it an easier or harder, shorter or longer game."

The game has a homebrew quality about it (comparable to Cheapass Games products, but in a nice carton). Noteable for being acquired by The Avalon Hill Game Co and being reissued as the much maligned Assassin, featuring better components but adds some rather odd tweaks and revisions to the rules.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Spies/Secret Agents, Transportation, Travel

name: Road Runner Game
description: Sylvester the cat and Wile E. Coyote are always trying to catch Tweety and the Road Runner. It is a race they all seem to enjoy and that's what happens in this game. The speedy Road Runner runs around the Black Road surrounding Lookout Mountain. The players, taking the part of the villains Sylvester and Wile E. Coyote, travel the Dirt Roads trying to TAG the Road Runner at the spots where the roads connect. When a player succeeds in Tagging the Road Runner, as a reward he collects a Character Card. Each card shows a picture of a character. The first player who succeeds in collecting each of the four characters is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Der Stern von Bethlehem
description: A cooperative children's game intended to teach children of the Christmas story. Also available as an Advent calendar, with one of the 24 pieces in each compartment.

name: America's Funniest Home Videos Game
description: In the boardgame version of the popular TV show, 3-6 players move around the board trying to be the first to $100,000. The game includes 250 clips from the show on a VHS tape, and players must remember parts of the clips in order to advance.

name: Number Race
description:
Learn to add & subtract as you play! Roll the die & move your piece to that card where a calculation waits to be solved. The first level covers numbers 1-20 & the second covers 1-100. Self-correcting: answers on the backs of cards. Be the first to reach the goal & win.

For ages 6 and up.

Apparently a different game from the same-German-titled Erstes Rechnen.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Bookmark Verlag, Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburger

name: Roup
description:
The goal of ROUP is to split up the former Communist monopoly and sell properties to Private Ownership.

Each player rotates turns as the "Auctioneer" and after that as the "KGB."

Basic Steps:
Step 1) Auctioneer rolls Red and White Dice.
Step 2) Auctioneer's Plane flies directly to property.
Step 3) KGB moves in any direction along street squares according to Red Die # rolled by Auctioneer attempting to
a) steal commission of property sold,
b) steal the rent from property already owned, or
c) move to a Black Market square for choice of Black Market Card or 2 million Rubles from bank.
Step 4) Property is sold at auction. Card serves as deed.
Step 5) Auctioneer collects Commission from Old Commie Bank (or pays rent to a property owner if property is already owned).

The game ends when:
A) a player or team wins by owning any three TRIPLE RENT COLOR FAMILY SETS or
B) the "Old Commie Bank" goes broke. In this case the richest player (Ultimate Capitalist) is the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Word Play
description: Move around all five levels of the pyramid to the summit by identifying the word to a definition. Don't worry, you get a letter clue! Includes six 4 sided pyramid shaped die, one regular dice, 2 boxes of definitions divided by TAB DIVIDERS, playing board in gold, tan and black, and instructions printed on heavy parchment like paper. It has a neat Egyptian-theme to the entire board and pieces.

name: Spycatcher
description:
From the game box

"The of the game in Spycatcher is to get YOUR book published!

To do this you must have 'permission' from the 'government', the 'courts' serialization with the newspaper and finally the publishers willingness to print.

To achieve this, you must travel around the board visiting the appropriate circles and collecting one of each of the permission cards found within.

The first player to do this and return to the center of the board is the winner."

name: Hit List
description:
"It's taken four years to develop an idea into Hit List - the most exciting new game in Australia in years!" the advertising blurb claims.

It contains 112 cards, lots of money and a few playing mats. The mats are only as a guide for learning, showing you how to build sets.

The theme is "elimination". You have to build contracts from sets of compatible cards. At the very least, a Victim and Means card are required to open a contract. The contract can then grow by playing in order: Scene and Hit cards of the same suit as the Means card (which there are seven suits - Strangulation, Poisoning, Drowning, Torture, Shooting, Starving and Hit & Run). Thereafter, you can optionally play a Disposal, then an Alibi card on the sequence Means, Scene, & Hit that you've built up. You can play a motive card on top (at any time on an open contract) - which must be of the same suit as the victim (there are eight suits - Royalty, Union Leader, Movie Star, Pet, Politician, Business Person, Religious Leader and "Choose your own victim").

The aim is to earn the most money, and money is earned by closing contracts. To score, a contract must contain a Victim, Means, Scene and Hit card.

name: L'isola dei Famosi
description: Game based on the popular realty Show "L'isola dei famosi", which is a VIP Survivor. Play cards and nominate others and wait for the peoples choice!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Fyrtøjet
description: This game is built on Hans Christian Andersen's children tale the tinder box. Each player is the soldier from the story and tries to win the princess and half of the kingdom by answering questions and roleplaying.

name: Chauvinist Pig
description: Object of the game is to collect 6 cards which, put together, form a picture of a pig. then, to complete the course and undertake the final test at Chauvinist Pig's tail ...

name: Barbie: We Girls Can Do Anything
description:
From back of box:

What would you like to be when you grow up? A glamorous actress, a graceful ballerina, an out-of-this world pilot? Choose a career, then follow the path that leads to success. As you work your way toward your goal you may experience occasional setbacks, but don't be discouraged. the first player to fulfill her dream of an exciting career wins the game.

Basically, a simple spin-and-move game that has players collecting chits and working their way, ring by ring, towards the center of the board.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Golden, Mattel, Inc., The Canadian Group

name: Just Add Ice Hockey Card Game
description:
The BEST Hockey Action Card Game You'll Ever Play! Its a race to assemble your team first. Recruiting and player trades allowed. Watch out for cross-checking and other penalties.

Watch out for flying pucks and overwhelming FAMILY FUN!

name: Impertinent Questions!
description:
Impertinent Questions is a party game of ridiculous questions and hilarious answers. It can be played by any number of players.

From the game rules:-

It is played with a Pack of 64 Cards, 32 of these cards have two questions printed on each of them and the other 32 have two answers printed on each of them, these two packs must not be mixed. Players sit in two equal rows opposite each other. The Hostess, or person in charge then shuffles each pack separately and proceeds to deal one card from the Question Pack to each player on one side and one card from the Answer pack to each player on the opposite side. FACE DOWNWARDS. The first player on the side to whom the questions have been dealt them turns up his card and asks the player opposite the Question which is printed on the TOP of the card, the player asked then turns up his card and makes the reply printed at the TOP of his card.

Thus question:- "Have you any holes in your stockings?"

Answer:- "Yes but only on Saturday night."

Or again Q :- "Do you ever get drunk?"

A :- "Yes when I am far from home."

name: Monopoly: Feyenoord
description: The Monopoly edition of Dutch soccerclub Feyenoord; published in 2002 after winning the UEFA cup. Streets are now players: Theo van Duyvenbode - Ben Wijnstekers - John de Wolf - John Metgod - Rinus Israel - Joop Hiele - Jerzie Dudek - Eddy Pieters Graafland - Ruud Gullit - Jozsef Kiprich - Kees van Wonderen - Ulrich van Gobbel - Patric Paauwe - Shini Ono - Jean-Paul van Gastel - Paul Bosveld - Wim Jansen - Coen Molijn - Willem van Hanegem - Hendrik Larsson - Pierre van Hooijonk. The pawns: ball, goal, cup, shoe, whistle, cap, hamburger, milkshake.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Reading Riddle Maze Game
description: Kids improve their reading and listening comprehension skills without even realizing it! Players read a riddle, then move across game board maze to collect the tile with the riddle's answer. Maze pieces, which can be rearranged, allow for multiple ways to reach the answer tiles. The first player to collect three riddle cards wins. Double-sided tiles provides two levels of play. For 2-4 players. Includes game board, 81 tile cards, 80 riddle cards and instructions.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Maze, Word Game

name: Definition: Cronicas Marcianas
description:
"Definition" is a commercial version of the traditional family game of "Dictionary". Here, the players start with their rockets in Earth and have to reach Mars by earning votes for their definitions of weird words and points for guessing what the true definition of those words is.

In each turn a referee player, who changes after the end of the turn, draws a card in which different eccentric words are specified. The rest of the players write down a definition for the word secretly on a piece of paper. Then, the referee reads aloud all definitions and players have to vote which one they think is true (they cannot vote their own definition). According to the number of votes received for their definition or if they where able to find the true definition, the players can move their rockets towards Mars. Also, the dice can determine if the players ought to write a funnier definition instead of trying to find the true one, or if instead of a word it's a famous star that they have to define, or if the definition is given to them instead of the word and they have to find this last one.
The first player in Mars wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shingen's Last Fight
description:
This game is a redesign version of 信玄上洛 (Shingen Joraku) (1986) with rerated leaders.

This game was published in Command Magazine Japan #36 in 2001.

name: Met. Office weather game
description: Designed with advice from the Met. Office, this game introduces people to the weather concepts of temperature, pressure and wind. Each player is given a card with an activity related to a certain weather condition. The player wins by being the first to travel round the UK, while attempting to collect the correct weather conditions.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crack Whore
description:
From the RPGNow listing:

Crack Whore is a solitaire adventure dice game where you play the character of a prostitute who is trying to escape the street life. Of course, to accomplish this you need to save up some considerable money; and that means working the streets. Will your pimp, drugs, diseases, and guys that like to hack apart street walkers stand in your way to achieving a better life?

Multi player option allows for more than one person to play at a time, competing to see who is the first to escape the streets and win the game. Can you escape the desperate life of the streets before they put you six feet under?

-- 7 Pages. Includes game rules and character sheets.

You will also need a D6 to play this game.

name: Doctor Who and the Dalek Spinomatic game
description:
Join the Doctor, K-9, Martha and Captain Jack in this boardgame as they race through time and space trying to be the first team to get safely to the finish zone. But beware; a lone Dalek is trying to EXTERMINATE you. This is one of the first products to feature the new assistant, Martha Jones.

Contains: 1 instruction sheet, 1 spinomatic unit, 12 playing pieces, 1 molded Dalek, and 1 gameboard.

name: Strangers and Dangers
description: A game designed by law enforcement officials to teach kids about the dangers of talking to strangers, Ages 4 and up.

name: Dinosaur Quiz
description: An educational card game based around asking each other questions on a variety of dinosaurs (as well as other prehistoric animals). There are a total of 288 questions on 36 different prehistoric creatures. Box contains 36 cards. Simple game that is easy to pick up.

name: Jungle Super Ball
description: There are four animals; a lion, an elephant, a hippo and a giraffe; and in between the four there is a round field. The animals are trying to defend their own goals as the balls are swinging around the field. If you're able to defend your goal for a round you get a banana. The first player to collect four bananas is the winner. You can add a monkey referee to the game to make it more complex.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Cinéma
description:
250 extra cards to be used with any Trivial Pursuit basic game.
The new cards feature 1500 questions on cinema -- mostly French pictures, but also international features.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Schlachtefest
description: A children's game consisting of cardboard jigsaw pieces, which put together result in multi-coloured pigs. By rolling two dice on every turn, the players try to get the most completed pigs.

name: Lost at the Zoo
description: Help! The animals are loose at the zoo. As a Zoo Keeper, it is your job to gather your animals and get them back to their habitats. Be the first to get them back and become the head Zoo Keeper.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Suomi Tietopeli Junior
description: This popular trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with fun questions that every child should know about the their country – films, books, sport, fun places to visit and much more. Answer a question correctly from each category as you move around the board and try to collect tokens. The first player to collect 6 tokens wins.

name: Monopoly: Troyes
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Troyes, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ciclos
description:
From the Publisher:

Evolua também!
Estratégia e planejamento são fundamentais para vencer esses emocionante jogo.
Use de estratégia para escolher o melhor momento para evoluir e mudar de CICLO.
1º CICLO:
Ganhe heranças dos terrenos e adquira conhecimento para se formar e escolher uma profissão.
2º CICLO:
Compre terrenos, invista em negócios, acumule dinheiro e patrimônio e se prepare para avançar para o ciclo final.
3º CICLO:
Avance e supere os desafios da VIDA e chegue ao final do ciclo com mais dinheiro e patrimônio e seja o grande vencedor.

Nós da PLAY, temos imensa satisfação de lhe apresentar o mais novo
lançamento de Jogos de Tabuleiro do mercado.

CICLOS é a Evolução dos Jogos Imobiliários e após anos sem
nenhum lançamento original de um Jogo de Tabuleiro, o CICLOS vem para revolucionar e revigorar esse importante nicho de mercado.

Nosso site:
www.playjogosebrinquedos.com.br
www.jogociclos.com.br

Com qualidade impecável, CICLOS não deixa a desejar ao ser comparado aos demais jogos de tabuleiro do mercado.


Roughly can be described as a monopoly-like game divided in 3 cycles (ciclos in Portuguese). On the first you struggle for inheritance and knowledge, struggling to find an career. On the second, you seek to buy land, invest in business, aiming to get money. On the final cycle you aim to overcome the challenges of life and become the richest player.

Translation of the publisher description:

"Evolve!
Strategy and Planning are essential to win this thrilling game.
Choose strategically the best moment to evolve and change to a new CYCLE (cycle = ciclo in portuguese)

1st CYCLE:
Win inheritance of the lands and acquire knowledge to graduate and choose a profession.
2nd CYCLE:
Buy land, invest in business, earn money and wealth and get ready to advance to the final CYCLE
3rd CYCLE:
Advance and overcome the challenges of LIFE and get to the end whit more money and wealth to be the great winner.

(...)

Our site:
www.playjogosebrinquedos.com.br
www.jogociclos.com.br

With flawless quality CICLOS doesn't fall back when compared with the other boardgames currently in market.

(From the translator: please note that this game is being released in Brazil, where the boardgame market consists mainly of "War", a simplified version of "Risk", "Monopoly", "Clue" and "The Game of LIFE". Only recently a few new titles have been released, but, still, the closest we have to modern games were "Hart an der Grenze" (which has been banished from market), "Sultan" (both from Brazilian authors), "Go Bluffing", and a "Diamond" clone, as far as I recall)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Love Affairs
description: This game is for one to four couples. The couples roll dice and have to perform tasks to move forward. There are different kinds of tasks: Harmony cards (guess the partner's answer), confession cards (honesty is rewarding here), trivia cards (about sexuality), charade cards (draw strange things and let the partner guess what they are). The goal is to reach a bed at the end of the track.

name: Boxxy
description: Boxxy is a bit like Boggle, but for starters it's much more compact. The letter dice and sand timer are all enclosed in a plastic box. Shake the box, set it down, and then find as many words as you can. The time limit is strict, you have only sixty seconds. Furthermore, only words that contain at least 3 letters as shown on the letter dice count!

name: Wer's weiß gewinnt!
description:
Trivia game. Players take turns being the quizmaster and picks up the top card from the deck. First person to answer the question correctly gets to keep the card, if they miss the quizmaster keeps the card.

Each question has 3 answers to choose from.

Sample questions:

What is measured by a barometer?
air pressure
heat
the humidity

When iron rusts its weight becomes... ?
heavier
lighter
remains the same

Includes 110 double sided cards and instructions

name: New Moon: The Movie Card Game
description:
New Moon: The Movie Card game seems to be a 'simplified' version of The Board Game.

Players take turns drawing cards, which may result in an activity or trivia question. These activities may be dice battles, secret balloting, or about your friends.

Collect cards by being right. First player to collect eight cards is the winner.

Comes in a tin box.

name: Steinzeit
description: A card game in which players hunt for dinosaurs and mammoths to feed their Neanderthal crew. They catch animals and later turn them into steaks, or they rob them off other players by using fighting cards. Special action cards allow other actions, e.g. releasing another player's animal into the wild or taking an animal without a fight. The first player to collect 10 steaks (plastic chips) wins the game.

name: Rallye Boom
description:
At the beginning of the game you decide how many laps you will race. Expect hazards along the track and be wary of other players!

Objective of this game is to be the first player to complete the predetermined number of laps.

Contents:

6 car token,
1 game board,
2 fuel chips,
1 repair chip,
6 car supports,
1 dice,
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Formen-Kobold
description:
Simple educational game about shapes of items. The components are items created from two jigsaw puzzle pieces each, plus some tiles which show the entire shape of an item and a kobold figure. There are various game ideas included.
The youngest children just assemble the items. The second stage of the game includes finding a shape that matches one of the items, then places the kobold on another shape which the next player has to identify.
In the most advanced game, some items are laid out on the table and the tiles are placed into groups. Now a shape tile is flipped open and the players check whether it matches any of the items currently open. If yes, the item is placed on the tile and a new item is added. If not, the kobold moves on. If the players manage to put all the items on the tiles before the kobold is back in its original position, all players win.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Basil der grosse Mäusedetektiv
description: The detectives win the game when they find out the secret code of a raid array before the first gangster reached this field. The crooks win when he reached the last box with the jewels. A gangster on the train rolls and moves accordingly, he moved to a secret map and places it among the questions on the next raid box. The detectives dice and move or ask a question with a card from the next raid.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Glee
description:
This edition is nearly the same as UNO, except with cards having artwork showing characters from Glee.

Cards that are different from traditional UNO:

Sabotage card -- allows you to select an opponent whose hand you wish to view, then allows you to swap a card you don't want with one you desire from the hand of the opponent you selected
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Confusing Sun
description:
In Confusing Sun, players compete to spot particular combinations of flames and UFOs near the sun before anyone else can.

The basic side of the game board has spaces numbered 1-10, and at the start of the game you place one card next to each space; cards show 1-3 flames, 1-3 UFOs, and some number of planets (including zero). On a turn, the active player rolls the black die and red die, then places the flame/UFO indicator card so that red is associated with flames and black with UFOs (or vice versa). This indicator card shows how many flames and how many UFOs players need to spot – for example, 1 flame and 3 UFOs.

For all cards that show precisely this combination of icons, the player sums the numbers (1-10) next to these cards and yells out a total. The first player to do so claims these cards, which are worth one point each if they don't have planets. (If a card has planets, it's worth that many points.) One side on each die shows a star; when a star is next to an icon, that icon is ignored. If stars are next to both icons, you total the numbers next to cards that bear planets.

After replacing any cards claimed, the next player rolls the dice. The game continues until someone has twenty points; this player wins! For a more challenging game, use the reverse side of the game board, which has spaces numbered 11-20.

name: Chameleon Crunch Game
description: Electronic children's race game where 2-4 kids try to "feed" (flip) "flies" (plastic bits) into a roving Chameleon (moving electronic piece with wheels and a mouth that opens and closes) and be the one with the most bugs in the Chameleon's mouth. But watch out, the Chameleon may spit out the bugs (when its tongue flips them out).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey – 4 Figure Mini Game
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Explore Middle-earth and enjoy grand adventures with Thorin Oakenshield and company!

Begin your epic quest through Middle-earth with The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey - 4 Figure Mini Game, featuring four HeroClix figures (Yazneg, Bilbo Baggins, Gandalf, and Thorin Oakenshield), an exclusive fold-out game board, a quick-start rules sheet, a Powers and Abilities Card, and dice.
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Hand in Hand: The Card Game
description:
Hand in Hand is a deck of 60 cards, each with two different brightly coloured halves that depict one half of a child that needs your help to be made whole. Similar to a deck of playing cards, there’s no limit to how many ways you can play with these cards.

However, the base game is suitable for 2-6 players aged 6+ and can be played in 15-20 minutes. By matching colours, players create a chain of children holding hands that can be “taken home” to score points. This is a great family game that offers positive, encouraging turns leaving everyone feeling like they’ve contributed to something good.

name: Emil: Stapla trägubbar
description:
Emil is one of the characters created by the famous Swedish child book author Astrid Lindgren. Emil has got himself into trouble once again and therefor finds himself in the tool shed, carving his wooden figures. However, over the course of his mischieveous childhood the wooden figures have become rather numerous and Emil has trouble fitting them all on his shelf.

The game Emil: Stapla trägubbar (Emil: Pile up the figures) is about piling the figures and trying to be the player who places the last figure on top of the pile without making it fall.

The players take turns drawing figures from a bag and try to place the figures on top of the pile in any way they want, as long as the figures don't touch the table.
A player that causes any figures to fall has to collect the fallen figures except from one that goes back into the bag. The player must then use the figures from his/her own collection before drawing from the bag again. The player who places the last figure from the bag onto the pile without it falling is the winner.

The game is very fast and suits ages 3 and up.

Even though the box states 1-6 players, there is no real limit to the amount of players since everyone draws from the bag.

The game also offers a solo play version where a player can try to break different records, such as widest structure or highest structure or most figures.

name: Makler Giełdowy
description:
Makler Giełdowy is a Monopoly with a twist. The board is very similar (there is a marketplace on the board). The theme is almost the same but instead of buying properties, players buy shares of companies.

On his turn, a player rolls one die and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned company share, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio (there is no option to auction it). The more shares of one company a player owns, the more profit he will gain when any other player lands on the company. There are no houses or hotels in this game.

There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes or collect income.

The main difference between Makler Giełdowy and Monopoly is the marketplace. Every time the player passes by the marketplace, he can go to it. Depending on the number thrown on the die the player may buy 1, 2, 3 or 4 shares. Selling is unlimited. Just before acquiring the player draws a market card which shows the price change. The share may be more or less expensive. It is possible to buy every unowned share in the game. It is not possible to buy shares from another players or sell them. There is no negotiation in this game and the trading is allowed only through the marketplace.

The game ends when first player goes bankrupt. The most wealthy player is declared the winner. There is also a variant when the game ends when all but one player go bunkrupt.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Harlekin Game
description:
This game relies on placing money on a small board in accordance with dice thrown. The player places some money on the number that represents what the player throws. In the 1800 version, money placed equates to one cent.

If there is already a cent placed, the players takes that money and throws the dice again. He/she takes money as long as there is already money placed, and places money as soon as a number is thrown that is empty on the board.

If a player has no more money to place, the player may throw the dice once more. If the player does not receive money on that turn, the player is out.

The game continues until there is only one player left, who collects all the remaining money.

This game is related to Harlekin och hans sju korvar and Der Deutsche Hanswurst, though the game intent here is a game for money and placement of coins (the others are roll and move games)
publishers: Amand Lithography Amsterdam, Brepols & Dierckx zoon, Glenisson et fils, J Vlieger, P.J. Brepols, Waterlooplein

name: Tsoro Yematatu
description: Tsoro Yematatu is a two-player abstract strategy game from Zimbabwe. Players first drop their three pieces onto the board, and then move them to create a 3 in-a-row which wins the game. It is similar to games like Tapatan, Achi, Nine Holes, Shisima, and Tant Fant. However, what makes this game unique is that pieces can jump over each other (without capture) which adds an extra dimension in the maneuverability of the pieces.

name: Megapoly
description: A game inspired by Monopoly (at the command of the publisher) but has other interesting features. Virtually everything can be traded so there is more player interaction. There are auctions at key times in the game. And owning any five companies that are placed at three of the corners of the board means you have 'cornered the market' and you win. If nobody achieves this then the last player in the game, after all opponents have been made bankrupt, wins.

name: Svälta räv
description:
Svälta räv (literally "starve fox") is a traditional card game played in Scandinavia that is similar to War and Beggar My Neighbour but differs from both of those games and may not have quite the same reputation for interminableness.

A deck of standard cards is dealt evenly to the players, face down. Then, each player simultaneously turns up the topmost card in their pile, starting to build a face-up pile. If one or more of the cards turned up are in the same suit, the player with the highest card showing in that suit wins all the cards in those face-up piles (but not the piles currently showing any other suit), adding them to the bottom of their face-down pile. This procedure of turning up cards continues until all cards are held by a single player, who wins the game. A player who runs out of face-down cards flips over their face-up pile and continues playing, while a player with no cards whatsoever is (mercifully?) out of the game.

name: Eastern Europe (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
