In the 2-player game, each player uses a single alien marker as normal, but chooses and places cows of 2 colors. Cow Lock and Bovine Doom Block can still only be achieved with cows of the same color.


From the packaging:
In Udder Madness you are an alien engaged in a contest with your alien pals to see who can tip the most cows of your opponents while tipping as few of your own as possible.

Why an alien, you ask? Well there are a couple of reasons.

One reason is that by now, any alien visitors we may have must surely have grown bored with abducting people and examining their nether-regions. So with nether-regions out, and crop circles quickly becoming pass, they're going to need some new mystifying activity... Why not this?

The second reason is that we at Placebo Press could not possibly believe that an actual human being, no matter how depraved or intoxicated, would participate in such an activity outside of the confines of a harmless board game? Hence it must be aliens. I don't think that our logic is flawed here.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Multiple Maps, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: The Moose Spotting Game
description: The object of the game is to get 20 or more Moose Spotting points. All players should have the same number of turns before one is declared the champion Moose Spotter.

name: Blaze Monster Dome Challenge Game
description:
Blaze down the Monster Dome Track to win the race! Monster Dome Challenge introduces preschoolers to concepts such as magnetism, trajectory, force, acceleration and more! Blaze and the Monster Machines is a new and exciting CG interactive series for preschoolers featuring Blaze, the world's most amazing monster truck, his driver, an eight-year-old boy named AJ, and their adventures in Axle City — a town populated with big-wheeled vehicles known as Monster Machines.

Blaze Monster Dome Challenge Game:

Age Range: 3 years and up
Build social and coordination skills
Help Blaze and his friends take the Monster Dome Challenge
Kids will learn about science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) concepts
Use memory skills to overcome obstacles Crusher has put in the path


Game Play Overview:

Choose a monster truck character.
Spin and move a character that many spaces.
When ending on a space:
Blue opstacle space - Choose one of the tokens and flip it over. If it symbol matches the icon on the space, then that character keeps the token and the turn ends. If it the symbol on the token doesn't match, return it to the stack and the turn ends.
Crusher Cheats - Go back one space.
Give Me Speed - Go forward one space.

Take turns in order until one monster truck crosses the finish line.
All monster trucks count up their tokens on the one with the most is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mystery-Dish Diner
description:
From the box:

"A fast-paced guessing game of delicious deduction.

Take turns playing customer and server. As the customer, make three food selections. Place your order by displaying the menu clue cards. Flip the timer! The server rushes to fill the order by using the clues. Ring the bell when the order is correct!

The more food items you serve correctly, the more money you earn! Switch roles and play again!"

This game for young children features cardboard food items, matching clue cards, and a screen to allow the customer to secretly choose three food items. The server can see only the clues (one for each item, describing color, shape, or temperature) and must figure out the customer's order using logic and process of elimination.

name: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar – Gutbuster Promo Card
description:
Card was available during the Secret Cabal 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

GUTBUSTER INJURY: When you end your turn on an unstable space, discard a treasure to the Maw.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dear Abby
description:
"The Game of Manners, Morals & Mirth! Where Your Advice Counts"

Given a letter in one of five categories (Husbands and Wives; Lovers, Friends and Others; Family, Kids and Pets; How To and Etiquette; and Funny Situations), can you determine which of the four answers was Abby's?

name: Fantastische Ballonreise
description: Fantastische Ballonreise [Fantastic Balloon Voyage] is a dice game for 2-5 players. The idea is to fly as quickly as possible. Whoever can land at his destination first wins. Fantastische Ballonreise will take you flying all over Germany and its neighbors following a "must visit" list set at the start of the game. At the various stops you will read a card which is descriptive of the folklore of the location and has a special effect on play, including trivia contests, drawing pictures or singing songs. This game was developed as a promotional item for the soft drink manufacturer Fanta. Includes five miniature plastic balloons which go up and down on stands to show their current altitude. Players race their balloons, and special dice are used to determine the change of orientation of a large wind rose, which indicates the amount of movement permitted in each direction, but lines on the board indicate which directions can be travelled in from each space. Cards are dealt out to indicate start position, end position and four intermediate points in each player's route. Very nice item.
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice

name: Drinkers Wild
description:
"100% Proof Spoof for Liver-Rated Adults"
Originally published by Gamma Two in 1978.
Although superficially similar to Smokers Wild, it is an inferior game, close to a Monopoly reskin. You roll and move, buying bottles. When a player lands on an owned bottle, he pays to drink from it. If you own all four bottles of one colour (four colours in all), prices double. The Pub Crawl is a separate inner track that you enter from four outer Pub spaces. While on a Pub Crawl, you don't collect from your bottles.

Similar to:

Smokers Wild
Lovers Wild
publishers: Gamma Two Games, The Avalon Hill Game Co

name: Star Wars: Episod I – Kampen om Naboo
description:
4 armies are fighting to be the first to reach Queen Amidala on the green planet Naboo, to get her to one of their own bases.

The armies are 2 different teams: The Good ones and the Evil ones. Each player control one army (or sometimes 2 if you are 2-3 players) and tries to move any of his characters to Naboo, throwing 2 dices per turn, each for one character. When getting doubles, all four characters can be moved. On the way can you attack your opponents and with luck and skill render them harmless. But be careful, so your not attacked and eliminated yourself.

Armies from the same side are allies during the game and has to cooperate, ie to open a gate to Naboo, as the planet is protected by a shield. It's done when 2 allies from different armies meet at an alliance field, where 'Star Wars' is stated. Throwing 4 dices and adding attack value, they must get at least 22. Enemies cannot go trough the opened gate.

The combat system is simple, by adding attack values and defence values of each character to the dice throws. Regardless who attacked, the player who got smaller number, loses the character. The lost character can be conquered back if ventured in the enemy base and both characters are moved back to own base.

When character reaches Queen Amidala, player takes control of it and tries to move it back to allied base. If Queen loses battle, the winning character is moved to center and control of the Queen is changed.

The game is based upon the the movie "Star Wars Episode I".

The game does probably only exist in Sweden, Norway and Finland.
"Kampen om Naboo" = "Fight for Naboo".
categories: Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Utmaningen
description:
An instructive game about the environment and it's influence.

Year of publication is 1995 by "Foundation The Natural Path". Came into Guinness Book of Records after been played simultaneously by 47160 students and teachers in the category "most players of the same game during one day".

You go around the world (=the board) stepping on question spaces. If you answer questions correctly, you'll step up on "environment meters" for 1-4 corresponging environment categories, otherwise you step down. You also get a money reward for correct answers.

When you have collected enough money, you may move to "threat space" and pay to remove it and get a plus on your "environment meter". The spaces will then be covered by "sun counters", to mark that they are handled.

When all threat squares has been covered by suns, you count the points on the environment meters. You count the points by adding the columns 1, 2 and 3 and then multiplying the sum by the value in column 4. The player with the lowest value knows best how to protect the environment.

name: Snowboard
description:
This game is a race between snowboarders, but speed isn't all --you must also do a maximum of free-style figures to earn first place!

Avoid the ice slicks, trees and rocks, succeed in your figures, exploit the course and you'll be crowned the best snowboarder!

name: The Idiot Box
description: Roll and move, draw cards, impersonate celebrities, answer quiz questions, spoil with dirty deals, collect money, buy your TV show, try to get to the center and then try to roll a 6 to win.

name: Scandal
description:
Scandal is a card game designed by Edi Birsan and produced with images provided by Nina Hartley a well known adult actress of the decade. The game was inspired by the Clinton-Lewinsky sex scandal and the design is a satire of that and all other scandals in history. The cards are divided into categories, each representing elements of a good public scandal: the Target, the Trigger, the Transgression, the Trumpeters (media), the Tidbits, and the Testimonials.

Players take turns adding a card to the growing scandal. Only one target, trigger, and transgression may be in play at any given time, and each is required for a complete scandal, but multiple cards from other categories may be added freely. When the three required elements are present, a player may trigger a scoring round by playing one of two "It's History!" cards. Scandals are thus generated until one player reaches a target total score.

The 54 cards are each marked with standard playing card rank and suit (to allow use for traditional card games), and many sport photos of nude or scantily clad women (the box carries a "not for sale to minors under 18" warning). As part of the marketing, randomly 1 in 12 decks were given an extra card signed by Nina Hartley.

name: Boxum
description: BOXUM The Game of strategy that you play from all sides to win. Each player has their own game board the object is to box in all the numbers on a player board first that player win the game. Using the dice a player can split the dice and take two moves or combine the dice and take one move anywhere around the numbers rolled on the dice.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Enclosure, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fill 'er Up!
description:
The object of the game is to get the cars back on the road.

Fix flat tires, help lost travelers, tow stuck cars! Draw a help-me card from the deck and match it to the all-fixed card at the friendly service station. Each time a problem is solved, one player advances her service station dial, and the other player puts the matched pair back on the road. The game ends when all the problems are solved, all the cars are back on the road, and all the players have happy cars showing on their service station dials.

name: The Mother Goose Game
description: Great introductory game similar to Candy Land. Spin the spinner and move you pawn to the first space with matching colors. If you land on a rhyme picture, you try to match it with the nursery rhyme on the board. If you do so, you move to that rhyme! The winner is the first person to make it to the Humpty Dumpty rhyme square.

name: Punto y Raya
description:
Punto y Raya translates as "Point and Line". The lines are the walls, presumably.

The players alternate placing walls on the 8x8 board (optionally, the walls must be contiguous). Whenever an area is closed off, the player claims it with one of his markers. Whoever captures most of the board squares wins.

Similar to:

Honeycomb (which uses a hex board)
Squares (which uses a cross-shaped board)
Box-It (the walls can pivot to enclose areas)

name: Dilemmas
description: Dilemmas includes a book of 150 situations that the players have to craft solutions for. There are solutions provided, which will score points if matched in the party game, but the main puropose seems to be to stimulate conversation of the "Why would you do that?" variety.

name: The Ultimate Route
description:
Although billed as a game for Ages 12 and up, this is a very simple roll-and-move game where the object is to make a round trip on a track that represents the Alaska Highway. It starts in Dawson Creek, B.C., goes through Fairbanks and Anchorage, Alaska and then returns to Dawson Creek.

Spaces are either blank, have an instruction to follow, or have you pick one of two types of cards which then give you instructions to follow.

name: The Perfect Crime
description:
The Perfect Crime is a detective game with a twist... one of the players is actually the "murderer". He constructs his crime, choosing his Victim, Scene, Time and Method. The other players are Detectives. They investigate the crime and try to discover which one among them is the Murderer. Naturally, the Murderer also plays as a Detective and tries to avoid being exposed.

The roll of a die determines what type of investigation you may make on your turn. Depending on the roll, the information that you receive may be secret or public. All clues may be entered on the provided investigation pad.

When a detective wants to make an accusation he may do so on a hunch, without seeing all four pieces of evidence except on the 12th round, when all evidence MUST be shown.

The player who was dealt the 'Murderer' must last 12 full rounds of investigation without being discovered to win. If any other player makes a correct accusation, he wins.

name: Celebrity Trivia
description: Celebrity Trivia is one of the myriads of trivia games that surfaced in the 1980s as a result of the success of Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition. The game consists of 2400 questions on 400 cards. Although there are rules for playing independently, it is compatible with Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition.
publishers: Nostalgia Lane, Inc., Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Diet: The Cheating Man's Game
description: A roll-and-move game that parodies dieting. Players move around the six different diet circles (Low Cal Diet, High Protein Binge, Crash Diet, Drinking Man's Diet, Surgical Diet, and Sportsman's Diet) trying to lose all of their calories. Players can play honestly, or cheat on their diet. If they cheat and are caught, however, they gain even more calories than they had before. Mealtime cards add random events to shake things up. The first player to lose all of their calories wins.

name: Backscrabbing
description:
(From the Back of the Box)

Backscrabbing is the exiting new game that lets you use your skills in making deals and back scratching and back stabbing your way to the top. A "real world" game, Backscrabbing combines subtle strategy with a little luck for fast and funny entertainment!

The object of Backscrabbing is to become the controlling shareholder of a large corporation. This is accomplished by rolling the dice, moving around the board and following the instructions on a series of cards.

There are also failed stabs, punishments, scapegoats, Team stabs and more. Watch the excitement level rise when players are given just 30 seconds for free-for-all trading!
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Charlotte's Web Game
description: In this 1974 children's game by Hasbro based on the cartoon movie, players begin on the starting square, spin the movement wheel to determine who will move first, then, on their turn, spin to determine how many spaces they will move. Some squares have certain instructions the player must follow. The gameplay is very simple and resembles Candyland, although the board is winding and contains a crossing loop. The first player to reach the "Wilbur is Safe with Friends" square wins. The board contains many characters and references from the movie.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Who Said That?
description: Who Said That? is a game for everyone with 400 quotes taken from famous people, commercials, movies, cartoon characters and more! On your team's turn, you get two quotes, one at a time. When you guess Who Said It? correctly -- and in time! -- you move ahead two spaces on the game board. Stuck? That's okay! Ask your opponents to read the hint that comes with the quote and if you're able to give the right answer now, you still get to move ahead on the board one space. Some quotes will be ones that come in a snap! Others are right at the tip of your tongue and just need that hint to help you through. Some will be tougher, but a good guess might be all you need to get your mover towards the finish. The first team (or player) to do that, wins!

name: Gruftmeister
description:
Dungeon Crawling game wherein each player has control over a TombMaster and TombBoy pawn, using them to uncover and retrieve five treasures. TombBoy pawns carry the treasure from rooms which the TombMaster unlocks. Combat is handled by taking monster tokens in hand, shaking them, and then spilling them upon the table -- any face-up chits count as a hit.

Apparently, two copies of the game can be combined to allow up to eight players.

Re-implemented by:

Gruftmeister Adventure

name: Jury Trial
description: Jury Trial is a game where each player assumes the role of an 'Attorney', each of whom represents the same Defendant during the course of a Trial. As in life itself, the Attorney who delivers a Not Guilty verdict, and of course earns the most money while doing so, wins the game."
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Who Really Has the Huevos?
description: Card game in which the object is to have more 'huevos' points at the end than the other players. Try to steal your opponent's huevos or use the 'Hey! Get your hands off my huevos!' card to prevent theft. A wagering element is introduced with the 'Huevos Challenge' card.

name: Hostage
description:
"INTRODUCTION: This game is designed to represent all hostage situations that may occur. Six of these situations are represented in HOSTAGE: BANK ROBBERY, EMBASSY TAKEOVER, HIJACKING, KIDNAPPING, PRISON RIOT AND PRISONER OF WAR.

OBJECT OF THE GAME: The object of HOSTAGE is to acquire, in proper sequence, the six steps of negotiation towards the resolution of the hostage situation.

WINNING THE GAME: The first player to obtain his six Pik A Cards in sequence is the WINNER."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pirate
description:
A player's turn consists of moving his or her Ship (choice of French, British, Spanish or Pirate) one space on a map of the North Atlantic. When a player's Ship is in Port, the player may do any one of three things:

Draw 1 Treasure Card
Draw 1 Trading Card that belongs to the Port's continent
Spin the Spinner

Pieces of Eight are accumulated by cashing in Trading Cards and discovering Treasure with the Treasure Cards.

Naval battles are decided by rolling a d6. The winner of the battle receives all Trading Cards from the defeated ship.

The winner is the player who has the most Pieces of Eight at the end of the game.

name: Thin Ice
description:
The object of Thin Ice is to be the first player to collect three Winning Advice cards. Players receive a Winning Advice card when they give the best answer for getting out of an "unusual predicament".

The game begins with a collection of unbelievable predicaments that have really happened to people. Players are asked what they would do to get out of the same situation.

The "right answers" are included in the game on Response Cards. Unfortunately the cards are all mixed-up... and players must use whatever advice is written on the card they select... no matter what it says! Here is where the "gift of gag" will come in handy as you compete against a choice of unusual answers.

name: Viva El Arenal
description: You are a Tourist and have 10,000 Peseten. On your turn you roll the dice move your token and do what you have to - that is explained on the space you land on. Most times you lose some of your money. The winner of the game is the last player with money left.

name: You Bet !
description: There are 5 different casinos on the gameboard. Every player choses one location. There is Bingo, Horse racing and stock trading. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

name: Syon
description:
The object of this abstract strategy game is to bring together 4 sun pieces (2 each of 2 different colors) into a connected chain. Each player has a hidden goal card with his 2 colors. This means that many times two players have a color in common, making it a challenge to help yourself without helping your opponent even more.

The game is played on a 6x6 grid of points. 24 planets are placed at random on these points at the beginning of the game. 8 sun pieces are placed in the square spaces formed by the grid points.

On your turn, you can move any one planet to any empty point on the grid, or, if a sun is surrounded by 4 planets, you can move that sun to an adjacent space. The only restrictions are that you cannot undo the last player's move or move a planet away from a completely surrounded sun.

You win immediately if your 4 suns are connected in a chain of any shape.

name: Ludi at the Circus Maximus
description: A combination of a race and a word game. Players choose a chariot and roll the die to advance along the track. The player then gives a word beginning with the prefix shown in the space on which the player lands. One player keeps track of all words given and penalties are handed out for repeating one. The first player to complete 7 laps is the winner.

name: Mind*Link
description:
Working in partnership, each partner spins to get a letter. Now, the partners have 30 seconds to see if they can individually come up with the same 'phrase' using the 2-letter acronym. Bonus points if even 1 word matches.

If not, then they can try to make the 3 or 4 words into some sort of sentence. If they pass the judging, then they can move on.

It's labeled as 'The Spellepathic Word Game'.

name: 3quence
description:
3quence is a quaint word based puzzle solving game. Players use a cluefinder (gadget) that holds puzzle cards. The cluefinder has sliding windows that hide and reveal clues printed on the puzzle cards. Players try to guess the answer words based on the clues available. Several types of clues are available and you are allowed to reveal them in any order you wish.

The game feels very similar to scattegories and tribond with a "family feud boardgame" feel to the cluefinder.

The box tag line:
" A word game.
A knowledge game.
A thinking game. "

Sample puzzle:
Category sample 3quence
----------------- ----------------------
States of the USA Florida, Georgia, Hawaii
mammals lemur, lion, llama
familiar words point, poise, poison

clues might include: for mammals - animals that start with l, or for familiar words - words that start with poi
categories: Deduction, Educational, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: Telephone Tag
description: Object is to be the first player to reach your location with three messages from your boyfriend. Game consists of gameboard, 4 electronic phones, 80 cards and 1 die.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Patriot Act Game
description:
The Patriot Act Game, a Monopoly-like board game based on education about, and opposition to, the "Patriot Act" -- is available at

http://home.earthlink.net/~thepatriotactgame/index.html

It's kind of fun as well as informative. It seems to be pretty soundly researched, based on actual analysis of the Act and, more generally, some history of civil liberties issues.

Here's a sense of how it goes: the currency is "freedom fries," the "homeland security threat level" rises during the course of the game, the players whose game tokens are black or brown or yellow get screwed in comparison to those who have the red, white, or blue tokens -- stuff like that. Even if it doesn't make it into the board game hall of fame, it could be a good gift for the civil libertarians on your holiday gift list.

Story published in Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
http://www.post-gazette.com/lifestyle/20040202patriotact0202...
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Deluxe Count'N Out
description: The fast-paced game of card-flipping fun. The object of the game is counting backwards. Be the first one to get rid of all of your cards and you win.

name: Leviathan
description:
If I tell you Leviathan is a cross between 'Go Fish' and a non-collectible 'Magic: the Gathering', you will instantly know pretty much everything you need to know about this game. Players take turns asking each other for cards matching the ones in their hands, each card being named after a particular fish (or fish-related being, such as Atlantean Priests or Mermaids). When a player manages to get a pair, they place it face-up on the table in front of them, just like in Go Fish. Once the cards hit the table, the Magic: the Gathering aspects come into play, as most of the fish have unique powers that can be used to aid you or annoy your opponents. There are also unique cards (with names like "Flying Dutchman" and "Offshore Oil Rig"), which have more esoteric powers and move from player to player as they get used. When one player runs out of cards in their hand, everyone scores a point for each pair they possess, and a new hand is dealt until every player has dealt once, at which point the final scores are tallied and a winner is declared. (Game time is thus dependant on number of players -- my guess of 90 minutes is a rough estimate of a 6-player game, which may not be at all accurate.)

In many ways, Leviathan epitomizes the "beer-and-pretzels" game -- in fact, it was designed in a coffee shop, out of a need for something to do while sitting in a coffee shop. The rules encourage a light ("jovially rude") atmosphere, and the writing style generally reflects this, although careful attention has been paid to the way the various cards interact, and to fix any possible contradictions or loopholes. (And the rule set has been edited to remove unnecessary rudeness in the author's writing style, although -- shh! -- an "impolite" version of the rules is rumored to exist, somewhere...)

Players are encouraged to devise new card powers and game variations, and as a bonus for players south of the equator, a special "Southern Hemisphere" option is given, which explains the way the Coriolis Effect changes the order of play.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Nautical, Print & Play

name: Beethoven's 2nd
description: Beethoven and Missy have a new litter of pups and they're a frisky bunch. Mo, Dolly, Chubby and Tchaikovsky have gotten loose and they're tearing around the front yard, wrecking everything in their path. Can you round up all four puppies and get them back into your doghouse first.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hidden Talents
description: Pick one of the 180 hidden talents question cards then place your secret vote for the player you think will come out on top. Then everyone gets to perform or answer the question that's on the card. If you're the player who performs the best or owns the most, you get to place one of your color tokens on the scoring board. You also score if you vote for the right person. After 10 rounds, the player who has the most points wins.

name: Game of the Millennium
description: Teams must answers questions posed from all 10 Decades of the Twentieth Century. Categories include: The World, Pastimes, Firsts, People, & Trends. First team to make it to the 21st Century wins!

name: Saint Paul and the Unforgettable Journeys
description: "The Unforgettable Journeys is a game designed to appeal to players of all ages. The challenge, competition, and excitement it presents is surpassed only by its educational content. The game has a twofold purpose. First, it provides excellent family entertainment as each player attempts to follow Paul's journeys from Antioch to Rome. Secondly, it can be used as an instructional tool by Sunday Schools to teach the book of Acts and the Apostle Paul's missionary travels."
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wheelspin No 1 World Formula Grand Prix
description:
-From the Box

ALL THE ACTION OF GRAND PRIX RACING

Welcome to Wheelspin, the board game that recreates all the thrills and spills of Grand Prix racing. Your objective is to be first past the chequered flag at the end of the race. You'll stand the best chance of winning if you 'read' the race in advance, avoiding hazards and penalties wherever possible and by forcing your opponents to make mistakes and incur delays and penalties. After only a few games you'll be reading the track like an expert - and beating your fellow drivers to that magnum of champagne! Why not run a series of races with your friends and family and create you own world championship….
Of Particular note:

-The game is heavily luck based. A flick-spinner is used for movement.

name: Liars Maze
description:
From the instructions:

Each player picks a card and tries to successfully bid the highest number combination or cause an opponent to unsuccessfully bluff a number combination. The last bidder of each round moves its playing piece forward the number of spaces indicated on his card, if his bid is successful. The player moves backwards that number of spaces if his bid is not successful. The first player to the finish line is the winner.

Cards consist of eight numbers from 1 through 10 (10 is 0) and may repeat. Bidding proceeds as:

Player #1 says "three-3's"
Player #2 says "four-2's"
Player #3 says "five-2's"
etc...

Consists of: 1 game board with a hexagon type "maze", 36 cards, and 4 wood playing pieces.

name: Splash
description:
CONTENTS
2x big lily leaves (homes)
6x small lily leaves
2x 4 frogs numbered 1-2-3-4

OBJECT
To race the 4 frogs from one home to the other.

PLAY
The starting leaf of player A is the finishing leave of B and vice versa. While all the small leaves lay in between as a path... quite pretty effect.

The movement is indicated by the number on each frog. Therefore the frog of value 1 will move or jump 1, the frog with a 4 will move or jump 4 leaves.

There is not luck involved, all the moves take place on that way. A frog is allowed to leap over other frogs and only unoccupied leaves will count as a move. Frogs can also knock off opponent's frogs when jumping over.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Racing

name: Medieval Warhawks
description:
From the back cover:
Medieval Warhawks has: 50 treasure cards, 10 player cards, 6 playing pieces, 6 treasure chests, 2 six-sided dice, 25 damage tokens, and can be played on any terrain!

---
Originally a miniatures-like game, with a cute little movement ruler marked with footsteps, an expansion provided modular square grid boards. Each player is a different character with different abilities. Fight each other, get to a treasure chest and draw a treasure card (which may give you magic spells, treasure-as-VP, or monsters to fight), and get home with your treasure.

Uses pawns for characters, but little toy treasure chests instead of cardboard chits.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Creepy Cave
description: Move a monster marker around the board by matching beginning consonants and build vocabulary, spelling and memory skills. Includes 12" x 17" game board, four monster markers, 21 word cards and number die. Ages 6 - 8.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: Hoop Hysteria
description:
This is Sportsfan's Hoop Hysteria - The College Basketball Trivia game.

This is an interesting sports trivia game for fans of college basketball. Each round one player is the offensive team (home team starts) and rolls d6 that has four results (1/6) Turnover - lose possession. (4/6) Shot - Offense selects whether they are attempting 2pt or 3pt shot. Defense reads the question and if the offense gets it right (separate questions for 2 and 3pt shots) they get the points. Regardless of whether they answer correctly, play goes to the defense. (1/6) Shot/Foul - Offense selects 2 or 3pt shot, but if they get it right, they get a shot at the 1pt bonus question too.

From the back of the box :

Over 2,000 questions on NCAA Division I men's basketball trivia. Contains questions on every major college basketball program. Includes a scoreboard, a 60-second time, and a custom die. Scores like a real game.

name: FBI Crime Resistance Game
description: Milton Bradley FBI Crime Resistance board game. For 2-4 players and for Ages 8 - 14. Travel the pathways on the board to collect "Crime Resistance" cards. Use the rotating discs to enter and leave each corner area. After collecting at least 4 resistance cards, try to match one with a "Victim" card to win.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: R.I.P. Collector Game Cards
description:
24 cards publisher in TSRs Comics Mudule magazine RIP #5.

With the card came rules for two simple games. The cards are in four suits (Hero, Villain, Item and Place) with values from 3 to 8 in each suit.

The basic game (for 2 players only, unless you have more sets, or cards from an expansion) deals 6 cards to each player. Each turn the player draws a card from the draw pile or from the top of the discard pile. Player win by having:
26 point in any one suit.
14 points in 3 of the 4 suits each.
one card of the same value in each of the 4 suits.

The "Graveyard" game is basically just a memory game, where you have to find cards of the same value.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Horror

name: Volgende patiënt
description: Lukas the patient is sick and players should help him to rid of his infections. 6 paths are traced around Lukas, players move along those tracks on the roll of the die, must answer questions and receive health police chips for correct answers. On the virus spots one can duel with a virus using dice and health police chips. One has to beat one virus of each kind, the player who has 5 different virus chips on his prison card, wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Medical, Trivia

name: Voltron: Defender of the Universe
description: A childrens' game containing two fairly similar memory games, in which the players work together to find the five keys needed to summon or form the giant robot Voltron, while avoiding other pieces such as Laser Blasts and the Robeast. Ages 5 - 12.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: At The Gates Of Moscow 1941
description:
"At The Gates Of Moscow 1941 is a division level simulation of the German campaign in Russia in late 1941. The game opens with an examination of the opening effects of Operation Typhoon and proceeds to the first Soviet winter offensive. At The Gates Of Moscow 1941 covers detail[ed] rules for: Militia Building, Partisan, Garrison, Air Units, Leaders, Forts, Hitler, Stalin Directives ... and much more."

"Find out what it took to be an army commander on the eastern front in 1941! So, for the wargame that has it all, play 'At The Gates Of Moscow 1941'."Two 22" x 28" multicolor paper mapsheets
450 pink, buff, and black die-cut counters
Standard and solitaire rulebooks

Note there was an associated computer version. Both were marketed as "The only board and computer game that can be played together and separately"

Standalone companion to computer game:

At The Gates of Moscow: 1941

name: Ultimate Quest
description: The board game is divided into 7 zones, the players move around and try to complete the requirement of the quest booklet, which contain a list of animal to obtain, either by hunting them or trading for them. Player can duel each other, if on the same area, with dice or by using the questions card (it's a trivia regarding 11 native nations of North America).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle Boarding
description:
Each player has 15 colored balls representing there boarding parties these are move by the throw of two specialist dice. The board has preset movement paths and a rotating playing board that alternatively allows all movement paths to be used and then opens some holes which your pieces can fall through. The aim of the game is to capture the other ship by getting 6 of your colored balls on the deck.

Pieces can be lost be either being captured by the other side when they are landed on, or they can fall through holes that open up when the board is rotated.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Barbarian Hordes
description: A fantasy wargame in which two players each control a horde of barbarians. As your forces approach each other you attempt to make alliances with other races you encounter to increase your power. Includes spells and magical artifacts.

name: Dare to Dream
description:
From the Rules introduction:

Dreams become reality in Dare to Dream the ultimate 21st century board game based on a lottery victory. Players experience life to the fullest while building on newly acquired fortunes in a quest to become the wealthiest player.

Opportunities and Pitfalls will be encountered along the way. Keep in mind that it takes money to make money. Now that you have the money - make it work for you. Live out a different fantasy every time you play. Remember there is an element of risk to be weighed in the balance. Opportunity may knock when you least expect it!

Enjoy the freedom to choose your destiny. The days of working from paycheck to paycheck are over! Bask in affluence, surround yourself in luxury, take a walk on the wild side exploring your adventurous self.

See the world... change the world... Dare to Dream.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Raiders
description: In this collectors edition, players buy, trade and sell various members of the Oakland/LA Raiders Football team Al Davis and John Madden are Boardwalk and Park Place. Six collector tokens are included: Raiders helmet, linebacker, cheerleader, football, kicker and whistle.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: ULTIMATE Sports Trivia: Super Pro Edition
description: Just like in Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition, you roll the die, answer questions and hopefully be the first to collect six scoring chips from the various categories. They are Baseball, Hockey, General Sports, Football, Basketball and Olympic Sports. The game is made more accessible by providing multiple choice answers to many of their questions, so even if a player doesn't know, they have a shot at it. Who will be the ULTIMATE Sports Trivia champion in your gaming group?

name: Bullwinkle's Supermarket Game
description:
This is a simple Bingo-like game. There is a board with a 5 x 4 grid. Each of the spaces contains a picture of a particular grocery item as well as a background color (one of 5). There are also 20 cards which match the 20 spaces of the board. These cards are divided among the players. The object of the game is to be the first player who places a card on the board that completes a column or row.

On his turn, the player spins a spinner which is divided into 5 spaces, one of each of the colors on the board and cards. The player may then choose a card in his hand of the color spun and place it on its corresponding space on the board. If he does not have a card of that color he passes. He may also choose to pass if he thinks it would make it easier for an opponent to complete a column or row.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: All Aboard
description:
This is a kids color-matching game that features Disney Characters. Each player takes a "train" and places it in front of them. The train is a vertical device that is used to drop passenger tokens into similar to dropping checkers in "Connect Four". There are 3 lower color coded token "seats" and 3 upper seats directly above the lower ones. The passenger tokens, depicting various Disney characters and having various seat colors, are placed in a pile on the table.

On a turn, all player take 2 tokens from the pile. The active player then spins the spinner. If Donald Duck is spun all players keep their tokens. If a number is spun then all players pass their tokens to the left the number of times shown on the spinner. Next players drop tokens that match their empty color seats into their trains returning any non-matches. A lower seat must be filled before you can stack a token into the upper seat. The first player to fill all their seats wins. For an advanced game, you must match both colors and the characters depicted on your train.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: Eldorado
description: A Finnish exploration game from the 70s in which the players travel around the South-American continent. A certain number of cities must be visited after which one can go the Eldorado site to look for the city of gold. The game includes 50 city cards, 12 flight ticket cards, 20 surprise cards, 6 Eldorado cards, 6 plastic pawns and 1 die.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Odysseuksen Harharetket
description: Odysseuksen Harharetket (Odysseus Irrfärder in Swedish) is a Finnish game from the early 1970s. The players try to complete Odysseus's adventures and race from Troy to Ithaca. The game includes 1 board, 1 die, 6 plastic ship pawns and 49 point cards.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Dice, Mythology, Nautical, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Riskland
description:
From the rules:

Riskland is an educational board game that deals with disaster prevention. The game conveys messages that help you understand how some actions can reduce the impact of disasters, while others can increase our vulnerability. Following the board's path, you will advance, and at times be made to go back. Some squares require question cards, the answers to which are intended to help you in learning about disaster prevention.

name: Richard Scarry's Busytown Best Number Card Game Ever!
description:
From the box:

Learning numbers has never been so much fun!

Be the first to match your cards, count them out and you will win! There's lots of different games for kids 4 & up to play with Lowly Worm, Huckle Cat and all their Busytown friends as they count from 1-10. Whether you are matching all the Banana Gorilla cards, remembering where Sergeant Murphy is, or simply counting the dice cards, one by one, you're sure to have a great time!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Pank-A-Squith
description:
A race game played on a spiral board. The game took its name from political opponents in Edwardian England - the suffragette leader Emmeline Pankhurst (1858-1928) and Herbert Asquith (1852-1928), Prime Minister from 1908 to 1916. The game was first advertised in Votes for Women on the 22 October 1909 and many of the references to recent events are illustrated by the squares. The illustrations on the board show the difficulties encountered by Pankhurst and her supporters in the militant suffragette movement.

Comments from The Jon A. Lindseth Suffrage Collection

The Pank-a-Squith board game was first advertised in Votes for Women on 22 October 1909. It comes with six painted, cast lead, figures for the suffragettes. The board is stamped "Made in Germany" on the back.

The goal of this board game is to reach the Houses of Parliament, the pinnacle of achievement for the campaign for Woman’s Suffrage. Although designed to be humorous, the images evoke the darker side of the campaign, making reference to police violence against women protesters and the force-feeding of imprisoned hunger strikers.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: WATCH IT!
description:
COMPONENTS:
4 plastic stands (used to set up the scene)
4 sets of picture cards numbered from 1 to 10

OBJECT OF THE GAME
To be the first player to repeat from memory the picture composed by an opponent.

This another MB mini size game, which are great to take with you and the kids when traveling.
Basically, this one is like if we show a drawing to the other player and this one has to draw it from memory. Instead pen and pencil this game uses the stands and cards of different sizes to compose the picture. These cards of course, are placed so that the big ones don't hide the smaller ones. There is a score system.
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Pollution Solution
description: Players are environmental managers in a township. A die roll determines which areas on the board get polluted, and players must make the right choice to clean up the polluted areas. Pollution can also spread to non-polluted areas. There are three levels of play.

name: Battlezone
description: Battlezone, a game of control of Pacific Islands, in which each player has a flagship and eight assault ships represented by colored markers and plays on a board divided into rectangular sectors. Islands are captured by completely surrounding them and great skill is required to out-maneuver the enemy.

name: Greenfingers
description:
The game is played through 4 seasons (commencing with winter) with a task to be completed in each season. There are also items to be collected throughout the game from the garden Centre.
Points, represented by the different coloured counters, are awarded if you answer questions correctly or if you are lucky with the chance cards(and deducted if you are unlucky). These counters are stacked on your score card, secured by the posts and indicate partial completion of the seasonal task.

The game moves through 4 seasons as players complete their score cards (ie complete each seasonal task). The first player to complete the seasonal tasks and collect all the required items from the garden Centre wins. If the game is stopped before this point is reached, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Supporters
description:
A magazine game from Jeux & Stratégie Nouvelle Formule #8.

Two groups of sports fans try to get as near as possible to the soccer field to support their teams.

name: Kogepunkt
description:
Kogepunkt is a trivia game focused on the theme of food, in which up to 4 teams of players can attempt to become the winner.

Each team takes a token and places on the starting point on the board. On their turn, they roll a die and move their token by its result. They then have to draw a card and answer a question (asked by another team) about the category they landed on. Categories include utensils, drinks, ingredients, background of certain foods, and miscellanous questions. Correct answers (and moving their token a complete circle around the game track) awards the team a Chef Hat.

The game ends when a team manages to obtain a pre-agreed number of Hats, thus making them the winners.

name: Takeaway
description:
Unlike many of the other Jax, Ltd. games, Takeaway doesn't seem to have previously existed as public domain.

Luck seems to play a heavy part in this game, advertised as "strategic": This is a set collection game, where you collect cards by making plays of cards between your cards and your opponents. At least, that seems to be how the game works: the instructions are well known to be less than specific.

The game seems to be well regarded by younger players, perhaps because they are not as concerned with playing by the "official" rules.

Verbiage from Jax, Ltd:
Take all you can get...when you play this unique, new family card game! Collect as many cards as you can by making plays between your cards and your opponent's cards. But BEWARE....Your opponents might take them all away! The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!! It's challenging and fun. When you change comes, take all you can get and play Takeaway!

name: Snapshot
description: The players are shown a picture and get one minute to write things down they see but only one word per letter in the alphabet. You get one point per word that nobody else has, no points if somebody else has it. First to 33 points.

name: Bibelspillet
description:
In this game you can test your knowledge of the Bible. You start at the top of the Tower of Babel and your goal is to, by giving correct answers, get down and away from the tower.

Includes 1200 questions in five categories:
- The old testament
- The new testament
- People
- Puzzles
- Mixed questions

There are two decks: 600 "easy" questions and 600 "hard" questions so that children and adults can play together.

name: Motto
description: Each player starts the game with 4 randomly selected cards in cardholders. The question side faces your opponent, the answer side faces you. Players begin by challenging answers to facing cards. Correct answers are exchanged for memory chips. The player with the most money chips wins the game. Great game to see young photos of many famous people as well as old sport and company logos!
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: 風の谷のナウシカ (Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind)
description:
Nausicaa is a game of hack and slash melee combat in the world of Nausicaa published by Tsukuda hobbies.

Very famous in Japan and the game itself is rarely seen.

name: Nephi's Courage
description: Nephi's Courage is a deck of cards with which you can play Gadianton Robber (Old Maid), Seek and Ye Shall Find (Go Fish), and Ponder (traditional pair matching game) with characters from the Book of Mormon. Another Latter-Day Saint themed game for Family Home Evening or any family game time.

name: Hydramatik
description: Tile laying game with 49 hexagons showing different body parts of dragons. If a player lays a tile and finishes a hydra, he scores points according to the number of tiles in the hydra. Extra points are awarded for player specific hydras (2 backs, 3 ends, ring and head, ring and claw).

name: Enterpriser
description:
This game is presented by the Economist and sponsored by major companies that are represented in the game, like AT&T, UPS and Shangri-La Hotels. It is meant to give players a flavor of how a competitive market works, while familiarizing them with economic terms and concepts.

Each player represents an "Enterpriser" who begins a small business and attempts to be the first to build a financial empire. Players have to decide how and when to invest, how much to borrow, how much inventory to maintain and when to take advantage of special opportunities that may come along through contacts with other companies; all this amidst changing economic times and unpredictable events (manifested through event cards).

name: Sesame Street, Off & Running
description: This simple track game is from the Sesame Street "My First Games" series. The board has 4 tracks leading to an inner Finish Circle. Players take a colored monster pawn and place it on the Start space for its track. On your turn you spin the Cookie Monster spinner and move the monster (not necessarily yours) whose color was spun 1 space on its path. The players who own the first and last monsters to enter the Finish Circle are the winners.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mut zur Mücke
description:
This game is based on a German expression which refers to someone who tends to exaggerate when telling a story. Literally, the expression would say "Don't convert a midge (mosquito) into an elephant." This is the aim of this game. Whoever is the first to convert their midges into elephants wins the game.

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!>

name: Diabological
description:
Simple fantasy-themed abstract strategy game from the mid-80s, when such things weren't as popular as they are now (early 2000s). Published in Warlock (Issue 13 - Dec/Jan 1986/1987).

The board depicts the classic demon-summoning layout, with pentagram and magic circle. One player is the wizard, the other, the demon; both are armed with tokens, two for each ancient element (earth, air, water, fire). The wizard plays first, setting up his elements hidden at the points of the triangle and pentagram with no opposing element on the same line. The demon plays second, laying down one element at a time next to the wizard's and seeing what happens before playing the next. The idea is that the wizard should create a difficult-to-guess defense, while the demon tries to solve the puzzle and/or hedge his bets.

name: Steel and Crystal
description:
"Steel and Crystal is an easy solo game of conquest on a fantasy land. You are the General of your Empire and your mission is simple: defeat the enemies of your Emperor. Every scenario states the initial forces that you have under your command and the objectives you must obtain to win."

"Scenario #1: the Aidlon offensive. After 5 years of relative peace the Xytyan empire has newly started a series of offensive maneuver against the neighborhood kingdoms: the Isle of Aidlon is now menaced so you've been assigned to the defensive campaign . . . You win the game if you control the city-fortress of Hishimur (area 24) at the end of any turn."

This game was part of the Microgame Design Contest 2002. The file in the link section contains this and several other games.

name: Profit & Loss
description:
Now here's a game from 1977 with a relatively short title and a mouthful of a game maker's name. The game is Profit & Loss ; the maker is Hollow Stump Bungalow Books & Games.

As the name suggests, two to six players buy and sell various items (antiques, art, securities, real estate, collectibles, etc.), trying to achieve a profit on each one. However, victory goes to the first player to reach $1,000,000, so at the end of the game it may be worthwhile to dump items at a loss to reach the finish first.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Hollow Stump Bungalow Books & Games, John N. Hansen Co., Inc.

name: Challenge the IRS
description: Players compete at finding deductions while avoiding criminal and civil fraud charges - and jail time - during the audit cycle. Deductions can be challenged by the I.R.S., or the other players. As noted on the box, the object of the game is "to claim every possible deduction and end up as the taxpayer with the largest refund."
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Marathon Beginner's
description:
From the box:

The MARATHON BEGINNER’S edition is a highly educational question-answer game, prepared under pedagogical supervision specially for children of elementary school age.

MARATHON BEGINNER’S has more than 2500 questions about school and cultural matters, classified in three difficulty levels. 240 cards use vivid graphics of famous people, monuments, animals, and many other familiar object to stimulate your child’s imagination and memory.

Your child will begin a 10 Kilometer “run” against IGG KNORANZ, the mightiest representative of the imaginary country “I-DON’T-KNOW”.

name: Minden Association Football
description: One of Gary Graber's Minden sports game range. Along with Playing Card Cricket, this is one of the best in the range. Alternately known as Minden Soccer.

name: Birmingham in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Birmingham, Alabama. It has spaces such as Rickwood Field, Kelly Ingram Park, Fried Green Tomatoes, Heaviest Corner on Earth, Dreamland Bar-B-Q, and Birmingham Zoo. The tokens include a Vulcan, pretzel, sax, heart, sailboat, and hard-hat. Cards include local events and staples of life in Birmingham.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Abi: A Game of Word Recall
description: Abi challenges players to exercise their problem-solving skills. Requiring only a single die (included), this pack of 26 cards offers hours of fun for up to four players, ages 13 and above.

name: Små grodorna
description:
A children's game from Ages 3 and up. Each player gets eight small frogs and a big mother frog. First you have to get the small frogs into the pond, and after that let the big mother frog jump on the water lilies and then into the pond.

There are no dice, the players move the frogs by spinning an arrow that points to different colors.

Similar but not identical to Quak.

name: Hits mit Witz
description:
Hits mit Witz is a simple music trivia game from the late 80s.

Up to 6 players move pawns along a square track and answer questions from 5 categories (1955-1963, 1964-1969, 70s, 80s, general facts). The first one to collect a disc from every category (by landing on a special space and answering the question correctly) and answer a final question correctly (after landing on yet another special space) wins the game.

name: Arena
description:
Arena is a simple boardgame for 2-4 players where each player has to try to move his or her gladiators from his or her table-end to the other end of the board. A die-roll determines whether a player may move their gladiators (1-4) or the lion (5-6).

Each gladiator has a weapon (net, trident or knife) and this weapon determines whether that gladiator can capture another gladiator (net captures trident, trident captures knife and knife captures net). The lion captures any gladiator it land on. Captured gladiators must start at that players table-end. The first player to move all his or her gladiators from the opposite table-end wins.

name: Buck Quest
description:
Buck Quest is a trivia game for hard-core hunters. There are 1500 questions that cover all aspects of hunting knowledge. For example (these questions are pulled from the same card chosen at random, really!):

1. To keep tree stands from being patterned by deer, A. move, B. camouflage, C. descent the stand regularly.

2. To estimate the live weight of a deer, divide A 0.98762, B. 0.78612 C. 0.62553 into the dressed field weight.

3. A shouldered shotgun can easily be checked for proper fit; the shooter's check should rest from A. 1 to 2 B. 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 C. 2 to 3 inches back from the point of the comb.

There are 6 such questions on each card. Players answer questions and race around the board to the finish.

name: Magnetel
description: A miniature table top pool game for kids. The game has ten numbered pucks in place of pool balls, two spring loaded cue sticks, and a triangular frame like in real pool to help set up the ten numbered pucks in a triangle. Also there are six magnetic pucks (3 yellow, 3 black) which if they get near enough will stop on any of nine magnets mounted under the board in a 3x3 array. This is to play "skid-tac-toe," and a few of the other games. There are a total of 8 Games in the rule book.

name: Pegs in the Park
description:
From the insert inside the box:

Come take a fun visit to the Park with some happy, lovable little Pegs as they race and jump from hole to hole along the colorful tracks in the Park. If you beat the other Pegs to the Ice Cream Car, you win!

Pegs in the Park includes a cheerful deck of 44 cards depicting the many happy sights and activities you will see in an eventful day at the Park. But look out! The stormy rain clouds or some hungry ants would like to ruin the Pegs day in the park and keep your Peg from reaching the Ice Cream Cart.

Pegs in the Park is both great fun and educational. The lovable little Pegs will delight young players. This child's board game goes beyond entertaining and challenges the youngster in an exciting learning adventure. The young player will have opportunities to practice counting, learn the concept of forward and backward, come to understand plus (+) and minus (-) along with developing small motor skills and hand-eye coordination.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Number

name: Xaviera's Game
description:
By the Author of “The Happy Hooker”

From the cover:

Dear Player:

You’ve probably read about my sexy adventures in The Happy Hooker. Now instead of just reading about them, you can play along with me!!! Can you think of a better teacher for fun and games than Xaviera???

Step into my apartment and be one of my girls of a very eager customer… But be willing to hang up your hang-ups… and try to keep your hands above board .. At least for the first few rounds!!

There haven’t been any dull moments in my life, and there won’t be any for you when you indulge in Xavieras’ Game!!!

name: Saving Private Checkers
description:
Checkers with an explosive twist for two players. Kinda like a cross between normal checkers and the D-Day invasion....

Object: There are two goals: 1) To get as many of your checkers to the other side of the board and back as possible. 2) To capture as many of your opponent's pieces as possible.

You Need:

* A Poker deck.
* The checkers from a checkers set.

Play is very much like normal checkers, except that you're trying to get your checkers to the other side of the board and back without either being captured or blown to pieces. (The cards act as 'live squares' -- when you enter a square, you may be blown away.)

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/86/saving-private-checker...

name: Larven Freddy
description:
Children's game, probably from the early 1970's. Players compete to build the longest caterpillar from tiles depicting heads, body segments and tails. To do this they take turns spinning a plastic pointer. When it stops, it will point to either a head tile, a body tile or a tail tile. The player picks up a tile of the indicated kind and adds it to the caterpillar he is currently building in front of him. A complete caterpillar has a head, at least one body tile, and a tail. A player must complete his current caterpillar before beginning a new one. If his caterpillar needs a tail, and the pointer stops at a head or a body tile, he may not pick up a tile but must try again on his next turn. There is nothing players can do the affect the outcome. Longest caterpillar at the end of the game wins.

There are 40 body tiles, 8 head tiles and 8 tail tiles. All heads are different but they are all happy faces, some with hats and so on. It doesn't really matter which heads you choose, but this may still seem important to young players. It is also the only decision players make.

Scandinavian edition Larven Freddy ("Freddy the Caterpillar") was published by Brio under the Joker label, but the copyright belongs to John Waddington Ltd. I haven´t found a similar game actually published by Waddington, so any information on this is welcome.

name: Dinosaur Dig
description:
Learn about the fascinating prehistoric world when dinosaurs ruled the earth.
Participate in a dig - gather all the supplies you need to explore underground ruins and collect bones to complete your dinosaurs.
As you travel the board:

You'll answer true/false and multi choice trivia questions
You'll collect dig supplies you need to work an excavation
You'll trade and collect dinosaur bones.


The first player to claim all the bones needed to fill his or her dinosaur cards and to check off all the dig supplies on the checklist proceeds to the finish line, the American Museum of Natural History, where the bones they collected will be exhibited!

With 100 trivia questions based on information gathered from the most famous of dinosaur museums, The American Museum of Natural History.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Prehistoric, Trivia

name: Cover Up
description:
Covered Up comprises two games, a basic game and an advanced game.

In the basic game a murder has been committed. Two players (or teams of two) play either black or white footsteps. The twelve playing cards are shuffled and dealt face down to both players. Players alternatively play a card (which contains some holes) onto the board. The object is to cover up as many of your own footsteps as possible whilst exposing your opponent’s.

In the advanced game (3 to 4 players) each player chooses a role card to establish whether they are a detective or a murderer. Before the start the 2 murderers must each decide on a board location to hide their victim. They tell each other their location, one will be a white location and one a black location. The detective(s), who are not told of the locations, will use the diagrams on the back of their cards to assist them identify the location of the bodies. Each murderer alternatively places a playing card onto the board, but they must not alter the color or direction of the two hidden locations. Each murderer will try to expose the other by changing as many of the opponent’s steps as possible to help the detective with their eliminations. When a detective has one location left un-eliminated he has caught the murderer. If the caught murderer has played one less card than their opponent then the opponent can play one more card to try to salvage a draw. The victorious detective and the uncaught murderer are the winners.

name: Schlock Attack
description:
A two-player checkers variant inspired by the online comic strip Schlock Mercenary by Howard Tayler. (http://www.schlockmercenary.com/)

Object: To be the last player with checkers on the board or to meet your special victory conditions.

You Need:

* A complete checkers set.
* A six-sided die.
* Some pennies.

Setup is identical to that of a standard game of checkers. Next, one player choses a character to play. Then, the other player chooses a character and starts the game. The character you pick will give you certain advantages (and disadvantages in some cases). Also, some of the players have special victory conditions. Play is identical to a normal game of checkers, except that the rules that govern a character overrule all other rules.

When your opponent loses the last of his or her checkers, you win. The game also ends if one player has met any special conditions that he or she has for winning.

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/110/schlock-attack
categories: Abstract Strategy, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: King of the Castle
description:
This game shows a lot of lively climbing stairs, because the goal is to be the first player who brings all his tokens on the top platform. Instead of moving step by step, it is faster when you form columns (towers of more than 1 token), since columns allow jumps of as many stages as they are high. After such a jump, the lowest token of the column remains at his staring place and you can move it downwards under certain circumstances, which is interesting, if the remaining token belongs to an opponent. This game requests a lot of strategy and the smartest player will win.

Description from the box:

Become the King of the Castle!
It takes clear thinking to reach the summit of this challenging test of skill.
publishers: Berliner Spielkarten, Hasbro Industries (Hasbro Bradley), Orda Industries Ltd.

name: Carol Vorderman's Sudoku: The Board Game
description:
This game is a fun way to enjoy Sudoku with a friend!

First, put in the "starter" numbers from one of the 100 cards using the green disks. Now agree how many one minute turns you will both take and who will start - then off you go.

It's a nail biting race to get as many correct numbers in YOUR colour as possible, during the agreed number of turns. Score for every correct number, but beware - wrong numbers are subtracted from your total.

The red filter allows for extra clues and lets better players take on less practiced friends.

In Carol's own words -

"I am a Sudoku addict. It seems that Sudoku addicts are male, female, young and old. We are all hooked. This game is the next stage of the Sudoku craze - it allows players of different levels to compete fairly against each other. I love it - it's perfect for all the family and fantastic value for the money"
Carol Vorderman

name: F.S.U.opoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
College Avenue, Lake Bradford, Seminole Marching Band, The Phyrst, Sweet Shop, Landis, University Union

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

Skip class and advance to Alligator Point. Pay $10 to the token of your choice to borrow notes.

Too much fun at The Phyrst last night. Lose one turn to study.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Sesame Street Cookie Hunt
description:
Sesame Street Cookie Hunt is a card game for ages 4 and up. The deck consists of several pairs of cards, and a unique Cookie Card. The cards are shuffled and dealt out to the players, who take turns drafting a card from the player to the left. Pairs are removed from play. The goal is to obtain and keep the Cookie Card. When all the pairs have been eliminated, the person holding the Cookie Card is the winner.

Me want cookies!!!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Sesame Workshop

name: Relax Wow
description:
Wow is the first game produced by Enjoy Board Game Co. The owner of the company said "Frankly, 'Relax Wow' is our first product, so it's not enough to compete other famous board games from overseas. However, we think that simplicity and interactivity of our game are great merits of our game that may not be found in other board games."

Wow consists simply of players turning over the top card of a stack they hold in their hand. If the card they flip matches another color on the table, they must throw both hands up in the air, shouting "Wow!". Players who do this incorrectly receive all the cards on the table. Certain cards have different effects - and the player who discards all of their cards first is the winner.

name: The Game of States and Cities
description:
The cards in this game contain a map side and a question side. The map side contains a map of the United States with a state blackened in. The question side has the name of a state and 6 questions about the state (state flowers, topographical features, capitals etc.).

There are two games to play. The first involves players looking at the map sides of the cards and making guesses as to which state is blackened in. If they are correct they score the card. If they are wrong it goes to the bottom of their card stack. The second game involves players asking the trivia questions and the other players answering (each player gets one guess and the the players are asked in order around the table). If you answer correctly you get the card. If no one answers a question you ask, you get that card. Most cards win.

The game is covered by U.S. patent 1745946.

name: Password Junior
description: The players form two teams of two players or one player can give the clue to two guessers. Players take one card which has ten passwords on it. A spinner determines which word will be the password for this round. The clue giver can give multi-word clues and use pantomime (unlike the classic version of the game which restricts the players to one-word clues and no gestures). Teams alternate turns until someone guesses the password. Any player who guesses the password is awarded the card for scorekeeping purposes. The first team awarded six cards is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Wordmaster
description:
Each player gets a grid on which each will write one's words. A specially designed roulette wheel that has seven balls is spun. Instead of the usual numbers, the roulette wheel has letters of the alphabet. Each letter of the alphabet has been assigned a value from one to ten points. Once the seven letters for the round have been determined, the players have a time limit to use those letters in words on their individual grids crossword-style. The player with the most points after a predetermined number of rounds is the winner.

In the official rules in the box-lid, it there is a single crossword grid that is shared by all players, each player taking turns adding to the grid.

name: Groovy Girls Sleepover Game
description:
From the publisher:

The race to put on your PJ's!

Now it is time for you and your Best Friends to go to the Groovy Girls™ Sleepover! Become your favorite Groovy Girl....Spin the spinner and visit the TERRIFIC TENT, VOGUE VANITY, POSH PARTY, LUSCIOUS LOUNGER and BEAUTIFUL BED....and change into a new outfit each time!

name: Jump-A-Sheep
description: A HABA game in a tin, containing 4 wooden sheep, 2 hurdle-sticks, a die and a small booklet of rules in German, English and French. To play, mark starting and finishing lines with the hurdle sticks. Line up the two sheep of each color, one behind the other at the starting line. Each player takes turns rolling the die and placing their rear sheep in front of their lead sheep the repeating the number of times shown by the die. The first player to reach the finishing line wins.

name: S'witches
description:
From the box:

Hilarious switching game for the whole family. Each player selects a witch, all identical except for the color under the base. Roll the die and move any playing piece. Fun starts when you land on a "switch" space. Other players must cover their eyes while you make your move by switching pieces. Land on "look space" and you can check the color under one piece. Winner is the first player to take their witch across the finish line. Take the wrong witch and you end up in the "white cauldron" and must wait until your next turn to win. Includes gameboard, die, and 4 identical witches.

name: Bogus
description:
Players take turns reading statements about pop culture, history, animals, entertainment, etc. They then bet on whether or not the question is true or false. The first one to $1 million wins.
Using the additional "sabotage" rule, the players can choose to bet against another player -- if they answer the question correctly, the win money from the player they bet against, instead of the bank.

name: Agro Invest
description:
From the box: "Invest your money on several plantations and breedings such as cattle, sheep, corn and others, hope for good weather and become the richest farmer of all!!!"
"In this game, each player is the owner of a farm. His/her goal is to manage his/her farm the best way possible, to obtain the highest profit" (from the rules booklet).

name: Learning to Sequence
description:
Game contains sets of three pictures in a sequence which must be properly arranged by the player. Examples include a girl planting seeds, kids getting dressed, building a castle out of blocks, and so on.

All sequences are "self checking" - the backs form a solid image so kids can turn them over to see if they arranged them correctly.

48 durable 3.75in. x 4.5in. picture cards, Self-checking cards, Game directions in English and Spanish, Activity guide, Ages 3 and Up, 16 picture stories
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational

name: O.R.B.I.T.
description:
A game of maneuvering spacecraft to dock with a space station then intercept planets and then return to Earth. The planets are in motion as well, so you have to plan the intercepts. You use course correction cards for your maneuvering.

Game consists of a 13 1/2" X 13 1/2" jigsaw board, 36 cards, and 9 pieces representing the planets and ships.

name: Chocolate Chip Math
description:
A children's game to help teach the basics of math.

Each player has a chocolate chip cookie scorecard with no chips on it to begin. Players work their way around the board, landing on spaces in which they must answer the math problem posed to them. If they answer the question correctly, they collect a chocolate chip to add to their cookie. The first player who fills his or her cookie scorecard wins!

The game board has two sides. One side is an addition and subtraction game. The other side is a multiplication and division game. The instructions are the same for both sides. Just the level of difficulty of the math problems changes.

name: 1492: The New World – North America
description: 1492 is not a game on its own but serves as an expansion to Europe 1483 and/or Europe 1483: Asia 1483. It adds seven new playable nations, plus optional rules to upgrade three African nations to full player nation status. With the addition of this expansion, the 1483 series can support up to 53 players in a single game. Includes a large 49.5" x 31.5" map to add to the game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval, Wargame

name: Big Bigger Biggest
description:
Children's card game (box says ages 5-8). Cards show four animals in three different sizes (Small, Medium, and Large), plus a few extra cards (a jumbo version of each animal and jokers). On a turn, players try to play a card to the table which shows animals that are at least as large as what's been played there before. If not, they draw a new card. If they play a jumbo (thus killing the chain), they get to play an extra card. First player out of cards wins.

Note: this game gives full name credit to the two "authors" (Yehuda Harpaz and Sahar Klein). The person credited with "design" is Hermann Wernhard.

Contents: 54 animal cards, 4 jumbo cards, 2 joker cards, Game Rules.

Ravensburger Game No. 00 631 1

name: Euroopan Omistaja
description: A trivia game about Europe and European Union.

name: Dozen Dice Games
description:
This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series by Patch Products.

This game comes with rules for a dozen different dice games as well as the neccessary six, eight, and ten-sided dice. The games included are:

21!
High die, high die, high die, ho!
Chase the Ace
Straight up to 100
Ship/Captain/Crew
Liar's Dice
Hacker's golf
Rock around the clock
Sinister six
Dead die 96
Bean your neighbor
Yacht race

name: Three Throws
description:
This is part of the Big Deal series of card games by Patch Products.

This game has a theme of rock-scissors-paper. It is played in two different rounds. In the first round, players take turns turning up cards on a face-down tableau. If they turn up a set of winners, these cards are taken into hand. When all of the card possible are taken, the second round begins, which is essentially a game of war between players.

name: The Book of Pop-Up Board Games
description: There are four pop-up board games in this book. The games are, Space Escape, Pirate Treasure, Mummy Chase, & Save the Princess. Each game has a storage pocket to store the stand-up people. There is also a fold out spinner, that you use to move.

name: Wort Maumau
description:
