An UNO variant. Each card shows a short word.

Goal is to get rid of all cards in hand. In turns, players play a card which has the same vowel or the same starting letter as the one on top of the discard pile (or draw one card, if unable to do so).

As usual, there are a number of action cards (draw 2, change direction, ...). Unlike standard UNO, these also have a word that must match up. So it's often not possible to play a 'take 2' directly onto another one.

In addition, there are a number of variants; for example, when a player plays a card which starts with a 'z', each player gives his cards to his neighbor.

name: Saddle Up!
description:
Contains game board, four horse cards & plastic holders, 12 challenge cards, and 2 dice. Ages 7-12.

Object of the game is to win a cross country horse race. You may move either by dice roll or by challenging another player to a race using the challenge cards.

The board pictures different landscapes that dictate how many dice you can roll for that turn, and some special spaces which cause other restrictions (i.e. landing on a lightning bolt space will spook your horse).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sports Know How
description:
Sports Trivia from the makers of Strat-O-Matic Baseball.

This sports knowledge game includes one game board,two dice, 4 plastic pawns, 55 cardboard discs for tracking correctly answered questions, a rules sheet, and a deck of cards with a total of 2808 sports questions. Players answer the questions and proceed around the board until they are eligible to land on the victory square and answer a final question correctly.

name: Liikenne muistipeli
description: There are 24 cards about traffic divided into six groups and a penalty card. The idea is to gather as many groups as possible and avoid the penalty card.

name: Pixeline på pletten
description:
Pixeline på pletten is a simple game, that's also designed to teach children to count.

Each player has 5 round raindrop cut-outs, a spinner shows how many raindrops a player can place on the board. The first player to place all his/her raindrops, is declared winner.
This game also contains a small memory type game.

Pixeline på pletten features a popular danish childrens character (Pixeline), who has appeared on a number of CD-Roms and in books. The main theme is always educations of children aged 3-12 years.

Please note that, since Pixeline is a danish invention, this game is mostly likely only printed in Denmark. Pixeline has however been printed on CD-Rom games in Sweden, Norway and Iceland, and this game may possibly be printed in these languages too.

Awards

2004 Årets Børnespil, Childrens Game of the Year Denmark

name: Take a Hike!
description:
From the box:

Kids take a hike through the forest in a race to fill their backpacks and reach Camp Fun. Players choose which animals they want to collect, then move around the board collecting those animals. The animals stick to the backpacks, then peel off so that they can be used over and over again. Take-a-Hike! is simple enough so that 4 year olds, can quickly learn to play, but interesting enough to hold older kids' attention, too.

This was designed by a five year old, Derek Nelson, the winner of the 1994 National Young Game Inventors contest.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Das Hamburg-Spiel
description: You roll and move around the city of Hamburg, Germany, answering questions about the history of the city and scoring points.

name: Post Danmark Rundt Spillet
description: In this bicycle racing game you race in Denmark. The one who gets to Copenhagen first wins the game. But beware of flat tires and illness. The game consists of: 2 dice, 212 cards, 1 playing board,1 players guide, 5 bicycles and 140 energy bottles.

name: Football dominoes
description:
Contents:
28 dominoes showing different football situations.

The rules of play mirror those of football wherever possible. Essentially, players take turns in attempting to control the ball, represented by a coin, into the opponents goal.

Luck and memory game, as the dominoes are turned is usefull to remember where certain pieces are laid.

name: Cosmic Decoders
description:
From the publisher web site:

The Cosmic Decoders Leader Kit is the fourth release in our series of family events and activities on topics in astronomy for Family ASTRO Event Leaders. It focuses on how astronomers "decode" light from space to learn about the universe and how we might decode radio waves from possible alien civilizations out there. The Cosmic Decoders Card Set (the corresponding Take-Home Activity) consists of a deck of 72 cards featuring beautiful color images of cosmic objects and some well-known telescopes. These can be used to play four different fun astronomical games.
publishers: Family Astro: Astronomical Society of the Pacific

name: Net Y
description:
Net Y is an acronym for Nested Tetrahedrons Y. There are three superimposed, interdependent instances of Y which are played simultaneously. Two of the grids are imprinted on tetrahedral shapes, and one is imprinted on a simple triangle. The winner of the majority of the three wins overall.

Net Y rule sheet:
http://www.marksteeregames.com/Net_Y_rules.pdf

Net Y printable game board:
http://www.marksteeregames.com/Net_Y_board.pdf

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in Silver Screen City
description:
Murder mystery where each of 10 players take up the role of one of the suspects of the murder. This version is set in 1950's in Silver Screen City (Hollywood) and you have to find out who killed Samuel O'Snuffit.

Who killed Samuel O'Snuffit?

Silver Screen City in the 1950s is the venue for a glittering party being hosted by the movie mogul Samuel O'Snuffit. But the evening went off with more of a bang than expected when O'Snuffit was shot dead during the firework display. Why did someone at the party want him dead? What had they to gain? Find out the answers by hosting your own party to solve the mystery of the Murder in Silver Screen City.

The suspects are:
CECIL LETHARIO - film director (his love life has a cast of thousands!)
MALICA FORETHOUGHT - film critic (nobody dare ask what she's thinking!)
LOSTA MORALS - actress (fluent in five languages but never mastered how to say NO in any!)
FANNY CHEZ-LONGE - actress (she likes to audition lying down!)
MONICA MAKEOVER - beauty salon owner (she's always willing to oblige!)
CLARK CRUMPET - actor (he enjoys his tea after his crumpet!)
ONNIS UPPERS - actor (he's definitely seen better days!)
JOHNNY COME-LATELY - actor (the new kid on the block - better late than never!)
SUE SPENDER - singer, dancer & nightclub owner (she likes to keep her men in suspense!)
THE DONNE COSI-NOSTRA - hotel & casino owner (show this Godfather some respect or it could be good night goodfellas!)

Contents:
Guest Invitations
Guest Nametags
Complete Instructions and Hosting Guide
Character Profiles
Clue Sheets
Costume Suggestions
Menu Suggestions
Cassette Recording
Murder Solution
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Conny
description:
You have been on a riding vacation on a farm for a few weeks. One day you notice nine horses being stolen by 4 horse thieves. You quickly discover where the horses are hidden, and then the big race begins.

You must ride out and find the horses which are hidden in the mountains, but many dangers lures, and the thieves can surprise you. Once the horses are found they must be returned to the farm, and the player who returns the most valuable horses is the winner.

An exciting and entertaining game for all horse-loving girls and boys.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Kirjalito, Litas Spil, Pelito, Schmidt Spiele

name: Electric Derby
description:
Electric Derby consists of five horses which are propelled by small ball bearings which hit the horses causing them to race down the track. The winning horse hits a "flag" which springs up and clearly indicates the winner.

Each race has a different winner, hence the ability to bet on the outcome by using small tokens. The motor drives the ball bearings in an irregular way which means that no one horse in the favorite.

name: Dungeons of Demus
description:
From the box:

"The all action sword and sorcery game.

Prevent Demus from seizing the throne and enslaving the land.

Enter the castle and defeat the Necromancer.

Pit your wits against the evil Demus.

Demus intends to capture the Throne of Laithnur and bring a great darkness to the land. In this perilous hour only a Hero of iron will and brave heart, can stop him!
Your quest is to enter the Castle of Laithnur and prevent the evil Demus from taking the Throne and enslaving the land and its people for all time."
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SexPlay the Game
description:
From the back of the box:

When Foreplay Just Isn't Enough

If you love sex... If you want variety and newness... If you are seeking new "Xperiences" together...
SEXPLAY is created just for you and your lover.

SEXPLAY offers delicious pleasuring and erotic enjoyment with endless sexual possibilities.

SEXPLAY encourages you and your lover to be playful and to enjoy all the secret delights of each other without pressure of performance.

SEXPLAY enhances your lovemaking and breathes a new level of "Xcitement" into your love life.

SEXPLAY is a fun game that's easy to play and you both win all the time. It also makes a great gift!

SEXPLAY is for any consenting couple 18 to 80, single, married or living together, who want more stimulation, escapades, and arousing sexual "Xperiences."

The SEXPLAY gameboard consists of 6 spinners that offer innumerable provocative sexual scenarios that are action packed, playful and unpredictable! Complete instructions are included.

No matter what sexual relationship you are in, YOU DESERVE SEXPLAY ...NOW!
categories: Exploration, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Olympics
description:
Compete in various Olympic sports.

Several events are played at once. You move a counter around the outside of the board - the space it lands on allows you to move pieces in certain events or to collect cards that affect your athletes performance.

name: Big Bully
description: Players move matadors around a board displaying a cartoon bullring trying to hide behind barriers to avoid "Big Bully" - a mechanical wind-up bull which contains a mechanism randomizing the direction of movement. The last player standing is the winner.

name: Little Bear: Berries, Cherries, Apples & Pears
description:
Kids can help Little Bear & his friends stroll through the orchard to gather fruit for their picnic!! The first player to pick up all their fruit wins!

It's a fun way for children to recognize colors and improve counting and sequencing skills. Plus, they learn cooperation and team-building along the way!

(from box)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jubilee
description:
A really quirky Red, White & Blue capture & replacement game (no points are scored) where the winner is the first player to have all his men in play on the board, however this is achieved.

In this game the player’s men are called Purim.

Once laid the Purim are neither ‘jumped’ or moved - but may be ‘returned to that player’s pot’. The key to this game is ‘Red, White, Blue. Red, White, Blue,,,etc’. Remember that & you cant go wrong. Recommended Ages 7+

name: Sudoku Dice
description: A multi-player game based on the popular Sudoku puzzles. Players roll dice to show which numbers can be placed on the common grid. Numbers must be placed within legal Sudoku guidelines. Cards are used to re-arrange tiles and force other events. Players score each time they can complete a row, column, or box. A variant allows players to identify if a placement would cause the puzzle to become unsolvable.

name: Casino Las Vegas
description:
This game is played on a round-course like Monopoly. You have to draw cards for special events and you can purchase 1 of 6 casinos when landing on their space.

But this is only one part of this game. Every time a player lands of the numerous casino-game spaces, he can "enter" the casino and play poker, craps, Chicago, (mini-)Roulette and blackjack. If the casino belongs to another player, the owner of the casino plays the bank!

Interesting, that the casino card games are played with a 32 skat deck...

name: Neck and Neck
description:
This a modern reproduction of a vintage game.

Players line up their horses on a three foot track and crank a handle that vibrates the board. This in turn causes the horses to move down the track. There are slits in the track that act as obstacles to possibly slow down the horses. The first horse across the finish line is the winner.

name: Bamses spel-bok
description: Bamses spelbok is a book with eleven simple roll and move games for kids.

name: Bert's Bottle Caps
description:
From the box cover:

Color matching fun with Bert & Ernie

You and Ernie get to help Bert sort out his bottle cap collection. Somehow Bert got all the caps mixed up, and even a paper clip from his paper clip collection got mixed in! Spin the spinner and match bottle caps to their identical caps on the gameboard. But watch out for the paper clip -- it keeps you from winning. The first player to get rid of all their bottle caps wins!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Class
description: From the publisher: "The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the top of the status ladder, while having retained a sufficient amount of pride, integrity, and happiness--as symbolized by the heart tokens."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Air Attack
description:
Designed by Steve Alexander and published by Millennium Games, AIR ATTACK! is a game “where you are the squadron commander of a tactical fighter squadron. Your mission - to bomb your opponent’s military targets while protecting your own. Other forces include surface-to-air missiles and an electronic warfare bomber at your disposal.”
This game contains rules for Basic Game and Advanced Version.

AIR ATTACK! comes in a 8.25"x11.5"x1" game box with one 4-color 16"x21.5" map sheet; one counter sheet with 40 single sided die cut cardboard counters; a 16 page rulebook; and two six-sided dice.

This game can be played by two to four players, has moderate solitaire capability, low complexity, and playing time for a game is “coffee break” short for the Basic Game, but Advanced game will run longer.

This is a very simple game, with fairly nice production quality. It has some chrome elements that may contribute to repeat plays. It would serve as a fairly quick and easy introduction to air wargaming for kids and adults new to wargaming.

name: Safely Home
description: The object of the game is to travel from school through the neighborhood and arrive home safely with the most Safety Tokens. Along the way, players encounter real life situations that require safe and smart decision making. Opportunities to earn Safety Tokens by using code words, "Safe Spot" locations and buddying up present themselves with every turn, as well as opportunities to say "No" to the dangerous "Stranger". The more advanced version of the game utilizes Safety Situation cards, extra chances to earn Safety Tokens and emphasize the rules of personal safety.

name: Spiderrinth
description:
Who will be the first to catch the fly in the middle?

Spiderrinth is a fun and tactical game, where the objective is to be the first to make a trail from one's home field inwards to the fly in the center of the web.

The trail is established by turning the treads and putting chips on the flies. When all the flies from one's home field to the center of the web is covered by a chip, you move your piece onto the prey in the center and thereby win the game - but only if you remember to say "Spiderrinth"!

(From the box - translated from Danish)

name: Teddy Bear Bingo
description: From the manual: Teddy Bear Bingo helps the child increase attention span and develop sensory motor skills through the use of color motivation and colored teddy bears. Teddy Bear Bingo helps the child practice focusing visual attention through the use of color stimuli and eye-hand coordination by matching colored teddy bears to colored circles in a bingo game format.

name: Rhyming Sounds Game
description:
From publisher:

Children explore rhymes, sounds, sorting and classifying. The self-checking feature lets kids determine if a correct sort has been made- just check the back of each tile! Games are included for both independent play as well as with family or friends. Includes 4 category cards and 56 tiles. For 1-2 players. Ages: 4,5,6,7,8

name: Elemental Warriors II
description: Elemental Warriors II is an abstract dueling game for two players with an elemental magic theme. You start the game with a standard poker deck, an Elemental Warriors II play sheet, and a limited number of coins. The play sheet is divided into 10 columns (number 1 to 10) and 5 rows (labeled Earth, Air, Fire, Water, and Combat). Before the game begins, you allocate your coins to spaces on your play sheet. During the game, you draw and play cards to activate columns on your play sheet. Your combat value and any effects you generate are determined by the coins in the column you activate. Earth effects tend to prevent damage. Water effects tend to add coins to your play sheet. Fire effects tend to deal damage to your opponent. Air effects tend to let you move the coins on your play sheet or draw extra cards. These special powers enable you to change your strategy during play and adapt to your opponent's behavior. When you take damage, you lose coins from your play sheet. If you surrender or run out of coins, you lose the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Embargo
description:
Embargo is an abstract strategy game for 2 or 4 players. You begin the game with your six pieces arranged in a triangle on one corner of a chess board. Pieces rest on the points of the grid, not the spaces.

On your turn, you can move one of your pieces any distance in a horizontal or vertical direction, like a rook in chess. Your goal is to move all of your pieces to the opposite corner of the board.

When two pieces of the same color share the same line without any other colored pieces between them, imagine an invisible wall extending between those two pieces. You cannot move your piece through any wall nor can you land a piece on a point currently occupied by a wall. (This rule applies even if you're trying to pass through a wall you created!)

Because walls apply equally to all players, it becomes dangerous to be too defensive. A diplomatic atmosphere emerges from these simple mechanics as your pieces dance around the board, avoiding walls and building new walls of their own.

From the Luchacabra website:

This elegant abstract board game is deceptively simple. Move your pieces like chess rooks, trying to get to the opposite corner of the board. Uninterrupted lines between your pieces form imaginary walls that no pieces, not even your own, can cross. That’s it! Embargo is a strategic game of territorial control and sharing.

name: Wolf Game
description:
The Wolf Game contains five dice, with a wolf replacing the "1" on each. Players take 3 turns rolling dice, scoring by multiplying the number of wolves by the total of the remaining dice. If 2 or more are rolled, a pack is formed, and a wolf is passed to the next player.

The instructions also include a numbers of "wolf facts."

name: Really Wild Bug Eating Party
description: A series of challenges are used to decide who will ultimately have to suffer the fate of eating a handful of bugs. At the start of the game players are split in to two teams and a leader for each team is nominated. Next a series of ‘bug’ cards are dealt out to each of the players. Lastly a spinner is spun to select a bug and if you’re the unfortunate person holding the most cards with that bug then you’ll have to eat it, that is unless your team can complete a challenge card…
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Humor, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Do U Know?
description:
From Retailer:

A compact game for full-size fun! Turn playtime into Bible-time with this fast-paced family card game. It's similar to Uno, but in addition to matching colors and numbers, players must answer questions about Bible facts, characters, and stories. Perfect for long road trips and rainy afternoons, you'll increase your knowledge of important Bible characters and events, and it's so much fun, you kids won't even realize they're learning! Do U Know? is great for the whole family, especially ages 5 and up.

name: Mitsubishi Space Game
description: The game consists of a board with a track in the form of an eight in it's length. The box contains a red die, 66 Mitsubishi model cards, 33 chance cards, 6 markers and a rulebook. The goal of the game is to collect as soon as possible the 11 different Mitsubishi car models that appear in this game. These models are: Carisma, Colt, Eclipse, L200, L300, Lancer, Pajero, Space Gear, Lancer Station Wagon, Space Runner, Space Wagon. The game was created Mitsubishi Motors Europe to promote their cars.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bumpers
description:
Partisan game with one player using green pieces and the other pink. Pieces are slid into a 5x5 grid of playing positions pushing pieces already in that row or column along the line of the piece inserted. Five in a line wins.

Similar to Overboard which has 6x6 grid of playing positions, and Slide 5 which you can only insert pieces along two edges instead of four.

name: Moneyworld Inve$tor
description:
From the back of the box:

Now, you can be a Global Investor! Buy and sell currencies, properties, commodities, production plants and shops. Collect rent and make profits. Yes, make a billion dollars! But to win, you n eed to make good decisions, form partnerships, be prudent, take risks; and, most of all, have balance in your life. So,.. Go.. get it!

Investing is... "The greatest game in the world" according to Mr. Barton Briggs, head of Morgan Stanley Asset Management, and one of the world's biggest international money managers.
This boardgame deals with issues related to the world economy and global investment. Design for
- families who love to play together,
- parents who wish to impart values and skills for future success,
- students for interactive learning, and
- friends in a mood for indoor fun.

INVE$TOR is:
Educational - young people learn about global economic issues, market trends and money management. They learn to plan ahead, make wise decisions, change with the times, take calculated risks, form partnerships, and have a balanced life.
Fun and Entertaining - the whole family, and friends, of ages 12 & up, may enjoy interacting, collaborating and competing with one another through a game that is never the same everytime you play it!

name: Internationales 6 Tage Rennen
description:
This cycling game appeared somewhere in the 1970's in East Germany. The game has very original mechanics as the movement of the plastic cyclists on the oval indoor track on the gameboard is not done by cards or by dice but by a speedometer, a device that looks a bit like a spinner. That only makes this game a collectors item.

Not to be confused with 6-Tage Rennen.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bugs Bunny's: Who's Got The Carrot Game
description: A spin and move children's game with Buggs Bunny and Elmer Fudd. Be the first to get to the Blue Ribbon Carrot and win.

name: The Harry Lorayne Memory Game
description:
6 Different types of memory games based on the teaching of memory expert Harry Lorayne.

You try to memorize objects, names or faces. The player that can remember the most wins.

name: Who's Who?
description:
All of the 480 game cards are placed in the bag. Each card contains a famous name, either real or fictional. The players divide themselves into teams of two. In turn, one player will draw a name from the bag and give clues to the partner so that the partner will guess the famous name. The clue-giver keeps this up for one minute. The team keeps all cards won for scoring purposes.

Play continues until ten rounds have been played. The team with the most cards after ten rounds is the winner.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Dominator
description:
From the box:

"An exciting war game set in space for 2 players age 9 - 90."

From the rules:

"Dominator is a war between two Battle Fleets for space domination. Each player commands a fleet which consists of a Flagship and fourteen War Craft. The object of the game is to manoeuvre the War Craft to capture the opponents Flagship.

In each Battlefleet there are three types of War Craft, and a Flagship. These all have different values of mobility and attacking power. The two players take it in turns to move the pieces anywhere on the playing board in an effort to capture the opponents flagship.

The War Craft may be used independently or combined to increase their power. However, when pieces are combined their mobility is reduced."

name: Pingo Pongo
description: Each player gets dealt a hand of Pingo cards, Pongo cards and Pingo-Pongo cards. If your opponent plays a Pingo card, you must play a Pongo card. It's back and forth fun for everyone. Play a Pingo-Pongo card and win the pile. Whoever wins the most cards, wins the game.

name: Den stora kassaskåpsjakten
description:
Players move around the streets of the city picking up tools they need in order to blow up a bank safe. When all tools have been found, the search for the safe is on. The first player to find it is the winner.

Vaguely connected to the films about Lilla Jönssonligan (Swedish humorous crime stories aimed at kids).

Ages 6 years and up.

Contents:
Game board
24 tool chits
24 tiles
4 pawns
2 dice with 6 labels
Rules

name: Tacklebox
description:
Tacklebox is essentially a set building card game with memory and trick taking elements. Using the equipment and bait available, the players have a choice of playing the fishing set up which is most likely to net them a fish. Only really available via the internet or in parts of New Zealand.

Home Page: http://www.tacklebox.co.nz/

name: Sesame Street Let's Go to the Park
description: In this children's game for ages 3 to 6 players try to get their Sesame Street character across the game board to the park picking up friends along the way. The board is made up of four straight tracks each with 20 spaces. Players pick from 20 cardboard Sesame Street characters and insert them into the slot of one of the triangular pieces and put the piece on a Start space. The players take turns spinning the traffic light spinner which is equally divided into a 1, 2 and 3 area. The player then moves the number of spaces that was spun. When a players lands on a stoplight space they must stop there. When a player lands on a friendship space they get to pick a new Sesame Street character, insert it into one of the circular pieces and hook it to the back of their current character making a train. Play proceeds until a player makes it to the park space at the end of the track.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: By the Walls of Constantinople
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple game of ship to ship combat in 1453 from the One Page Wars series. Four Byzantine galleys try to break through a large contingent of Ottoman vessels and get to the Golden Horn. The mapsheet uses irregular shaped areas and the game abstractly covers boarding and ranged combat.

name: The Game of Captain Kangaroo
description:
This game for children Ages 4 10 gets it title from an Educational Children's Television Program geared to pre-schoolers (1955-1980).

Captain Kangaroo (Bob Keeshan) and Mr. Green Jeans (Hugh Brannum) starred .

This is s simple match the colors in order to move kind of game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hee Haw
description: Game includes: animal gameboard with self-contained metal spinner and set of 24 animal cards. The game involves dealing cards equally to all of the players. The starting player spins the arrow spinner and when it stops on an animal, each player that has a corresponding card in their hand tries to be the first to call out the sound made by that animal. First one to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

name: Media Magnate
description:
Media Magnate is a game of strategy and chance in which players acquire power and wealth through buying and running newspapers and magazines, radio and television stations and international media networks.

It accurately reflects the real and unpredictable world of media wheeling and dealing from the newspapers to the boardroom.

The game involves all players every time the dice is thrown. The first player to acquire a complete Media Empire is the winner.

name: Chathurvimshathi Koshtaka
description:
This is a game drawn from an old book written in Sanskrit by Harikrishna, son of Venkatram in the late 18th century. It is interesting to read the first stanzas of the book and appreciate the importance he gave to play.

'I hereby describe the organization, structure and rules of this ancient shastra (games), the reason being that there is no such book available and the scholars do not study them. In this book there is a description of several board games, and the intention of this shastra being that people will enhance their brain power by playing them.'

He goes on to conclude the book thus:

I have described the famous games of my time. I do not claim this to be exhaustive, there are several games of various types played in the world and it is physically impossible to compile all of them. I have done my best to compile the most important of my time. ... I, Harikrishna, son of Venkatram was born in Aurangabad in south Maharashtra. I have described in this book many wonderful games and the ways to play them.

It was about the same time that Krishnaraja Wodeyar of Mysore developed and promoted many interesting games.

The game we have here is a simple strategy game described by Harikrishna as a game in 24 squares. We have used the Sanskrit description he has given as the name of the game. Chathurvimshathi Koshtaka simply means 24 boxes or squares.

Contents: game board, two sets of 8 coins each, rule sheet.

name: Metropoli Eurooppa
description:
The game shows Europe as it was back in the late 1980's. All the independent states of the time are shown on the board as their flags as a way to identify them, and as geographically correct in relation to each other as possible; each flag also exists as a game card. Each player gets their "own" random country in the beginning to start from, and the idea of the game is to try to gather as many different flags for yourself as possible; players move on the board using colour-dies and a right combination of colours allows a player to turn one of the flag cards - they are shuffled on the table face down, forming a memory game element - hoping for the flag of the country they're currently standing on, or at least a flag of same colours.

Flags are scored at the end of the game with the Finnish flag and each player's "own" flag carrying bonus points.

One of the last original Paletti publications; the brand ceased to exist soon after, and most of it's games were taken over by Peliko Oy.

name: Bisnes
description:
Players try to earn money by selling one the products in the game: ice cream, toys, lemonade or candies. Each player has his/her own product. Products are sold by moving the player's truck to a right kind of spot on the board. Truck is moved by throwing two dice.

When a player has enough money he/she can buy another truck to improve his/her possibilities in selling products.

Players can decide the length of the game at the beginning by deciding the sum of money player has to collect to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: After Dinner Games
description:
From the publisher:
This set comprises sixteen entertaining games with which to test and tease your guests over the mints and coffee. On the CD are ten terrific rounds of audio fun whilst on the cards you’ll find six more ‘traditional’ games.

Games include:
FOOD & DRINK ~ A cornucopia of culinary trivia questions!
PLAYS & NOVELS ~ Characters from famous plays & novels to identify
8 P’S IN A G ~ For what do the initials stand in the mystery phrases?
HOGWASH ~ Weird words and bizarre definitions for you to solve
MOVIE MAYHEM ~ A challenging collection of celluloid posers
CHARACTER COUPLETS ~ Find famous folk whose initials match the letter pairs
QUOTABLE QUOTES ~ Match the quotation to the personality!
BRAIN TEASERS ~ Cerebral conundrums for egg-heads to crack!
WHO IN THE WORLD? ~ Guess the mystery person as the clues are read
WHERE IN THE WORLD? ~ Guess where you are before it’s too late!

There are also six games featured on playing cards as follows:
HUMM BUG ~ The hilarious tune-humming game
CHARADES ~ A great version of this family favorite
TOPIX ~ One topic, one letter... name as many examples as you can!
CABOODLE ~ Be the last to play out your cards!
TENSION ~ A subject and 10 examples ~ can you guess what they are?
TALL TALES ~ The shaggy-dog-story-telling game

Includes: Audio CD, Card Deck, Answer Booklet & Score Pad

name: Millionaire
description:
From the box: MILLIONAIRE CARD & BOARD game is an entertaining family game. It has been developed so as to free it of complications, therefore requiring only a minimal amount of Mathematical skills. Although it is a game of chance, the order in which the individual player plays his/her cards is of great importance.

The playing board is printed with consecutive boxes each with an additional $10,000. Players use different color pegs to identify the amount in their account. Al players start with an account of $00 and 3 cards. Upon playing one of the cards during his/her turn of play, that card will be replaced with one from the unused cards. The ultimate goal of the player is to first achieve an account of $1,000,000, or more or first bankrupt all the other players.

There are 50 money cards categorized into CASH, GRANT, and PAY comprising of 6 different denominations between $10,000 and $200,000. As such a player's account will be credited and debited during various stages of the game.

name: The Main Idea
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to answer five questions correctly by landing on the right answer letter on each level."

name: Monopoly: Liverpool Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Liverpool, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Gerald Mcboing Boing Game
description:
From the manufactuerer's web site:

Based on the Academy Award winning Dr. Seuss cartoon, and now featured everyday on the Cartoon Network, Gerald McBoing Boing Game is the story of 6-year-old Gerald: an adventurous little boy with a unique talent for speaking only in sound effects. The game allows young children to join Gerald on his adventures both big and small as he honks, whistles, clangs, toots, and cuckoos through his day. The fun game will entertain and teach, using sound association, to engage its younger players.

For 2 or more players Ages 3 - 6.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Slumber Party
description:
The game of fun and laughs for girls. So much fun your friends won’t want to leave!

Made by Cadaco in 1990 for up to six girls Ages 8 and up.

OBJECT: Be the first player to get rid of all your rollers, by acting, drawing, answering questions, doing a silly stunt, whatever the game cards tell you to do.

Contents include: 30 plastic hair rollers, pencil, timer, 110 game cards, Dear Diary with notepad, and the instructions.

name: Tee Off! Das Golf-Brettspiel
description:
A golf simulation which includes all the elements of this sport: driving, pitching, putting, holes in one, water hazards, penalty shots, etc.

A full 18-hole course is featured on a beautiful huge board (98 x 68 cms).

Strategy and luck combine: players select a club (aggressive? conservative?) and then spin the distance disk to see how good their stroke was. The disk contains 26 different outcomes for each club.

name: The New Avengers Board Game
description: The objective of the game is to be the first player to get their three Avenger figures into the Assignment Completed Area.

name: Wildcat Soccer
description:
This is a card game for 2 players. Available for free download or in the files section.

Players represent the coaches of different soccer teams, but not "professional teams". You have to train and play with a team full of young and unexperienced players!

Play a game divided in 2 halves (like a real soccer game) and choose the right action in the right moment, because different players have different abilities (attack, defense, strength, etc.).

Who wins the match, wins the game.

Home Page: http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Proverbial Wisdom: Bible Edition
description: Proverbial Wisdom Bible Challenges players to sketch a proverb for teammates to guess, choose the correct meaning or origin of a proverb, or guess what proverb a pre-drawn picture represents. Players have sixty seconds to preform! 500 proverbs, familiar sayings and expressions are included. Ages 10 and up, 4 to 16 Players
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Trivia

name: Little Grey Rabbit
description:
Little Grey Rabbit is a children's card game based on the books by Alison Uttley and "pictured by" Margaret Tempest.

The object of the game is to collect the most counters, which are exchanged with other players according to instructions printed on the cards. Alarmingly, for a children's game, the rules suggest using matches for the counters!

Each player and "Wise Owl" (a dummy hand) are dealt cards which remain face-down. In each round, players reveal their top cards and follow the instructions, giving or taking counters as directed.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: Labirinto de Creta
description: On a round board, try to move 5 balls to the center of the labyrinth, without let any of them fall from the border.

name: Pökaspelet med Ronny & Ragge
description: In this game, the player take on the roles as "raggare" (Swedish fans of beautiful women and American 50's youth culture) and try to get their chosen "pök" (chick) to the gravel pit to do burnout in their "fårrd" (Ford). To do this, they have to collect essential raggar-paraphernalia like sideburns and Brylcreem, all the while avoiding the police cruiser and the slow moving Volvo. The game is based on Byhåla, a popular Swedish TV-show from the early '90s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Hack-away
description:
Hack-away is a roll and move game based on taking a pony on a hack through the country, with players sometimes having to answer questions about horses and horsemanship to avoid missing a turn or being sent back down the track.

There are shortcut bridleways that can be used, but these are riskier routes and may mean the player goes back to the start.

Although the game only comes with 4 pawns, there's no reason to stop 5 or more people playing the game, if you have different tokens for each player.

name: Kurt Olsson: Spelet om mig själv
description: Ever wanted to be a talk show host, just like Kurt Olssson? Here's your chance! Move around the board, make interviews with your fellow players, play silly games, demonstrate how to make thing out of milk cartons, guess the validity of incredible statements and much more. The first player to reach 60 minutes of air time wins!

name: Epyx VCR Golf
description:
Epyx VCR Golf features 18 different holes from the world's most famed golf courses. Pinehurst, Jupiter Hills, Miami's Doral Country Club and other equally spectacular courses. Epyx VCR Golf tests the very soul of classic golf strategy.

Play against yourself, against an opponent or three opponents. You move the ball from tee to green deciding each shot along the way. There are three ways a player can make a stroke: You can select a club card which includes a predetermined shot distance. You can roll the dice once you hit the green. Or you can play the videocassette featuring real live action footage, courtesy of ABC Sports and the PGA of America. And all the pros are there.

But, of course, the hottest pro on the tour is somebody you're very familiar with, You. You're the one who decides everything. Beginning to feel the pressure?

name: Catch 19
description:
36 balls are evenly distributed into 12 tubes. On your turn, empty a tube and place the balls in the next tubes, one each, going anti-clockwise. If you place a ball in an empty tube on your side you capture that ball and all the balls in your opponent's adjacent tubes.

The winner is the first to capture 19 balls, as there are 36 to start with.

It's a 3D game related to Mancala, but very different in physical style.

name: Swizzle
description:
From the game manual:
Swizzle is an easy to learn but challenging strategy game. Players try to get their chips three-in-a-line. Both players play cards and swizzles to determine where the chips will be played. Be prepared for the fun of unexpected endings in this fascinating game.

name: Apples to Apples: Yiddish Edition
description:
This game is completely in Yiddish--cards, box, and instructions. It is "based on the Apples to Apples 9+ card set" but cards have been changed to reflect the Yiddish culture. Recommended Ages 7 and up

288 cards total. Language-dependent.

Part of the Apples to Apples Series.
publishers: Kinder Shpiel, Out of the Box Publishing

name: Monopoly: Centenarium Benfica 1904-2004
description:
Special Monopoly edition dedicated to the one hundredth anniversary of the Sport Lisboa e Benfica football club.

This edition was not sold commercially and was distributed solely through the Record sports newspaper.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Peter Pan Game
description:
Box Description:

OFF TO NEVERLAND WITH PETER PAN! The Pirates, Indians, Tinkerbell and Captain Hook (Boo!) are all here. A delightful board game for 2, 3, 4 players Ages 6 and up.

Additional Notes:

Simple spin and move pawn type game for kids to relive the story of Peter Pan.

name: Wu-Pee
description:
The idea of this game is to collect the nine pieces that make up a clown. The game comes with 40 cards, each with a clown on one side of the card, and a portion of a larger clown puzzle piece on the backside. Whoever collects the nine pieces of a larger puzzle first, wins the game.

In Wu-Pee Disney Card Game there are 4 different Disney characters to collect.

Box and cards are significantly smaller than usual card games.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Around the world
description:
"Travel around the world in a fun-packed race, learning about countries, continents and oceans as you play".

A simple roll and move game based on a grid of 55 squares overlaid on a map of the earth. Players move their counters (airplanes) and obey any instructions for the square they land on.

name: The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game: Junior
description:
From the publisher:

How do you keep from spreading your poison oak rash? How do you get an alligator to let go of your friend's foot? Based on the best-selling books and games, this game brings the Worst-Case concept to kids, to amaze and educate a whole new way. Players have Tool Cards, that feature common items like a broom or water bottle. The kids hear a scenario and decide which tool can get them out of it. Tap the alligator on the nose with the broom to release your friend's foot. Use the water bottle to rinse off the plant oil and your poison ivy rash isn't contagious anymore! Just for fun, What's Worse? Cards give kids icky choices. Like, What's Worse: giving your cat a bath by licking it all over OR eating a giant bowl of dog food? Comes with a game board, 50 Tool Cards, 170 Game Cards, six What's Worse Chips, playing pieces and a die. For 2 to 6 players.

name: Gomer Pyle
description: Players race around the board, as Gomer Pyle, placing their men in to form a grand salute to Sergeant Carter.

name: "Struggle"...a game about life
description:
Struggle is a game about life. Each player/team starts with $650. Every time you pass Payday on the board you earn $1,500. You can purchase things like Auto and Life Insurance and 'You're The Boss' cards, make investments and pay bills.

Once players pass Payday three times they will draw a 'Last Will' card which will give them a cash bonus or make them pay a cash penalty. The winning player/team with the most money after counting their cash and investments is the winner.

name: Beat the Drum
description:
Beat The Drum is a game for 'Salvationists' as stated on the front box. It is described as a fascinating trivia game for Ages 12 and up

Various questions in the categories of - Salvation Army, General Quiz, Old Testament, and New Testament are asked in levels of Easy, Hard and Master. By answering the Easy, Hard and Master, players advance their marker one, three or five steps respectively.

The winner is the one who reaches GLORY first.

name: Rampant Colonialism!
description:
Miniatures rules for the Colonial Period (late 19th Century).


Rampant Colonialism! was designed to recreate colonial engagements both real and fictional with miniature figures.
While these rules were written with 15mm figures in mind, there are just as well used with 20mm and 25mm figures.
The period covered by these rules includes the French and Indian Wars through the late 19th Century, and even beyond into the early 20th Century for such conflicts as the Boxer Rebellion, and the African and Middle Eastern theaters of World War I.

Rampant Colonialism can be played with two or more players, and in fact makes a great multi-player game.
Each side is organized into a number of units, and optional command and control rules have been provided to maintain a chain of command for issuing and receiving orders.
Individual models are also used, and include officers/leaders, NCO's, sharp shooters and heroic individuals.
During a turn, a unit may move, fire and/or engage in melee with the enemy.
All combat is resolved with the use of a ten-sided die.

The weapon chart covers everything from black powder muzzle-loaders through magazine-fed rifles using smokeless powder.
There are also rules for cannon (both muzzle and breach loading) and machine guns.

The lists in the book include:

The French & Indian Wars
The Asante War, 1874
Second Afghan War, 1879
Zulu War, 1879
First Boer War, 1881
Sudan, 1885
Boxer Rebellion, 1900
WWI in the Middle East and Africa, 1914-1918


Best of all, the rules are simple, and they play quickly.

If playing Rampant Colonialism doesn't cut down on the "rules lawyering" syndrome in your gaming group, we'll eat our pith helmets!

–Description from publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I

name: Major League Baseball
description: Experience all the thrills and excitement of Major League Baseball. You are the manager of a National or American League team vying for first place and on to the World Series. Everyone can play. Your six year old (by the roll of dice) plays right alongside Mom and Dad while they answer the Trivia question cards. There are over 500 True and False, multiple choice or direct response questions on 100 cards. All this happens on two different parts of the unique gameboard with Manager and Umpire cards getting into the act adding to the frustration and momentum that are all part of the real baseball world. This is an officially licensed product of Major League Baseball.

name: Ratsutalli
description: In Ratsutalli (Finnish for "horse stable") you move around the board answering horse-oriented questions which gain you chips that you use to buy riding equipment in the "purchase squares". He who first manages to collect a predetermined amount of equipment wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Elvis: The Game
description: Answer questions in five separate categories as you relive the magical moments from the life and career of Elvis Aaron Presley. Correct answers earn players gold record albums. Be the first to return to Graceland with a collection of five different albums and you win the game.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: My First Picture Dominoes
description:
Number fun for preschool children.

My First Picture Dominoes helps preschool children learn to count, recognize numbers, and practice hand-eye co-ordination.


An exciting game for 1-4 players, Ages 3 - 5.
Reinforces observation and matching skills as included in the Early Years' Curriculum.
Developed in association with early learning consultants.


Contents:


28 sturdy domino cards featuring numerals and photographic images
Easy-to-follow instruction sheet with helpful note to parents and teachers

name: Charge!
description: Charge! appeared in White Dwarf issue 115. The game combines Citadel Combat Cards with Citadel Miniatures to create a very simple combat game or, using Games Workshops' Dungeon Lairs, a very simple dungeon crawl game.

name: Grandmama's Geographical Game
description: Typical Q&A card game featuring world geography.

name: 3.. 2.. 1.. meins!
description: Players bid for goods cards, trying to collect a set of 3 cards with one common characteristic: card color, goods type, or age of goods. Losing bidders pay a fee based on the highest denomination in the winning bid. Players can extend the bidding by playing a blockade chip. Going broke puts you out of the game.

name: Cite Coop
description:
A roll and move game around a circular board with "Chance" cards, where each player is trying to contribute to the building of a town/city.

The game is only printed in French.

name: Crossing Stonehenge
description:
This is a two player abstract strategy game that includes a unique custodian trap/freeze move. In Crossing Stonehenge, two druids and their armies, battle to cross from one side of Stonehenge to the other.

The game was initially made as a set of rules for the game Stonehenge.

name: Ultimate MindTrap
description:
The Ultimate MindTrap - the Challenge Continues is an incomparable collection of 300 all new murder mysteries, brainteasers, trick questions & visual experiences that will capture your imagination & challenge the way you think... and see !

In the twisted world of MindTrap, your team will encounter a variety of challenging categories. You will confront the classic mystery scenario that is richly illustrated & riddled with both clues & red herrings. Then you'll find yourself racing the opposing team in shaping a Tangram teaser or assembling a beguiling matchstick puzzler. Or for a completely different twist, stretch your imagination to identify a magnified photograph of a common object that you know you know, and yet, it hovers there, defiantly out of reach. All the MindTrap questions are written in humorous prose with a delightful twist that will make you laugh at the surprisingly simple solutions.

In MindTrap, it's not what you know that counts... it's how you think !

name: 360° Air Hockey
description:
360° Air Hockey with sound FX.
Fast flipper action for 2-4 Players. Ages 5 and up
It' just like air hockey.The object is to try and score in your opponents goal. The first one to score 10 goals first wins!

4 Player:
Place puck in center and let the fun begin! First person to 10 wins! Every time you shoot the puck into your own goal you lose a point. Just keep score on the score marker by sliding it over the number of pucks you have shot into an opponent's goal.

2 Player:
Same as above only the inserts are used to block two of the goals.

Other ways to play:
Place all 5 pucks on the playing field at once. When you have let 10 pucks into your goal you are out! Place one insert in to block one goal and continue this way until only one person is left....and you have a winner!

Takes 2 D batteries
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Party Game, Real-time, Sports

name: Kalamazoo on Board
description:
Kalamazoo is for sale!
Give the gift of Kalamazoo with Kalamazoo On Board.
Kalamazoo On Board is an exciting, one-of-a-kind celebration of community based on the famous "opoly" style real estate trading game. The game is customized specifically for Kalamazoo and showcases the businesses and attractions that make Kalamazoo so special.

Kalamazoo On Board is available at any Kalamazoo County Harding’s, Felpausch or D & W for only $34.99. Quantities are limited. Proceeds benefit the YWCA of Kalamazoo. Call (269)345.5595 for more information.
YWCA of Kalamazoo
http://www.ywca.org/site/apps/s/content.asp?c=bpLJJTOvHmE&am...;b=420727&ct=1210179

name: Cranium Grab & Go Super Jacks
description:
From the publisher:

The game of jacks gets fun Cranium twists!
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel
Laugh-out-loud fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends
Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Super Jacks!

Play jacks the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists. Can you play with your opposite hand? Can you spin the jack like a top on the lid of the can?

What's in the box? Super Jacks includes 10 jacks and 2 bouncy Cranium balls.

name: Horse Racing To-night
description:
An edition of the Pepys Board Game Series.

Game contains one large three-folded gameboard, 6 bakelite horses with jockeys (metal ones in a different edition) on wooden stands, 2 black and two red wooden dice, 2 bakelite dice shakers and three obstacles on wooden or metal wire stands (regarding how many horses start).

Players agree before play how long the racecourse they want to play. According to this the obstacle(s) are placed.
The dice are thrown, one showing which horse will move and the other how far this horse will ride.
Interesting rule is that always two dice-pairs are thrown simultaneously, speeding up play.
The obstacles do what they are designed for: Hinder a horses move.
It is advised that players place bets before commencing to play.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pompeii XV
description:
The game consists of a circular board with the numbers 1 to 12 in compartments and 15 numbered disks. The disks are tossed into he middle of the board and those that land face up can be placed in the numbered compartments as long as some simply rules are followed. Points are scored for every disk used and deducted for those face up disks that couldn't be used. The winner is the player with the most points.

The game is based on components excavated at Pompeii; the rules were produced by a computer analysis of the components (per an article by R. C. Bell in Games & Puzzles #65).

name: Monster Truck Math
description:
From the instruction page: This kit includes everything you need to play two fun math games. One game tests your addition skills. For the other game, subtraction skills are practiced.

Race your monster truck around and accross the game board as you solve the equations and win trophies!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: World Cup Cricket
description:
Players represent the batting and fielding sides in a game of limited overs cricket.
The fielding player sets up his field using white counters to depict his fielders. Counters also represent the batsman and umpires, though these are static.
For each ball in an over, a card is drawn from the deck to represent the outcome of that bowl (no ball, howzat etc.), and the result is recorded in an authentically detailed score book - meaning that at the end of the innings the scores will be represented as in a real match. The positioning of the field affects the likelihood of the batsmen being given out as well as the number of runs they will score.
The box includes: Game board, with all the major fielding positions marked; counters to represent fielders, batsmen and umpires (including several spares); a deck of cards for drawing each ball of the over; An in/out die (green and red sides); A fully authentic cricket score book; four blank cards for replacement/original outcomes.

name: Way to the White House
description:
Two to four players compete for Electoral votes, based on their knowledge of U.S. state capitols and their luck with a spinner. Starting with the player who has the spinner, the player who correctly guesses the state associated with a given capitol city gets to mark the state with his peg. When all states are claimed, the player with the most Electoral votes (as determined by the 1927 map board) is the winner.

At the time of this game, red was the color of the Democratic party and blue was that of the Republicans (vs. the current Republican=red state, Democrat=blue state association). For the third and fourth players, the Independent (yellow) and the Prohibition (natural) parties are also included.

This game was later sold, with minor cosmetic modifications, as E. E. Fairchild Corp.'s Battle of Ballots. The only major difference is that this version uses a spinner to randomly select capital cities, while the later version uses a deck of cards.

name: Hancock's Half Hour
description: This Chad Valley Board game from the early 1960's is based on Tony Hancock and his classic Hancock's Half Hour British television program. Hancock's Half Hour was a ground-breaking and influential BBC radio comedy series of the 1950s, starring Tony Hancock, with Sid James, Hattie Jacques, Bill Kerr and Kenneth Williams. From 1956 it also became a television comedy series. This is basically a track move game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Halifax On Board
description: Halifax On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Nova Scotia, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Bryony House – A Shelter for Battered Women.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fredericton On Board
description: Fredericton On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in New Brunswick, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Chimo Helpline Inc.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cedar Rapids On Board
description: Cedar Rapids On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the Iowa city. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Mercy Medical Center Auxiliary.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Waukesha County On Board
description: Waukesha County On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the county in Wisconsin. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Unplanned Pregnancy Connection Inc and Healthy Families of Waukesha County Inc.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Le Lys et la Cocarde
description:
Le Lys et la Cocarde is a game about the French Revolution.
Two to six players try to survive the Revolution traveling the gameboard from 1789 to 1799.
110 cards, 2 ten sided dice.

name: Buzz and Flutter's Big Electronic Game Book
description:
This is a big book that has several bug themed games in it.

PICNIC PATH - Be the first to make it to the cupcake finish. Watch out for the other bugs along the way that either help you or hinder your progress. (Similar to chutes and ladders.)

VEGETABLE GARDEN CHASE - Be the first to make it to the Watermelon. Watch out for the other bugs along the way that either help you or hinder your progress.

UNDERGROUND BUG HUNT - Choose your path through the ant hill. Trouble lies down each path, which obstacle do you want to face?

THE GREAT BUG RACE - Race through the fair. Participate in games and activities along the way, do well and move ahead, do poorly and move back.

LET'S MEET IN BUG TOWN - Be the firs to get to bug town. Choose your path, watch out for the traffic cops telling you to change directions because of closed paths.

LILY PAD TAG - Try to catch the other bug without putting yourself in the position of getting tagged. Duck down a side path to get close enough to strike on your next turn, but try not to get cut off by your opponent.
categories: Animals, Book, Children's Game, Dice, Electronic
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: They're At The Post
description:
The fun new game, that brings you all the excitement of the racetrack.

Each player places bets and then rolls two dice (one white and one green) to move the horses around the board. Each number on the dice represents one of the horses, the green die moves the horse forward two spaces whereas the white die only moves the horse forward 1 space.

name: The Eternity Game
description:
The Eternity Game is a Biblical trivia game for players ages 12 and up. Players answer questions in one of 5 different categories: Characters, Words, History, Geography, and Miscellaneous, and these questions are in 3 levels of difficulty: Easy, Harder, or Hardest.

The goal is to be the first person to move their token across the board to reach the space indicating "Eternity with Jesus". A player simply answers a question taken from one of the hundreds of question cards corresponding to the color of the space their token is on. The color of the space indicates the question's category and the number on the space indicates the difficulty level of the question. If answered correctly, the player rolls the die and moves accordingly. Should a player be unable to answer a question, the player on their next turn may attempt a lower level of question in the same category.

This game can be played in teams. There are also "Advanced Play" rules, in which the die is not used. In this rule set, once a player answers a question correctly, the token is moved ahead on the board the same number of spaces as the level answered (1, 2, or 3), and the player retains her turn until an incorrect answer is given.

name: Tervapata
description:
"An exciting game of chase"

This is a boardgame version of an old children's outdoor game. The game board is a circular track running around a boiling "pot of tar" (Tervapata). Each player has their own starting area with 4 playing pieces, which are moved by throwing 2 dice; players can choose whether to move two pieces, or to combine the results to move just one piece. Landing on an opponent's piece means that that piece immediately goes to the pot of tar, to be retrieved with a roll of 6 and then placed back to the owning player's starting area. This gives scope for some simple tactics: Should I try to concentrate on moving my own pieces as fast as possible, or to land on an opponent's pieces? And if so, whose?

The first player to get all 4 playing pieces to their goal area wins.

Paletti game no. 4047

name: Office Party
description:
From box:

"America's newest and most exciting party game. With this game all players really get down to the nitty gritty. Makes a great gift! (Any number can play)"

"The object of OFFICE PARTY is to have a rollicking good time. This will be achieved by drinking, stripping, winning chips, and indulging in general hanky panky."

The game consists of a board, die, candle with holder, chips, pawns, a "Boss's Cards" deck, and a "Sexetary's Cards" deck. The candle goes in the center of the board for ambiance.

The board has many tracks, similar to a Careers board. Players roll and perform various actions depending on the space landed on. The currency in the game is chips and articles of clothing. Chips can be bought for articles of clothing. "When a player has run out of both chips and clothing, he is declared a PARTY POOPER, and is at the mercy of the other players."

"NOTE: OFFICE PARTY does not condone gambling nor alcohol. Neither does it specify the measure of each drink taken. What the chips represent, and what is used for drinks, is left entirely to the discretion of the players. All we can say is, 'HAVE A BALL!'"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sarah Beeny's Property Ladder
description:
A spin-off from British TV series "Property Ladder", this game sees players navigate around the board trying to acquire, renovate, and sell prime residential property.

A bit like a far simpler and more modern 'Monopoly'. Players must first land on a 'buy' square to purchase up their first property: then increase its value with by spending money on 'developments' and 'advice cards'. Once the kitchen, bathroom and garden are renovated, the player can sell - if they land on the right square. A renovated property means a profitable sale: the extra cash can then be spent buying, and improving, a more expensive property. The winner is the first player to buy, renovate and then sell three properties in succession.

Landing on 'repairs' or 'council tax' squares can cost the player money; if you run out of money in hand, you have to 're-mortgage' your property, meaning you can't develop until you get more cash by passing Go. And if you're out of cash and have no un-mortgaged property, you're out of the game.

There's a balance to be struck between cash now and cash later: buying an expensive property early on, or investing a lot in the optional (but profitable) 'advice cards', pays higher dividends - but it can leave you stuck for ready cash and hold up your progress by re-mortgaging.

This amusing game was exclusively available at Marks & Spencer in Q4 2007.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trick-taking

name: Milo's Magical Card Game
description:
From the back of the box: "...a variation on the ever-popular game Happy Families, will delight children aged 4-up as it helps reinforce basic counting, colour identification, memory, and puzzle-solving skills." Game features cards with pictures by Marcus Pfister from his Milo books.

The cards also double as eight simple puzzles which form larger pictures when combined.
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Knabberbande
description: A trick-taking little game with prickly kakties, carrots-greedy hare-robbers and silly hens!

name: Queen Mary Steaming Round Great Britain
description: Players select plastic ships and begin their travel route around Great Britain by placing them on the board at London No. 1. After arranging starting-order, each player rolls the dice and advances their ship along the route corresponding to the number revealed by the throw. When the throw of the dice brings a player's ship exactly onto an obstacle or meets with other trouble, the player must do as directed. The first player to reach Chatham wins the game!

name: Lettro
description: With the Lettro - character cards you can play many popular games as Buchstaben-Memo for 2 to 5 players, or Alphabet-Training for 1 and more players,or Buchatebn-Quartett for 2 to4 players, Kreuzwort, ABC-Schnipp-Schnapp and finally Wörter-Poker.
publishers: AG Müller (AGMüller), ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Rhino Games

name: Brainy
description: The idea of BRAINY is to decode the secret three-line-pattern-code and to get as many chips as possible to win.

name: Sherlock Holmes: The Hand of Moriarty
description:
SHERLOCK HOLMES: THE HAND OF MORIARTY
Release date: May 2008

Sherlock Holmes has tracked Moriarty to a reception marking the opening of a museum of Egyptian Antiquities. He is surprised to meet Irene Adler there as well. The rest of the crowd are highly suspicious. That is when the museum’s benefactor is found murdered and a priceless necklace gone missing. The museum is sealed and Holmes is put on the case.

The Hand of Moriarty is a laminated folio game. It includes a 21x16 inch game map, and a separate set of laminated rules and example of play. The game does not include dice or tokens.

TYPE: Beginner Engle Matrix Game
PLAYERS: 2 to 8
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: ½ hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order

name: UNO: Over the Hedge
description: This themed version of Uno is based on the family film, "Over the Hedge." This version includes a special card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the Verminator's "Trap" card.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Old Shell Game
description: The object of The Old Shell Game is to be the first player to get his/her shell with the hidden pea to the opposite side of the board. Four player games can be played as individuals or as partners. Each player receives 3 shells and only one pea. The players secretly shuffle their shells, and places them on the three squares of their color. Players take turns. Two dice are rolled, and one shell is moved the number of one dice and another shell is moved the number of the other dice. A challenge occurs if one player's shell lands on the same space as an opponent's shell. The challenged player must lift up his shell, and if the shell contains the pea, then the challenger loses. The challenged player loses if no pea is uncovered. The following points are added to each player's score: 20 points for reaching the finish with your shell that has the pea; 10 points for a successful challenge; and 5 points for successfully defending a challenge. Several rounds are played until a player or team reaches a score of 100 points.
publishers: Berwick's Toy Co. Ltd., Selchow & Righter

name: Ripley's Believe It or Not!
description:
The Story Card is read aloud. Players choose to Believe It or Not! Those who choose correctly move the number of spaces shown on the card.
The Ripley's Believe It or Not Game takes you through the mysterious halls of Ripley's Museum where you will encounter unique treasures from around the world.
Land on an Exhibit Space and hear a wild tale about the exhibit you are shown. Do you Believe it or Not? Answer correctly and keep the card.

Win!
Collect an Exhibit Card from each room, be the first to exit the museum, and Win!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pink Panther
description:
Pink Panther is being held in a zoo, guarded by several zoo guards. Scattered around the zoo are eight face-down tool cards (crowbar, ladder, lifebuoy etc.) which are needed to release the Pink Panther, depending on what cage he's in. Moving around by the die roll, players must find the right tool and release Pink Panther from the cage, at which point they will start playing as the Pink Panther, trying to escape from the zoo. If a player lands on a zoo guard while carrying a tool they have been spotted and must replace the tool on the board; if they land on a guard as the Pink Panther, the guard puts him into the nearest cage, and he must be released again.

The player who manages to escape from the zoo with the Pink Panther wins.

There's also a rules variant where the game is played over several rounds in teams of two players.

This is Ravensburger game no. 00 147 7 (601 5 492 2)
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Swiss Quiz
description:
In Swiss Quiz, players will read statements concerning Switzerland and will have to vote whether these are true or false...

For each correct vote, the players will move their pawns toward their ultimate goal : the edelweiss !

A token-betting system enables players who take risk at the right time to advance faster if their answer is correct.

name: Kentalong Tennis Card Game
description: The game consists of 50 cards comprising 22 service cards and 28 play cards. The service cards dictate whether the service is to the backhand, forehand an ace or a fault. The play cards are made up of 5 each of the 4 combinations of backhand/forehand to backhand/forehand and 4 smash and 4 lob cards. Scoring is the same as in lawn tennis. The two packs (service and play) are shuffled and both players receive 4 play cards to form their hand. The server then places the top service card face up to show the type of serve. An ace is a point immediately won and if a fault is drawn then another card is immediately drawn and if this is another fault, the point is lost. If it is any of the other service cards, the opponent can return it only if he has a corresponding card that allows him to play the return type or he can play a lob card. A lob card can only be returned by another lob card or a smash card. A smash can only be returned by a lob. If a player cannot return with the appropriate card then he loses that point. Players replace cards as they are played from the draw deck to make a 4 card hand. Play continues until the correct number of sets (predetermined at the start) is won.

name: Grashüpfer im Zahlenland
description:
From the rules:
"Once upon a time there was a land of numbers.
The inhabitants counted everything they saw. They knew that there was one sun, three hills and twelve sunflowers. However there came the day when they had counted everything that could be counted in the land of numbers, and they became very sad.

That's when the little grasshopper remembered an arithmetic game his grandfather used to play with him. He invited the inhabitants in the land of numbers to play with him. So they competed with the little grasshopper, counting and jumping.
Up until today this is the favorite game of all the inhabitants in the land of numbers.

Dear Parents and Educators:
The game Grasshopper in the land of numbers combines, in a playful way, the physical activity with the learning of numbers. The games stimulate motor skills and acquaint the children, depending on their age and the variation chosen, with the numbers 1 to 10. For children a little older they offer a first approach to adding and subtracting. For the games, it is not always important that there is a winner. Children often have fun resolving a task together."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Buckaroo Banzai
description:
A card game based on the characters and events from the movie The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the Eighth Dimension.

One player plays Team Banzai, the other player is the Red Lectroids. To win the game, be the first player to win eight hands, or win three hands in a row. A hand is won by the player who plays the meld having the highest Action Point total.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Chain Home
description:
A solitaire pencil and paper game which puts the player in the role of a Royal Air Force commander seeking to intercept attacking German aircraft during the Second World War.

“The game combines successful use of radar and RAF fighter resources to intercept German air fleets during the Summer of 1940.” The game is played with a six-sided die, a pencil, and the game sheet. The game lasts fifteen turns.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Batman
description:
A card game inspired by the characters and events of the Batman comics and movies.

“One Player is Batman, the other is the Nemesis player. The Batman player uses the Batman Deck. The Nemesis player has 3 decks: the Villains Deck, Location Deck, and Action Deck. Object: The first player to accumulate ten Victory points wins.”
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bionicle Skirmish
description:
This is an abstract, skirmish-level combat with Bionicle theme. Each figure (unit) represents a single Bionicle. One player controls the good Toa Nuva. The other player controls the evil Rahkshi. You win if you destroy all opposing Bionicles.

Bionicle Skirmish is played on an 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the combatants. Both teams consist of seven unique Bionicles, and each Bionicle has a special power. However, the Rahkshi player only starts with six units on the board. The seventh evil unit, the powerful Makuta, does not appear unless the other six Rahkshi units are all eliminated.

The cards are central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, defend, or use special powers.

name: Border Keep
description: “Each player controls a small town in a fantasy setting. Every turn players build structures and hire heroes to defend their town. Some cards are used to send monsters and disasters to destroy your opponent’s towns. The Deck: The deck has 75 cards. These will have to be constructed before play is possible. Object: Have the most defenders and structures at the end of the game. Each defender and structure is worth 1 victory point. The game ends when the last card is drawn from the deck. In a multiplayer game, the game ends if all but one player’s town is destroyed.”
categories: Card Game, City Building, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Masters of the Universe
description:
"Help He-Man defeat Evil Skeletor and his Minions."

"One player uses a Good Deck. The other player uses an Evil Deck. Each deck has 2 discard piles: A Reserve pile and a Casualty pile."

"Object: A player loses when all of his Leader cards are in his Casualty pile. The other player wins the game."
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Norse Odyssey
description:
"A solo dice game of Viking Raids of the Ninth Century. Summer of 869...You and your 10 Kinsmen from Olafursdal, Norway build the most beautiful dragon ship ever constructed on the Heimdalsfjord and set sail to trade and loot the riches of Europe. It's early April and you have 32 weeks (turns) before you have to be back home when the winter comes."

"Victory: Keep book of the turns. If you don't get to Norway before turn 32 is over, you perish in the cold Northern European Winter. If you get to Norway, you can continue the next spring. With multiple players, the richest player is the winner on turn 32."
