categories: Dice, Fighting, Medieval, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Sudoku: Verflixte Streifen
description:
Sudoku: Verflixte Streifen is another title in Knizia's Sudoku series of games.

You have 9 stripes with 9 numbers on the front and 9 numbers on the back. Players place the stripes down following the rules of Sudoku. There are stripes in 4 colours. This allows 4 players to play simultaneously. The player to solve their Sudoku board first wins.

name: Aventura no Mar
description:
Adventure at Sea.

Meet the pirates and recover the treasure of King!

In this game, one player is the adventurer, who needs to find the Island of Treasure, the other player is the pirate, who hides the treasure.

This game is similar to Aventura na Selva

name: The Great Galumphus
description:
"The Great Galumphus, an amusing round game of cards."

An antique children's card game featuring a custom deck of cards marked only with colorful illustrations of fanciful animals and their unusual names. Some of these include the Painted Pooh Pooh, Puttyfaced Popcat, Hairless Hunkum, Long Eared Scootler, Spotted Snifflegrub, Lunar Lumpkin, Flying Umbratunk, and the Cissling Sand Snapper.

The design is credited to "Miss J. Veal" on the title card.

name: Dalli Dalli
description:
Boardgame which was published in Germany after the TV -Show Dalli Dalli by Hans Rosenthal was a tremendous success. Some special features of the show are implemented in the game (e.g Dalli Klick)
Box features Hans Rosenthal (1925 – 1987).

name: That's Life
description: At the beginning of the play each player specifies purposes in life for itself its, in whom he distributes at least 250 points on the different columns (social, career, luck, education and wealth). This is valid to reach it now in the play. Each player can contain questions, have their answer different effects to the markers of the purposes in life or also simple instructions to shift the markers. Some fields of the programme are barriers, which only to be overcome to be able, if appropriate values were reached with certain purposes in life. Who met its targets at the best one, the play wins.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Maisy's alphabet card game
description:
a set of 52 cards 26 capital and 26 lower case.

From the back of the box:

There are lots of games to play with these colorful Maisy alphabet cards -

Identify the letter and name the picture
Put the the cards in alphabetical order
Spell simple words
Play a memory game
there are lots of possibilities


All the while, children learn the alphabet and build their vocabulary.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Mikkelipeli
description:
This is the Mikkeli version of the Kaupunkipelit (City Games) series. Mikkeli (S:t Michel) is a town in Southern Savonia, and hosted the headquarters of the Finnish armed forces during World War II.

Kaupunkipelit is a series of games, each of which is basically a light version of Monopoly localized to a city/region of Finland. The games promote local companies, councils, educational institutes etc. and were designed as a fund raising effort for local sports clubs.

The main differences between these games and Monopoly are:

-Instead of a "street" each square on the board represents a local business.
-There are no hotels or houses, but each square has two title deeds instead of just one, allowing two players to jointly own any location on the board.
-The majority of the event cards are trivia questions about the locality the game is set in.
-While the effects of the first two corner squares (Go and Jail in Monopoly) remain the same for every edition (Go and Stock Market Crash), the effect of the other two corners varies from edition to edition and is the only real difference between them (except for the trivia content, of course). They are typically also local businesses but without title deeds and thus no rent either, but some special effect instead, such as pass a turn or get an extra throw.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bismark
description:
Bismark [sic] is a low priced 2 player strategy board game covering the epic naval confrontation between the German battleship (actually known as the Bismarck, with a 'c') and the British Royal Navy.

In may of 1941, the German navy has sent is greatest battleship out to begin hunting British commerce, trying to disrupt the British naval supply lines and otherwise distract the British while the bulk of Germany's armed forces were heading eastward. In this game the German player must take the Battleship Bismark and the heavy cruiser Prinz Eugen out to sea and north of the British isles past the Denmark Straits and out into the Atlantic where it can prey upon and sink vital British convoys.

The British must sink the Bismark at all costs. Failure to do so will mean a menace upon their shipping they can ill afford. The might of the Royal Navy is surely capable of the task, but the real challenge will be, how long will it take and what will be the costs. Victory in Bismark will depend on how much shipping the Germans are able to sink before the Brits are able to sink the Bismark.

Game Components:
1 22x17 inch Full Color Map in 2 pieces
1 D10
Rules
Over 90 full color cut out units on adhesive paper
Cardboard to stick counters on

name: Apples to Apples Niños
description:
Apples to Apples Niños consists of two decks of cards in Spanish: Red Apple cards (persons, places, things, or events) and Green Apple cards (adjectives). Each turn, the current judge selects a Green Apple card and players try to pick a Red Apple card from their hands that best match that the chosen card. The judge then chooses the Red Apple card is most like the word on the Green Apple card. The judge gives the Green Apple card to the player whose Red Apple card was chosen.

Once a player has won a four Green Apple cards, that player wins.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Sudoku Mania! Le défi
description:
Contents:
- 1 book of rules
- 4 grids and 4 hiding screens of same colour
- 324 oval coins with figures
- 324 squared coins with figures
- 4 scoring boards and 4 pawns

The purpose is to be the quickest to solve a common Sudoku problem, each player having his own color for grid and numbers. The first to solve his grid wins 3 points, the second 2 points, and the third 1 point. First to raise 9 points is the winner.

The book of rules have 100 grids and solutions.

name: Superman
description:
“Card game for 2 or more players. Each player takes on the role of Superman on a similar but alternate parallel Earth. Players compete to see who captures the most powerful villains.”

The players attempt to play combinations of cards to capture Villains. A combination must include the Villain Card to be captured, together with up to two Weapon Cards and one Plot Card. These cards represent the total Villain Point Value. The player must then play a Superman card together with Power, Ally, and Equipment Cards having a higher total value than the Villain Point Value.

Opponents may then play Weapon and Plot Cards to aid the Villain. The player may then respond by playing additional Power, Ally, and Equipment Cards. If the total value of the Superman cards still exceeds the total Villain Point Value, the Villain is captured and placed in the players Prison Pile together with all Weapon and Plot Cards played to support the Villain.

The game ends after the last card is drawn from the deck. The winner is the player having a Prison Pile worth the most total points.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Antony's Retreat from Parthia: 36 BC
description:
In 36BC the Roman world was divided between Octavian and Antony. Octavian's legions were training for the inevitable clash by campaigning on the Rhine, and Antony needed a campaign to get his forces, living in the luxury of the East, in top shape. Political turmoil in Parthia suggested easy pickings, together with an opportunity to avenge Crassus' famous defeat in 55BC. Antony therefore assembled an army of eighty thousand men, including Armenian allies of dubious loyalty, and late in the campaigning season he set off through Armenia to attack the Parthian capital at Ecbatana, The first objective was Phraata, a Median city which must be captured to maintain communications with Armenia. Here Antony halted to wait for his siege train to catch up. Unfortunately, it never arrived. A Parthian army under the command of Monaeses ambushed and destroyed the train, and at this point the Armenians deserted en masse. Antony was now left in the middle of Media, with no siege train and his communications cut, and one quarter of his army already lost.

2 players game on the disastrous retreat of Antony's army from Parthia in 36 BC. Published in Slingshot magazine # 123.

name: Soccer League Training Game
description:
The author says that the game tries to simulate and teach soccer tactics, the intended audience were soccer enthusiasts and sports clubs; the flyer to the game shows the 1974 world champions Gerd Müller and Jürgen Grabowski as well as Helge Andersen (game critic) and Holger Obermann (sports journalist, trainer) uttering enthusiastic opinions about the game.
The game comes with a huge velour-covered gameboard and two teams of 11 players each. The men get a movement allowance equal to the roll of a die, and on an odd roll the player may continue with another turn. Rules for nearly every conceivable real-life soccer situation. Two egg timers are available to limit each player's time to move.
However, the rules sometimes seem far-fetched and often do not give real choices to the players. This, of course, also affects the value as a training and simulation game, and the game vanished from the shops as quickly as it came.

The 1987 edition contains a smaller variant of the game named "Hallen-Cup" on the reverse side of the board.
mechanics: Action Points, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Who Knows
description: Who Knows is 'an intellectual and exciting game' published by John Jaques & Sons, London around 1930. There is a bag full of questions (Where is Long Island? Off the coast of New York.) and a set of cards with divisions on to place those you get right. The winner is the player who fills his card first (36 right answers)

name: Tatun ja Patun Suomi-peli
description: Tatu and Patu are characters in Finnish children's book series. In this game you're travelling with them around Finland and get to answer trivia questions regarding Finland.

name: Mayor of Metropolis
description:
From the rules:

"Welcome to Mayor of Metropolis!® This unique game of real estate development for 2-4 players offers far more choices, and demands more complex strategies than other real estate games. Amazingly, games progress quickly, and victory is often achieved in less than one hour.

Streets in Mayor of Metropolis® are five blocks long. Properties can be developed with homes, condos or retail stores. Because you don't need a 'monopoly' to build, you will constantly be making choices about where to build, what to build and when to build.

Players can see at a glance who owns every property by simply by looking at their CityPad.® You'll have chances to speculate in rural land, municipal bonds to bid for, and most importantly, an elections strategy to plan.

In Mayor of Metropolis®, you can win by popularity with the voters, as well as through sheer economic power. Since the elections occur at different times in each game, you'll spend countless hours trying to develop winning strategies!"
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Kingdom Quoor
description:
From the Back of the Box:

Amass your Royal Warriors and rally your camp. You have been granted the honor of defending Kingdom Quoor from the vile dragon scourge and rescuing her fair maidens.

Seek the sometimes costly aid of the citizens enlist the unique talents of the friar, the assassin, the wizard, the temptress and, more.

Bid for control and plot your every move, help your cause or hinder your opponents.

The many decisions are yours.

Temper your forces before entering a lair. Slay the beasts and collect your rewards.

Tactful competition or purposeful sabotage. Race against your vile opponents to prevail.

Experience the menace and marvel of Kingdom Quoor.

name: Forward March
description:
Forward March is an educational game teaching music theory that can be played as a board or a card game with 2-6 players, partners or teams.

Over 250 questions on notes, intervals, chords, key signatures, scales, meter and music vocabulary are for three different levels of play from early elementary to intermediate. When questions are answered correctly pieces move around a board and the first person to space 32 wins.

name: Jättipotti
description:
The original jackpot game - Jännittävä kasinopeli ("An exciting casino game")

The deck of cards has 4 suits - triangle, circle, square and star, which also appear on the dice - as well as empties and various special cards. The idea is to roll the 3 dice and to follow up with cards from your hand to make point-scoring series; for example, 3 triangles from the dice followed by 3 triangles from your hand scores 10 points. Triangle and circle are 'normal' suits while star is a kind of joker suit in that it can be combined with the other suits as well as stars, and the square is a negative suit but only if you get 3 of them on the dice; the other players can then follow with more squares from their hand to give you more negative points. There are also 9 different special cards which allow you to steal points from other players, change the direction of play, etc., while the empties are only there to mess up your hand. The board has slots for each player's point card and players use the transparent chips to keep track of their scores.

The object is to be the first to score 100 points or win the game directly by getting the Jackpot ie. 3 stars from the Pop-O-Matic followed by 3 stars from your hand.

Contents:

1 plastic gameboard with Pop-O-Matic dice roller
150 cards
8 transparent plastic chips
4 point cards
4 point tables
Rules

name: Gefira
description:
From the back of the box:

Lead your people to the other side!

Gefira...the only way out of the wretched jungle. Guide your explorers across a dangerous and unstable hanging bridge in a race of life and death. Your opponent will try to boycott, slow and outsmart you. You will need a sound strategy and use all of your wits to succeed in your mission!

But beware... snakes, strong winds, floods and more will cross your path on a bridge already half in ruins!

Overview:

Players need to escape the jungle by crossing a bridge. Crossing is made more strategic and difficult by flipping and replacing parts of the bridge based on cards that are drafted that can trigger events - both negative and positive.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Polar Bear A-B-C
description:
Welcome to the icy world of Polar Bear A-B-C, the game where everybody fishes for letters, and works together to spell a word!

This game is one in the latest wave of games by Cranium for preschoolers. These games intend to bring parents and their little ones together by participating in a fun and interactive setting.
The three games in the trilogy (Puppy Pals Bingo, Duck Duck 1-2-3 and Polar Bear A-B-C) are a fun way for your preschooler to learn about matching shapes and patterns, simple counting and spelling.

In Polar Bear A-B-C, a word is chosen for the round and you must use your magnetic fishing rod to fish for letters from the icy lake, and then use these letters to help spell out that word. Players take turns in fishing but any letters caught that are not needed for the word must be dropped into leftover letter lake!

name: I Spy Private Eye
description: Become an I Spy Private Eye.....can you remember what you spy? Shake up the cubes,press the timer and go! You have 30 seconds to spy the I Spy images on all 9-picture cubes before they are hidden from view. "Beep,Beep!"...times up! Examine the evidence. Choose one I Spy picture card and find all the images that match the cubes and score points....but watch out for a challenge!

name: Destination Southampton
description:
A game of taxi driving around Southampton. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of Southampton's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

name: Book of Mormon Quest
description:
A sister game to Bible Quest, this one uses a different game mechanic and is aimed Latter-day Saint (Mormon) families, drawing on knowledge of the Book of Mormon. It includes a somewhat Pacheesi/Sorry-like board, rules/questions booklet, 12-sided die, 4 pawn, 4 Celestial Markers (colored tokens), 10 white bonus tokens.

In a turn, a player is first asked a trivia question from the booklet, about the Book of Mormon, along with the 3 suggested answers. (Wee folk can get just 2 answers to choose from.) If answered correctly, the player rolls the die and moves his pawn around the outer track. Several outer spaces affect the player's next turn (roll & move twice, choose which direction to go, etc.)

Each player also has an inner path, whose steps are labeled with important spiritual steps (baptism, confirmation, temple marriage, enduring to the end) toward the center (heaven). Their Celestial Marker is placed on the first step when the pawn lands on a colored space; each step after that comes from turning in 2 bonus tokens, which are earned by landing on a corner space. The first player to the center wins.

Options are also described for cooperative play, team play, activities, chance cards, etc.

name: Koning van Katoren Theaterspel
description:
Just like in the theater play the idea is for the players to fulfill assignments. Whoever first completes four assignments is the winner and becomes the new King of Katoren. The assignments may be fulfilled in any which order, except the jump off the tower, which must always be the final assignment.

To start an assignment the player must first go on a train trip. The journey consists of two tickets and each assignment consists of three tickets.

To win you must lay out 20 tickets. For the final assignment, the player may only play the second ticket when he/she has collected 5 pillow tiles.

name: Tannenberg 4
description:
Introduction
Tannenberg 4 is a wargame about the Russian offensive into East
Prussia 1914, later known as The Battle of Tannenberg.

What You Need To Play
1 hex map tile
3 army tiles
dice
turn counter token (optional, not included)

(This game is also available as a VASSAL module.)

The Map Tile
The map on the map tile shows part of East Prussia. On the
map is that it has a grid of hexagons ('hexes'). There
are railroads in some hexes. One hex (Konigsberg) also has a fort.
On the map tile is also printed the Combat Results Table
(CRT) used to resolve combat (see below) and a turn track.

Army Tiles

One player (the "Russian Player") plays the attacker, controlling the two tiles representing the Russian 1st and 2nd armies. The other ("German") player plays the defender, controlling the third tile, representing the German 8th army. Each army tile has two numbers printed on it. The one to the left is the combat power of that army. The one to the right is the movement allowance of the unit,
which is 1 (one) for all armies. In the rest of these rules, the army tiles are refered to simply as "units". A unit, as long as it is in the game, is always in (only) one hex on the map. Two units are adjacent to
each other if they occupy hexes that are adjacent (that is if they share a common border). Two units may never occupy the same hex. The Russian units are enemy units to the German unit and vice versa.

Victory
If only one player has (an) unit(s) remaining on the map, then that player wins immediately. Otherwise, after 10 turns the Russian player wins if there is a Russian army in the fort (Konigsberg). If the Russian player did not win the German player wins (there can be no draw).

Part of the 4 Tile Contest:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/383408

Freely available: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/3170712#3170712

Added under a Creative Commons Attribution licence.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Clan Battle
description: Clan Battle is a game of conflict and elimination for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game. The game starts with the outer ring of Stonehenge seeded with guards and walls. Players play cards to fight for possession of spaces on the outer ring, and to position guards there. On your turn, you have the option to reveal a trilithon card to try to eliminate a random opponent. The last person in the game wins. Alternatively, if the current king is eliminated, the player with the most guards in play wins.

name: Ugler i mosen
description:
Ugler i mosen is a game licensed from NRK (the Norwegian broadcasting) and their children's nature program. The players create fantasy animals by mixing upper and lower halves of animals, mimic animal sounds and solve rebuses. The first player to complete all tasks is the winner.

Contents:

5 game boards
1 playing piece
1 die
24 animal cards
16 owl chits
12 post cards
12 question chits

name: Monopoly: Tampere
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A version of Monopoly based on the Finnish city of Tampere.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Flam-boozle
description: A two-dimensional word deduction game. Each player writes five words in a small crossword-style grid and tries to deduce the other player's words. Players take turns asking what letter is in a specific square, and then (if there was a letter in the square) for the location of a specific letter. The winner scores 100 points minus 20 points per word the losing player completely found.

name: Operation Olympic: The Invasion of Japan
description:
This solitaire hex-and-counter wargame covers the planned invasion of the home island of Japan in the event that the Manhattan Project failed to bring about Japan's surrender. The player plays the Allies against the Japanese, who are run by the game system.

The game comes with a hex map of a portion of Japan, rules, and approximately 200 square counters.

name: Siege: Richard the Lionhearted at Acre
description:
A wargame, set in the Crusades, simulating the Christian army under Richard the Lionhearted laying siege to the city of Acre in the summer of 1191.

The game comes with approximately 200 counters. The map is a gridded representation of Acre and the surrounding region. The map consists of 10 sheets which must be arranged properly to create the grid.

name: Der Schatz des Marco Polo
description:
When Marco Polo returned to Venice in 1295, he had to leave his treasure behind in the Chinese city of Hang-Tschou. The treasure was well hidden, and marco Polo left hints on where to find it in various pagodas and buildings across the city.

In "Der Schatz des Marco Polo" (The Treasure of Marco Polo) the players search Hang-Tschou for that treasure. Once a player has found it, the others will try to snatch it away.

In the first part of the game the players move through Hang-Tschou looking for hints. The hints always point to buildings in the city. When a player has gathered two hints of the same kind he needs to move to that location to uncover where the treasure is hidden.

This starts the second, co-operative phase of the game. If the player who got the hint manages to reach the treasure he wins. From now on, though, all other players will try to hunt him down. If they succeed they share the loot among themselves and the first player loses.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Adventures of Robin Hood
description: Basic spin and move game with an extremely colorful game board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Red Handed
description:
Don't get caught red handed...

Someone is trying to frame you for murder, and you have only one option left - frame them first.

You'll have to locate enough evidence to link them to the killing - the murder weapon, incriminating documents and a personal effect from the deceased.

But locating the items is the easy part...you've got to plant the evidence on your rivals to make sure they're caught red handed before they do the same to you!

name: Ohne Bewährung
description:
The title means "without parole". This is a simple game about experiencing prison regime. The players are prisoners who have to reach different goals for being released from prison as soon as possible.
The players have to roll a die to move their pawns. They have to reach special locations to receive rewards. If they reach other special squares they have to draw event cards and act accordingly.
The game was published and manufactured by a german prison, the JVA Moers-Kapellen.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Korkeasaaripeli
description:
A roll and move game where the players move around Korkeasaari (the Zoo of Helsinki). The objective of the game is to visit the 12 sights and get back to the ferrydock before anyone else does.

Contents:

game board (the map of Korkeasaari)
72 green cards to cover the visited sights (with three alternative backsides; new throw, wait one turn and empty)
48 orange action cards
6 board cards (include the 12 sights player must visit)
6 pawns
1 dice
1 instruction sheet


There is no real information about the publishing year. 1984 was the year the artwork for the box and the board was signed.

name: Almauftrieb happy-time
description: Traditional game in which the children try to drive their animals to a meadow, using color dice which move an animal to the next free square of that color.

name: Insult Bingo
description:
Using web based or software based bingo card generators, players create bingo cards filled with various vulgarities and insults. (Many card generators are widely available that will create random cards from a wordlist) Players conceal their bingo card from others during the game. During their turn players will shout insults at another player who then has to mark off any that are on his/her bingo card. The length of the insult/vulgarity string can be varied for what each group enjoys. Players who get a "Bingo" are out of the game. Play continues until one player remains.

Varients include any of the standard "Bingo" varients.
Best enjoyed with an easygoing group with an open mind.

name: Metsa Peremees
description:
This fun game gives you a change to determine the winner with a honest fight. Rabbits and foxes walk around the forest and search different kinds of things: berries, bones, flowers, buttons, bugs, mushrooms etc. By trading and collecting you have to get most points by the end of the game to become the king of the woods (metsa peremees). And by playing you will learn fast, that no stepping on the trees!

Game box contains:
* game board,
* 45 signs,
* 6 rabbit and fox pawns
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Environmental, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Golf
description:
Board game is for small and big fan of Golf based on the real rules of golf. More and more people sink into the unique world of golf. This game helps you to orientate in basic rules and golf terminology. The goal of player is to play ball from tee to the hole with as few shoot as possible. Board games were prepared with maximum observance of length, shape and difficulty holes including handicaps.

Box content:
1 doublesided game board
8 dices
8 pieces
score card
1 instructions

name: Full On AFL
description: Full On AFL is the new action packed, Aussie Rules Football board game. It uses no trivia questions - just a unique Directional Dice to shoot and score! Non-stop, full-on, family fun!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Split 1000
description: The game consists of number cards (1-10, 12, 15, 20, 25) and color cards. In a move, a player places two cards on an open stack. If he or she can place a number card higher than the previous one plus a color card of the same color on one stack, he or she gets to keep it (until it is taken away by another player).

name: Monopoly: Editie Brussel
description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade the property of the Belgium capital Brussel.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Vilda västern
description:
Wild West

A roll and move game with a Wild West theme. It starts at the prairie and ends with finding a golden nugget.

name: Robots vs. Dinosaurs
description:
History books won't tell you of the epic battles between Dinosaur and Robot. On one side, the scaly green behemoths fight for their land. On the other side, the shiny steel automatons wage war for...well, whatever it is that Robots want.

In this card game, each player chooses one side of the battle and must use strategy, luck, and cunning to outlast and outmatch the enemy.

Slashing claws, pounding metal fists, and clawing talons will finally give way to a winner...

Who will win in this titanic war?? Robots or Dinosaurs?!

For two players, this is a light-hearted strategy card game that the whole family can enjoy.

name: The Armor of God
description: In the Armor of God players exercise their faith (by playing faith cards) in an effort to be the first to put on the whole Armor of God (Breastplate of Righteousness, Helmet of Salvation, Shield of Faith, Sword of the Spirit, Loins Girt with Truth, and Feet Shod with the Gospel of Peace). Be sure to use your opportunities wisely or you will be unable to fully arm yourself.
publishers: Keystone Games, LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: The Royal Pastime of Cupid or Entertaining Game of the Snake
description:
The Game of the Snake is an adaptation of the Game of the Goose Game of Goose. It is a simple roll and move game played with two dice, with spaces that cause you to move back, lose a turn, etc. If one reads the rules which are printed on the game board, there is also an element of gambling as well as elements of an early party or drinking game.

The game starts by the players agreeing on "what to play for," "which is to be lay'd down and then you must throw who shall play first." Some spaces require the player to put up an additional wager: "He that throws upon 38 must feast with Cupid paying his share, that is, as much as he stak'd down first, and must remain there till his Companions have play'd once about." If you land on space 30 you have to wash yourself in the fountain "until dispac'd by some other." If you land on 59, the bottle space, the player is "to drink a Glass and pay a stake till his turn comes to throw again."

The earliest known version was published in Antwerp, ca. 1620, by Pieter de Jode as "El Juego Real de Cupido". A copy of this version, published for the Spanish market, can be seen in the British Library (ref: Maps * 999(1) See also: https://www.bl.uk/picturing-places/articles/the-royal-game-o...). A French translation was published in Paris, ca. 1640, by the widow of Charles Petit as "Jeu Royal de Cupidon" (private collection http://www.giochidelloca.it/scheda.php?id=1240 ) and a version was published in Amsterdam, ca. 1625–1640, by Claes Jansz. Visscher. This version, "Het Nieuw slange Spel anders Genaemt Koninclycke Tytkorting van Cupido" ("The New Snake Game, otherwise known as the Royal Pastime of Cupid"), introduced the peasant dance as the central motif, which was reproduced in some later English editions. A copy can be seen in the Rijksmuseum Amsterdam (https://www.rijksmuseum.nl/en/collection/RP-P-OB-77.369).

The earliest known British edition was published ca. 1690–1700 by John Garrett at his shop "next the stayres of the Royal Exchange in Cornhill", London, with the peasant dance motif. A copy of the Garrett edition is included in the George Clarke print collection, Worcester College, Oxford (http://prints.worc.ox.ac.uk/about.html).

William Dicey published an edition ca. 1736–40 from his press in Bow Churchyard, London, using the same design. An example of the Dicey edition can be found in the John Johnson Collection of Printed Ephemera, Bodleian Library [where it is incorrectly dated "1794"]: (http://digital.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/inquire/p/6ff20133-45bb-427...).

A different design was employed in the edition published by Laurie & Whittle, 53 Fleet Street, London, in 1794. The central motif shows cupid sharpening his arrow. A copy of the Laurie & Whittle edition is included in the John Johnson Collection of Printed Ephemera, Bodleian Library (http://digital.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/inquire/p/7e4aa3bb-b2e6-4f0...). This edition was published in a later state by R. H. Laurie (Laurie's son) ca. 1850. An example can be found in the Victoria & Albert Museum (V&A E.1747-1754 http://collections.vam.ac.uk/item/O26286/the-royal-pastime-o...). James Lumsden & Son of Glasgow also used this design in an edition published ca. 1810–1830. A copy of the Lumsden edition is also included in the John Johnson ephemera collection (http://digital.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/inquire/p/278f99e8-623d-45a...).

A third design was used by the Bowles family. The first Bowles edition was published by Carington Bowles, St Paul's Churchyard, London. The game is included in Carington Bowles's "New & Enlarged Catalogue" published in 1784, so we can estimate a similar publication date for the game (it is not included in the earlier Bowles catalogue, published by John Bowles & Son, in 1753). A later state of this edition was issued Carington Bowles's son, Henry Carington Bowles, who traded from the St Paul's Churchyard address as Bowles & Carver between 1793 and 1830.

While the coiled serpent design is reminiscent of the ancient Egytptian game Mehen, there is no evidence of any relation between the two other than the spiral track. The same can be said of the relation between this game, as well as of Mehen and the Game of Goose being related to the Phaistos Disk, which dates to about 1600 BCE and which some have theorized may be an ancient board game. We are sure, however, that "The Royal Pastime of Cupid, or Entertaining Game of the Snake" is an adaptation of "The Game of the Goose".
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Bowles & Carver, John Garrett, R. H. Laurie

name: Star Track
description: A simple roll and move game. You need a 6 to launch your rocket. Other spaces provide various good and bad effects.

name: Schiff ahoi!
description: The game is played on a 12 x 7 grid. Each player has six ships and tries to sink the other player's fleet. A die determines how far a ship can move; the direction can be changed once per move. Islands and other ships are obstacles. If a ship hits another ship with the last point of the movement, that defending ship is sunk.

name: Ganoven Memory
description:
Gamoven memory is a memory game in which you have to find pairs of hudlums AND one handcuff. You turn over three instead of two cards if you have found a hudlum pair. Only if you can also find one of the handcuffs you will get the pair. Each pair is valued differently (x * 1000 $). The player with the highest money value wins the game.

69 cards included in the game.

name: Monopoly: Fishing – Prized Catch Edition
description:
Whether you’re fly fishing for trout, trolling for salmon or in deep pursuit of a prized marlin, the Fishing Edition of MONOPOLY is sure to reel you in for the ultimate fishing experience. Anglers can buy, sell and trade the most sought after catches in the world of fishing from largemouth bass and spotted trout to tarpon, king salmon and swordfish. So, get your reels, bait and tackle ready and go fishing, MONOPOLY style.

Six collectible tokens include Tackle Box, Lure, Reel, Fisherman’s Hat, Net and Waders

Ages 8+
2-6 players
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: KenKen
description:
KenKen puzzle put into a multyplayer format.
Do not repeat a number in any row or column.
The numbers in each heavily outlined set of squares, called cages, must combine (in any order) to produce the target number in the top corner of the cage using the mathematical operation indicated.
Cages with just one box should be filled in with the target number in the top corner.
A number can be repeated within a cage as long as it is not in the same row or column.

name: Dangermouse Saves the World
description:
In Dangermouse Saves the World players take on the role of secret agents travelling the globe to foil Baron Greenback's world-threatening scheme.

Players move around a track on the outside of the board while the peice representing Baron Greenback moves between key locations on the world map at the centre of the board.His movement is determined by a coloured die, and the whim of the player to the right of the turn-taker.

Player collect Assignment Cards for the key locations - these are required to win the game - and Peril Cards which contain instructions for the player.

Pices are full colour card with plastic stands. Cards are full colour on one side and black and white on the other. Instructions fill both sides of an A5 sheet.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: In Other Words Bible Edition
description:
This is a Christian version of the classic game. The categories include New Testament, Old Testament, Psalms, Proverbs, Hymns, etc.

Includes a colorful board, special dice, cards, pawns, rules, score chips, and a storage insert.

name: Nuggets, The Rush To The Klondike
description: This Selchow & Richter Game from 1937 is an adventure game where players try to go the Klondike in an attempt to find gold. They must supply themselves with the correct equipment and then follow the path to the gold, avoiding hazards that are put in their path. The first player to discover gold wins!
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rainforest Safari
description:
From the publisher: "As adventurers on a photo safari, You'll travel through an exotic rainforest in which surprises and hidden treasures pop up around every turn. Roll the die and move to the space with the matching color along the easy to follow path. Be sure to collect all the puzzle pieces because the first explorer to complete their puzzle is the winner!"

This is part of the "Pop-up Games" line, a series in which the boxes unfold to become gameboards with pop-up scenery.

name: 22 Ku-du
description:
From the Publishers web site:
In Brief: 22 Ku-du is the wood tile math crossword game that's fun for all ages. Easily adaptable to all skill levels. Make all your rows and columns total 22. Learn while you play. 108 all-wood tiles

In Detail
Each player draws 7 tiles to begin play. Players make crosswords of numbers so that each grouping adds up to 22. As tiles are used to make a "22" a player yells "Ku-Do" and draws more tiles so that they are always working with 7 tiles. Play continues until all tiles are gone. Each "22" scores 1 point. Use of two of the same number in the same equation scores an extra point and three of the same number scores two extra points. Each player checks the other player's crossword and scores if they find any errors.

Many variations of play are left to the player or teams, depending on age or desire. Players can determine the number of rounds for each game, can use dice to set a new "goal" number in each round, or can use the color number tiles as either positive or negative numbers. Many different variations are possible to enhance the game and match the players skill level.

name: Fire At Will, Men
description:
Miniatures rules for fighting mass fantasy battles with 6mm figures.

Capsule description from the designer's website:

"One Brain Cell Heroic Fantasy Wargame Rules. Designed to be simple, these are fast moving rules involving knights, orcs and mages and all that Don't expect pages and pages of weapons and armour lists, loads of results tables, buckets of silly dice or complex record keeping."

"This is an easy to operate game all about command, control and fast play gaming. All you need are the figures some cheap terrain and imagination."

name: Conni kommt in die Schule
description:
A game collection with 4 learning games, age 5-7.

Common gameplay: The player rolls a die, moves the Conni figure that number of spaces on the board, and tries to solve the task on the target space. If he succeeds, he gets a part of a "Schultüte" (First-Day-Of-School-Surprise-Bag). The player(s) who first collect all 5 pieces win the game.

The tasks are suited for first graders: adding and subtracting numbers up to 10 (or 20); searching for the starting letter of an item; memory variants with letters, items, and numbers.

name: Feed the Elephant
description: Early 1950's game of flicking peanuts into an elephant's mouth. First player to 12 wins.

name: Go Goal! Ole! Tournament
description:
In Go Goal! Ole! Tournament each player contols a team of five footballers. On their turn each players can spend up to one action for each footballer they control, not including the goalkeeper.

That action may be to move the footballer 1 space in any direction, to tackle another player, to pass the ball to another footballer or empty space, play an SFC (Special Function Card) or shoot for goal.

To tackle, each player rolls a D12. If the attacker wins, the two footballers exchange places and the attacker gains possession of the ball.

To pass the ball to another player or space, you just need to have line of sight to the space you're aiming for and it needs to be in a straight line (like the queen's movement in chess). You then simply place the ball on that player or space.

Each player recieves 3 Special Funcion Cards in each half of the game which can be played at any point during your turn.

To shoot at goal, each footballer figure has a spring-loaded knee joint which you pull back and release. This is where the dexterity aspect of the game comes in.

There are 90 of these super-quick turns in a standard game, and whoever has scored the most goals by the end is the winner.

From the description on the box:
Go Goal! Ole! Tournament is a five-a-side football board game, combining the technique of shooting a ball and strategic thinking of a board game that gives players to enjoy and feel the excitement of a real football match.

Contents:
1x Football Field
4x Footballs
8x Footballer Figures with Stands
2x Goalkeeper Figures with Stands
2x Goal Posts with 4x Goal Screws
1x Score and Round Counter
25x Special Function Cards
4x Promotion Stands
1x Coin
2x 12-sided Dice
4x Stoppage Cones
1x VCD/DVD Game Demo
1x Full-Colour Manual (in English)
4x Black & White Manuals (Danmark, Norge, Suomi & Sverige)

The official website is:
www.gogoalole.com
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Sports

name: Verhext nochmal!
description:
The powerful witch Gundula charmed seven princes. To releases them from the spell, players have to prove their own magical powers and brew a miraculous potion. The princes will be released as soon as the great potion is finished. To mix the elixir and collect prince cards you have to add always two ingredients in the exact order. In the end, you piece your prince cards together and count the points your prince scores. The larger the prince, the more points he scores!

A bewitched card game for 2 – 4 bright junior witches

name: Planet Earth Board Game
description:
From http://www.catchoftheday.com.au/smallfish_info.php?products_...:

Explore, discover & learn about our world!

What are cicadas- insects, plants or animals? Antarctica is in which hemisphere- Northern or Southern? An elephant's tusks are actually teeth- true or false? A interactive game the whole family can enjoy, and test your knowledge as you roll the dice and journey around the board in the Planet Earth Board Game.

* Featuring stunning imagery and incredible facts
* Explore, discover and learn more about Planet Earth
* Educational and fun to play
* Includes game board, player tokens, 55 question cards, dice and player guide

Correctly answer questions about the unique regions of our planet and be the first player with three tokens on home region spaces to win the game. But watch out, other players will be trying to swap their tokens with yours!
categories: Educational, Environmental, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Disney Fairies Tinkerbell Springtime in Pixie Hollow Game
description:
From the back of the box:
It's springtime in Pixie Hollow, and Tinker Bell and the rest of the Disney fairies want to make their gardens sparkle! Help them gather flowers, berries, and creatures to take care of. Players try to match their cards to the three pictures on the fairy pawns. If you only have two of the items in your hand, you can ask your friend for the third! Once you have a match, you get to take the fairy pawn and put it in front of you. The player that collects the most pawns wins the game!

-Includes 7 Pixie Hollow Fairy Pawns & Stands, 28 Cards and Instructions
-For ages 5+
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: I Can See You
description:
The infant polar bears secretly leave the polar bear camp to catch some fish, and their mother of course does not like this. Players should try to catch three fish and return to the camp without being caught by mother polar bear. The active player turns the arrow and may move as many steps accordingly over the floes, only at the back of the iceberg the bears are safe from being seen. If the mother turns and spots a bear, the bear must move three steps back. If one passes a floe with fish, one may pick up one fish from the floe.

From The Publisher:
Puppies hide and seek is a fun children's game in which players carry their own little polar bear expedition glacier, and thence back to the nest. Puppies are tring to hide behind the icebergs and not to be caught by the mother who is lurking for fish. An exciting game to make her head spin around. Who will keep alert to every movement? Can mother see a bear puppy? Come on - they play hide and seek!

name: Power Rangers Wild Force Circle of Power Game
description:
The Power Rangers must defeat the fearsome Master Org before he destroys the planet. They need your help to Save the World!

You must win your Savage Cycles to chase Master Org who has kidnapped Princess Shayla, disable the "Nexus Force Field", break Zen-Aku's curse and finally capture the evil villain Master Org. Teh first player to blast through these challenges Saves the Planet and wind the game!

(from the box back)

Dice are rolled to attempt the challenges, players can stop at any point and 'Bank' their success so far in a push-your-luck system.

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Hexenkugel
description:
The game consists of a "magic" crystal ball, a number of plastic chips and some cards. The players put a number of chips (of each color) on the table equalling the number of players minus one.
The crystal ball glows in different colors until it suddenly stops at one color. Each player then has to quickly put a hand on a chip in the corresponding color. The player who is slowest (i.e. doesn't get a chip) receives a card and has to perform an action stated on it. When all cards are used up, the player with least cards is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Toy Story 3 Alien Claw Rescue
description: The Claw is the master. Kids will love reliving the unforgettable scene from Toy Story 3 in this action-packed game filled with unpredictability and loads of fun! Game features claws, which players activate to bring the action to life as they try to save their colored characters from the incinerator. Game begins with characters randomly placed on a motorized conveyor belt which rotates throughout game. Players try to skillfully capture their respective colored characters from the moving belt and place in the center safe zone. Watch out! You never know when the belt is going to send your characters flying off course!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Tiddlycricket
description:
This is, as the name suggests, a game that is a combination of cricket and tiddlywinks.

Contents:
Minature cricket bat
Minature cricket stumps
Felt bowling crease
1 large and 4 small winks

The wicket is set up on a table with a mat for the bowler's crease 22 inches away. The batsman holds the bat in front of the wicket, and the bowler 'bowls' by flicking a small wink with the big one. The batsman tries to hit the wink with the bat, and there are rules for runs scored and some ways to get out.

name: Monkey Tree
description: Playable with up to four players, the game begins with players determining player-order. Each player in-turn spins the spinner and hangs the shown amount of monkeys and bananas on the monkey tree. The round stops when one of the players makes the tree lose its balance and drop monkeys or bananas. That player out and the game begins anew with the other players. The winner is the last person standing.

name: Mission to Ecuador
description:
Mission to Ecuador is an entertaining and competitive card game of strategy for two to four players. Mission to Ecuador duplicates some of the real effort and uses some inspirational biblical verses required to establish a working mission as based on an actual mission to Ecuador.

Source: [ The Publisher Website].

Players take turns drawing cards until a mission card is played. At that point players stop drawing cards and start playing their convert cards that match the played mission. When a player can no longer play a convert card the mission ends and all players who placed convert cards places them face down in their "good works" pile. The player with the most "good works" when the deck runs out wins.

name: Tijdstrijd
description:
Co-operative trivia game on history, mainly Belgian and European.

Players move their pawns through six different periods in history. For each move he makes, the active player must answer a question about that period. When answered correctly he draws a token (mostly hour glasses) and gains one point on the players' mutual life scale. For each wrong answer, one life point is lost.

In each history periode, there is also an enemy card, representing an evil character or event in history. Each enemy has a printed value. When reaching such an enemy, the active player may try to defeat the enemy. For that purposes he bid a number of hour glass tokens and throws a ten sided die (values 0 through 9). The number thrown is then multiplied by the number of hour glasses bid and if that number is equal or higher than the enemies value, the enemy is defeated and life points are gained. Otherwise the enemey card remains on the board and three life points are lost.

Players win the game when all six enemies are defeated or they lose the game when they have no more life points left.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Trivia on the Go: Movies
description:
A trivia game including a deck of about 50 cards. Each card has questions and answers on them, multiple choice. Players take turns asking questions and answering. Players getting a correct answer are given the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

Designed to be a travel game.

name: Cogsburg
description:
Designer Summary:

For ages, the studious inhabitants of Cogsburg lived without fear, happily ticking along as they went about their business. But now a freak accident has occurred at the Cogtower, scattering cogs all over town and sending the clockwork winders into chaos. The Cogmen must repair the Cogtower before it is too late.

Each player directs a handful of resourceful Cogmen to gather cogs and repair the Cogtower. Each turn, a Winding card will be drawn from the deck, and any Cogmen standing adjacent to a Winder will be wound up by that amount, gaining Energy. Once all the Winding cards have been used, a Rainy Day card is added and the deck is reshuffled. If a Rainy Day card is drawn, any Cogmen who don’t find shelter will get wet and rust (a terrible fate!)

Beginning with the starting player, players take turns moving all of their Cogmen, who must spend Energy to move. At the end of the turn, any Cogmen dangerously low on Energy (and not near a Winder) may make a Desperation move, one last push towards a Winder before becoming unwound. A Cogman that becomes unwound is inoperable until he is wound up by an ally.

Cogmen gather the cogs that are scattered about Cogsburg, returning them to the Cogtower to gain victory points, or he may choose to repair a broken/rusted Cogman instead. A Cogman can only carry a single cog at a time (They’re very heavy!)

Once the Cogtower has been rebuilt, final scores are tallied. Each player recieves one Victory Point for every cog they supplied to the Cogtower, plus an additional point for each operable Cogman.

The basic game is for two players. Rules for three players and four-player team play are included. Official rules for entirely cooperative play are forthcoming.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Decision Day Fantasy Hockey
description:
From the back of the box:

Embark on a quest to build your all-time fantasy hockey team by competing against opponents while managing a salary cap to become the best General Manager in hockey history.

Build your fantasy team with the roster of trading cards provided or use your own trading cards from any era to enhance your roster.

Game play:
Players pick up challenge cards in the categories they are trying to advance in, example "Assists", a sample of one question would be "how many career assists does your opponent's Center have? Your opponent will then tell you who their Center (trading card) is and the last year of statistics on his/her card. For Example, "My Center is Mark Messier and the last year of stats is 1998/1999. You must then make your best guess as to how many assists you think Mark Messier had by the end of the 1998/1999 season. The closer you are to the correct answer, the further up the fantasy charts you go in the assists category. So....the more you know about Mark Messier and how many assists he averaged per season, the better guess you can make as your answer.

You don't ever have to be exact, but the closer you are, the faster you move up the fantasy category charts.

name: Bingo: The Friendly Farm
description:
Back of box: This amusing two-in-one bingo game stimulates children's sense of observation. Reversable game boards and cards allow children to explore the wonderful world of the Friendly Farm and learn the letters of the alphabet. Same general idea of the Classic Bingo, but with pictures on one side of the board and letters on the other. As in traditional Bingo, a player calls a particular picture or letter that is selected at random, and each player covers that figure on their personal board. A player who gets a row covered wins.
A colorful way to get children to play with and recognize letters.

name: Jag har aldrig!
description:
User summarey: A party game of confession. The party chooses one act of "confession" that they all must make when faced with the question. The act of confession might be raising your hand, taking a sip of your drink or paying a coin when faced with a question.

Each player picks up a card and reads the text out aloud. An example might be "I have never dated more than one at the time". If a player find this to be true they do nothing, otherwise they "confess".

This is a social game and there are no "winners" in traditional sense, it is about knowing more about the fellow players.

name: Pokemon Sliders Battle Arcade Game
description:
Pokémon Battle Arcade Game - Sliders: Extreme Rolling Action!

Are you ready for the ultimate Pokémon Battle? The Pokémon Sliders Battle Arcade Game lets you experience the thrill and action of a real Pokémon battle. So, choose your favorite Pokémon Sliders action figures and get ready for EXTREME ROLLING ACTION!

Comes with:

- Battle Arcade Game and Stand
- 6 Pokémon cutout cards
- 4 Exclusive Pokémon Sliders*
- Label sheet


Collect all the Pokémon Sliders! More coming soon!


Setup and Game Play

1. Place Battle Arcade Game archway onto Poké ball base and snap into place.
2. Position Battle Arcade game between two or more Pokémon Trainers.
3. Spin Power Paddles to align their arrows with the arrows in the center of each paddle section. This is the start position.
4. Shuffle Pokémon cutout cards and distribute them evenly between the rival Pokémon Trainers.
5. Each Pokémon Trainer places their Pokémon cards in the three slots closest to them. Gently push cards down until trigger locks into place. (Be careful not to show your opponent which Pokémon cards have been chosen!)

The Battle is Ready to Begin

Your mission: Capture all 6 Pokémon cutout cards and become a Pokémon Master.

Round 1

1. Battle by rolling your Pokémon Sliders at the Power Paddles to spin them as quickly as possible.
2. capture your opponent's Pokémon by spinning the Power Paddles all the way to one side. (But, be careful, rival trainers can spin the paddles back at you!) The Power Paddle will strike the trigger and launch your opponent's Pokémon into the air! You've captured that Pokémon!
3. Round 1 stops when one trainer has lost all three of their Pokémon. (Note: If a trainer captures all of their opponents Pokémon without losing one of their own, they are the new Pokémon Master - in one round!)

Round 2.

4. Trainers then reset the game using three cards of their choice. If a player has less than three cards, they must reset with the cards they have left.
5. Continue round after round until one trainer captures all 6 Pokémon cards. That person is the new Pokémon Master!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: IQ: A szerencse és logika játéka!
description: The title translates as IQ - the game of luck and logic. A player in her turn rolls a die, moves her pawn horizontally or vertically on a grid and on certain spaces gets a question (an IQ test item). If answers correctly, she gets 2, 4 or 6 points. The winner is the first player who arrives to the goal (the opposite corner) first, having at least 30 points. The game comes with 220 question cards and two additional IQ tests.

name: Gołębie
description:
"Gołębie" ("Pigeons") is a non-collectible mini card game for 2 players in which they take the roles of pigeons. They "fight" with the patience of people waiting at a bus stop. The purpose of the game is to be the bird that reduces their patience the most.

There are total 5 character cards. Each character card has different number of marks printed on it. These marks are called "patience". During the play "patience" on those cards will be covered by player's markers as they play their pigeons cards. After all "patience" on a card is covered, that card is put aside – it won’t be used till the end of the game.

Game ends when all character cards has been put aside. Players count their markers on those cards. One with the most counters wins the game.

name: Seduxion
description:
Seduxion - The game of dice that melts the Ice

The game comes with 8 differnt dice and a scoring pad along with a small rule sheet.

Each of the dice have one face with Lips, Serpents, Apples, fig leaves and Cupids on them. The 6th face contains one letter of the word SEDUXION. 5 of the dice are black the 3 red dice which have the letters S,E,X on it are red. (This combination scores a special bonus)

In turn each player throws all 8 dice and may leave down any, none, or all the dice thrown. Up to 3 rolls are permitted per turn. You get points for more than 3 of the same symbols or have more than 7 differnt faces shown and for making words with at least 3 letters

Example: After 3 rolls you got: 4 Cupids and D, I, E, X. This counts 5 points for the 4 Cupids and 10 points for the word DIE, a total of 15 points. The word SEX gots a special bonus of 30 points.

Every field on the score sheet can be used only once, like in Yatzee. You have to cross out the field on the score sheet. After ten turns one column is finished and the points are calculated together. The games ends here or goes up for 2 other columns on the same score sheet. The winner of a column gets a 50 point bonus.

Should you get SEDUXION at any time this will ends the game and you win the game. In a 3 column game the winner takes a 100 point bonus and all other lose their point on that column.

(from the rules and user summary)

name: Justin Bieber Backstage Pass Game
description: Publisher Description: Justin's got a special message for you. Be the first BACKSTAGE before your friends beat you there! Prove you got the lowdown on Justin's life and his music. Correctly answer the questions as you race through the concert hall. Justin's secret message is waiting for you backstage. Fast and fun, Justin's trivia will keep you and your friends guessing to see who's the biggest fan.
publishers: (Unknown), Bravado Games, Longshore Limited, The Canadian Group

name: Hot Streak!
description:
Hot Streak is a roll and move game combined with a variety of different gambling sub games. Players move on an inner or outer track and land on properties. Based on the property they land on players can take a lottery ticket, play a casino game such as slots, bet on a horse race, or acquire one of a handful of Keno parlors. Players compete to gain the most money without going bankrupt.

In terms of actual game play, there is very little decision making other than the amount of particular bets though even this is fixed for some of the games. Occasionally players have the option of switching between tracks. All games are determined by random spins, dice rolls, or draws. For example, the horse race has six horses starting at the same point and all players bet on a horse; a die is rolled and the corresponding horse advances one space; this continues until one horse has advanced to the finish. As another example, lottery tickets are simply distributed as one lands on the spot with a random winner drawn later in the game.

The game board is a thin cardboard, the chips and horses are generic plastic pieces. Generally the quality is below average even for a mass market game.



From the Box --Made by the makers of Nick the Greek Official Casino Gambling Games

The most exciting strategy board game about casino gambling ever made!

Contains: Beautiful casino board game, authentic roulette layout, dice, poker chips, keno parlor ownership cards, roulette/slot machine spinner, six molded race horses, six game tokens, lottery tickets, odds cards, cashier checks, NICK THE GREEK money, plus complete easy-to-follow instructions.

Great fun for the whole family
For 2 to 6 players

All the glitter and fast action of a trip to any one of the world's glamorous gambling casinos.

Get to Play
9 Great Casino Games
Including: Roulette, Blackjack, Poker, Craps, Slot Machine, Horse Race, Chuck-A-Luck, Baccarat, and Keno plus A State Lottery!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Donjons & Trésors
description:
From the back of the box but translated:
In Donjons et trésors, you and your friends plays each one of the 6 characters : The elf, the barbarian, the mage, the thief, the dwarf and the robber.
You walk with your lantern to seek adventures and fabulous treasures that are in dungeons. But, especially you want to be rich, your ultimate goal is to find gold.
Multiple pitfalls are wainting you in your periple, fierce creatures will attack you and sneaky traps will block you.
To help you, you can have with allies, issue some prisoners and discover hidden treasures, You will find also equipment that permits you to overcome all dangers that you will encounter.

Theme : exploring dungeons, kill monsters and seek gold.
Game-play : play cards to gain gold for your character and lose gold for the others.
Goal:

From the back of the box:
"Dans Donjons et trésors, vous et et vos amis incarnez un des 6 personnages disponibles : l'Elfe, le Barbare, le Magicien, le Voleur, le Nain et le Pilleur.
Vous avancez à l'aide de votre lanterne à la recherche d'aventures et de fabuleux trésors que les donjons renferment. Mais surtout, vous voulez être riche, votre but ultime c'est de trouver de l'or.
De multiples embûches vous attendent dans votre périple, des créatures féroces vous attaqueront et des pièges sournois bloqueront votre progression.
Pour vous aider, vous pourrez être accompagné par des alliés, délivrer les prisonniers et découvrir des trésors cachés. Vous trouverez aussi de l'équipement vous permettant de surmonter tous les dangers que vous rencontrerez.

name: Unterwegs mit Paulus
description:
This is a biblical cooperative game, where the players try to form new christian societies while traveling through the eastern mediterranean.

When all players are die or imprisoned the game ends and you score how man societies you have build.

name: Jogo X-Men
description:
"With skill and expertise, you and the other X-Men must dodge the pitfalls of the Danger Room. Only then will meet your goals." (Translated from the rule book).

Every player chooses his character (Wolverine, Beast, Cyclops, Storm, Gambit or Rogue) and place it in the Danger Room (any Start Point valid on the board) with one objective (collect X-Tokens, the amount of each color is in the Objective Card) and four Trap Cards. Then the game starts.

Every turn the player spins the Moviment Wheel (to define how much he moves) and next the Trap Wheel (that activates a trap). The Trap Cards can be used any moment of the game and disarm or arm one trap.

Win the X-men who complete his objectives first.

This game is from Brazil and may not be available elsewhere.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Zodiakos
description:
The sister game to Junishi, 12 Moons and Neteru,
Zodiakos is an abstract strategy game inspired by the 12 signs of the Greek Zodiac. (Each player controls 6 of the 12 signs.)

The object of Zodiakos is to move one of your 6 pieces into your opponent's Gate, which is located at the opposite end of the board, in between your opponent's Spawn Areas.

Players begin at either end of a board comprised of 23 circles.
At the start of the game there are not any pieces on the board. Any pieces that a player wishes to use must be "spawned" in one of the Spawn Circles on that player's side of the board.
Players may move the pieces that they already have on the board either by moving them into adjacent circles or by jumping over friendly pieces.
Players also may use their animals to capture their opponent's animals by jumping over them.

Zodiakos is a simple and fast paced abstract strategy game that is easy to learn and usually plays in under 20 minutes. It comes in a little cloth bag that also serves as the game board
and it can be carried in any pocket that is big enough to hold a pack of gum.

Zodiakos is a complete game that can be expanded by combining it with its sister games Junishi, 12 Moons, and Neteru.
(source : the publisher)

Integrates with:

12 Moons



Junishi



Neteru

name: Environmental Concerns
description:
A Monopoly variant, but does not simply rename the squares like most variants. More property sets are present, as more 2 property sets exist. In addition, properties sets are not arranged in increasing value order but rather randomly (in terms of cost, they're semi-logically sorted by environmental themes)

As a final twist, the railroad points are replaced by canal entrances which lead to a plus shaped set of spaces. When landing on an entrance, you are relocated to the center of the plus shape and must draw a card to determine the direction you must exit.

Other changes involve no utilities, only one kind of event deck (not counting the canal cards), and a good park fund (basically the Free Parking fees variant)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tiddlytennis
description:
Tiddly Winks played on a felt tennis mat with a "net" made of wood between the ends. A plastic disk is pressed against a second plastic disk to propel second plastic disk over a net. If you miss, your opponent scores a point.

Repeat.

name: Karnak
description:
Karnak is a Mancala-type family game for 2-4 players.

Quote from the box: "3000 year old stragic game from old Egypt".

In this version of Mancala game, the 12 cups are in circle, and there are markers for to indicate the cups for 2, 3, or 4 players. The game system is traditional: pick beans, drop them one by one in other next cups (with 3 or 4 players, the direction can be chosen). If the last cup(s) to drop the bean into had 1 or 2 beans before, take all the beans from the cup(s).

name: Wer knackt die Nuß
description:
Goal: Form a sentence from randomly drawn letters and a 'theme'-card, as quick as possible.

Build up the board - distribute the letters onto the coloured spaces

1. Draw a 'theme'-card out of different fields of topics
2. Use a six-sided coloured die and pick up corresponding letters
3. Form a sentence (simultaneously) , which must refer to the 'theme'-card - the faster the better, because only the first one scores;
categories: Book, Dice, Educational, Real-time, Word Game

name: Snow White
description:
45 cards, in four suits - Diamonds, Stars, Circles and Squares. The game is inspired by the playing card game of Hearts or Black Maria. This is a trick taking game where you lose points if you 'collect' a trick containg Stars or the 3 Witch Cards. When one player has a score of 200 points against him, the game ends, and the player with the lowest score wins.

This was the first card game published by Castell. Belisha, Progress, and Speed were all part of this new range.

In 1951, the game was reissued with slightly different rules and new card illustrations, and a new name:
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Crib Football
description:
You must know the rules of Cribbage to play this game, but the scoring system means that quite different tactics are required.
Each player tries to score goals and for a shot on goal, you need to score dozens (or more) with your hand. Opponent will get a chance to save the shot.
Further rules cover the actual player 'on the pitch' who scored the goal. The time in the match when the goal was scored. Penalties, and Home Advantage.

Published by Games Unlimited Ltd. in their house fanzine Random.

name: Robin Hood Game
description:
A fast-action race game for younger children, based on the lovable Walt Disney Robin Hood film characters.
A simple dice-rolling game. The object is to get your men safely to Nottingham Castle.

name: Crazy Caterpillar
description: Colour and shape matching form the basis of this fun game as players compete to see who can make the l-o-n-g-e-s-t caterpillar (see image to see children playing the game). A spinner decides which card you may take and then you must try to fit it into your caterpillar.

name: Triumphant
description: Roll-and-move game similar to Pachisi, with a multi-level playfield and event cards that are drawn when a player token lands on a "Black Hole" space. The game has two possible victory conditions. A player wins by either moving one of their tokens onto their home space, or by eliminating all other players from contention by sending their tokens to the "Dead Pawn Box".

name: Very Busy Spider Game
description:
Players work together to create a spider web in this cooperative children's game based on the book by Eric Carle.

Players spin to move their way around the board, landing on colored and fly spaces. Each time a player lands on a colored space they draw a line to create a spider web.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scats
description:
Contents:
1 rules sheet
5 dice (very small)
25 Scats sheets
Each player must attempt to 'draw' all the correct body parts of The Scat (a cat). Each stage of the drawing is governed by a die roll. The first to complete their card cries "Scats" and wins the game.
The age is a guess but I think it must have been a war-time issue, because the rules have the message "Entertainment is vital to the spirit of the nation" down the right side.

name: Tower of fruits
description:
Players take turns rolling the die, and stacking either towers of fruit (game 1) or just the fruit itself (game 2.)

Dexterity game similar to Jenga and Bandu with very nice wood pieces shaped like fruit.

Pieces are selected according to the result of the die roll.

name: Noah's Ark Card Game
description:
52 cards, 17 sets of three plus the Noah card. A player offers his face down hand to the player on his left. Now that player may lay down a set, if he has one. A set comprises of three cards, Mr Hippo, Mrs Hippo and Baby Hippo, for example, and once played that family is said to have boarded the Ark. However the player might choose to lay down only two cards (which must be the mother and father) and place them into the Ark without their Baby. The Baby is now unable to join his parents in the Ark.

The player holding the Noah card may 'drown' babies in his hand if the parents have entered the Ark. Drowned babies are kept in front of the player who drowned them as they score bonus points at the end. The Noah card might move to several players during the game as part of the random draw from each player each turn. So different players might get the chance to drown the babies.

The game ends when all the parents have entered the Ark.

Each card has a points value once placed in the Ark. Drowned babies score 5 points for each one you have in front of you. Undrowned babies in your hand at the end score -10 points which is added to the player who holds Noah at the end.
publishers: De La Rue, H. P. Gibson & Sons

name: Mini-Quiz
description: A simple trivia game for 2-12 players. Those have to answer questions of 4 different topics: "Tales and Legends", "Sports and Games", "Nature and Environment" and "General". If the answer is right the players token goes one step forward on the board. The player first reaching the finish line wins the game.

name: Huikka
description:
From the publishers web site:
Here comes the adult game from the pipe (game box is cylinder), which includes seven adult dating games favored by the rules. Throwing dice, card games and beautiful components combine in this hilarious package, which is enough fun for the whole bunch! The game needed a stimulant substances are not included in the package.
The game comes with a lot of cards, including regular deck (two) and special card decks. Game has 7 different adult games from drinking games (2) to actual serious adult fun with scoring and also a trivia game for couples.

Trivia game:
Game comes with a special trivia cards and dice. Players play in couples and roll a dice. Dice shows the category from which the roller needs to answer. The weird thing is that couple needs to choose another couple from which to give the answer for. For each correct answer you keep the cards. First couple that knows other couples best and collect 6 cards are the winner couple.

Card game:
Uses 2 classic game decks. Can be played with 2 or with 4 couples. Each couple gets a deck of cards or 2 suits in one color. Hearts and spades in this game act as trumps.
Hearts are a life together and spades are the separation. Game is played in one full circle. With 2 couples the idea is to get rid of all the spades and collect all the hearts. Problem is that they both act as trumps, so getting rid of spades is hard, but there are special rules for Jacks and Queens in other suits that help to make that easier. When all cards are played, couples read their hearts and spades. Each heart is 2 points, each spade is -2 points, each Jack and Queen is extra 2 points (whatever suit) and each Ace is a free drink card (still a party game). Winner is the couple with the most points.
In 4 couple game, game is played the same, but the winning conditions are different. Couples now only score how many cards they have - each red 2 points, each black -2 points. Rest is the same with the exception that 0 is the worst result. That means the further you are from the 0 the higher your score is.

Couples game:
Uses the special trivia game cards. This is played in circles, couples sitting against each other. When the times comes to a player, he/she pulls a cards and ask one question from his partner about herself/himself. Partner then writes down an answer along side with the question asker. When the answer are more or less the same, they score one point (a kiss or a hug). Game lasts 10 rounds. Couple with more points (kisses) wins the game.

Other 4 are drinking games (one seems to be a sex game) where there is no actual winners or scoring of any kind. Like they say in the rules - all players are winners with these games.

name: Wer bellt denn da?
description:
Wer bellt denn da? is a 2011 release along the lines of Lach and Rapp's earlier "Top3" series from Kosmos. Players reveal three cards showing various dog breeds and are then confronted with a dog-related question, such as

• Which breed is most popular among Germans: Dachsund, Golden Retriever or German Shepherd?
• Which of these dogs needs more outdoor play space?

Place the dogs in the correct order and you earn points. Whoever knows the most about dogs – or uses their intuition the best – will howl with victory.

name: Spellmaster
description:
The game or "educational toy" as described on the underside of the box lid was aimed at helping younger children spell 100 words correctly.
Consists of a perforated base board, 20 word cards (each with 5 pictures on) and 80 plastic letter tiles.

If the word is spelt correctly the tiles will easily fit onto the appropriate square; the ‘snap’ of a correctly positioned letter is actually pretty satisfying. A letter in the wrong place will not fit (==> mistake proofing). There are sufficient letter tiles to complete a card. Once a card has been completed the letters are removed and another card selected.
Some letters can be used upside down [n vs u; b vs q; d vs p)

On the base board all letter tiles will fit into any position -
you can form any word up to 8 letters and even short sentences.

name: Kids Trivia Plus
description:
Children's trivia in a tin box.
Three hundred colourful cards with trivia questions, fascinating facts and actions. These fascinating questions and facts about the subject in question also contain actions to perform.
