Decide your own objective to win, first to get 5 questions right wins, that sort of thing.

name: Le mystère des pyramides
description:
It is one of the Milton Bradley "Flipsiders" games that resembles an audio cassette until you "flip" the game open.

The archaeologist takes the green marker and begins at the entrance to the pyramid.
The other player, the mummy, begins at the bottom of the pyramid.
A ruby is set in another room at the bottom of the pyramid.

The archaeologist will get the ruby and back out of the pyramid.
The mummy has to kill the archaeologist.

name: Mod'Collection
description:
Mod'Collection is one of the Milton Bradley "Flipsiders" games that resembles an audio cassette until you "flip" the game open.

Each player will get a full set of clothes (shoes, skirt, top and jacket) to buy in shops. After that, they need to reach the final case.

name: Yacht
description: YACHT is an exciting sailing race built on reality in which wind force and wind direction are of great importance.

name: Lords of Cricket
description:
An Australian cricket board game. It takes into account Test, One Day, Twenty20 and even back yard cricket.
The game is designed to replicate game conditions including real life statistics and score keeping. Lords of Cricket is fun and educational for kids, improving their maths skills while teaching them the fundamentals of cricket. The box says 'Great for players of all ages from 7 to 107' so any of you 108 year old cricket game fans are out of luck.

The Lords of Cricket playing board is divided into four parts, one for each of the different versions of a game of cricket. The board consists of six circles, each one representing the six balls in an over. Each game of Lords of Cricket is played with cricket ball-shaped cards, each designed to imitate different formats of the game of cricket.
Red cards are for Test cricket
White cards are for One Day International and Back Yard cricket
Yellow cards are used for Twenty-20 cricket
There are four dice
White - Ball Dice - numbered from 1 to 6 representing the number of the ball in the over
Yellow - Appeal Dice - used to determine the type of appeal
Red - Out Dice - used to determine how a batsman is out
Black - Reverse Decision Dice - used to reverse an Appeal decision

name: Jogo da Vida Feliz
description: A very different version of The Game of Life, where money matters very little - in fact, the player with most happiness chips is the winner at the end!

name: Doubles
description: Party game. Each guest is handed a picture. As they mingle during the evening, they try to match their picture. The first to be successful, wins.

name: Bobs The New Bridge Game
description:
The game parts consist of a Bridge with various arches. Each arch scores a different number of points. The Bridge is placed at one end of the table. The player uses the cue provided in the box (it comes in two halves which screw together) to propel a ball forward, with the intention to hit it through an arch and thus score points.
The components include six balls. The cue and the bridge are made of solid wood.
Described on the box as 'A Popular Colonial Pastime for Any Number of Players'
publishers: (Unknown), Chad Valley Co Ltd., Glevum Games, Jumbo Manufacturing Pty. Ltd., Kangy, Roberts Brothers Games

name: It Pays to Advertise
description:
Trivia party game featuring very famous advertisements and you have to guess the product. The guest who gets the most right, wins.

Each player receives a double-sided card with 18 clues to famous adverts in Britain in the 50's. Altogether there are 8 visual clues and ten written clues.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: LÖWENZAHN Quiz-Spiel
description:
The players have to collect 8 knowledge chips of every color. The chips are rewarded for answering one of 2200 questions out of different areas
During player's turn die is rolled; he/she may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, die is used to pick a question - if the answer is correct, player may add an additional turn - moving again. You pick a chip if you find a correct answer for a space on the outer circle.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Les Visiteurs: Le Jeu
description:
A familly game about a french movie (a big success).
An evil wizard has sent you in the twentieth century. To return to your epoque (1123 AD), you must find magical ingredients to reopen the corridors of time.
A fun game for a familly, an hard addiction for the movie's fans.
The goal : On a journey full of obstacles, traps, psychiatric hospitals, you must be the first to recover the three magic ingredients to return to your day. The first player to complete this conditions wins.
The manner : After a dice roll, you move your pawn on a case and you have a question about the film or you must make an imitation of the movie's actors (there are many ...) If you are correct, you can reroll another dice to get closer from a Magical Ingredient. The cases of the board need specific action, you lose your turn or change direction.
Components : 1 bonus roundel
6 pawns
1 8-sided die
138 cards, Movie, Surprises, Imitations and Magic Potion.

The winner must say "Per Horus, et per Ra, et per Solem, in victus, luceres" and normally he must go back in 1123 AD...
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jump the Shark: A Storytelling Gambling Game
description:
Have you ever watched a bad movie and said to yourself, "I could write better than that!" Well, here's your chance!

In Jump the Shark you and your friends are trapped screenwriters who are forced to write bad movies. Even in your poor circumstances, though, you make a gambling game of your situation, so you get the dual fun of making up a great/horrible story and rolling dice. Risk a token for each addition to the scene. Only the last writer and the caller have a shot at the pot. Win the most tokens, and you win the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: Schmetterlingsspiel
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points (chips) as possible
- acting by turn -
place on any flower and stalk a red chip ( 1 bonus point)
place on any butterfly a green chip (2 bonus points)
roll the dice
phase 1
start on stalks ==> if your dice show matching numbers - take a red chip - if the chip was already taken off: bad luck
rolling a '2' or '5' double ==> take a butterfly - from the board or from another player
phase 2
if all red chips placed on stalks are reaped start with chips on flowers - same procedure as described above
game ends if all chips are harvested

1 board, 4 butterflies, 20 red chips, 4 green chips, 2 dice,
1 rule sheet

name: Kopfnuss
description:
Objective: gain as many points as possible finding correct answers in time
- acting by turn -
Agree setting limit: elapsed time or no. of winning points
On each players turn, the player draws a card with a theme on it, then a letter is drawn.
Time runs. Every player has to find words for the chosen term with the given letter.

name: The Berenstain Bears Learn to Share Game
description: The Berenstain Bears Learn to Share Game brings the classic tales of Mama, Papa, Brother and Sister Bear to life as kids use the detailed characters to race around the board. Drop the die down the tree house slide to roll, move your bear or draw a card that will tell you about a nice behavior or one that could cause some trouble. Kids love the fun role play and trying to be the first to reach Mama and Papa Bear! Love the book, now live the game!

name: Suitors & Suitability
description:
A card game based on the works of Jane Austen. Players take the role of young women from the stories, trying to get married to a suitor of good social standing.

Gameplay consists of players playing cards to raise and lower the social standing of different characters.

name: Quick-Quiz: Fussball
description:
"Soccer" in English
108 game cards with 500 questions and 500 answers.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

Contents:

108 playing cards,
notepad and pencil

name: Eesti Laulude Mäng
description:
From the back cover:
"Eesti Laulude Mäng" (The game of Estonian songs) is a board game for ages 12+, although we are sure, that even a younger players can handle the game and find answers the adults cannot. So, one might say, that the game is meant for all ages just like the differential Estonian music. The can be played alone and as a team.

In this game you need to answer six different questions. Players move around the board according to the track drawn there and answering the questions according to the space they are standing on. Important thing is to keep a fun and happy attitude and even sing along with the songs. When a player suddenly finds themselves on Rock board on a Pirate space, the player must give up one card he had already won. The reason this game has a Pirate space is because in real life a lot of music is stolen as well, so hopefully this space has a small motivational purpose as not to steal music. We are sorry! The Pirate space will not affect a player who already has 6 cards. When players finds himself on a corner, then he can choose the category. You need to collect 6 different colored cards, this is how you win the golden record.
To win the game, you need to stand on one of the finish squares and the player to the left ask one question and this time you need to sing the answer. Get it right, and win the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: DIG: the Card Game – The Flood
description:
The Flood for DIG: the Card Game is a 10-card mini-expansion that includes:

Flood Cards
Pump Cards
Raft Cards


Shuffle the Flood Cards into the Mine deck.
Shuttle the Pump and Raft into the Tools deck.

If a Flood card is drawn when mining, that Tunnel is now flooded. A Pump card is needed to clear it.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: An Anatomical Puzzle
description:
A party game for doctors (!) perhaps.

Each guest is given a card with 25 clues to which the answer is a part of the body. An example:

Clue 22. The law is credited with having a long one = Arm (as in the long arm of the law)

The first guest to hand in a card with 25 correct answers, wins.

One game in the Dainty Series of games by this publisher.

name: Go Diego Go: Air Soccer Kick Off
description:
Join Diego and his rainforest friends for a friendly game of soccer.

Head-to-head action for two players. Players try to hit the soccer disc into the opposing goal over a bed of air generated by the board. Scores are kept track by slide scorekeeper.

Electronic board has a air flow system that creates a cushion of air that floats the disc. Comes with 2 pucks, and 2 player pieces.

This game is just like air hockey except it has a soccer theme.

name: Das Erntespiel
description:
A harvest-themed racing game for children.

Components: One board with a spinner, 16 harvest cards, 4 pawns, 2 dice

Aim of the game: Being the first player to collect one's harvest (4 different harvest cards) and get it to the barn.

How it is played: Each player takes a farmer pawn, puts it on the corresponding farm space and places the corresponding harvest cards (potato bag, corn, cabbage and wheat) on the corresponding field. Players then take turns moving the spinner, throwing the die/dice (except during a thunderstorm) and moving their pawn.
The spinner shows the weather: Sun helps the farmer with the harvest - use both dice and move the corresponding number of spaces. Wind also helps the farmer to move faster - throw one die, move, turn the spinner again. Rain slows the farmer down - use only one die. Thunderstorms mean its too dangerous - the player loses one turn.
Pawns are moved from the farm to the field, where one harvest card is taken up and then brought back to the farm. On the players next turn, he moves his farmer to a different field etc.
The game ends when one player's farmer has taken all his harvest cards to his farm.

name: Gib 8
description:
Children's card game featuring Benjamin Blümchen.

From a hand of cards, each player adds a card to the face-up stack pile. The card added must be either the same colour as the previous card (thus changing the number) or the same number (thus changing the colour. Being a game for youngsters, after they have made a legal play, they can then add any other card from their hand to the stack (so, in one turn, they should be able to use two cards).

The first player to use all their cards, wins.

name: Das Quiz rund um den Euro
description:
The game board has four fields on each edge, each of these fields has a six question cards. The answers are on the back of each card. Now a number of dice-chips (from one to six) are chosen. This specifies the question to be answered in this round on the cards. Each player now receives chips with various values ​​of 5€ to 500€ and a joker.
On his turn player bets depending on whether he knows the answer, or rather has to guess, he now sets up a low-or high-order chip and then responds. If the answer is wrong, the chip remains on the field. If it was correct he wins double chips.

Player with the most chips (€) at the end of the game wins.

name: Portland in-a-box
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature locations and landmarks from Portland.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by first building skylines, and then upgrading to keys to the city. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: UCLAopoly
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature campus landmarks and traditions from UCLA.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Soccer Replay: Euroclub 94/5
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a selection of 16 European teams from the 1994/95 season.

name: Pettersson & Findus: Ein Feuerwerk für den Fuchs
description: Reaction game after a childrens book of the same name. The fox has to be chased off from the chickens. Every player gets a differently colored wooden ball and a puzzle consisting of six puzzle pieces which show Pettersson and Findus, building a rocket to chase away the fox. If a fox token has been revealed in the game, everybody makes rocket noises and throws his wooden ball, representing the rocket, into a platic cup. The two fastest players may take and use one of their puzzle pieces. The player completing the puzzle first wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Novel-based, Puzzle

name: Soccer Replay: Euroclub 95/6
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of the following 16 European teams from the 1995/96 season:

- A.C. Milan
- A.S. Roma
- Ajax Amsterdam
- Barcelona
- Bayern Munich
- Borussia Dortmund
- Deportivo La Coruna
- Girondins de Bordeaux
- Juventus
- Nantes
- Nottingham Forest
- P.S.V. Eindhoven
- Panathinaikos
- Paris St Germain
- Rapid Vienna
- Real Madrid

name: Soccer Replay: Top English & Scottish Clubs 1995/6
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game includes the following English and Scottish teams from the 1995/96 season:

Premier League English
- Arsenal
- Aston Villa
- Blackburn Rovers
- Bolton Wanderers
- Chelsea
- Coventry City
- Everton
- Leeds United
- Liverpool
- Manchester City
- Manchester United
- Middlesbrough
- Newcastle United
- Nottingham Forest
- Queens Park Rangers
- Sheffield Wednesday
- Southampton
- Tottenham Hotspur
- West Ham United
- Wimbledon

Premier League Scottish
- Aberdeen
- Celtic
- Falkirk
- Heart of Midlothian
- Hibernian
- Kilmarnock
- Motherwell
- Partick Thistle
- Raith Rovers
- Rangers

First Division Teams
- Barnsley
- Birmingham City
- Charlton Athletic
- Crystal Palace
- Derby County
- Grimsby Town
- Huddersfield Town
- Ipswich Town
- Leicester City
- Luton Town
- Millwall
- Norwich City
- Oldham Athletic
- Port Vale
- Portsmouth
- Reading
- Tranmere Rovers
- Sheffield United
- Southend United
- Stoke City
- Sunderland
- Watford
- West Bromwich Albion
- Wolverhampton Wanderers

name: Soccer Replay: Champions – A Selection of League and Cup Winning Teams from the 1970's and 1980's
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game includes the following 18 Champions and F.A. Cup winners:

- Arsenal 1970/71 (Division 1 Champions and F.A. Cup winners)
- Derby County 1971/72 (Champions of Division 1)
- Liverpool 1972/73 (Division 1 Champions and winners of UEFA Cup)
- Sunderland 1972/73 (2nd Division winners of F.A. Cup)
- Leeds United 1973/74 (Division 1 Champions)
- Derby County 1974/75 (Champions of Division 1)
- Liverpool 1975/76 (Division 1 Champions and winners of UEFA Cup)
- Southampton 1975/76 (F.A. Cup winners from Division 2)
- Manchester United 1976/77 (F.A. Cup winners)
- Nottingham Forest 1977/78 (Division 1 Champions by 7 points - unbeaten at home)
- Ipswich Town 1977/78 (18th in Division 1 but winners of the F.A. Cup)
- Arsenal 1978/79 (F.A. Cup winners)
- West Ham United 1979/80 (Division 2 winners of F.A. Cup)
- Aston Villa 1980/81 (Division 1 Champions)
- Tottenham Hotspur 1981/82 (F.A. Cup winners)
- Manchester United 1982/83 (3rd in Division 1 and F.A. Cup winners)
- Everton 1984/85 (Division 1 winners by 13 points and losing F.A. Cup finalists)
- Liverpool 1985/86 (Winners of Division 1 and F.A. Cup winners)

name: SLUGBUG!
description:
SLUGBUG! is a fast-paced, easy to learn family game for 2-4 players that mimics the classic road trip game. Players take turns playing “driver” cards which determine how fast to go and how many potential slugbugs they see along the way.

The driver cards will direct players to flip various cards off the Slugbug deck. Players will keep an eye out for Volkswagen Beetles as the cards are flipped. When they see one, they slap it and shout "SLUGBUG!" to collect the card. If they identify wrongly they have to discard a slugbug card.

When the final destination card is played, the player with the most Slugbug cards is the winner.

name: Codigo Cube
description: Codigo Cube is the play anywhere, anytime trivia game using QR Codes and the camera on your Smartphone. QR codes are those little pixilated squares you see everywhere. When you scan them they take you to a website. How Codigo Cube works is there is a QR Code embedded die. Each side of the die contains a different QR Code. Each QR Code represents a different trivia category. First person to get one question correct from all six sides wins!
publishers: Four Clowns Game & Toy Co, LLC

name: Quala
description:
A card game that feels like a mix of Mille Bornes and Rummy.

Each player has a hand of 8 cards. Players take turns in order; a turn consists of:
1. draw a card
2. (optional) meld cards (face down), and/or change previous melds
3. discard a card.

The first card melded must always be a "start" card; followed by several number cards (forming one out of 5 legal combinations), and a "key" card as last card.
In addition, the game contains cards that mess with other players hands, or allow to claim a discarded card.

A round ends when one player has completed a combination (for example: start, two triplets, key). Each player gets points for the cards he melded. There are some ways to score bonus points.

The game is played in several rounds, until the score of one player reaches 35 points.

name: Super Soccer
description:
Soccer simulation. The field is a grid of 6 x 5 boxes. Each player receives a pack of action cards. Either coach place the 11 pawn in the pitch.

The mechanism is simple: the player with possession of the ball takes three cards attack action and puts them into three boxes of your choice on the board, empty or occupied by pawns or their opponents. Two of the three cards played, however, are "cards bluff" and only serve to pull the wool over the eyes of the defender, who has two cards only line of defense to counter the effect of the cards of attack and must therefore try to guess where the attacker has the real paper and where the bluff. Place the cards, move the pieces closer to where they were put in the boxes of the tiles, the tiles are discovered and resolved effects. If the defender did not guess where the attacker has put the card real action, this explains its effects immediately. If you have guessed, it resolves the conflict according to a mechanism completely devoid of throwing dice (sic): the proceeds to count a series of penalties against both the defender the attacker (for example, for each opposing checker that is located on the trajectory of a passage the attacker receives a penalty). If you are under penalty wins the contrast. In case of a tie the defender wins. If the attacker loses the ball as time counter moves forward one minute.
The action cards allow it to attack steps, jumps, throws, crosses, headers and volleys.

The action cards allow defensive tackle and advances (ground ball or head).

Resolved shots: the attacker has a certain number of points distributed on a shot that has a football goal (drawn on a separate sheet) divided into six sections. The goalkeeper has 14 points that can be distributed parade of no more than five of the six sections. The choice is made for both in secret. If at least one section there are several points that shot points parade's goal. Otherwise, parade. In case of a tie, corner.

Who wins at the end of the two times (the duration of which may be agreed between the players) have scored more goals.

name: Monster Crabs
description:
From Kickstarter Web Site
Monster Crabs is a card game. It combines war with rock, paper, scissors. First you deal all the cards out. There will be 16 different crabs in three different elements. Each player says offense or defense and then flips up the card after they said offense or defense at the same time. The person whose card has the highest value wins that round and gets the cards. If it is a tie, you see if it's air, fire or water type. Air beats water, water beats fire, and fire beats air. Those are the basic rules. A full rule set will be included in each box.

name: Poolette
description:
Football related card game. The 52 cards are split into two different decks. 25 cards are used to Arrange Matches in part 1 of the game. The other 27 cards are used in part 2, Playing the Arranged Matches.

Arranging Matches: Each player getrs a hand of cards and a turn consists of laying down a pair of cards from the same division, or drawing a card from the stack. Depending on the number of players, this goes on until all players have arranged the correct number of matches or there are no more cards to draw from the deck. Points are awarded or lost depending on whether you did or did not arrange the correct number of matches.

Now play shifts to the second deck. All the arranged matches are placed in the middle of the table. These nicely illustrated cards are in four suits, marked A to D. A is trumps. Now you play 6 hands of cards in Whist fashion. Must follow suit, if not can discard or trump. The winner of the most tricks decides the result of any match on the table. He does this by choosing one of three face down cards - Away Win, Home Win, Draw. An Away Win scores him 20 points, a Draw scores him 15 points, a Home Win scores 10 points. Then another hand of cards is played, and the winner chooses a card to be the result of that match, and so on, until all the matches have been played.

The points in Part 1 are added to the points in Part 2 and the winner is the one with the most points.

name: Kinder Quiz
description:
Children's quiz game. 300 questions on 60 cards. Play as long as you want and gain a card for each correct answer. Whoever has the most cards at the end, wins.

Also includes a book of facts that children might like to read.

name: Sonix Junior Musik
description:
36 cards with 18 musical instruments and one Audio CD in this Junior version.
The games of Sonix series are specifically designed to promote the following skills in your child: perception, discernment, acoustic memory, logic, observation and language skills.

Before the game must be activated the random play function on the CD player to listen to each round a new track.
Some games are old familiar games like Memory and Lotto game.
Some games are new. Players listen to CD and must be the first to find the pair with the correct instruments.
Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Das Sonnenscheinspiel
description:
Curious little game in that it is not boxed and comes in a ziplock bag.

The board has 12 coloured spaces and on each space a counter is placed of the same colour. Depending on the number of players, each player gets an equal area featuring these counters.

The game is simple. Throw the dice with the colours on it. If you roll a colour in your area, you may remove the counter (it goes out of the game) or you can move that counter into an opponent's area if he has a space of that colour without a counter on it. There is some strategy required by the little ones who will play this game and that is a good thing in my opinion.

The winner is the first player to clear out all the counters in his area.

name: Das Milka Schoko-Spiel
description:
The players go on a chocolate travel through Europe. The player who takes the longest will win the game.

Every turn, the players throw a die and move that many spaces. Depending on the space they land on, they get a card, which can be used to halt progress on the travels.

Filled with little chocolate bars tha players get to eat durng the game :-)

name: Angry Birds: Happy Holidays
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

In a similar format to previous Angry Birds Games (Knock on Wood, On Thin Ice, Space) This angry birds game has the player building structures specified on cards to knock down using plastic birds launched with a catapult. This version features a holiday theme with snow and ice building pieces and Santa hats.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Aces and Faces
description:
Players move around the board trying to acquire Aces and Face cards, trying to collect 4 of a kind or 4 from one suit. To move around the board, you flip up the top card from the deck. If it is a number, you can move that many spaces either direction on the board. If it is an ace or face card, you move to the space with that card and collect it into your hand from the board.

The board has 4 types of spaces. It either has a specific card that you can collect, or is a duel space, where you pick a player and each of you pick a card off the top of the deck, with the higher card getting to take a card from the one drawing the lower card, or a higher/lower space, where you guess if the next card in the deck will be higher or lower than the last card drawn, or Suit Match, where you draw the next card and if it matches the suit of the space you are on, you can take a card of that suit into your hand.

name: Mágové z Hexanu
description:
At start the game board is randomly formed with the hex-tiles and players place their magicians on hexes.
In his turn player rolls dice and move one of his mage on the board from one hex to another so that the number on the hex-side the mage moves fits with the rolled number.

The objective is to move all of his six mages to magic-schools on the different hexes first.

Each mage reached on the school may start using magic spells.

name: Blockers! 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel
description:
From Spiel 2011, a sample version of Blockers!, packaged with Zatre 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel.

This version plays 2-3, unlike the full-size version, which plays 2-5. The grid is 5x5, rather than the 9x9 of the regular version.

It uses one game board and 48 cardboard tokens:

A, B, C, D, E, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, Club, Moon, Diamond, Circle, Star, and Blockers in red, yellow, and blue.

The goal is to have the fewest number of groups of tiles on the board at the end of the game.

The players take turns placing one of their tiles on the grid and then draw another tile to replace it. There are three tiles which each player can place on each space: a letter (rows), a number (columns), or the shape on the space of the board (five areas; the corners plus diamonds form a cross in the center).

If another player has placed a tile it may be captured by playing a legal tile in its place, only if removing the tile doesn't break a group of tiles belonging to the player into more than one group. If players tie for the fewest number of groups at the end of the game, then the winner is the one who captured the fewest opponents' tiles.

name: Zatre 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel
description:
From Spiel 2011, a sample version of Zatre, packaged with Blockers! 2 in 1 Schnupperspiel.

This version uses 25 cardboard tokens (five 1-pip, and four each of 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6) versus the 121 tokens of the regular version.

Zatre is short for Zahlen & Treppen, numbers and steps. Players alternately draw and place tiles on the board extending the pattern already laid. When you make a vertical or horizontal line that totals 10, 11 or 12 (12 is the limit), you score 1, 2 or 4 points accordingly.

Simple and quick, but surprisingly challenging when you get the idea. The idea being that you must keep an even, balanced score pad, scoring 10s and 11s, not just successive 12s. Easy to pick up, but it requires some effort to score well; spotting those opportunities to place one tile which scores each way, making sure you keep clocking up 10s, to turn into 11s or 12s.

name: Stop-Over Hamburg
description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Hamburg-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

name: Board Football
description:
Game found in The New Book of Games, circa 1950.

For this game a large board must be drawn like the one in the image. The football is a counter, which at the beginning of the game is placed on square 14 for the kick-off. The two players, or sides — “Rovers” and “United” — throw the dice alternately. Rovers add the value of their throw to the number of the square on which the ball lies, and move it on to the square indicated; thus, if the ball is on 17 and they throw a 4, the ball is moved to 21. United subtract the value of their throw from the number where the ball previously was: thus if it is on 8 and they throw 3, the ball goes to 5. A goal is scored when the ball enters square 1 or square 27.

After a goal has been scored, the game is restarted, and the side which has lost the goal kicks off. If a throw leads to a number over 27 or less than 1, it is a goal lick, and the other side places the ball on the square in front of goal, and throws. If 1 is thrown while the ball is in a touch-line square, the ball is out of play and not moved, the other side taking a throw immediately.

A time limit, say five or ten minutes, must be fixed for the game before starting. When elapsed, the side with the most goals, wins.

name: KiCKran
description:
objective: score as many goals as possible - two versions:
1.
- acting until you score or ball is taken off -
roll one die (or two - depending on the coloured area) and move the ball straightforward; if your die shows a '1' draw an event card instead (possibility for penalty, corner..). Combat-cards can be used for a counterattack. If Ball is shot on target you can score a goal.

2.
- acting until you score or ball is taken off -
no dice - 6 movement points per turn - + combat-cards instead;
no event cards are drawn: a bit more tactical;

Game can be played with 2 persons or two teams

name: Monopoly: Phineas and Ferb Collector's Edition
description:
Phineas and Ferb want to make every day of their summer vacation spectacular. Jump into their decidedly quirky world-kiddie MythBusters meets sitcom-sibling hijinks meets classic spy spoof-which has become the top cable animated series among 6 to 14 year olds.

Phineas and Ferb want to make every day of their summer vacation spectacular! Jump into their decidedly quirky world-kiddie MythBusters meets sitcom-sibling hijinks meets classic spy spoof-which has become the top cable animated series among 6-to14-year-olds. Start your 104 days of summer right and join Phineas, Ferb, and the whole gang as you round Danville hot spots looking for the ultimate adventure: a chance to own it all! Can the Candace token finally stop Phineas and Ferb from their schemes? There's only one way to find out! In MONOPOLY: Phineas and Ferb Collector's Edition, you can buy, sell, and trade your way from the Googolplex Mall to the Hard D Har Toy store. Team up with the O.W.C.A to purchase Agent P's secret locations then scrounge up Dr. Doofenshmirtz's childhood homes to finally defeat him once and for all! Let the battle for summer glory begin!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Plymouth
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Plymouth, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mind Benders
description:
Simple quiz game but does have the virtue of an interesting array of question styles.

There are 90 cards and each one will be in one out of six types;

Code Crackers - Work out the secret code.
Cryptic Clues - As in a cryptic crossword.
Anagrams - Unravel to reveal the correct word.
Extreme Close-Ups - Guess the onject from an unusual angle.
Sudoku - Solve the number puzzle.
Logic Words - Guess word from an array of letters

The answers are on the back of the cards. You or your team get 1 point for every correct answer. The most points after a pre-agreed time has expired. wins.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Pizza-Party
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Party alarm! In Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Pizza-Party, Leo, Donnie, Raph and Mikey have just ordered pizza when Shredder and his ninjas storm in...

Now it's time to use your turtle-powered martial arts skills to send those uninvited guests back through the door – then it's time to eat! Whoever can rid himself of cards first in this action-packed game wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Marvel Avengers: Iron Man Armor Up
description:
Harness the power of Iron Man's Repulsor technology and battle against Loki the trickster! Be the first player to use all your cards to win.

There are 7 types of cards—Iron Man's Energy Shield, Repulsor Blast, or Flight cards, the Avengers cards, the Tesseract and Counter Attack cards, and the Loki cards.

On your turn play one card from your hand following the rules for that card. If you are unable to play any card, you must draw a card and end your turn. Continue playing until one player has used all their cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Loop-the-Loops
description:
Loop-the-Loops is played on a piece of paper on which one player draws five intersecting loops (or more if desired), in any way they want.

Players then on their turns start at an intersection and color the lines, going past two intersections and ending at a third. It is possible to switch to another loop at an intersection. The first player can start at any intersection; after that each player must start where the previous player ended.

If the coloring reaches an intersection which can't be moved from the player's turn ends and the other player may start anywhere.

When a played finishes a loop they score 1 point (or 2 points for the last loop if there are an even number of loops).

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Ninja Moves
description:
Jumbo combat card game. Perform the ninja moves shown on the card to defeat the villain hiding on the other side. All players move at once, and moves performed by more than one player at a time means the villain gets away!

Each of the jumbo cards features a villain and a points value on one side of the card. On the other is one of four ninja moves: swing, kick, spin, or jump. Cards are divided into four equal decks with the villain face down; players should have plenty of room to move actively without hitting each other. Together, all players shout "1 - 2 - 3!" and perform the ninja move showing on top of any deck. If a shown ninja move is performed by only a single player, that player turns over the card and captures the villain on the other side, scoring those points. If more than one player performs the same move, even if the move is showing on more than one card, no points are scored and those cards are discarded. The game ends when one deck runs out of cards. Points are counted to determine the winner.

The box declares this a game for ages 5+. The jumbo cards feature artwork from the 2013 Nickelodeon Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles cartoon.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Tiki Taka Soccer
description:
Solitaire statistical replay game on Soccer, where each team is rated for a lot of statistics (shots on goal, fouls for, fouls against, possession percentage, counterattack, defense, etc.) and the player has to fill a game sheet before each game - as each match differs according to the comparison of the opposing teams.

When he/she has fill up the game sheet, he alternate rolling a percentage dice on the Game Flow chart to see what happens in the match. Result may vary from Missing opportunity, shot on goal, change of possession, penalty, goal and many other possibilities.
Each match lasts about half an hour after you have taken confidence with the system.

At the moment the following sets are available (each a complete game by itself): Champions League 2011/12, Champions League 2012/13, Italian Serie A 2012/13, English Premier League 2012/13, Spanish Liga 2012/13, German Bundesliga 2012/13

name: Body Builders: A Tale of Taxidermy
description: In the light strategy game Body Builders, 3-6 players assume the role of lonely taxidermists who recruit vultures, hyenas, crocodiles and other critters to scavenge for animal parts that can be combined to build themselves a friend. Players recruit these scavengers with dice through a combination of choice and chance, and they use this army of scavengers to invade opposing taxidermists to try to steal the parts they need to complete their new pal and thus win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Green Game
description:
The Green Game is an entertaining, enlightening and sometimes alarming way to examine the ecological facts and myths that face us today.

The person who bought the game always goes first. Players roll the die and move their tokens around the circular track. Landing on certain spaces lets the player answer a question. Correct answers reduce the player's carbon footprint, while incorrect answers increase the carbon footprint. Other spaces have players draw "Eco-Warrior" cards that reduce the carbon footprints, or "Eco-Pig" cards that increase the carbon footprint. The first player to reach the smallest carbon footprint on the scoring board (8 points) wins the game.

The Green Game is made from recycled material, soy inks and wooden game pieces.

name: La Conquista dello Spazio
description:
A fast game about spaceships movement.

Each turn the players move their spaceships, each one with different speed and try to reach the orbital station. In each turn every player can rotate some parts of the board for trying to delay the movement of the other player, causing him to waste useful time, trying to regain the path that leads to victory.

The first that moves all of his spaceships to the orbital station wins the game.

name: 32 Suspects
description:
Quoted from the rulebook: Policemen have to catch a disguised thief. Whoever wins the largest number of medals becomes the best policeman. Policemen can jointly investigate in catching a thief and they can win and share more medals,

In each round one player is the thief and the other players are the policemen. The thief draws one thief card (from 32) and the policemen have to find out that card.

In turn, the policeman turn over 4 cards from the suspect deck, which consists of the same cards as in the thief deck. Then they ask a closed question (yes/no) about a feature of the thief, like baldness, wearing a beard, wearing glasses, having a red jacket etc., which the thief has to answer. After that, the thief is allowed to turn over one face-up card.

After six questions the remaining cards are turned face up. Now the policemen have to point to the suspect, they think suspect being the thief. If all policemen guess correctly, they get a number of medals that is printed on the thief card. If they point to different suspects, only the correct guessing policemen gain 1 medal. If all policemen fail with their guesses, they all lose one medal.
The game ends when each player was the thief once. The player with the most medals wins. Ties are possible...

name: Es läuft die Zeit... wir laufen mit!
description:
Two different boards:

1. Uhrenspiel
Objective: move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. Learn to read a watch.
The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".
Ending on a 'white' space move foreward according to the printed watch, on a 'red' space backwards.
Can be played by 2 persons or 2 teams.

2. Snakes and Ladders

name: Reise um die Erde: ein humoristisches geographisches Gesellschaftsspiel
description:
The first game published by the Otto Maier Verlag, later to be known as Ravensburger Spieleverlag.

The game was inspired by Jules Verne's "Around the World in Eighty Days". The players travel around the board rolling dice to get to the field with the number 80 accomplishing their travel around the world, using money to overcome any troubles along the way.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Töölö
description: This is educational roll and move game about Helsinki city district of Töölö. Players are rolling the dice and moving across the streets of Helsinki. There are 24 places of interest and if players happen to stumble on them, then they must answer some questions. If the player knows the right answer, he/she might get some kind of reward (extra throw of dice, get further). If the player's answer is not correct, he/she might get punished (miss a turn, go backwards). First one to finish is the winner.

name: Glücks Reiter
description:
The game is about luck. Gather as many stones as you can.

The board is filled with color marked stones. The marks are face down. The position of the 'Glücksreiter' is crucial. It it is on the same color as the stone just moved, you loose your stones. If not you get an extra stone.

The player collecting the most stones, wins.

name: Crazy Cat: Geheime Mission
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Four crazy cats are taking part in a wild race in Crazy Cat: Geheime Mission, but who's hiding where? And which two crazy cats will reach the finish line first?
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mike the Knight Ritter-Wettlauf
description: The players move through the kingdom of Glendragon to the castle, where Mike the Knight is waiting for them. Lucky rolls of the die and the help of the jolly dragons Funki and Löschi allow a quick advance, while the vikings try everything to hinder the progress of the players.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tricki
description:
Choose your favorite horse and compete in horse jumping. The horse that reaches the finish line first wins.

In Tricki, you move your horse through hurdles, events, and jumps as you try to win the horse show.

Simple roll and move game with some event cards.

name: Prinzessin Lillifee: Die Suche nach dem Bergkristall
description:
Princess Lillifee and her friends search for the beautiful mountain crystal that is guarded by a troll. To find the troll between all the flowers and bushes isn't easy. Do you want to help the princess and her friends?

The aim of the game is to find a beautiful rock crystal among the trees and shrubs on the game board.

Contents: game board, die, crystal heart, and 4 pawns

name: Battle of the Sexes: Couples
description:
It’s couples vs. couples as they draw cards and try to correctly guess their partner’s answers. The couple with the highest score at the end of the game wins - proving they know the most about their partner.

Includes 100 cards, 4 pencils, scorepad, timer and player guide.

name: CockFIGHT!: The Card Game
description:
CockFIGHT! is a 2-4 player stand-alone card game, and revolves around a group of Fighting Cocks, battling for supremacy in the ever competitive world-wide cock fighting circuit. Players take on the role of one of the top contenders and battle it out using a variety of cock inspired attacks!

The game employs a liberal amount of double entendre, creating hilarious experiences as friends "Cock Block" you, "Cock Slap" you or gulp down a "Little Blue Pill" to regain health.

The game employs a 50 card battle deck, 4 Champions and is comprised of Attack, Healing and Defensive cards.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: My Tailor Is Rich!: Le jeu de l’anglais
description:
The English game for the whole family from 10 years-old children.
Language, pop-culture, royals, challenges of all kinds: from the United Kingdom to USA, Canada, Australia, English is available in 1600 questions and challenges fun, strange or useful.

This is a trivia game. The goal is to arrive first at the end of the boardgame shaped as the London Underground map.

Four categories of questions:
- Culture
- Language
- Civilization
- Challenge

Contents: 1 die, 8 pawns, 1 tray, 1 pen, 1 notebook, 800 youth questions, 800 adult questions

2 to 8 players from 10 years-old
Play as a team or individual
Average game length: 40 minutes


Le jeu de l'anglais pour toute la famille à partir de 10 ans.
Langue, pop-culture, têtes couronnées, défis en tous genres : du Royaume-Uni aux USA, du Canada à l'Australie, l'anglais se décline en 1600 questions et défis amusants, étranges, utiles ou futiles.

Le but de ce jeu de connaissances est d'arriver le premier à la fin du parcours en forme de plan de métro londonien.

4 catégories de questions :
- Culture
- Langue
- Civilisation
- Défi

Matériel : 1 dé, 8 pions, 1 plateau, 1 crayon, 1 carnet, 800 questions jeunesse, 800 questions adultes

De 2 à 8 joueurs à partir de 10 ans
Jeu en équipe ou en individuel
Durée moyenne d'une partie : 40 minutes

name: Hannebambel: Das hessische Schimpfwortspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Hessian-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Hessian dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to dicussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: The Smurfs: Snakes & Ladders
description:
In The Smurfs: Snakes & Ladders, players roll and move their pawns in a race to the finish line, using ladders to their advantage and falling down slides when they can't avoid it.

But not only players are taking part in the race: Gargamel is chasing the Smurfs from behind, threatening to catch them. This added dynamic element serves to add freshness and excitement to an old formula and makes the game deeply immersive for young players.

name: Super Bis: Deutsch
description:
Super Bis is pretty simple language learning game. The game comprises of two decks of cards (one deck of questions and one deck of answers). For every question card, there is just one matching answer card. There is also one joker and one jack-in-the box -card. There is two rule sets in the game.

In the first game you just deal out the cards. Joker is removed. Everybody then removes matching pairs from their hands. Then the player in turn takes a card from the previous player. If the card matches a card in the players hand, he/she reads it loud and removes the pair. Then it's next players turn. This goes on until cards run out. Winner is the player who gets rid of his/her cards first and the loser is the player holding the pairless jack-in-the-box when pairs run out.

In the other game you just deal out the question cards. Joker and the jack-in-the-box are removed. Answer cards are shuffled and put in the table. One player then turns up the first card from the answers deck and reads it out. The player with the matching question reads it and then discards it. Then you read out the next answer card. Winner is the player who first gets rid of his/her cards.

name: Marvel Comics Super-Heroes Game
description: The goal of the game is to reach Mehisto at the center of the game board and defeat him. The movement is determined by the spinner. The playing pieces have two sides, the costumed hero and his alter ego (for instance Spider-Man and Peter Parker). While in their secret identity the players are safe from attack and can move into position. To attack Mephisto they have to change into their superhero identities. On the Zoom Spaces the heroes get to collect Power Cards to use in the fight against Mephisto. If a Superhero succesfully attacks Mephisto, he gets a Talisman Card. The first Player who gets 3 Talisman Cards wins the game.

name: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood Grr-ific Game
description: Players choose 1 of 5 characters from the popular PBS tv show, "Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood" to collect their friends in a trolley for a party at the clock factory. Along the way, players get to use their imagination to act out scenes or emotions from the tv show.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme
